TppOFagoMEe_SMzMlY5q6A.text: What a shocking surprise this place was! A wonderful treat! We were visiting the museum across the street, got hungry, and thought we would just walk to the strip mall across the way and grab some lunch there. We couldn't even see this place at first, but once we hit the parking lot, we noticed the sign and decided to go in.  We were there for lunch, which, as others have noted, is a buffet. And, as someone who eats and cooks a LOT of Indian food, I have to say the buffet was super-generous in terms of options and quality. They even had a bin of full-sized idli, which you never / seldom get on the buffet line.  Food was MUCH better than average. The naan was excellent. And, the selections were original and refreshing.  The service seems meek -- almost like the waitstaff is afraid to talk to you. And, the table service needed to complement the buffet is a bit slow. (Of the two things we needed from the waitstaff, the staff got both items wrong. No biggee, but still noteworthy.)  We did have a table of some foul-mouthed young men near us who were talking disrespectfully of women. I might have liked it if management had taken care of that for us, but, eventually they did leave.

t39zo2Pdg8lv0fOTiv28jQ.text: I'm probably not a great judge on quality of indian foods, but this place was yummy. I hear the lunch buffet selection has increased (since 6 months to a year ago). the korma is yummy.  I ate so much garlic naan :) the lunch buffet for only $13? awesome!

kaOic4iGjP6PEAMjtgMD0w.text: I love the Mint! Not much to say that hasn't already been said.  Many vegetarian and vegan options (and labelled as such!). The menu itself is an enjoyable read - very cleverly written.  My most recent visit was on Valentines Day 2012, when they had a pre-fixe menu - which was a four-course meal with several options for each course. At $40 per person, not including drinks, this was a more expensive meal than the usual dinner here. If anything, there was too much food, but I love leftovers for breakfast, so I'm okay with that.  The meal was delicious as always, the waitstaff friendly and prompt - especially considering how slammed they were on this big dining-out night.  Two special little treats were the Rose Mintini - a slightly sweet, rose-flavored cocktail that was a perfect compliment to the spicy fare - and the kulfi, which was a cardamom flavored cross between rice pudding and ice-cream. Extremely rich and flavorful, it was served in tiny cups, but was creamy and wonderful - and just the perfect treat to end a lovely meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Valentines Day special cocktail - a Rose Mintini! Delish!

ezeJPDwwoj5zbvyMJBtVBA.text: Food is good, but overpriced. For $5 we got 5 medium pakoras. Mango lassi was good. Order paneer tikka masala which was nice. Ambience is good.

GMO8PAGr05OJzNN5fWtJ1Q.text: Service was great!! Garlic naan was BOMB! This was our first time trying Indian food. There were some items that were really foreign to me and those I didn't venture to try but all the popular dishes I ate and really enjoyed! We ended up also getting a mango lassi for my son and he loved it. :) Overall experience was very good and I would recommend this place to those who have never tried Indian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi $4.00 (he loved it)!

hgh0DZvy-74XBeudxZ0mYw.text: Excellent Indian food hands down. For the money, the daily buffet is a fantastic value. Really wonderful dishes. Everyone of them made with care and just delicious. Pretty much sampled everything and really liked the vegetarian tikka masala. Even garlic naan is included but I prefer the plain buttered naan. I'm not going to say it's a negative thing, but one night we went for dinner and not buffet and when our food arrived they were very small portions in small little bowls. And very expensive for the quantity vs. value I thought. The food was excellent but won't go back for dinner again.

zow1pUEwVWl96La15ohkcQ.text: We didn't realize it was a buffet. They were closing for lunch and said we were welcome to catch the end of the buffet. It was delicious!! So many flavors and we enjoyed ourselves.

HBlqJpwBhAS-85eASqjnlg.text: If you are in vegas , craving for some indian food , you have to stop by here ! Esp their buffet , yes their buffet ! They have a wide variety of both vegetarian & non vegetarian dishes , their speciality chau - chau , sweets & salads & chat , all that you can eat for 14.99 + taxes ( as of dec 2015) clean , fresh & hot ! But mind you cz there is always a long wait during the lunch hours for this buffet , they have their own waiting system where you enter your name , phone no & party size in an ipad outside the restaurant & the waiter cmes to call you ( which i found interesting) , they serve you your choice of naan / flat bread which is on their menu of that day .  Dinner time is usually an alcarte , they make food according to your choice depending on how spicy one wants to eat ! Try their kheer , gajarhalwa , idli & cutney !

QMFuHh129uL2GTT2tDVNcQ.text: This experience was head and shoulders above Bombay! I absolutely LOVE this restaurant  Their lunch buffet lists if the dish is gluten free or vegetarian! A rarity, and totally awesome! All of their meat is halal.  They will give you papadam at lunch if you request it  The staff here is insanely friendly, and very attentive (but not annoying)  Their chicken tikka masala is amazing! Great sambar, idly, pakora, chutney, salad... Everything was delicious! I found the mattar paneer to be rather devoid of flavor, but in all fairness, I got here shortly after they opened and the dish probably hadnt had time to sit and develop flavor.   5 stars on the lunch buffet, hands down. Will be back for dinner.

soXhbfwwOisbpuIXwGD26Q.text: Service was horrible. My friend invited me to what was before this incident her favorite Indian cuisine restaurant.  She always ordered the Mango masala  raving about how delicious it was and that it's been a year since she was here.   When it arrived she ate 3 bites then paused with the look of disappointment and horror after bitting onto a complete ginger root .  She bit into it thinking it was mango and was finished with the meal. Asked the server he said he'll bring the manager over and tell the chef so it wouldn't happen again.  When manager arrived no concern or compassion stating that meal has ginger in it.  Will not be going back again.

OAOkbj0bNO5vJarO4FTK6Q.text: If i have to, i would rate this place a big zero star, yeah thats rite. Food is not that great for the price and attitude of manager is sky high. 5 of us went for lunch and the manager started scolding us for adding a chair in the middle of walking area, he kept on arguing and fighting as to why we kept the chair in middle when on the first place he had shown us a better place. His arguments didn't stop even after confronting him, and finally after the scene created for 10 mins, he says i was Only requesting for you guys to move to other table. You should understand people have come for a peaceful  lunch and your last statement in fight should have been the first one instead.

Z2RUlq11s0ViVBDm0JDQvw.text: Best restaurant for Indian food in Las Vegas..  Love their mono's, dosas, egg biryani and mango lassi. Ambience is good too. I do wish they add veg or egg biryani to buffet.

0NQMD_5C2JSw2JkTPki3nw.text: We came here for lunch last Saturday and as the place was packed we had to wait for 20 minutes to get seated. The host tried to push us into sitting outside but most in our group refused and preferred to wait for a table to come up.  Food wise there were standard items that you will find in any other buffet. The taste was very average with surprisingly no dish really standing out. The only worthwhile comment was that the noodles were really Indian style chow-mein that is very common in and around Delhi. They gave us hot bread (naan) at the table without charging more for it, I'm not sure if that is their policy or they just forgot to do that.   The sweet dish (Gulab Jamun) looked pretty nice but when eaten felt like they were recycled after being left around for a couple of weeks so you can avoid that. The menu on their website mentions lots of options for the sweet dish but the only other item was an empty bowl of mango custard.  Service overall was a little slow considering the amount of rush that was there, and the host (could be the owner not sure) at the door tried to be friendly but ended up being very pushy.  Overall left satisfied but not overly enthused to return again.

mgDdkYQtM7VaE9ef-2Zm1g.text: Pistachio Kulfi. That is all.   No not really, Mint is by far the best Indian establishment in the area. My girlfriend and my go to place when neither of us can decide on what to eat. But seriously, get the pistachio kulfi. Get it.

HDqwyt-rW16_dKYbHx456g.text: I had the buffet here. Appetizers were really good with all chutneys. I liked the deserts too. Curries were tasteless!

Z7dzelu2rbzwcawcHv0o5A.text: Service was friendly, attentive and nice. I really enjoyed the boneless Butter Chicken. It had great flavor and was cooked perfectly. It was render and the spices were wonderful. I'm so glad I stopped by this restaurant tonight. Their beer list is extensive and the entree was outstanding. I look forward to trying the lunch buffet some time soon.

qB9k-d-sGlePdK2ayMSnnQ.text: This place was recommended by a friend. Didn't disappoint. Can't do Indian food more than every other week but this is the place to get your fix.  Lunch buffet has a grt selection. Chicken, goat, vegetarian, salad, dessert, naan bread. Can't go wrong for around $15/pp.  When I need my Indian food fix, this is the place.

Cn-HJNVZfOUwl6hQpAECjw.text: Found meat in our Vegan Handi Biryani. When reported the attitude of server was very callous. First he tried to explain it is ginger. But it was a small mutton piece. Then He was smiling and said sorry about that. Vegetarians and Vegans beware!!!! Their kitchen is not rightly setup and you might be eating meat without knowing. Will never go back to this place

Q-4Jq8d2jU9UYg65TlJezQ.text: Went there the first time and ordered Vegetable Biryani - not a typical biryani but the ghee adds a nice flavor to it. Also, my friends who ordered Chicken and Goat Biryani found it really spicy and their spicy is actually spice so choose the spice level wisely/take the ghee option for Biryani. The portion size is on the lesser side and we had to re-order in the middle of our dinner. The food was good for us to go a second time and this time we tried the buffet. It was absolutely heavenly !! This is probably the first buffet where I loved everything and had a good number of vegetarian dishes as well. The buffet offers different variety of food from Indo-Chinese to bhel puri to Dal and curries. The yellow dal is a must-have ! It's something that I usually avoid having outside because it seems a boring everyday thing but this one is a must have ! Mango custard and gulab jamun are yum! Worth going if you are around the area. Bon appetit!

XyLetGTuUDlKrqFZOueX_A.text: I've been coming here for at least 4 years.  I have never had a bad experience.  The wait staff is attentive and friendly.  I have only been here for the lunch buffet.  It is wonderful. They change up a few of the dishes but they do have a consistent offering of rice prepared plain or with vegetables and sometimes cranberries.  The goat is always tasty as well as the chili chicken.  There are vegetarian offerings that are very flavorful and the Indian tea is very good.  I have tried other Indian restaurants in town but none have reached the level of Mint.

Xmz6vKo-G_zxYG_guI1VKQ.text: The most authentic Indian cuisine I've come across. I still crave their curry dishes and spices. If they offer advice on what to choose, listen. Clean kitchen that you can see and the bathroom is clean and awesome too. Modern design and friendly service. Coming back again, always.

rx8lACl-pCIiLxeCeUgnwQ.text: Food was really tasty and great.....Ambience was good too and we ordered chat and Kadhai paneer both were awesome,Naan was very soft .  Overall great food and great prices with good service.

dweFC8DXN7BtX28UOynIWA.text: Mint was delicious. The service was prompt and attentive. The mango lassis were thick and tasty.  The neighborhood around the strip mall is a little rough (we had to run the beggar gauntlet on our way in) but once you're inside it is one of the nicest Indian restaurants we've been too. Do not miss the chance to get away from the casinos for a real meal. If you enjoy Indian food you will not be disappointed.

ynCKqzSL2rHMjqitHZnQ5A.text: That was a pretty outstanding Indian buffet. I'm not giving it a perfect five because it was a tad expensive and the quality of the chicken could've been better. The soups were superb. Nice attentive service is well. Garlic naan was a good choice, nice flavor.

x2OvGRdksqNSRVZcZK7clw.text: 3 words.... gluten free Roti. These words made this girl excited! Their food is really yummy and not super expensive. The location is odd, but that seems to be the case in Vegas once you get off the strip, which you should do anyways.

RbdrhT-gxW1zh_r8gERayA.text: Went here for dinner yesterday. The place was packed for a Monday night but they arranged a table for us after a 15-20 minute wait.   The server quickly brought out some papads and 2 chutneys-coriander and tamarind. The chutneys tasted great.   I remember visiting a long time ago for the buffet and not being very excited about the food. This trip was different. We all were excited to see so many options of different types of indian food, and tried the following:  chau chau noodles with veggies-This was yummy despite the taste of tomato ketchup in it. really yummy actually.  Schezwan fried rice-good dal makhani-yumm saag with paneer-flavorful  cheese naan, naan and tandoori roti were fresh and crisp  The only downside was the fact that the portion sizes are quite small for the price. They also charge for chutney, onions etc.  I look forward to going back and trying some other stuff like south indian food and indian street food, which I always seem to crave.

uRM08PeA3dN0JgoToifGCg.text: My boyfriend and his buddy went here the other night. They ordered multiple entrees, including a two-for-one tikka masala. We all greatly enjoy their yogurt, so they finished off their helpings and asked for extras, which the service complied with. When they were leaving, he asked for an extra yogurt so that he could bring some home for the leftovers.   When the check was brought to the table, he was able to take a look at it before another one was quickly brought out. When he asked why he was being given a different check, he was told it was so that they could apply the two-for-one tikka masala. That was unTrue- the first check already showed the two for one discount, the only discernable difference was that he'd been charged a dollar for the yogurt.   It's not a big deal that they charged him a dollar for the yogurt- the problem is that they obviously felt the need to lie about it after failing to mention anything earlier. That was really disappointing.   We will probably be back for the food and interesting beer selection, but being lied to is a big turn-off.

sD4J3qH-DwDkRsfDMmhbVg.text: Clean restaurant. I ate the Maharajah Tikka Marsala with paneer cheese. Really creamy and very delicious. I wanted it to be spicy so I asked for a 6. But it wasn't spicy at all. My friend ordered the vindaloo with spicy level at 6 and it was quite spicy. Not really consistent with their spice levels. im guessing if you are ordering something creamy and you want it spicy, at least go with an 8. Naan was soft and good. I enjoyed it overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maharajah Tikka Marsala with paneer cheese
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menus...

7mzGklGbCesFFUyAcmDz5w.text: Mint is my favorite Indian restaurant in the Valley.  I love coming here not only because it's near UNLV, but because it's really good.  You can't beat $10.99+tax for a delicious lunch buffet with 10% off if you're a UNLV student.  It just doesn't happen.  Their butter naan is so yummy; I have to remember not to fill up on that so I can fit more delicious food in me.  My OCDness likes that they organize their buffet trays from starters to sides to entrees.  They used to have a dessert warmer at the very end, but I think they nixed this because not enough people were utilizing it during the lunch hours.  My favorites are (and I will definitely butcher the correct names of these items): the yellow Indian fried rice with vegetables, fried vegetables, the noodles with vegetables, chicken tikka masala (I know that one!), goat curry, and spicy chili chicken.  I'm pretty sure I've tried everything there, but these are my go to dishes.  The 5 stars comes from food and price alone.  They really do have delicious high quality food.  The service is consistently mediocre if not subpar, but if I'm at Mint it's for the food.  Also, it takes awhile for drinks to come out, especially if you order coffee.  I don't know if it's a cultural thing, but I've almost always received my coffee at the end of my meal. I would prefer it as an accompaniment to my meal.  And getting your bill can take awhile too sometimes.  If I have to leave, I just go up to the counter and pay.  And fair warning, you will leave the restaurant full and with a lingering fragrance on your clothing and hair for the rest of the day. You were warned!

zuILSc5HuTTd-LwkUJgUOA.text: One star, and there's good reason for it.  Visited Mint today. I love Indian food. I grew up on middle eastern, Pakistani, and Indian food. The food here is NOT Indian, it's Indian made for American taste buds. Yaddaddaimean? But let's get down to the *critiQUE.*  Service: There hasn't been a single time that I have come here, in which I have felt comfortable walking through the door. It's always a depressed / emotionally challenged man who takes us to our seat. Water, at first, is there quickly. Refills are scarce to none. We wait 5-10 minutes for the check every time. Never half-a-smile cracked by the server(s)...and everyone who works here looks, plain, miserable.   Food: I'm a huge curry fan, and a huge goat fan. Both of these are garbage, here, and this is why: all curry tastes the same, jus different levels of spicyness. The goat is terribly undercooked, chewy, and has NO FLAVOR (as everything else, here, is flavor-less). Today was the last straw. There was hair in my food. Done. I don't pay money for hair.  After the fact: Ive been feeling like crap all day. Stomach is not right. I am unbelievably, and strangely fatigued. I regret this.  There's nothing here for me. I don't trust this place's discipline in cleanliness at all! I don't trust that it "matters " to them until they get caught and shut down! (which they already have, as far as I've heard, for sanitation) they're here for the quick buck. It seems that There's no "moral standard" in this business.

-RTavlbvw4q6dhw8_VRUDQ.text: Amazing Indian food: I and my husband ordered lamb biryani, plain dosa, Bombay bhel, pista kulfi, virgin pina colada and strawberry lassi. Every dish was authentic to taste. My husband loved the biryani;  however I would say the portions are not large enough for their value. We had lunch at 6.30 pm due to our activities in Vegas, in spite of this the food was fresh; ambience was cozy and romantic. However,  the second visit here was a bit annoying.  Even though the restaurant says that dinner starts at 3 pm, they made us wait for a good 25 min outside in the hot torrid Vegas weather because the servers were cleaning..However,  the non-vegetarian dinner for two that we ordered was extremely filling. The rice kheer offered as dessert was simply yummy.

82uwWc7c1laiZrB85nUZBQ.text: Stopped in last Friday for the lunch buffet. I'm not very familiar with Indian food though I've always wanted to try it and this place had a good Yelp rating so that's how we ended up there. The food was very good, once I determined what everything was and tried several small portions. The servers were quick to refill our water (we had a large party) and the restaurant seemed very clean.

m2vQUtbfUDqg9GgsDE30aw.text: The best delicious food I have ever eaten since quite some time ..it's more than worth for the amount you pay for buffet.. I bet there are better than this but this is definitely one of a kind and go to stop.. Do not miss it

lCh0qh49jiefpqoKzioJ3g.text: The food didn't have too much taste, selection was limited, water tasted like tap water, parking lot is small, service was okay but not overly friendly. Price is very reasonable though.

Rdp1HP9yUqqACgxcfKyT0w.text: Wow... this place is awesome! Went here with a friend and had the tasting pre-fix dinner we couldnt even finish it! And for $40 bucks not bad at all!! came with appetizer and desert, cant beat it!.

G2XXRaiDn9Quazyh2xszTA.text: Top notch service and extensive menu with delicious food!  We were driving home hungry and decided to stop at the next decent restaurant we saw.  Luckily, Mint Indian Bistro crossed our path! I ordered the naan stuffed with paneer cheese (an Indian cottage cheese) with the samosa chaat, and my husband ordered the chicken tikka masala - a creamy, tomato, spicy curry that can be ordered mild, medium or hot.  Even though I only ordered an appetizer, it was so filling!  The samosa was topped with a tamarind sauce, a mint sauce, and garbanzo beans.  It paired perfectly with the paneer naan.  For dessert, we shared a perfectly petite portion of mango kulfi - a mango custard, which was very deeeelicious.  Also, tons of vegan and vegetarian options.. including gluten free and organic beers and wines! Amazing.  The price is right for the amazing customer service and quality of food here. Definitely going back!

i9pZ31eaJQM2N5B70T3MkA.text: I will NEVER be back again. We specifically requested low heat on the spicy scale. From 1 to 10 it was a 10 on the burn factor. The food smells great, but good luck choking it down, digesting, oh, and then comes the day after.  Just over $60 was dinner for two.  Not cheap considering it was inedible. One of us ran for the pepcid. The other one looked for dinner elsewhere.  MINT INDIAN BISTRO? No thank you.  This app wouldn't let me rate them zero stars!

lvpZpEgK6XTG04SRw8x2MQ.text: Good value for money with a tasty and well selected collection of lunch buffet. Waiters are attentive to guest needs. We had buffet lunch at other known Indian restuarants but found Mint better. Will surely revisit. Could have been five stars if space was a bit more.

eoukR68h_QuBshBt6PaJrQ.text: I was so craving Indian food. It's been months since i've had any and due to my last experience at Namaste several months ago i needed an Indian fix. Thanks to the reviews of fellow Yelpers I took my talemts to Mint! So after reading their Menu on line for a few days I new my wife and I would be getting the Indian Sampler.Served with Rice, Homemade Yoghurt, and Khir for dessert. Garlic Naan  -Fresh warm and pretty much melted in your mouth. I like to use it to scoom the rice and other dishes.  Vegetable Pakodas- Fried veggie chips with plenty of flavor  Lentil the chef's way- Lentil soup. Very tasty had a hint of Cilantro that was outstanding  The lamb and chicken dishes were so warm, flavorfull and comforting. I only chose level 4 spice not knowing how hot it would be. Next time i will leap to a 6, not being brave but curious, and i do not eat spicy food at all. So much to say about these dishes but please go and experience them for yourself, you will not be dissapointed.  Not a fan of rice puuding. The Khir which is similar was fery smooth, rich, tasty  ans flavorful. Can't wait to go Back.  Thanks to my friends for coming along, who have dinned here before and enjoyed it once again!!

R2eZ9McX_oo1Uay7GHQlRw.text: Best Indian restaurant in vegas period. I have been going here for past 2 years. Excellent service with great food.

ocLOVucfdLjBZiDPrjs3XA.text: By far the best Indian food I have had! When I am in Las Vegas for conventions I HAVE to come here, it's a tradition. I always come with a colleague and we always get the Non-Vegetarian Prix Fix Menu. It is a great mix of all the popular foods. Lots of variety and enough proportions to make you full! So happy I found this place! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ultimate favorite! The non-vegetarian prize fix.

QOmdje6jqC5PW2D-8k5OZA.text: Amazing food, very different flavors! Husband even tired the inferno naan, he ate it all! The only thing I was disappointed with the Service! It was horrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sev puri

7cV0c8mWz2ECUqxxCB1PKg.text: We went for a lunch buffet...the place is half empty and still very lacking in service.  Takes 30 min for simple naan to come out.  No plates at the station and no bowls.  The servers are rude and don't recognize their lack of speed.  Understand if they are packed, but simple service is required.  Never would come here.  Experience is based on quality of the food and the level of service received.  When one is lacking it fails.

7FyY2GGj94xEX_BaaAHhUQ.text: ...another successful visit to this place.  There are very few restaurants which has not disappointed me yet! Mint is on that list and glad its there! Had an amazing time with friends and family.  Service was excellent and food was just amazing.  Highly recommend to all... Cheers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with gravy (sorry! Dont remember the name)
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Handi (Pot) Chicken Biriyani
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My go to drink and favorite... Johnny Walker... Black Lable

PmKQhS40KqjUbusXG2hDIg.text: Great food I like lunch buffet so I can try all the menu. I ate here 3 days in a  row. Now back to NYC.

IwEGuBpzieVHzUfqYR_G2A.text: Very  good  food at a affordable price.  Fast and friendly service..  Enjoy  my experience...

F4wwRNt8xn0x2Ey37L7mEA.text: Super delicious and freshly made food !! As we reached vegas late at night this was one of the restaurants that was open. Once we called they said it can only be a to go order.. we were okay with as it was after 11. After we got the good... once we started eating we came to realize that these were few of the best curries and chats we have eaten in a long time. Super delicious, fresh and mouth watering food. Thank you! We will gladly come back without a doubt.

Meipk3mvLfE-bq7bEibOBA.text: Very disappointed, we ordered Idle which came with tasteless blond coconut chutney and onion chutney there is no seasoning even in those chutneys. We ordered panipuri too and ended up with no flavor and no khatameta chutney. Gave 1star because the noodles soup was not bad it's OK.

bkBvVURhTfYaK7GLG7knxg.text: First time trying this place by recommendation of my friends. It's a little far from my home but well worth the drive.   At 4pm, we were the only consumers there. Other started coming in little by little, probably because it's raining outside.   The aroma of the place alone makes you drool. So many mixtures of spices floating in the air!   We were served our water one at room temp and the other with ice. We ordered, and had our food maybe 15-20 mins later.   Recommending their Chicken Tikka Masala (Roasted Chunks of Chicken in a creamy, spiced, orange colored sauce), Chicken Tindoori (Yogurt Marinated and seasoned with spice mixture), Garlic-Butter Naan (somewhat like pita bread), Biryani Rice. It was enough to feed my family of four though we had to order another two orders of the Butter-Garlic Naan. It was just that good!   We also ordered the Raita sauce which is yogurt based to cool the spiciness of the chicken tindoori for my mom who doesn't like spicy food. It definitely did what it's supposed to but the taste was nothing to go crazy over. I've tasted better from other places.   One star deducted for how non attentive the servers where when we were there. They only came to our table when one of us flagged them down and never did they just check up on us throughout our meal.   As for the place, clean looking, very spacious, dimmed lights to make the place more intimate and music to portray the the desired ambiance of the place.   Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Garlic Naan.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basmati Rice, Biryani Rice, Butter Garlic Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala, Tindoori Chicken.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tindoori Chicken; Spicy Level 3-4

-kFHPBYXXNtZ1riSiti2Yg.text: Delicious Indian food with great service near UNLV.    Their lunch buffet has plenty of meat dishes and veggie options, do yourself a favor and get the garlic naan #treatyoself

X8B87HPrFISNO4Tkopfjrg.text: I had very good experience with Mint the last time I was in LV. My friends keep reminding me to go here for food. And so I convinced my friends (we were 8 of us) to go here and we went for dinner.   We ordered the Idly(Steamed Ricecake), Dosai (Indian Crepe), Chicken Pepper Fry, Chicken Biryani and Egg Biryani, Aloo Gobi Masala, Veg Kurma and Chettinal Chicken.   The Idly was okay.  The Dosai was good and they provided Podi as well for the Dosai in addition to Sambar, Coconut and Red chutney. Was disappointed with the Sambar as it was not close to being south Indian version.   The Biryani was a flop for us because there was too much masala and the flavor was overpowered by the turmeric powder and could not taste the biryani. The chicken fry was not an item in their menu but the chef was kind enough to accommodate our request. It tasted good. We had a good conversation with restaurant manager and found that he hails from our City in India. So here we go for nativity and scored a Gulab Jamun on the house.   Net net - we had high expectation for the restaurant but it failed to meet our expectation. The dinner menu pricing was a little higher side for the quantity served.   If I revisit them - it will probably to try their buffet service.

31_jIIDvQ4FAHcYLMTCAsQ.text: This is the Indian restaurant to go to in Vegas. Drive across town if you must!!! I've been going to Mint Bistro for a while now, and their lunch buffet doesn't disappoint. I was very delighted to go to their new location. It's huuuge and very appealing to the eye. The naan bread is made right in front of you in a big, silver oven that you just want to stick your head in to eat all the bread. This restaurant is perfect for vegetarians/vegans. I have never seen so many options at an Indian buffet in my life. The paneer masala and veggie korma were my favorites.   If you are looking to learn more about Indian cuisine, this is the place to go! The lunch buffet is massive, so you will be able to eat more than the basic tandoori chicken or chicken tikka masala. I honestly feel like I learned so much more about Indian food from my most recent experience at the Mint Bistro lunch buffet. Can I say how yummy the veggie korma was again?! It had me going back for thirds.   And although the buffet was mostly vegetarian/vegan, there were still more meat options that I would find at any other Indian buffet. Their buffet is massive!!!  I can't wait to bring more friends when I'm back in town

AZ8m5tpUK0CJLZFpuTGtJg.text: This is a place that I've heard so much about as anytime someone in my family visits Vegas, they end up going to Mint! Finally it was my turn ;)!!  First off, the place is located very close for Vegas strip but far enough that you don't get the feeling that people are walking all over/around you.. lol ! We were seated pretty quickly and provided our waters!   As for the food, we didn't order any appetizers as we were very tired from our plane ride and just wanted to eat and get to or hotel. Because we ordered only main dishes, it took a while for the food to come out (that's why 4 stars). We got butter naan, roti, a creamy Gobi Sabji, and a paneer dish and everything was extremely delicious!!   Overall, I'm glad I tried Mint, and would definitely tell anyone who's going to Vegas to go here if they want some rich and creamy Indian fare

j0wpYcPp-fU-_6EfiApzXA.text: Mint is outstanding. The menu is diverse and well organized. They have a decent bar with a well crafted selection of beers from around the world.  The food is excellent. I live near the Little India neighborhood in Chicago and have had the opportunity to eat at many great restaurants. Mint would compete well and probably be at the top of that list. I can't wait to come back.

ERaLu6T_jCKTJEyA841Pag.text: indian food lunch buffet. great services. fresh food. love the Mutton/Lamb curry.  would come back again next Las vegas visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ILZ3FUho3BKTwY2k1bVX6g.text: This place is poo poo sauce  (not in a good way)!!!  As a father of 2 and a family man who was looking for good Indian food, I have to say I would never recommend this spot to anyone bc their service is dookey sauce and the homeboys that are servers like to speak Spanish in hopes you don't understand their insults!  The food is only take out worthy.  They literally serve water in a bottle that is tap and the bottle had black mold at the top of the cap!! "Disgusting!!!"  The only Indian person we saw from this restaurant was the cocktail server who was great.   All in all never go here bc they are a disgrace to the Indian Cuisine and I hope the city health inspectors shut them down!!!  GFY Mint Bistro!!!

pXzfZwB4d5tTRLBWtKyybQ.text: I absolutely LOVED IT! This was my first time eating here and it was really good! The   Waiter was very helpful and recommend the Tikka Marsala with chicken and it was amazing! Also the garlic nan was so delicious! Plus the place is very clean and aesthetically pleasing. 100% recommend!

LEkY0VYkD64pJ17XoKZutA.text: Went to this restaurant upon suggestion from friend. Completely unhappy with the buffet. Lamb curry in the menu is not boiled properly and no taste for appetizers. Not even one item was good. Completely dissatisfied.

Rpf0NLXvzvmRVfSt1X2VYA.text: By far the best Indian food I have had in the last 7-10 years outside of my mom's kitchen! God bless the chef's hands! We had chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo. Perfect combo of spices and flavor! Definitely a must try while in Vegas!

2WUAzhHibTXnlbG1_9_Xaw.text: I really enjoyed our meal here. I'm torn between 4 and 5 stars due to somewhat limited abilities on the part of the first waiter. The rest of the staff really picked up from the shortcomings of the guy. Might have just been overwhelmed? The staff is pleasant and very nice, and the place is jamming. Great food, I loved the lamb lollipops!!!!!

veAnGVu28IQxe-cU2swXlw.text: Many varieties even on a weekday Naans are very fresh and hot Vegetarian food was good

gAYQbC8XjInsOWvF5muNAA.text: The Indian cuisine lunch buffet is aptly named Nirvana!   Linda and I agree without a doubt this is the number one best India cuisine we have ever had and have traveled all over this great country. Ranging from North Carolina, Washington DC to New Mexico and now Vegas, baby!  They had a great selection of buffet dishes including garlic naan, they had a great Taj Mahal beer. The dishes were very tasty and some were two alarm hot which we love!! As MacArthur famously said "I shall return"...

5pG91EwnrhkpL24kFmYifg.text: Went there during our road trip to Vegas. Got Bhel puri which was very damp and very small serving compared to the price we paid. But, the 'chau chau' was fine and the Mysore dosa was fulfilling too. An upscale ambience however the servers were in hurry, must have been a long day for them.. wish they were more attentive.

xTMiMnEjBxkSwUtKzJfKpg.text: This place is so lovely and I come here time and time again. They're always offering a wide variety of fresh and delectable indian cuisine as well as a pretty impressive beer/cocktail menu.  The food here is always up to par and their use of traditional Indian flavors never disappointment. I can truly recommend many items here, it's all so good and definitely satisfies that overwhelming Indian food craving. The lunch buffet is yummy as well and a great way to try different flavors. You get all the basics and more: Chicken and goat dishes, different rice dishes, Paneers and masalas and kormas. A great place for vegetarians as well. One thing I also have to mention, is they serve up thee best naan bread in Las Vegas.  The atmosphere is lovely. Dim and calming. The service is fantastic and overall everything is very affordable. One of my favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A perfect selection of stuff from their lunch buffet.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Selection of beers and more.

NbNJSi4pXxTtaUF27geMvA.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant was a little strange at first. As soon as we walked in, the staff seemed a bit surprised to see us. They were friendly and courteous, but I got this "uh oh" vibe.  Once we were seated and started looking over the menu, things settled into a "ahh" vibe.  Looking through a menu for food that I'm not super familiar with can be a bit daunting, but I went with what I know about Indian food. Majaraja tikka masala, vindaloo, naan, saag and rice. Can't go wrong!  We were given an appetizer on the house - I forget what it's called and forgive my ignorance but they were like super thin taco shells with a mint sauce and chutney. Really great. We enjoyed them, then the main dishes arrived.  Everything tasted AWESOME. Their tikka masala is a bit more tangy than I am used to, but it was delicious. Vindaloo was spicy (level 3) in a good way, not a burn on the way out way. We were devouring our food...   Nearby patrons were ordering lassi drinks but I was afraid that combo of lassi and curries would lock me up in the bathroom for too long.  I'm really happy with our experience here and would definitely visit again during a long-term Vegas stay.

LYi2ZClqv5inGxLWFqX2OA.text: Waited for roti for more than 15 mins for lunch buffet even when there were very few customers . Food was not heated as well.

ENpXdnOzokhCXsMuk6LJkA.text: 3 stars as we were seated right away. But the overall service was just not good. It took them forever to bring an added item for us. Overpriced for some of the items in the menu. Had already ran out of some food items as well.

mP2z4I1gQzhaFuzrf-mWNg.text: We had an errand east of the Strip and popped in to the Mint cafe for dinner. It was about 5:30 or so and we just made it for a booth, without a reservation. The staff are very attentive, and soon we had our drinks. We ordered an onion potato dosa, an order of malai kabob chicken, and onion cilantro naan. The dosa is delicately positioned on a silver tray with delicious sauces, and the filling was very tasty. It left me craving more filling... The dosa was perfect. The onion combination with the malai kabob was heavenly, because the lemon pieces were generous, making the basmati rice and chicken sparkle with flavor and tenderness. The four pieces of naan were scrumptious. We had tried onion cilantro flavor and were not disappointed. Mint is a good place to know, and we look forward very much to checking out the second location west of the Strip. I recommend parking around the end of the stores because the front driveway is busy and full of taxis, so backing out is a trip. We had no problem parking on the east end, further away from the front parking spots.

bUBbkBYaptEWDs7kt0GpTA.text: Best Indian restaurant in Vegas. Great food and even better service. Do ask for their recommendation. Best part is their customizable options.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Masala papad

31ICnUCwaNnkg3PJa5MKXA.text: Great tasting food! Hot/fresh bread bright yo you table. Good selection of food. Lot of variety at lunch buffet. Fried stuffed were told were vegetarian as they were fried in a separate fryer with separate oil. Garlic naans were good. Tandoori roti needs considerable improvement.

JaAzLwaaCKLzhmWbIwLqZA.text: I have been here twice, once for dinner and again for the lunch buffet. Both times I was truly impressed!!  The food was AWESOME!!  The atmosphere is sexy, and the service was friendly and o-point both times!  I was mentioning to a friend that I was yet to find an Indian food place that I loved, he suggested Mint. stating it was the best he had had since leaving "Little India" in London. OK, that is a TALL order, and Mint totally lived up to it!   For dinner,there were 3 of us. We did the "vegetarian dinner for 2" and another entree. It was the perfect amount of food for the 3 of us! And so good. A great selection of about 8 dishes, plus soup and dessert.   For the buffet, there were a lot of selections, a bit towards the meat side, which is fine for me.  If you are a vegetarian, you can definitely do it, but it is a smaller selection that your meat-eating friends will enjoy. I tried almost everything on the buffet, including goat! Everything was amazing!!  I can't wait to go back!

TkHGSRj49mBBhAiGV-D3qw.text: The lunch buffet has gotten SO good here! Oh my my - a fantastic, large, and well-executed selection of vegetarian and non-veg buffet items. A thicker Tikka Masala curry (both veg and chicken) than their previous recipe. A long row of creative curries. Even Chicken Vindaloo.   Full disclosure - this was probably my 14th time eating the lunch buffet here and I have never liked it as much as this trip. I actually stopped coming here because I felt there was a lack of selection and no variety (always the same buffet items). The last time I came here was in the Summer of 2013. We were driving by and hungry and a what-the-hell moment ensued. We went to Mint for the first time in almost a year.  Clearly lots has improved, and I am a huge fan. The Mt. Everest Indian restaurant on Sahara has a lot to live up to now (I've eaten at Mt. Everest close to 25-30 times.) Mint is my new favorite Indian lunch buffet spot in Las Vegas, no contest.

rkZ8pU7OdUMC9o-FmrsbYw.text: We have tried several Indian restaurants in the area while visiting Vegas and this was the best of all. The food was delicious and the service was good. Their pav bhaji was authentic and tasted very good. We also tried the handi biryani and we were not disappointed. Everything we tried was flavorful and we would definitely go back to this place. However you have to be careful when asking for food spice levels as anything above level 5 (on a scale of 10) was really spicy.

MggF31_D2cpv1ii-UBwiwQ.text: I probably wouldn't have ever ventured out to Mint if it weren't for my Vegan friends but I'm glad that I did!  I have no concerns when it comes to food except for my slight lactose intolerance but if you are one of those who are vegetarian, vegan, or have any kind of dietary restrictions, Mint is the spot for you. The first page of the menu explains what every symbol beside each entree means. So if you don't eat meat, dairy, gluten, nuts, and etc ... Mint has you covered.  (see photo below)  Our orders were taken on an iPad mini where every possible alteration to any dish is already programmed into the app that they use. I believe that they also have an app that you can download on your smart phones to order before coming into the restaurant. Sweet!!  Nice to see a restaurant seeking out new ways to better service their guests. Not something you see everyday in most restaurants.   Food was excellent. The vegan tikka masala was great.   I also tried my friend's potato curry which was good but I am a carnivore so I probably would've enjoyed one of their meat curries a bit more.   Heard great things about their lunch buffet so I will definitely have to come back for that. Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AfusFb69H110KB_-e0tbVA.text: Was craving Indian and saw a bunch of Elites raved about this place, so it made the top of my list despite being further than I wanted to travel. Called in my order for takeout and headed on over. Upon entering, saw that the restaurant itself was a bit nicer and more upscale than I expected. Service was a bit lackluster- waited for a bit at the door before being acknowledged, my boxed food was waiting at a table with a manager-looking guy who brought over my receipt and took my card with a series of gestures, then ran my card and disappeared without a thank you or asking if I needed anything else.  That probably explains why I didn't get any utensils or napkins, nor did I add on another side or additional naan as I'd originally planned. And there were only two tables seated at 5:30PM so it's not because they were busy.  I found this place to be a bit pricey.  I like that half-size entrees are available for a slightly-lesser fee, but found that the decrease in pricing (usually around $3) isn't worth the decrease in product. Lesson learned. For three half-size entrees, one container of rice was provided. Also ordered one garlic naan. Total was around $40, which is a bit steep. I always have difficulty paying so high for a la carte indian food when the buffet prices are so cheap for so much. I feel like there's a discrepancy there that should result in lower prices rather than higher, but whatever.  Quality made my entree choices worthwhile: saag paneer, baingan bharta, and lamb korma. The saag was decent but I prefer mine a little saucier, this one was a lot of spinach and good-sized cubes of paneer but the dish seemed as if it hadnt been cooked down long enough. Best eaten with the garlic naan, which was fragrant and delicious. Baingan bharta was ordered exclusively based on recommendations here on Yelp, and I was not disappointed. It was flavorful and I appreciated that the sauce was on the thicker side, which allowed for it to go well with the rice.  The lamb korma is the only dish that had any spice to it whatsoever, and it was quite mild despite ordering a 5/10- at Thai restaurants, that'll get you a spicy dish, but I guess Indian is a little more laid back with the scale. I know now for next time. Dish didn't have quite as much lamb as expected for a $10 portion.  Speaking of portions, I was a little confused by the portions and packing of my takeout. I appreciated that the half-size entree portions were packed in plastic lidded containers and wrapped in plastic to ensure that nothing spilled. But the size of the portions themselves were on the small side- think the smallest hummus containers at the grocery. That size.   Going to put this on the list to try again for the lunch buffet, thinking that will be a better value and possibly a better overall experience. Good quality, vast menu of options including several vegetarian dishes.

SurTPVr9QcPlXShZo_Un8w.text: So bad can't give a zero  Don't be fooled by paid reviews. I went in, the staff kept saying you'll be seated in 15 mins. I got seated after an hour, I saw people who came after me got seated before me for some reason  I had hopes that the food would be good, but everything was tasteless and Roti was uncooked ! I knew I had wasted so much time on worthless place. This is by far the worst Indian place I have gone to in the US, and I have been to few dozens.  Seriously don't go, I have lost any faith in Yelp as well.

ZcHgQb3lZN2MZ5OalTwXCA.text: I've had the lunch buffet as well as an a la carte dinner here and I must say the food is absolutely great! I am a vegetarian and even for me, the buffet had a variety that was well worth the amount paid; with south indian, north Indian as well as Indo Chinese items. I got the tomato soup as a dinner starter and it was a pleasant surprise that the flavors were True to the ingredients rather than be masked by a whole lot of cream as is the usual in most other places. I followed that with paneer tikka masala with spicy shezwan fried rice, while my companions ordered pav bhaji and paper dosa. Every single thing we ordered made us smile and savor the moderately but skillfully spiced food. Their Chai especially is a must-drink, beautifully flavored with cardamom and other Indian spices, it was a delight for my taste buds.

niVEx4iUTOOgZ2vr2XShCQ.text: This is one of those places you shouldn't go. Rude servers didn't even refill water. Terrible food. The aloo Tikka chat was more like channa masala. The fried idlis was so hard you could use them as stones. The Dal makhani reminded me of a chef trying cooking for the first time. I can't even fathom how somebody can screw up making a mango milkshake.

VCZrbZ6CM5zgCNYsIXToQg.text: The food is great, but it's pricy and smaller portions than I've encountered before. I guess I have been spoiled by the abundance of great and affordable Indian restaurants in Colorado, because the ones here in Vegas are a bit of a let down. Maybe the buffet is a better value, but I tend to expect more for $25 a person at dinner.

jRJ9yVKbrYK76zjXbQG7ZQ.text: Delicious! We stopped in late night for couple of curry dishes and were very impressed. We're already planning trip back to explore the menu. Gracious and helpful staff.

wqlduBSSbBve-31sVcCuCA.text: This review is for the buffet only. Unbelievable! Everything is high quality and consistently amazing! Stylish decor, fantastic friendly service. All the entrees are labeled so vegans and vegetarians know what's up. I'm addicted to this place Best Indian buffet in town! I wish they would open up one on the west side. It would be packed!

rNySC6sGrc76oa5Qj9FhHQ.text: Good tasty food...Spices are added appropriately for the dishes...Must eat place if visiting Vegas...

5KVyNlMTqoBKIeuclCkQRA.text: Not much to say here - I liked the food, which was tasty and reasonably priced.  Service was very slow, however.  It took about 30 minutes to receive our order - quite surprising since there were only two other tables occupied, and it was only ~7.00 pm.   Bottom line: if you're in a hurry, go elsewhere.  If not, stay and enjoy.

qN4hkUIIPefUqhxrYL07OQ.text: This is my favorite Indian place in town. Their food is very tasty and well spiced and the Naan bread is hot and crisp. The service is attentive. Unfortunately they don't have the lunch buffet anymore =(

5xQyPtdNVP1fL7Q73EPd0A.text: The food is good here; got the "LSD", which is lamb in some spicy sauce (sorry not an Indian/Nepalese food expert) and I believe there is a hint of curry.  It was served with something reminiscent of grits and a green leafy vegetable.  I tried the mango drink, surprisingly good.  I definitely liked how low key it is and the server was polite.

t1Keak6VGiKqsgM_lEEFwA.text: There are many decent indian restaurants in town, but here is one more yelp vote calling this place the BEST indian lunch buffet in Vegas.    Big selection, so even if one item is not to your liking (ingredient or spice-wise), there will be plenty else to nosh on.  Service is quick to get beverages and naan on the table, and tables cleared for new customers. You feel very welcome here :)  (Side note: Always a bummer though to see how much food is wasted at buffets here in town.  C'mon folks ~ take a lil to see if ya like it, and if you do, go back for more! Discarding plates still piled with food is appalling.  And please at least have had a meal in the last 24 hours ~ the single diner next to us sat down and demanded three baskets of naan right off the bat...did he finish them? NO.)

RPSGwKcTk4po5BVyjiJfeQ.text: Prolly one of the best Indian restaurants in Las Vegas area.. A variety of cuisines made in the most authentic manner. The service is just wonderful and food quality is just amazing ... Every time I go to Vegas I go to this place without fail...

Quk3Z92-rvBgxFcw8gv2pA.text: This was absolutely delicious. Had the Malai Kofta and was amazing.

6hA56UCGlePiAFXD6g-nKA.text: Simply Amazing... no words to describe how incredible the food is.  Tikka Masala is to die for.  The service was great, too.  They were all very friendly and overall it was a great experience!

BhiPyPeahT-CYUt16TBElQ.text: Best Indian food in Vegas .. I've lived in Vegas for 6 years , and before that in the bay area .. Where u can find the best Indian food. But it took me 6 years. Finally.. No more eating this fake Indian food in Vegas.

jjJwgzyRybUzvBP2Boz57A.text: good food and a surprisingly sophisticated beer and wine menu.  have yet to have something there that wasn't delicious.  hit the lunch buffet for a nice selection of what they have to offer or order off the descriptive (and slightly humorously written) menu.  if you like it hot (and i mean HOT..this is one of the few places i have been to in a while that will make it hot enough for me) don't be afraid to say so...they will accommodate you.  however, if they suggest a heat level for a dish, my experiences there are to listen to them and enjoy the subtle nuances that too much spicy might cover...you can always ask for something spicy on the side if you want to heat it up.  be sure to check what the specials are...often unique and tasty.  good variety and a place that can accommodate your vegan and vegetarian friends, as well.  head there for happy hour (can't remember the exact time) and enjoy the two for one beer prices.  they have a diverse selection from around the world, including some great belgian-style ales as well as a couple of organic brews.  or try the ginger energy tea....just the thing to pick you up.  **edit 4/10/09....the place in under new management...wasn't happy w/ the food or service the last time i was there (hard to get them to make it hot nemore).  i know they have a different chef than when i gave my first review....will give it another shot, but it isn't the same place as it was  ***edit 6/1/09...went again last friday.  food was lackluster....not bad, but not at all what it was.  sad that the place that used to have awesome flavor and spice served me two bland entrees.  would drop it to two stars if it didn't have a decent price....and one of my friends did like one of the two things she got.  ****edit 12/15/10...THEY'RE BACK!!! very happy to say that the food has been really good the past couple of times i have been there. and the lunch buffet is still good and reasonably priced! thumbs up

M4ahMo6ZbCGKXiszoI7efQ.text: Great food at a good price. In Las Vegas this is not easy to find. This is not generic indian food. The menu is varied, creative and will please both vegetarians and carnivores. The service was friendly and good. The restaurant is being remodeled and said it will have a Lassi bar.

hQcrWIDRV2uVEsMzEyE_3g.text: Flavor-Spice-Grease...These are the three most important ingredients the personable owner, Kris Parikh, is concerned about when he prepares his dishes. I have never eaten at an Indian restaurant before and was pleasantly surprised how good and flavor full the food was. Spice.. Well, spice is a relative term. What is mild to an individual is hot to another. I asked for medium spiciness and the food was perfectly seasoned. Grease..the food was not greasy. Put your inhibitions away and enjoy a pleasant meal at the Mint!

soBjB02PC0lWGOzuIZyfgg.text: Excellent food, attention to detail, service and beer list. Wow, we wish Mint was in our home town.  The menu was fantastic and caters to all diets. We loved our visit to Mint!

DecIODM8lQX2Ti9q2nqiwQ.text: The place smells great when you go inside. Some of the best tarka dal I have ever had. My Karia was good, not spicy enough my friend had chicken vinaloo which was also tasty. The service was at a glacial pace.

H_AmwzoUPamQggYYdZZHTg.text: Let's get right into this.  The service is adequate.  I haven't really tried Napalese food, but I thought it was okay.  The place looked comfortable.   The server was a bit slow at times even though there were hardly any people.  I also tried a few of the Indian food, and it was also decent.  I've only tried this place in Las Vegas for Indian food, but I don't think it's up there compared to other Indian food I've had in other states.  However, it was ok even though I think the prices could be better.

R75pm5zf72P28XxsIRGUIg.text: I went there for launch.  Their service was very good. They greet and sit me right away and cleared the empty dishes of my table every time I had finished unlike many places that let it linger there forever. Although it was a buffet, the food was fresh and tasty. They offered good selection of vegetarian and meet items.  In general the atmosphere in that place is good. I will go back. I gave them only four stars because I went for their launch buffet not dinner. Therefore, it will be wrong for me to give them full credit. but I might will, after I'll go there for dinner.

Ytrk9MDT7bQTwJ3e8hbQWQ.text: I have been coming here since 2006. Before it was named Mint Bistro, it was called Himilayan & Napalese Cuisine. They used to not have a lunch buffet. The lunch buffet is great. I go to UNLV and I used to come here often for lunch. The owners are really nice. They food is really flavorful. They try to change the entrees up as often as possible. There is always chicken tandoori, and Kheer, which is all that I need to make me happy. Sometimes they have Saag, and it's so delicious. The music is nice and the ambiance is very pleasant. They have vegan and vegetarian dishes and an assortment of appetizers that go really well with mint chutney. They also have fresh fruit and salad. It is well worth the ~$9.00.

bgS7mlSdNxp_P3bXsdvjpA.text: Decadent, Some of the best Indian food I have ever tasted and I live in sf bay area home itself to some great food. Suggest try the sampler items..Will be back next time in Vegas or might just come to Vegas for them.,

hBAV2C0Uu7vz1Z97Rtri1Q.text: Great service, great food, great selection. Our dinner party of four included a vegetarian, a gluten free vegetarian, and low carb dieters. Mint was made to order for us. You would never guess that the buckwheat naan was gluten free. The vegetable korma was delicately seasoned, creamy, but we asked for medium spice, so it did have a little kick. The marinated vegetables cooked in a tandoor were spicy and smoky - too much for one person. I hear the chicken tandoor dishes were delish too. We will return. Thanks MINT!

QjLiGgM-zcDLuxoNhTB28w.text: DELICIOUS!!! Simply delicious!! The have a very good VEGAN selections on the menu. I recommend everyone to try it out - you will not be disappointing! Good service and convenient location. It's a little dark inside, I personally do not like it, but on the second thought, guys it's not that important.

-yY5Mdru3roUwptGweinMA.text: It's very hard to come by good quality Indian with good service and food. This place has a few ups and downers. Food is excellent; service is bad. Quality is great; options are short. Drinks are included; tea is $5. There are options for vegetarians; although they aren't too tasty. So I would say to try it if the terms are up to par

_aS1m7vyPPRt-gdND55fdQ.text: Absolutely delicious!  I ordered food from Mint Family Bistro and had them deliver it for a party I was having at my home.  They were very friendly and driver was right on time, it was  a big hit with everyone.  I can highly recommend this restaurant for eat in or delivery. Carolyn W.

Vj4VlL8XTYqFupEuDSOK1g.text: The food is awesome!!! Really what I expected.... Nice ambiance too!!! We ordered for different fried rice, and all items were too good!!! Best restaurant for indian food!!!

iG2wgVKUpJY-JNNVTY-xiA.text: I work across the street from Mint, so it is our go-to lunch place for vegans, vegetarians, and meatavores.  However, reading the other reviews, I really need to check it out for dinner sometime!  I'm quite pleased with their buffet because A) it is cheaper than most at only $9.99, B) it has lots of clearly-marked vegan options, and C) UNLV/DRI employees get 10% off.  Yay! Cheaper, more stuff, plus a discount? SOLD.   We go there so much that the staff puts in a order of vegan roti for me as soon as we walk in the door, which is sweet.  The service is usually very attentive (filling drinks, etc. ).  Apparently they will even make vegans a special version of the vegetarian dishes on the buffet if you ask! I never even thought to try this until I saw some other vegan customers do it! Between the Kwaati (deliciously spiced bean soup), mixed veggie pakoras, Chau Chau (Nepalese noodle dish), two kinds of rice, daal, and usually 3 vegan entrees, I was never really hurting for options.  They also have a great beer selection that I never get to try since I go at lunch. Going to make a dinner trip there a priority!

mFmZka6stejKI0ScaK50uA.text: Delicious food. Nice environment. Friendly staff. Just a little pricey then most Indian food  Delicious food. Nice environment. Friendly staff. Just a little pricey then most Indian food

mfIw-6Uukbk2-tM2QQG8wA.text: this place is alright.  no lie, this place doesn't joke around when it comes to real indian food. i just didn't like some of the dishes.  i had yellow curry, it was good and i was full.  pretty pricey.. and it took me forever to figure out what i wanted. the menu was like a book.  not coming back.

9MTI_HOnX5muUKg6z2BuWQ.text: Visited this place for lunch buffet. Food was Ok with few good varieties which tasted well. Price was reasonable. Ordered Pomegranate Mocktail which tasted good but I would suggest to steer away from the salt lassi. Overall an OK lunch buffet but I couldn ask for more in a city like Vegas ;)

WxPRP6BXlDeokANbqFi4Ng.text: This place really does it right Clean,Friendly and Awesome Food!  We got the vegetarian platter for 2 and it was awesome!  We walked out of another Indian Restaurant that was voted best in Las Vegas 2004! So glad we found this place for our first Indian Cuisine experience

2GgpHj3GLgKgQvwj2HSKlw.text: This place is absolutely amazing! If you're looking for tasty, authentic Indian cuisine this is the place to try. We had the chicken tikka masala which was amazing, the salad with tandoori chicken, na'an bread and the chicken tandoori. Every single dish was absolutely amazing, the whole family agreed on 5 stars. There were multiple people coming around to refill drinks and get you anything else you may need, the owner came by multiple times to make sure everything was great, just as he promised it would be. This is a must try for people just visting from out of town or the locals, just east of the strip (Las Vegas Blvd).

2Advje17G8kuwDdOluucAg.text: Great food, good prices.  We tried a combination platter and it was all very well prepared and plenty for two.  Well done.

czAzlyzf6iNwVzzDA1VhNw.text: We visited Mint about six months ago but I never got around to writing a review. (We recently went to a terrible Indian food restaurant and it made me realize that I should really give kudos to the good ones when I can)  Mint was one of the best Indian food restaurants I have ever eaten at.  I have eaten at several in Las Vegas and Phoenix. At Mint, we had the buffet and the food was hot, fresh, and perfectly seasoned.  The decor was very nice and clean.  The staff was attentive. The price was a good value. Can't go wrong with Mint!

P6LmsQoVZx4Na2-jEbD3jw.text: I'm sooooo disappointed in this place.  This used to be my favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas, but not after my experience I had tonight.  First of all there were only 4 tables including ours..  I think the waiter came to our table once to take our order and twice for drink orders and that was it!!!  The appetizer took at least 45 minutes.  Never saw our waiter!!  Entrees came (not from waiter) out cold except for one entree..  Couldn't find our waiter to order naan bread.  I took my out of town guest there for his Birthday and was embarrassed.  I don't know what's going on, but this place is going downhill..  Even then seats in ALL the booths are ripped up, the tables need to be cleaned or replaced.  I ask for Chris the owner to talk to him with my concerns and he wasn't there.  I really hope he pays attention to these reviews and tries to correct the problems.  The service needs the most help.  Good luck.

n3-PkjvY39nUWlw4y5zfeQ.text: The MINT is the hidden treasure of las vegas....the food is awesomest of all...I have never had more amazing food than this...its a must go...loved the paneer and malai kofta to the core...i will definitely go here to eat whenever I am in vegas... Kudos to you and I hope you stay there forever!!!see you next time :)

xaNhQtFK_1zVwmbxtwTQUg.text: Food is really good. But little expensive. Masala is just amazing and nan is so soft.

FLVcSjt9khmR1ECr50pzhw.text: Being from the bay area, I have Indian/Pakistani restaurants by the dozens everywhere. So, when we looked up for Indian food in the Vegas area, I wasn't having high expectations. I was surprised by what I had there. It was freaking amazing! And the cherry on the cake, it was zabihah halal. We had the following:  Chicken fried rice: absolutely awesome. The rice had a slight crunchy texture and though by concept may sound like raw, but was actually superb.  Yellow dal: the best dal I have had in the US. Period. Low in spices and full of flavor. In love with dal now.  Malai kofta: didn't care much for the kofta, but the gravy was awesome.  Chicken kadhai: wasn't bad but we had far superior food on our table.  Chicken momos: the momos were amazing but the sauce with it wasn't. I have had a lot of momos in India (my fav roadfood snack after chaat). I used to love the chilli sauce served with the momos in India. Here the momos were pretty close to the original though.  Paneer pakoda: good. Liked the sprinkling of chaat powder over it.   Chilli chicken: was nice. Not like India, but am not complaining.  The portion sizes could be upped a notch. The half portions are way too small and the full aren't that large themselves.  The decor is nice. Not date night but better than Indian restaurant standards. The service was really good.

kNCD9zLeLpig-WIzEUlcvg.text: Not an expert on Indian food. But we loved the dishes we ordered. They were all very flavorful. The interior is modern and clean, big plus.

U6X7u1BtjPIqHzFq8ep_lg.text: still stellar Indian and northern Indian food. Great Belgian beer list . Top your meal with khir. Service is hit and miss.

_sjJuZ2vuP9h7OCTinosHA.text: The food was okay, but their serving size is very small as compared to other Indian restaurants. Also, their service was slow. I'm not sure if their service is always like that or on just that day.

BzlXyyYVDaWsDXBst8KHOw.text: Loved the food and their service .. spice level was perfect !!! Will visit this place every time I am in vegas ...

fpAe4BD4YCsdYiBReT-0Tw.text: Great Indian restaurant ! We were there for the lunch buffet and were surprised by the variety. There were 5-6 vegetarian entrees and plenty of non-vegetarian options as well. The bread was fluffy, the rice pudding had flavor and didn't taste watered down. Would highly recommend!

4e-J2KTGaedZM-WlrlweZg.text: This is my favorite Indian place, I've been to many other Indian restaurants but this place is something else, the only annoying thing was that when we got up to get food from the buffet they cleaned up our table thinking we have left, other than that everything was good. They have increased the price on their buffet, it's $12.50 now, which is still fine!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet

Zlz8OdEcfWeVoMKAo6OF0g.text: Very humble location but packs a punch when it comes to the flavors and variety. I do have to admit that I travel quite a lot and do try out a ton of food options.   The first thing that hits you is the menu and its plethora of options. The appetizers we're plenty and very good. We tried paneer pakodas and got and  hot and sour soup along with some really good entrees which included the mahakali masala I also tried the special kabuli parantha which had stuffed dried fruit inside it.  Overall very satisfied with the quality of the food the good service as well as the ambiey in this place.  The prices are very reasonable and is definitely worth a try for every Indian food lover !!

X75ijYTT5HRjk0nNcMXbLw.text: Awesome food lack consistent service. We ordered Sanjivani and naan, waited for a good half an hour for sabzi while naan were getting cold. Do a better pulse check, touch the table and issue at least an ounce of apology for delayed service. Take ownership.

zbjRZYZl98sMKnDFOTScXg.text: I went here with a couple of my friends . The service was amazing.  They always make sure we have naan. They make their naan fresh . It was amazing the food was good. Will come back

WnK8bbVOO6yBsAfTXcmx_A.text: Thursday's lunch. I've been on a spicy kick lately, and decided to come here for their lunch buffet.  Their service was good. The food tasted very good, and the strawberry lassa I also ordered was very nice.  Something I would revisit the next time I am in Vegas.

seu_u4IxA7tvCddNDla44g.text: Yummy! They have a great lunch buffet. The food is always fresh and the buffet area is always clean. I usually don't like buffets but i do like this buffet. They have a great lunch special. Sometimes there is a wait to get in but it is worth it.

_UZILPTDdGgskFbyNn4-ig.text: My boyfriend and I love to come here for their lunch buffet. So much food for a great price! We love the vegetable tikka masala and garlic naan. Dinner is a bit overpriced for getting only one kind of dish. We will probably only ever come for lunch.

Y1q95foMhGi23fz0nDdF7A.text: Had the buffet on New Year's day. The place was busy and we had to wait for around 10 mins. The buffet spread wasn't huge but had all the right and most sought for items. The food in general tasted good. Nothing exceptional about any food item. The mutton and chicken curries were decent and cooked well. For the price and the taste it's a good deal overall.

QWfSqZwwZVZvP0QODk3Png.text: I was hungry one fine Sunday and I decided to try this place. I have not found my go to Indian place quite as of you but mint Indian bistro was an okay experience. I went doing lunch time buffet style feast.  The price was in my opinion over priced for the quality of food. Chicken Tikk-masala was bland and it sauce seemed out of a jar or can. Their tandoori chicken was seasoned nicely as well as the rice and was probably my the only thing I liked all in all. Their chicken chili lacked flavor as well but I feel the vegetarian dishes were on point. The nan was fresh and the service was quite awesome.

5WsyH0X8jI9MHrT1qcd3gw.text: What a great gem here in Vegas. Food was amazing , menu was large with many choices. I was personally impressed by the exotic beer choices. Wait staff was great . I would def recommend . Fav dish would be be the lamb Rogan

PIrAiBwg-vFqnkRgN9DFog.text: Soooo good!! The flavors are amazing! The buffet is a reasonable price and everything I've had so far is delicious!!!

xWbfOmSJW8wQXRGcuuMdPA.text: We unfortunately did not even get to food , the seating itself was a problem. The front desk refused to give us a table where we could place the car seat (3.5 month old baby) He gave us a high chair but said ' the baby might fall as we have had 2-3 kids fall off' !!!! So we asked for a 6 seater (4 adults 1 child) and he even refused to give even that saying they are very busy so cannot give that table...   If you have kid who needs a high chair/car seat, I would not recommend this place for the kids safety!!

tAgcYDZs7Wd89jKo1NuLgg.text: Excellent food. Service slow. Had goat Khatara. Excellent. Lentil soup very good. Hot and sour soup was excellent but HOT!!! Definitely worth a visit.  Spice level 1-10. We had 6 but was mild. Soup was a 9

NZhptZuFDgWczUkW6pZMmQ.text: Came here with the wife last night, because we were in the mood for some Indian food. I've also heard rave reviews about this place (they've won numerous accolades for best Indian food of Las Vegas).   The place was packed when we walked in. The atmosphere is very dim, has somewhat of a bar/lounge feel to it. They do have a bar section specifically labeled the Lassie Bar. There were about 3 parties ahead of us, and after waiting for about 20 minutes, we decided to take a seat at the bar. We asked the server/bartender if we could order food here and then move to a table once a spot opens up. He said that once you order food, it will be difficult for us to do that. Seriously? It would take less than a minute to exchange that. Very poor customer service right there. We just ordered a glass of pinot noir and a mango lassie and waited another 20-25 minutes for our table to open up.   The whole night basically consisted of us waiting, waiting, and waiting some more. I don't mind waiting, but the servers never said a word about the food coming out late or apologizing for the food being really slow. They seemed to be lacking employees either out on the restaurant or in the kitchen. The parties next to kept looking around as well, because they weren't getting their food either. We ended up waiting about 40 minutes for our food after we placed our order.   The food was above average. The butter garlic naan was a miss. It wasn't soft, and it was lacking the garlic flavor. The Maharaja chicken tikka masala (spicy level 4) was really flavorful, and the chicken was tender. It had the right amount of spiciness too. The lamb vindaloo (spicy level 6) was ok; the lamb was really soft and juicy, but I wasn't a fan of the sauce. The tomato flavor was too strong in this dish.   We should have come here for their lunch buffet before trying their dinner menu. It's probably a better bang for your buck. I'll consider giving their lunch buffet a shot before ever coming back for dinner.
