Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tikka masala (butter chicken)
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter garlic naan. Ehh the garlic flavor was lacking.

Ud-Epl733G3Z0b7Y_8wblA.text: Carolina reaper biriyani! Sign me up every day of the week!  The drink menu is also legit and they have a good beer selection.

v8NtI5WlS4tK8-0aISmD3Q.text: I've never tasted Indian cuisine and wow I'm speechless. We started with samosa as an appetizer. I don't eat any spicy food but they were delicious. You tasted the potatoes and a small kick of spices. Next we had the puri bread by far my favorite, it was so fluffy and yummy. The naan by itself is a good option we tried, i recommend no cheese inside because it doesn't melt all the way. If you like to be electrified i would order the dosa. It's a piece of art on a silver platter. The lamb lollipops look small but are filling(the only thing i didn't like was that the secret sauce tasted like straight mustard). We had to chicken entrees that where marinated to perfection, don't remember the names but the chicken was succulent. For desserts we decided to get all of them. I didn't like the gajar halwa(carrot pudding). The mango custard and the mango kulfi are the best.

nSOYXbSjL67awk4639K73Q.text: I didn't know this place was buffet only but I didn't mind. Everything was hot and plentiful. There weren't many choices of entrees. The service was decent; took forever to get a glass of wine but it was busy and the kid was doing his best. I gotta say I was a little disappointed with the chicken tikka masala. The sauce was thin and light and lacked the robust heartiness that is usually present in this dish. The pieces of chicken were small and dry. I'd say try this spot if you're in the neighborhood but don't go out of your way.

wHqQ4FQzxMQb65q-duxmZA.text: I don't know if I'm die hard for Indian food, but I love this spot for their lunch buffet. Never been here at dinner. I've both dined in and got the lunch buffet to go. I'm crazy for goat.   Complimentary, all you can eat Naan if you dine in for lunch. A good portion wrapped up to go if you do to go. I always go with the garlic butter.   They also have a dessert/salad bar which I always forget exists when I dive in but, when you order to go, they give you a small plastic container for dessert. I either get the frozen yogurt from the machine or the non frozen mango yogurt which is quite tasty. Both are a Great way to get some sugar without feeling too guilty.   So the way to-go works is that they give you a normal sized to go container and you fill it up as best you can. I typically have enough for three or four meals (I shouldn't be telling you this). I go a small layer of goat, then tandoori chicken (the bone-in one) then more goat, maybe a little bit of whatever has spinach in it, then top with rice because rice is the least likely thing to spill out while still doing a good job of compressing.   If you like Indian food or savory/spicy foods, it's worth a shot.

P-8pBe6tzQ5gB0zdOzoFQA.text: Great all you can eat lunch buffet. Mango custard with yogurt was the perfect finish. Service was very friendly.

i_tbur6hqPdi1f0rM1ooeA.text: Mint was a great place for us to have family dinner! The place was clean, had great service and an extensive menu. My husband tried one of their flavored milks (to help with some spice maybe?) and it was delicious.   I refused to leave without trying the naan and it delivered. I wish I would have taken photos, but you know it's a good meal when you are enjoying it so much that you forget to! There was a mixture of different curry dishes at our table and I enjoyed each one. I honestly couldn't tell you which one I ordered because we ordered a handful. There was not one that I DIDN'T like!  They also have a great wine and beer menu and appetizers. Dimly lit for a perfect date spot or a fun place with the family like we were there for. (Can't believe we got a table with minimal waiting on a Saturday!)  The only downside to this location is the parking lot - it's small and a little sketchy in the evening!

h9DeM61ewCJxSD7x6nKw5w.text: One of my favourite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.  Massive menu and really lay out your choices, great for vegan friends!!  No dish has ever disappointed us.  Oh, they also have good tea selections. I had the mountain tip, and it was so good and refreshing. Really goes well with meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot tea

1JXRvF8-TGl5wy2TvXiFjw.text: The manager would not allow me to place an order for pickup.  I have lived on this planet 32 years, and this is the first time I have ever heard of this.  This was not a small order either - I guaranteed a $200+ order, and they turned it away stating that they were too busy.  What a complete an utter joke.  #trulyafirstworldproblem

0Es2FdVmeKjjL5jEM3V9Bw.text: I've been to most Indian restaurants in Las Vegas.  Not one can beat the food and service at the Mint.  I think this sums it up.

NLMOsNaB_lqfh4Ri3e1VAA.text: Love their lunch brunch. Great price and pretty good quality.  One warning they have very limited parking but It is worth going

DmI_7TbaRj-XnSz6fOcxEw.text: We were looking for Indian food while visiting Las Vegas and came across this gem on Yelp. When we walked in we were pleasantly surprised with the lunch buffet and didn't expect to have an all you can eat.   The buffet had multiple options for vegetarians, vegans and meat lovers like myself! It was DELICIOUS! Very flavorful and delicious! Great environment, polite staff, cleanliness, affordable ($11.99 for all you can eat) and overall a great find. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

AQf4THUMSbqrexgLUeLG8Q.text: The food here tastes really good but this review is in respect to their take out service. I call in to order the same thing I have for years and they tell me that they cannot mix shrimp and chicken together now. Also, the times they quote for the food to be ready is crazy. Told 20 min and I took 45 and they weren't busy at all.

gN3mQe-J_mKO3rxQRH9xSQ.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate the end of a successful vacation across the national parks in Utah and Arizona. Being vegetarians, we had a VERY limited choice of food while on the vacation! Coming here was definitely a vegetarian's paradise!   We started with the sev puri which was awesome and followed it with their vegetarian Momos. The momos were steamed to perfection and the accompanying sauce with it was amazing. They did warn us that it would take 20 minutes for the momos to steam and we were absolutely ok with that. I definitely appreciated the heads up (they mention the 20 minute wait time on the menu too, which I thought was really considerate). We then ordered the fried rice and masala idli and they were really good too. I do have to warn you - their portion sizes are not very big - but definitely enough for 2 people of you order couple of appetizers and entrees!  We also ordered the mango kulfi which was absolutely delicious! Highly recommend this place for anyone craving some good tasty Indian food!

TzsQWy59yx9vkfCel-0sAA.text: Everything tasted fresh and delicious. The whole wheat layered paratha disintegrates easily in your mouth and it was crispy at the same time. That's not an easy feat (I mean making it..not eating ;) The Handi chicken biriyani was good, but my benchmark is a well put together Hyderabadi dum biriyani. However, the butter chicken was great and didn't feel heavy. They also have dosas and the paper roast was well made. Lastly, they accommodated us despite not having reservations. The place started filling up pretty fast into 7 pm.

nIDhubZpdTqQqbOCLGYDIQ.text: Great service and very good food. Everytime we visit Vegas, we always go here for   fresh and hot vegetarian Indian food. Especially idlis!! Staff are very courteous and ensure we enjoy our meal.

atiGgB6v7v669QDpxI6K5Q.text: Pretty good food. They messed up my order but they replaced it so that was nice. Service is decent but could a bit more improvement in the friendliness department.

wgHHGUcSH9Ay0HqBohfyRQ.text: Went for dinner with kids on 03/31/2018 .Food tasted great. Service was not so great. The host who took our order was disinterested. We went there around 8 and were seated after 10 mins wait (not bad at all ). Once seated the host came to take our orders. Questions were not explained properly. One would assume that orders will be fulfilled when placed a bit later. But not in this place. We were told that he wont be able to take the order since there were some tickets ahead of us. Was annoying especially if you are  hungry. Felt like we were rushed to leave so other customers can be seated !!!!

m6LsGpXxaGClP_a63kV2EA.text: This is a pretty awesome Indian place in Las Vegas. Very good quality food and good menu selection. A great juicy naan. Next time I have to try that great big dosa they have! Trendy modern atmosphere.

PgdHY3-5figqs3AvnCoLmA.text: The food here was pretty good. We had the buffet. The service was above average. I would suggest going here for dinner and order. The Chinese Indian dishes tasted Better then the regular Indian dishes. I really liked the chili chicken.

CiSpctxScakRwMKU3TFkjQ.text: OMG I don't know who was cooking on Saturday night but the food was delicious... Naan bread was soft and fresh. I order the chicken makani, lamb korma and rasha mali...not sure if I spelled that right. Anyway, it was delicious and I'm never disappointed when I go there. Keep staying open late please....

EJXvox3sfPQkFBypT2Li2A.text: Mint Indian Bistro easily earns 4.5 stars but I'm rounding up to 5 stars because A. Yelp doesn't offer a half star review option and B. Mint's huge menu offers so much potential, I can easily see it going to 5 stars depending on what you order from here. and C. I'm easy to please. This was our first dining out experience in Vegas. Despite what the directions may say to walk here if you're coming from the north on Paradise, don't venture off of Paradise until you reach E. Flamingo. The neighborhood gets real rough, real quick. Was it worth the short walk through the hood? You best believe! This is everything Udupi Palace yelp.com/biz/udupi-palac... in The Bay Area should be and more. Service is quite good. The menu, in addition to being massive, is well labeled with what's Vegan and what's not. On top of being easy to distinguish between what's Vegan, the majority of dishes are offered in a Vegan and non-vegetarian version as well. While I appreciate that the menu is expansive, I was a little confused since it's laid out according to region. I'm not the biggest Indian food expert so I needed to comb through it to find what I was looking for. It seems to me it would be easier to navigate if it were separated by meat, veg, and so on. The Popular Pakoda are delicious little fried buggers full of shredded veggies. Their mint and tamarind chutneys are both very tasty. As a certified condiment whore I can say they're as good as you'll find at most places around. I love Malai Kofta, but haven't had it in years since I've never seen it made Vegan at any of the Indian restaurants I've been to. Once I saw they offered that, I was a happy boy. It wasn't quite as spicy as I was hoping, but it had a good creamy flavor with soft dumplings as a centerpiece. I'm sure if I asked them to bump up the spice level, it would be excellent. It also comes with a complimentary side of rice, which is a rarity nowadays. Speaking of spice level. They offer to spice most things on a 1-10 scale. I'll have to come back to get my photo on the Inferno Wall of Fame by downing the Inferno Curry. I'll just be sure to pick up some throat numbing spray as was recommended to me by an expert in the subject matter. If I have to sign a waiver to eat something, I'm bringing my "A" game! The Curry Pineapple Rice was alright. It wasn't mind blowing or anything. I would order something else in it's place. Especially since they already include plain rice with some of the entrees. We ordered the Pistachio Kulfi as a dessert thanks to it's description. I was thinking it was a Vegan ice cream but it was much more icey. Not in a terrible way though. A little different but still good. The Paratha was really good filled with potatoes and peas. It had a nice smoky taste on the verge of being burnt, but not all the way there yet. For some reason in all my visits to Indian restuarants I've never once ordered a Lassi that I can remember. Even during my dark Vegetarian years when I was eating everything BUT meat. My dining partner encouraged me to order one since we've never seen a Vegan version. I went with peach, which I think was a great choice. I thought I was getting the alcoholic version from the "Lassi Bar" but it wasn't according to the receipt. It was still really good, like a more refreshing, less heavy milkshake. Very recommended! It's not cheap, but you get all this food in nice looking digs for not too much coin yelp.com/biz_photos/mint... I would easily go out of my way to dine at Mint during my next visit to Vegas. Although you can find "decent to good" Indian food on The Strip, Mint is worth the short drive/walk/bus ride, or whatever means of transportation you use to get here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices aren&#39;t too bad for what you get.

ofK5Zra3SGFq-myfRF8GXg.text: Awesome food, very good staff behavior but unfortunately you have to wait for approximately 30-40 min until they serve food...

trWofJr3smZSKtX5wF0EaQ.text: Excellent food. Had buffet and completely satisfied with the service and food. Food items were good and all dishes were really fresh and delicious. The icing on the cake was the mango fruit custard which we thoroughly enjoyed. Though there was a little wait time but felt worth after having the delicious food. Food is not pricey and definitely recommend anyone visiting Vegas and craving for Indian food!

WCiEv7vLdeDIIuhnc9iKfA.text: Clean restaurant, friendly staff, and the best Indian food in town by far.  Though my family and I aren't Indian, we've eaten at many Indian restaurants because it's one of our favorites. Mint has the best variety as far as the buffet goes.  From vegetarian or vegan to meat eaters you won't be disappointed. Their naan is made to order so you're guaranteed a fresh basket and you can choose from plain or garlic...both are very delicious.   Their lunch buffet is $11.99 from 11:00am-3:00pm.   They are located in a strip mall and do accept credit cards.

Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet

UunoB420MbL1YeTBKA-KDA.text: Authentic Indian Food! AYCE lunch buffet from 11am-3pm for around $12.  I had a little bit of everything and to tell you the truth dont remember the names of any of the dishes Lol.  Poultry seemed to be their main ingredient meat wise. They were all good and a few were great such as the Goat, and you cant judge it unless you taste yourself.   The funniest part i must add to this review is my friend had never ate Indian food before and had the shits a couple hours later. I had the exact same dishes that he had so moral of the story is.. if you have a uni-cuisine stomach, dont go hard on new ones Lol.

5td7FM8mgLcIh_z73qCVAg.text: the menu options are really exahustive including nepali cuisine.  our order of chettinaad vegetable curry and the nepali soup can be skipped by others. The chau chau vegetable noodles were tasty.  food quantity is less & more expensive than other indian restaurants in Vegas.  Ambience is excellent though!

oxmUetEbQyogwsHJrhlBVA.text: The food here is good but overrated. I was so gassy after I ate from here. But it was still somewhat memorable.

BRgYp87i49htjXVZdIyTzw.text: Eh, nothing screams "I must come back here".  Was anything wrong? Not really.  Was anything great? Yes, fresh naan of your choice. But now do we go to Indian restaurants for the naan alone? No.  They have a lot of vegan choices on the buffet, which I certainly wasn't there for. I enjoyed their version of chicken tikka masala. It was lighter, had chunks of tomato in it. I didn't feel super guilty eating it. My husband did not like it as much as the creamier versions. I enjoyed the chicken chili, nice and spicy. First time I ever had chicken chili at an Indian restaurant.  The restaurant was clean, with newer furniture.  So anyhow, we will not be back. There are at least two other Indian restaurants in Vegas that my husband and I prefer.  Check it out if you feel like it, if you don't, no loss.

OlXXe8bDNAAAiqDef84WwQ.text: Very good food, I love it, everything is very nice , so, I will be back again, ,so,flavor chicken , goat curries , I love naan,,

dJRemSH724_u3RIRcghp1A.text: Don't come here alone, there's no seating and they won't give up a booth for one person.

ULE3qGy1siWKI_myhqSQWQ.text: I wish we would've just gone to our old standby Tamba which was not even a block from the hotel, but the wife (who NEVER wants to try anything new) wanted to try a new Indian restaurant.  The service was somewhat inattentive.  We had hot supposedly Chai tea, but no one brought out any kind of sweetener until we requested some.  (I should've had a nice cold Taj Mahal beer.)  The food was just fair with the standout being the malai kofta.  The tandoori mixed grill (lamb and swordfish) and saag paneer were pretty bland.  I've had way better food back home in Maryland.  They spoiled me rotten apparently.  Next time we're in Vegas and want Indian we know where NOT to go.

ZRMl94SsR56i6GvXxMTnGQ.text: Visiting Mint Indian Bistro two weeks in a row definitely warrants a review!  Our first visit was at dinnertime and we were utilizing our Entertainment Book coupon.  For the Husband and I, we ordered:  * Karma Korma "A creamy sauce sprinkled with nuts and assorted Himalayan spices." (with fresh veggies $12.99) -   * Rebel Curry "This is the Nepalese Gurkha version of the famous curry with a rebelliously inspired exotic blend of curry spices." (with lamb $13.99)  * Garlic Naan ($2.99)  One thing I absolutely love are papadums and was so pleasantly surprised when they offered these to us complimentary!  (Other Indian restaurants don't offer it complimentary anymore!)  Both entrees were so flavorful and just delicious that we couldn't resist checking out their ever so popular lunch buffet option.    The daily lunch buffet is $9.99 with kids 3 and under being free.  (Ages 4 to 7 years are $5.99.)  It's offered from 11:30 am to 3:00 pm.  One thing I appreciated was that they noted what food items were vegetarian and vegan.  As someone who recently stopped eating dairy, I found this very useful.  When ordering naan, I was able to get this sans butter, which was quite appreciative in my situation.  And with my  new dietary restrictions, I was still able to enjoy quite a lot of food items and left feeling full and satisfied!   Their buffet menu can be found on their website, but it does change.   Overall, we were both quite content with their food, a la carte or buffet.  Definitely one of the better Indian buffets in town, especially if you're looking for a vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free menu!

Y9zUgtj-cuMczEQUZV7C6A.text: Went on a recommendation of a friend in our dining party, who had heard of Mint via word of mouth but also had never been himself either.  Located in an unassuming strip mall, Mint is somewhat of a buried treasure in Vegas.  We went for dinner and were seated in a spacious booth, the restaurant itself was almost packed at 8:00pm.    The menu itself is extensive, but also descriptive and keyed for Vegetarian/Vegan items, Gluten Free, Spicy, etc.  Very impressive regional beer selection, I had never tried Indian beers before.  Our party of three enjoyed the Garlic Naan, Vegatable Samosas, and the crispy flatbread that was brought to the table was toasted perfectly.  For our mains, we enjoyed chicken tikka masala, lamb biryani, Rogan Josh (with lamb), and I loved loved loved the buttered masala dosa I ordered.  (I had been craving a proper dosa for months!).  Various chutneys were brought to the table as well.    All of the items were delivered with good timing, and were all equally delicious with tender chicken and lamb.  At the time of your order you can designate how spicy you'd prefer your meat/curry dishes (on a scale of 1-10).  Our server was hilariously talking us into spicier levels and we were glad we agreed with his recommendations in the end.    We ended with the small dessert offerings of which I can't remember the name but all were lovely and petite, served in tall shotglasses it seemed.  Total bill for three adults with one alcoholic drink and one soda $100 with tax.   Mint is definitely a jewel hidden in the Vegas rough, we will be back indefinitely.  If not on this trip, then the next.

fVBTKBkIx_XW40RXMrTTiw.text: The inferno menu is no joke.  I eat all kinds of spicy food.  I grind my own Trinidad scorpion moruga, ghost, and habanero mix.  I got crushed by the inferno curry. I had to stop halfway through my meal due to a stomach ache from the SEVEN TABLESPOONS of ghost chili powder that they use in the meal. The food tasted delicious and the service was great.

z6jOK10jUPuEPbxDOJezZQ.text: Not a South Indian style. If you are looking for some spicy food in the buffet, then this is not the place. Apart from mango custard, Idly and sambar nothing else is good as part of the buffet

WU6gYGr9buOzkz4dVOX7YQ.text: Pretty average Indian buffet.  Not enough vegetable dishes, everything had meat and we can't eat meat.  Green tea was $5.00 which seemed high.

w7ukI85YkRrxdFc8ix92_w.text: We love this place!  By the way, if you are a UNLV student, show them your ID and get 10% off, even for lunch!  The food here has been fantastic every time we've come.  Sometimes it's a pain in the ass to find parking, so just be aware that you might have to park further away than you might like (it can be a rough neighborhood).  Still, the food is totally worth a stroll through a dangerous neighborhood.  For real.  When we first came here, we thought our server was being REALLY rude, because he was looking at his cell phone while we ordered.  Turns out, this is how they input the orders, and they all have fancy iPhones to do it.  This is actually helpful, because they never screw up your order, which has happened to me at other Indian places in town.  The only thing that sort of bothered me last time was that they dramatically decreased the size of their kheer (the price went down, too).  It's like a little shot glass now.  Totally not worth the decreased price of $2.99.  Should be at least a dollar less for how tiny it is!  I took a picture because it was so hilariously small.

kuHkGNdsaVjdYu3gyMQoIQ.text: One of the best places to eat Indian food in Vegas. The lunch buffet has lot of options and the food is delcicious !! Will definitely come back and recommend to friends!

PZZt1hZnjxhGaIEV48cYyA.text: My wife and I have been wanting to try a new indian place for a while now, and omg are we happy we chose Mint.  Everything was beyond delicious (seriously there are no words).   I ate until it hurt and it was worth it.  Counting the days until we can go back.

q5UMpHPcXji7BN2RNdbSLQ.text: Was my first time there as i had heard that the food was really good. Well the food was good, but the service was super slow and we would have been okay with it. But when we got our food, they got us somebody else's orders. They were nice to note it quick, apologize n get our orders, but then again we asked for just one more flatbread n they got us 2. By that time we had resigned to our fates as evryone else seemed to be eating happily. So It'll be some time before I go there again. But yes, the food was yummy, the stars r for that

6SKLD0j_b3cq2HBox2ya1w.text: I work for an Indian company and have traveled to India in the past and enjoy the cuisine. Mint has a daily buffet that runs 10.99 and is well stocked. You can also go ala carte if you like. The service is good and they are fast. Tables move quickly and its a good place for families with kids as well. Overall a good place.

miTh3sxQWpZm5C4HgNrV2g.text: Came here this past Sunday and ordered the Vegan combo for two.  Service was wonderful, food was great, and we left stuffed!  Although they were all out at the time my boyfriend was particularly impressed by the fact that they had Vegan Lassi's available on the menu.  That's right, soy yogurt lassi!  Yum!!!!

VS5IHzB30yLOLrHJnVAxWQ.text: This is a great little Indian restaurant or maybe I've lost how to rate Indian restaurants since the Indian restaurants in Austin just plain suck (at least most of them).  The lunch buffet had a decent variety of vegetarian and non vegetarian dishes, along with a salad bar and two desserts(it was gulab jamun and something else). I don't like desserts so I can't comment on them; the vegetarian dishes, kadhai paneer, Saag, mushroom potatoes, dal, sambar, idli, rasam, pulao were all great. In the non veg section there was chicken tikka masala, chilli chicken, tandoori chicken, goat curry and another chicken dish. They all were great; I ate a bit of each coz it was that good. Also they bring your choice of bread fresh at your table unlike other Indian restaurants who leave theirs at the buffet table.  Oh yeah, if you're Indian and drink iced/cold water, you need to tell them that. The default water for us folks is warm water :)

BsGvcHJXfk94DxJ_MpdQPQ.text: Great place.  Great food. Waiters take your order on iPads. Way kool.  Btw food is not loaded with heavy cream

SqdI2iTLE9Vl_17pW8iuAQ.text: If I could give more than 5 stars I certainly would! Indian good is absolutely one of my favorite cuisines, and The Mint is most definitely the best in Vegas. I have dined at nearly all the Indian restaurants around town and as a Concierge it is my job to know the best places to dine in the city. I always refer my guests here for the authentic amazing food and genuine service. I can't wait until my next dining experience! If you like to try new things I highly recommend one of the tasting experiences you will not be disappointed!

3YuzPfhDk_0SnAkzQNTTRw.text: My favorite Indian cuisine in the valley! The food is fresh, delicious, and perfectly seasoned. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, regardless if you've ever eaten this kind of food before.   I've eaten from both the lunch buffet and the a la carte menu, and have been delighted every time, with every dish. My favorites include their tandoori chicken, turkey mo mo, potato and pea samosas, and their delectable garlic naan.   Their beer selection is excellent, and the atmosphere is lovely.   A+++!

Unkswjx755Ksx_BMJG4Ujg.text: My husband and I went there last week because everyone had raved about it.  There was no parking and its in a very busy area. We went for the lunch buffet and despite the crowd it looked like everything had been sitting there a while.  The desserts were just plain gross. I will give them credit for good naan bread but it wasn't "to die for" and it took forever to get it.  We were almost done before it was brought to our table.  And to top it all off I got sick an hr after I ate there.  It could have been an off day for them but I think I'll try to find a different Indian place. :(

70Uc9tD4ws0jg0yLHEUomg.text: This is a nice little Indian Restaurant not far from the Strip.  The decor is hip, the workers are polite, and the lunch buffet is delicious.   The price is $9.99 and they usually have a good variety of indian dishes.  If they have Tikka Masala, it is usually watered down... but everthing else is good, especially the Chicken Pakora.   I like the salad area, where they have some nice chutneys.   The nan is good, but they don't always ask if you want more.....and sometimes they get busy and don't refill your water... and if you have a burn going..... that could be dangerous.  Of all the indian restaurants near the strip, this is probably the best.  This place can get full very fast, because it is small.   Parking is not so good, as it is in a busy little strip of stores.  They open at 11:30.   Enjoy!

5y70SVD4jBMsS3FR6asMog.text: my boyfriend surprised me on valentines day and took me to this restaurant. it's been awhile since i had indian food and so far this is one of my favorites. i haven't try their kabobs but the curry's are to die for! i will definitely come and dine here again. The servers were so nice!

OZS5qFn0Pq91GYXlVNRSwA.text: Was here over a great weekend where we saw Peter Gabriel at Planet Hollywood and The Beatles LOVE show by Cirque du Soleil. We could have eaten anywhere on the strip, but chose Mint based upon their menu and reviews. We came in late, after LOVE and were seated. The gentleman who came over to our table was a joy, asking us what we might like, the level of spice we may want in our food, etc. He is the owner. The menu is extensive: Northern, Southern Indian with Himalayan foods offered, as well. I asked for his help in navigating the menu and he guided us brilliantly. The food, service and experience was one that I WILL repeat - EVERY time I am in Vegas. It was THAT good.

Q7XW78XCCm1ud_HANL2dAg.text: Went here this week on a friend's recommendation and loved it! We felt that the taste was pretty close to what we are used to in bay area, which is saying a lot :) Buffet offers decent choices and a special mention to the goat curry, the fresh naan (garlic and butter) and tandoori chicken. The service was good and the host was very courteous. We were told the wait was 45 minutes but were seated within 15-20 minutes.

icPto18uL8Kb3Ya7QBp0AA.text: All the good things everyone has said are True. It's not on the strip, which is great, since it means it's not ridiculously crowded. The Lassi bar is a great innovation, and the thandai lassi with vodka is awesome.   We asked for all our dishes extra spicy, but while they were pretty great, they weren't spicy at all. I've known this to happen before to some of my friends at indian restaurants when the server makes a size-you-up decision that you can't handle it, but really, this time they should have concluded that we can, given a) we were indian. b) we kept repeating about how much we loved spicy food. oh well.  Minor nitpick aside, the food is pretty great, especially some of the nepalese dishes, which are pretty rare (i've only been able to find one restaurant in chicago!)  If i ever decide that going down on vegas junkets to behave outrageously and pretend you're exempt from all rules becomes a regular habit, mint will be a regular lunch spot too.

VT-dDzkVOmgoFUEWHvQYEg.text: Nice location, nice decor ( very modern and straight) and amazing food ( we had the indian dinner for 2 - which was enough for the three of us). Attentative service, never had to run on empty.

OwCXnHNaXAe8HaYcfqwLHQ.text: An interesting mix if Indian and Nepalese food.  It's a small place in a strip mall but worth trying.  The service is friendly and we met one of the owners (or managers?) who was from the Bay Area and chatted about Indian restaurants back home.  Tikka Masala and Butter chicken are tasty but not at the level of my favorite in SF (Mehfil).  Best I've had in Vegas so far.

lUExKIal51DXBzLa6ezKGg.text: This place was so good!! The decor was chic and the service staff was very nice and helpful. The menu was huge (sometimes a bad sign) but everything we ordered & every dish that passed our table looked and smelled delicious. We had been craving Indian food, so before we stepped foot in the restaurant, we already knew we were going to order momo and chicken tikka masala. Lucky for us, Wednesday happened to be chicken tikka masala night, which means if we bought one, we'd get the 2nd one half off. (You can choose the level of spiciness you prefer.) Along with the naan, this meal really hit the spot. I'm not from the area, but I will definitely come back here anytime I'm in Vegas again just to try more tasty dishes, especially those on the prix fixe menu!

OqhgqBSfQtwyqQj-3Oo5PQ.text: Absolutely tasty!!! This place is one of the best Indian restaurants I've been to. There mixture of Indian, Tibetan and Nepal is a  refreshing blend. The first time I went there I asked for paneer pakora which wasn't on the menu and the owner went to the kitchen and made me up a plate which tasted amazing. They have lots of beers from India and alot of lassi drinks. Just to prove my taste buds are on the level I recently brought a friend who's wife is from India and she said very tasty and top notch. Well worth it. Nice atmosphere as well.

zKi5SxcLakYcwOvFD8Ke3Q.text: The Indian food we had was pretty good with the exception of the kulfi.  For those who don't know what kulfi is, it is Indian ice cream.  The pistachio kulfi we had here had a lot of ice crystals in it.  A sign that it was either melted and re-frozen (that has to violate some health codes) or that they did not cook the milk down long enough (lazy cooking).  Also, the Nepali dishes I had were not very good and I know this because I've lived in Nepal.  The momos tasted like they were made with ready made wonton wrappers from the grocery store.  The momo dough isn't quite the same as a wonton wrapper.  The kwati soup did not appear to be made from NINE types of beans/lentils.  It also did not look like the beans/lentils had been sprouted.  I give this place 2 stars because I the Indian food here seems decent but I definitely recommend avoiding the Nepali dishes.

RbhigPDBrfF7LRZzHyzVEg.text: went for lunch buffet. it's great. lots of food selection. they even have lamb and it's cook and seasoned nicely. and 3 different kind of hot soup. they only thing that I didn't like about the naan is that it's a bit under cooked. looks really white and I like my naan to be brown. (slightly burned)

cpHZX0GZRVxYnPZDjnwqKw.text: Simply awesome food! Manu covers almost everything.

v1bsJKW68IH9b_g91n7KvQ.text: I've been to Mint Indian Bistro for dinner once before, but I wasn't blown away by the food. Luckily, I tried the lunch buffet this time around, and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. One thing that I did like on my first visit and still like about this place is the decor. It's definitely a good place to go for a romantic date. I also am fond of the service here.   Anyways, back to the food. At the table, the server brought us our choice of either plain, butter or garlic naan (we chose garlic) and also roti (a thinner bread made with whole wheat). The garlic naan was yummy- soft, warm and studded with garlic bits, it was perfect for dipping into the soups and curries. The roti was good too, but I definitely prefer the naan. I can't remember all I ate, but I will list off my favorites. There were three soup varieties; I enjoyed the Sambhar soup (a hearty lentil soup) the most. I also enjoyed the seasoned rice dish, as well as the Chicken Tandoori and a vegetarian dish called Paneer Tikka Masala (blocks of soft cheese simmered in a spicy tomato-based stew). I also thought the Chicken Curry dish to be flavorful and good. For dessert, I had a few cubes of watermelon and one piece of Gulab jamun (fried balls of dough soaked in a sweet syrup flavored with cardamom and rosewater). I wish I went back for seconds on dessert though. The best part about the lunch buffet is that it is healthy or at least tastes healthy.   All in all, I had a nice time here. I would probably go back again- for lunch, that is.  P.S. Parking here during busy times can be dangerous. Small parking lot, too many cars, etc....Be careful!

r1eByoqz-4tBFsiIAaQt2g.text: Our absolute favorite lunch spot!! We go almost every week and it's always busy and delicious!! The naan is amazing and the lunch buffet is amazing! We will miss our weekly Indian food lunch!!

ro_NQItGC2WUXlFDkAe1DA.text: Delicious!  Interesting selection of Indian and Belgian beers. Gluten free and vegetarian/vegan options. Chicken vindaloo and buttered naan highly recommended. Friendly and attentive service.

RGekwElEnKHqlZR6-7KzaQ.text: Simply put, this is the best Northern Indian food I've ever had. The Tandoori was excellent, and the goat Karahi was the best I've ever had. Well, I've never had that recipe, but in the past, the goat was always salty. This time, it's like a smooth lamb - it's dark and tasty-tasty!  The buffet includes enough purely vegetarian items to make a Vegan want to get fat. And it's a small restaurant in a strip mall, but don't let that fool you. The service is good, and the staff is friendly.   My only regret? I don't live in Las Vegas and it's going to be a long time before I get back. And The Mint will be the first stop when I get back.

v_NbeG94UgtlkzKo6WpOKg.text: Really decent for a lunch buffet.  Didn't see the raita. Interested more on the dinner menu. We'll be trying this place for dinner eventually.  All 'n all this Yelp event here was nice. I laughed more than/similar to by the winner (seem down to earth) of the Crazy Horse tickets than the Wanda Sykes show at the Mirage last night.  Mint seduces you with alcohol mixed in various lassis.  My Wife had the Raspberry and I had the Black Current Lassi (no alcohol).  Food was not greasy at all and flavored with authentic seasonings. (to be continued, because I'm full & sleepy from lunch)

QIXNM09T1MYfEJ4SBXloZg.text: Love the buffet. Have not ordered anything from the menu, but really love the buffet too much to try anything else : ) The food is great, and I love the fusion of (what I believe to be chow Mein with tandoor chicken and spices!) Everything tastes fresh, and the service is friendly. A must try if you enjoy Indian buffets!

PZTGMOb3BgiXc32Mhg8nPg.text: Lunch buffet is awesome. A good variety of Indian favorites and they bring out fresh naan. On top of that students get a discount (for lunch and dinner)!

3r_y_cjRlobJNApmXDJoRg.text: I have eaten Indian food all over the world as a touring musician for 25 years. Indian food is one of my favorite foods and I search it out as I travel.  The Mint is excellent. I am newly Vegan as well and it provides an excellent choice for the Vegan diet.  Also ,my family is not Vegan and I have tasted the meat dishes they have gotten as well and they are fabulous.  I am a regular there whenever I work in Vegas.  Highly recommended!

SyB3rxk9CV5TRueMLU7keA.text: Very nice place , good waiters, nice food ( LUNCH  buffet is $11 each , eat as much as you like ) meat is Halal . AWESOME

gmlMhMeDSeXqMx3HN2en-Q.text: Great quality food.  Much better than when it was HImilayan Cuisine.  Love that we got a free good quality mimosa w/ our weekend buffet.  Price not unreasonable, food was amazing!  Delicious chicken Pakora (like Indian chicken fingers), chicken tikka masala, tamarind rice and spinach w/ chickpeas.  My husband is vegan and there were some nice options for him too.    Will go back again soon!  :)

DD_dSlQKcln7VXbN1qxcLA.text: I'm usually here for lunch, and they do a very nice buffet every time I've been here.  There's a nice mix of vegetarian and meat dishes, and I've never seen the exact same menu two days in a row for lunch.  Dinner here is good too, they do a nice Tandoori chicken, which is how every Indian restaurant should be judged in my opinion, at least if they offer it.  Overall, very happy with this place, and they also have a limited bar menu, plus wine and beer.

SeDW0ZRd3b0SR-Gz_cr3ow.text: The best indian restaurant Ive been to. I am not a big fan of Indian food.  This is the only Indian restaurant I ever enjoy. Ive been to 10 different Indian restaurant and do not like Indian food.  If your a vegetarian, this is the place and it is awesome for you.  I am not.   I did enjoy there yellow curry and clossal shrimp dish.  The price is fair. Lunch deal is excellent.  The service is friendly and have excellent selection of beer and wine.

fD9jgOGrTK_t6NP-iGO_-g.text: This place is so good.  The best place to get indian food in Las Vegas and the food is slightly cheaper than other indian places.  And get this, you get the rice for free!  OMG...what your not gonna charge me ten dollars for basic white rice which, is almost should be an inalienable right like freedom?   The Makhani with vegetables is delicious.  Malia Kofta is creamy, and not to rich and the kofta balls are nice and fresh.  The saag tastes super fresh, not like canned spinach.  The beers are on the pricey side but, I tried the kingfisher beer and enjoyed it immensely.    I got a mango lassi for dessert and it was delicious.

MZfH26uNuH0-O_DBg4opZA.text: The lunch buffet can't be beat here!! The price is super cheap and the food is very good! Is it worth the hour long wait one time, when the line was out the door and had to wait a super long time for a lunch at 2pm on a thursday... ehh??? The buzz must have gotten out cause this place was packed for lunch.  The garlic naan is super fresh and keeps coming out when asked for.  The selections at the buffet are all tasty and good.  My go to indian food is always chicken tikka, tandori, rice and goat curry which are all good here. The tandori is not too dry (which happens often for indian buffets I noticed) and the goat curry has lots of actual goat meat.  Spicy factor is definitely there so be warned!! I also ordered a mango lassi but that was ok, I think it was a pre-made from a carton though, boo :( which is a little disappointing.  The only issue is when it's packed, the service gets a little slower and the wait is pretty long since people do not want to leave without getting more than their money's worth.  You know a place is super good when it's native people are taking over the place, not trying to be racist but this place was FULL of indians and their huge families... so it must be good right?!  Don't miss out on this place and lunch is very good cheap eats for great food!!

ZND71XWIXcb4RhVrpc0saw.text: It was a good experience for me and my family. We tried the Lunch buffet. The food was good and was quite cheap.

AVoQgOPV9N7mIGN9MAzOSg.text: Good restaurant with mediocre at best service and decor.   The food was good, a mixure of Indian and Nepalese food. The curries were quite tasty and Naan was great. However, I was expecting more Nepalese and Himalayan food and less more traditional Indian food fare. However, all in all cuisine aspect of the place is definitely above average.  Service was poor. We came in for an early dinner (around 5PM), and the place was empty. A few Nepalese gentleman (friends of the owner, I presume) were sitting together talking business and writing stuff on notepad right in front of the customers--not professional. That would have been okay, but to top it off, one of the managers, or possibly the owner was also serving the tables and was quite slow with water/drink refills and was very rude in questions about different, unfamiliar menu items. He even had a smirk on his face a couple of times. The tables were unimpressive and some of the booths were ripped in places and patched together with tape.  Overall, for me to return to this place, I would have to make sure that the server/manager was not there that day and that it was busier so I do not have to see creepy business conversations. But, I may come back and recommend this place for unique and tasty food.

TUT32-PmWSVShsUhJ2YQyw.text: Good food lunch buffet has food value.   Staff is helpful and polite.  Worth trying

_HYYNwWwd9rNiHTFDogroA.text: Unbelievably great Indian restaurant. Hip, classy, reasonably priced, and the food is outstanding. Everything in this place is really well put-together; even the menu is a delight to read (the beverage section says something like, "while we're waiting for the Himalayan snow to melt, perhaps you'd enjoy some of our other water selections..."  The Indian sampler was so tasty, with a wide variety of dishes and perfect proportions (the perfect dish for a first date). The Mango Lassi was flavorful but not too sweet. The organic tomato soup is unlike any tomato soup I've ever had.  The owner stopped by our table, and it was clear how much pride and thought he had put into the restaurant. I plan to return to Mint Indian Bistro every time I go back to Las Vegas.

V5o-u3DjOsh4ETuAe0qI_Q.text: Really average food in buffet for lunch. It was a good selection but food was a little less than I would expect.

3ScQpJuOyqfgwREaLjLK5g.text: Their buffet was the best amongst all in the sin city. Ambience and service was good and timely.

TWSgZZwAmyg5ldqqZ3IZcA.text: New favorite. Every time the food is great. I recommend the malai kofta. Nice beer selection. The waiter is a young chap who presents your beer like a fine wine. He also politely corrects your pronunciation of the beers. Loads of booths. Sometimes parking is tough. It's classy.

tFnBgjrABmaez9RDrdYN6w.text: We stopped in for their lunch buffet while visiting my sister who lives in Vegas. Great food, great ambience. Friendly, efficient staff. Will definitely go back next time we're in town.

YdXGXg8ol5xKt-wJ7qxDkA.text: Went twice for lunch buffet.Food was okay.idly was not good.liked curd and mango custard

5Z4vG3SeaRZp--yUBGiKfw.text: The food is delicious and they have a good selection. I've never had bad service any time of day that I've gone, and their bar is pretty diverse. This is definitely a "staple" Indian restaurant for me.

ivSf9AHYWVouTRqGpGfMGg.text: Food is great. I would put this at the top of all lunch buffets in Las Vegas.

018mQb_YpfdqJvz7DG9JiQ.text: awesome food - the sampling menu has a lot of food and two of us could not finish it! We walked in without a reservation and they still were able to accommodate us.

xH5MLB6DYf2AJhNdKNqhoA.text: A group of friends and I have a food club, where we get together every two weeks and take turns picking new restaurants to try. Being a huge Indian food fan, I was ecstatic to hear that someone had finally picked an Indian restaurant.  The service we received was great. My friend had informed the owner what it was we were doing, and he was more than accommodating. He sat down with us and we were able to talk to him about the restaurant which is really nice.   The food, however, was so disappointing. Two of us split the Indian sampler, as it was advertised that it was "Perfect for two to share or one to feast on." Naturally, I was expecting a bunch of food. To my disappoint, when the platter came out - it was nothing more than barely a half cup of each item. It was not enough to satisfy one persons' hunger, let alone enough for two to share. We had even ordered an extra side of naan. It was sad to say, we had more naan than food to eat it with. It's a sad, sad day when that happens.   I will say, their mango lassi was good.  A majority of my group was disappointed, just as I was, in the food to price proportions. Although, many of them left full, unlike myself - the price they paid for the food wasn't sitting too well with them. But who can blame em? My friend and I spent about 40 dollars between the two of us, to leave the place completely dissatisfied and hungry.   Needless to say, when we left the restaurant, the first place I headed to was the Jack in the Box in the same parking lot.

DIIH80O7SGvB2ruzhFeN7A.text: Bad food. Raw food. On top of that bad service. Avoid this place unless you are so hungry that you can eat pretty much anything.

6rULr-5X5N-EYMKIaYkgLA.text: I went for lunch buffet and I loved it. The food was great and garlic naan was best! The ambience was lovely and the staff was friendly too. Well organized place and the best part was there were many vegetarian options. Me and my parents enjoyed our lunch!

9ZdyvQLk9_eXXlV5w6KLkQ.text: Mint India has a very extensive menu including vegetarian, gluten free, and dairy free options. Always on our Las Vegas dinner list; never disappoints! This trip, I had the Maharaja Tikka Masala and vegetable samosas. Absolutely Delicious!!!

wO3iG-yI5G1mHuQWwtywJA.text: During lunch they offer a buffet and have about 8 different entrees ranging from vegetarian to those with meat, gluten free options and a variety of sauces and accompaniments. This is a great way to sample different dishes without having to order the entire restaurant. But, Indian food is not for those with a low tolerance for spicy (hot) food. The fresh naan is wonderful and great for dipping in these flavorful dishes because most entrees do contain a good amount of heat (probably 3-4 On a Thai 1-5 scale). Worth checking out and they open at 11AM which reservations aren't really recommended till after 12PM.

05YThrtVzSrjw47AOE4PlQ.text: The food was really great, and it was cool that they had Vegan options.  The service was ok, but they took forever to seat us even though the restaurant wasn't that crowded and there was only one party ahead of us.

AK0zc7gctrCa4cL1yaCs7w.text: Came here for the lunch buffet.  I do not know if the food here would be considered authentic, but I think the food is delicious and I was not disappointed at all. I would recommend this place.

rs2460YoIglGywaJUhBxYg.text: Great off-strip choice that is allergen-friendly. All the options on the buffet are clearly labeled and so many choices are both gluten & dairy free. Gf breads only available for dinner buffet but no shortage of carbs. Discounted prices for the kids are much  appreciated. I like the blend of both north and South Indian choices. I've been to Indian 3 times and this food is fabulous. The restaurant full of Indians seem to agree. Will definitely eat here again next time I'm in Vegas!

HC1JrGTHjP4xMk_CdEf3TA.text: I hv been there twice, they hv good customer service great food and my fav is butter chicken n naan. Must go place for variety of north and South Indian food + more. I will definitely b back.

Avh4G8NuvNnnTi47Emk99g.text: Great food. Naan were fresh made and soft. Salt Lassi had a very nice taste to it. Great and fast customer service.

VTyH-IAragVDmhE-sqtU2A.text: I love the lunch buffet.  Tons of food and I like that they bring out fresh naan.  The chicken masala and basmati rice are my favorites.  The only thing that is lacking is True raita.  They have yogurt sauce but it's just not the same.  So I have to go to India Palace for my raita fix.  Still very good, friendly prompt service.  Every so often I hopefully check to see if 9091 has reopened and end up here.  It does quite nicely.

yV6PLpbCb0NnIJwBYeZeKw.text: Very Good Food, hospitality was excellent. Lots of options for Veggies. Dosa with its various varieties were loved by kids. It's reasonable too.

NJJFIlYi7es76hX_K-EKWw.text: Nice decor, ok service (example: we ordered extra rice and our waiter forgot about us and we had to ask the next waiter who wandered by 10 minutes later if he could bring us some), tasty food. I'm not too sure on the value as my husband and I shared the Indian sampler plate which was all pretty tasty, but wasn't exactly a ton of food for two people (even though the menu indicated it would be plenty). But maybe I'm just used to having tasty leftovers to take home when I go out for Indian... hmm.  I'm gonna have to update my review after I try the buffet, because I've heard good things. For now, Mint remains a solid option for Indian food in Vegas, but nothing really mind-blowing.

mPtPSgz_ljBJ4y886Z0Yig.text: Love this place! The staff is always pleasant and the food is delicious! Being a vegetarian, they have tons of amazing options. I always leave here full and happy.

v4XoZzA1sVKOONEv9zWwig.text: I went to this place recently for dinner. They have good looking food but average tasting. Salt was not right in all the items we ordered. Table service was not good too. For some reason the waiter was in hurry to clean the table and indirectly putting pressure on us to finish sooner.  While we were having food, there was incident in restaurant. One of the guest fell while her chair broke during getting up. Waiter serving us saw it and did not even bother to extend help or ask if she was OK. He just moved to serve other table. That was bad as other guests had to help the other person get up. Even manager did not seem too concerned when the guest complained.  For the price they charge for the food and based on other reviews, I expected lot more. I would not go again.

1zcS4BDeno3PdW3Urmf_8w.text: My friends and I decided not to go to a buffet, because one of us was a vegetarian.  We ordered the Indian sampler and another dish for 4 of us. Everything was so delicious and filling. YUMM!!!

Twy5CE22H_xHORwfEHoyUw.text: Was looking for some Indian restaurant at 11 pm. Luckily found this. I ordered idli sambar n lassi. They were pretty good. My husband ordered andhra chicken curry and roti which were tasty too.

GUU4jUDp5R7_92-yZwoqiQ.text: Auuuggghhh! I don't want to give out five stars anymore! My reviews are too positive. I have too many five-star reviews, so I changed the way I rate places. I'm more critical now and an establishment has to go way above and beyond expectations or be the best I've had in its category. Unfortunately, Mint Indian Bistro is THE best Indian food I have EVER had, period!  I know, my life sucks! All I want to do is give a critical review, but I keep having outstanding experiences.  When I opened the menu and saw dosas in the appetizers, I knew I was about the experience something special. Dosas!!! My use of redundant punctuation should indicate the percentage exceeding one-hundred that represents how much I love a good dosa!!! Mint has giant flaky dosas filled with many different types of awesomeness.  Both Southern and Northern Indian recipes are included on the menu, as well as Tibetan and Nepalese entree selections. I know of nothing like this back home in Seattle. If someone else does, please tell me! This place was great from beginning to end.   I don't do dessert at Indian restaurants so I can't speak to that, but I did have a delicious Blackberry Lassi which I can say served a dual purpose as dessert/beginning of the evening cocktail.  They have a lunch buffet, but I didn't get to do that since my friend is a bit of a germophobe about buffets.   So, in conclusion, best, awesome, great, and delicious! I'll have to wait another day at different restaurant to be comfortably critical. I can always go back to Chutney's back home, I guess.

iDbMtsdi74L9mZUffibhiw.text: Food was tasty. They had a good buffet. I liked the mango custard too!

qJonbGjY-JN_00tj2ouZqg.text: How wonderful to find this place off Rainbow!  Chris, the owner, who is ALWAYS working, is wonderful, and makes a point to great all guests, and visit the tables to say hello and make you feel appreciated.  Inside decor is still being worked on, but even in mid-decoration, it's a nice atmosphere.  Great beer list with good prices!  Try the Pirate - $8 @ 10% with an amazing flavour - you definitely get your money's worth on that one!  Everything we tried there was wonderful: the Chau Chau (sp?)Chicken, the Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Biryani, Chicken Chili, Naan, Mango ice cream....fabulous!  And the yogurt topping is fantastic - a definite must with the spicy dishes.  Servings are well-presented, all come with superb rice, and generous portions.  Great service, wonderful food, and decent prices (entrees ranged from $10-13, and the lunch buffet is a steal for $10).  Mmmmm.....I only wish I lived closer!  OR, even better, that Chris will open up a Mint in San Diego :-)

KYo1W6MGKK8w4QONwQihGA.text: Wow, this place inspired me to actually write a review! You either have to be exceptionally good or exceptionally poor and this place was exceptional! Unlike most Indian restaurants i've been to, this place didn't hold back on ethnicity to India's native dishes and held True to the level of spices and flavor each dish had. I had the linch buffet and only wish I could've eaten more !  I can't wait to return

TwjzcsduLLHI7u9d24iX_Q.text: We visited this place twice during our stay at Vegas. They have a variety of options on their menu. We ordered Masala Papad, Schezwan fried rice, and dosa. Everything was freshly cooked, spice was perfect as per our request and the dosa was very crisp just the way I like it. Based on our first experience, wanted to give the food another try and went for their lunch buffet next time. We were not disappointed on our second visit too. They have a good number of choices on both veg and non-veg dishes. The food tastes delicious, the ambiance is very quite and comfortable. The service was great too! I would definitely visit this place on my next trip to vegas.

yhqFYjLNe40IKruHMEtsNg.text: I can't sing enough praises about the food here. Simply amazing. Came in a little over an hour before closing, which can mean old food and crummy service, but that definitely didn't happen. Had the Dhal, veg samosa, garlic butter naan, veg biryani, chicken masala, and spiced hot tea. Everything had a 1-10 spice option, I went with 7. Superb! The dhal was absolutely loaded with flavor and spice. I love that Indian food (when done right) doesn't even need meat. Next time I will order veg masala because the flavor was such that meat was totally not needed. The service was fast, friendly, and attentive. I don't give out 5 stars easily, but if I could give a 6, I would. This restaurant truly takes me back to The Flavors I experienced in India, and I would recommend it every day of the week!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Samosa. Delicious! Perfect spice!

K5csZm3QOZ0Cz5GVdd3LPA.text: Do yourself a favor and head off the strip for this gem!  This is flavor country!  The service is impeccable. Also, they can customize most dishes to fit your dietary requirements   We really liked that the naan can be served without butter and it did not hinder the taste one bit. The specified spice adjustment is perfection!  The beer and wine lists are extensive too.  The mango curry is to die for!!!

GirxJbOuYtmCp-qV--pNqg.text: Why did it take me so long to check out this place?! The decor is modern and friendly . They have plenty of chairs if it gets busy and you have to wait, I thought that was considerate and showed the owners think of their customers.  There is one row of fantastic fresh food , water comes served in a glass bottle adding some class.  The service was great , everyone was very polite and on point.

7ATVRtVcZgO8mYvAFVfQyg.text: I said I am never going back, but i did .. Bad choice.  Not much changed as for service and bad attitude from last visit, but this time even food was bad. Didn't taste good , was just okay. One of the chicken dishes tasted burnt. Another disappointing Indian food experience :(

wT7cQ6BYaa1NXqzSlCwOZg.text: Our favorite place to eat in Vegas! The Chetinad Masala is the best. I order it vegan with roti. The Durango location has ample parking while the Flamingo location is cramped.

mHqU1NIVE8tGXgRUj2I0kQ.text: I have eaten the lunch buffet about 6 or 7 times before and decided to Yelp my most recent visit.  Really enjoy the cool and laid back vibe at Mint.  The lively Bollywood style background music adds a nice touch. Also, the creative art on the walls contributes to an air of whimsy.  Now, onto the food. The buffet starts out with a small but nice selection of simple lettuce salad, various chutneys (mint and mango are my favs) and plain yogurt to tamp down the heat of the curries which aren't really that hot anyways.  While I didn't try all the the entrees, a few of my favorites included: Paneer Tikka, Veggie Korma, and Chicken Tikka.  The basmati rice is always a nice addition and works well under the entrees.  I always look forward to the garlic naan bread and it did not disappoint. Just a nice pillowy, but crispy bit of deliciousness. Yum!! I'll take another order please! And another...so addictive.  Found the servers to be attentive and courteous. They are always sure to bring another carafe of ice water.  All restaurants need to have carafes of water as it's a major time saver for the servers and keeps customers happy.   Can't wait to return, but could do without the three children who kept screaming during my lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Every restaurant needs this. What a concept.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small but nice salad section to start off the buffet.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paneer Tikka and Veggie Korma on buffet.

cQIpC4WR_PArehdXplsi2A.text: Five year before when i went Vegas for the first time, i found this place on google and i still remember how amazing it was then.  2018 was my fourth trip to vegas & now i have decided not to visit Mint again if i will go to Vegas for my next Holiday. There menu has limited items now, they cut the chicken Biryani from buffet, food quality is not even up-to the mark of one star. Garlic Naan was hard and not soft & fluffy like it used to be earlier. Gulab Jamun was like a hard rubber ball which you cant cut with spoon. Mint seriously need to recheck food quality else they will soon start losing customers. Only reason i am giving two star because once i liked this place.

7nFlGxfKnovqtOQRSXQwHQ.text: Hair in appetizer - no apology from the owner Portions are tiny, took 15 minutes for getting the menu Shezwan fried rice has no Chinese food taste  Will not choose to visit again!

-MeA-LvpHTdBBHvEhnn8lQ.text: To update, I use Mint Indian Bistro mainly for dinner take out. The flavors are pretty good, however the portions are a bit lacking for what they charge. I usually get some kind of Vindaloo, and while the container appears to have a lot of stuff, most of it is sauce. Order a little tray of rice to go with the sauce and a little naan to dip, I'm looking at over 25 bucks for 1 after taxes and tip. Wouldn't mind it when I'm lazy

_ikCJGsSlMSavQ6cI5P1iA.text: We had to wait for 40 mins to get our food. We ordered masala papad to start with the drinks.We were done with the drinks and the papad never came,so we decided to cancel the order. Food was good and if you like real spicy food ,you can try this place.

mhaE7ls5zYBj131LRwITwA.text: We stopped by this restaurant and the gentleman offered us free bottles of water. I have never visited a restaurant and received this kind of hospitality. To top it off their hummus was delicious, the interior was brightly lit, and it was perfect for pictures. Food prices were reasonable too. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Las Vegas. Avoid the tourist spots and save three times the money and get a peace of mind.

yWwxBnrp4P-BLccpYYfErQ.text: I had been here during Thanks giving holidays. I was told that there are many Indian buffets in Vegas and a lot of varieties when compared to the place where we live SlCC, Utah.  As this was the closest and on the way to Hoover Dam, we decided to stop by here. The food was terrible and I don't remember  any dish worth mentioning here.  It was a buffet and not a single dish was tasty enough for the second serving.  The only manageable one was chicken Tikka masala.  I would never go back to this place ever again !

nR4ukVDw80BW19M9ZFimtw.text: Told fiance I been wanting Indian food for a while! We decided to head this way after the gym considering it was just down the street!  Service was great! At no time did they try to rush us and was helpful & patient when we were deciding on what to order. Refilling our waters and even offering more basmati rice when we were out.  As far as food, we ordered Lamb Samosas to start with, a bit dry and needed some type of sauce but still good. Our entrees were Chicken Breast Tandoori for me and Lamb Korma for my date. We also ordered their infamous Garlic Naan! I love anything on a sizzling plate! The chicken was moist and tender! My dish was not spicy at all, which is a plus for me because I can't handle TOOO spicy! Paired perfectly with the basmati rice and I even made a little sandwich bite with the Naan, grilled onions, cut the chicken up and topped with yogurt sauce! DELISH!   The Korma was a "7" and I guess it wasn't too spicy either but he likes spice so  \_()_/  , he said he might go "10" next time. They also have an inferno menu where you have to sign waivers! I wonder how serious that is! Lol  Overall a great experience! Wish we had room for dessert! Until next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kurma!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Breast Tandoori!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan!

8D8jEnm4959xNAcUXUsIRg.text: Went here on a whim but now seek it out when I'm in LV. Love the organization of the menu and the flavor of everything. Lassi bar is fun, creative, and delish.

7ExLIN010W1XMr1W6hE0vQ.text: Best Indian paneer Tikka masala in US......order Maharaja Paneer Tikka masala!!! Great taste, great texture and great flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maharaja Paneer Tikka Masala
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best thing is this water bottle and the ambience!!!

ib5CdJx9f-bR1slFR68otA.text: After reading reviews of Mint Bistro, I was excited to try it out.   Meh. I am visiting Las Vegas from Denver. I tried this restaurant for their lunch buffet.   Overall, I was not impressed. The buffet itself was of average size. I found nothing to be spectacular. They had about 3 vegetarian dishes, 3 or 4 chicken dishes, and one goat curry dish.   Nothing I had tasted bad but I did not find any of the items particularly good either.   The tandoori chicken and chicken massala were average at best. The goat curry was mainly bones.   Thankfully they had a container for additional hot sauce so I was able to spice things up a bit. If I lived in town I can't say that I would return to this restaurant.  It looks like Las Vegas has many Indian restaurants with lunch buffets. I will be eager to try somewhere new next time I am in town.

ykGQVU17_keONo-ld3RipQ.text: The place is quite small so when it's busy around lunch time you might have to wait for a while. I like there options, most of Indian lunch Buffet places don't have soup but her they have 3 options just for soup itself. Their dessert is awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango custard and gurab jaman
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nanny of your choice. This one is garlic

uPRxdbPC7aUa4zdpRg3YrQ.text: I was pretty disappointed when I tried Mint about a month ago. I LOVE Indian cuisine, it is one of my favorite foods when going out to eat, I pick it over almost anything else. There are a lot of good Indian restaurants in the area, and one absolutely incredible one. But Mint, I wouldn't even call it fair. It's not True Indian cuisine. It's in the horribly ghetto parking lot near Mr. Beijing on Flamingo, but the restaurant itself inside is extremely nice and clean, only reason it's getting two stars. The service is absolutely horrendous, some of the worst service I've had at any restaurant in the Las Vegas area. I always go to Indian restaurants at lunch because of their lunch buffets which is nice so you can experience many different foods rather than just one entree, and its generally a really good deal. Mint had the same sort of setup, so I began at the buffet. The options here were really really weird, there were some Asian inspired choices and everything seemed very Americanized, not your traditional Indian restaurant. I remained optimistic. The food was not good, no spice, no real flavor in their tikka masala/butter chicken. The naan was absolutely horrendous, worst naan I've had. How can you mess up bread? Super weird. The guy at the cashier was so rude and barely acknowledged my presence. Will definitely not be back.

uR-wBS8lS9aylc4lku5faA.text: Mmmmmm Mmmmmmm   This place is delicious!! Lunch buffet has a lot to choose from and is very reasonably priced. The staff is friendly and provides great service.   I dare you to try the inferno challenge and get on the wall, but first you must sign the waiver!   12/10 would recommend

HQid3Flynqk71-hum5dOUQ.text: I have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed with the food. Their dinner menu as well as buffet selection is great. The food is very authentic and to be very honest they serve some of the best Indian food in the country. The only downside is the service. During my multiple visits what I have observed is that they are understaffed. Just one server most of the times taking orders! And I guess that level of stress have made them to act rude sometimes. Long delays in service still hasn't stopped me to visit here again and again. I would be great if their service improves

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ucN18FgkT2Id5ADJ_ur8jQ.text: Mint Indian lunch buffet is so good! Made with fresh ingredients and made from scratch every day. I needed a delicious, healthy meal like this today and it completely exceeded my expectations. Been a fan of Desi For awhile, but this buffet from 11-4 is where it's at. Friendly staff and I was quick in and out. Every bite of everything I tried was delicious.

UYjpOWr1R02G9Mnkickc1w.text: Superb indian buffet! So glad we tried it! The food was so flavorful! Good options in both veg and non-veg!

2HNS_1kPVh5jpyYXExvWeA.text: Food is delicious... service well it's ok Coming back to try the lunch buffet  Dosa was awesome...

9WU544gSsQlbIxSiCOv4fw.text: My favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas for delicious food. The prices are reasonable. They have good buffet which covers north and south India. The service is good even in busy times. They open the bar for dinner. I recommend Mint Indian Bistro for good Indian food in Vegas.

5IhZRfT1kA2fHSjwniahCw.text: Came for the lunch buffet. Like this options as it allows you to try the various dishes the restaurant offers. Some of the food we dried out others were perfect. They even had goat, yum Was not a long wait, we sat inside because the place they put us outside smelled like a urinal

I_hlGs2swrmCJnu5hvystw.text: Although my first time, i enjoyed the food. The place is a little small, wait staff friendly. The food was really good. I loved the goat curry, nicely flavored and very tasty. Their rice was also good although a bit oily. Overall, I like the variety of the selection and would definitely return. Price for their lunch buffet was very reasonable.

1nJnMkiaFLkVbnfliGtTkg.text: IF YOU ARE PLANNING TO VISIT FOR DINNER AND ORDERING VEG DISHES, DON'T!!  Sorry to say but the worst indian food I had in my life was at this restaurant.  We ordered vegetarian dishes, Maharaja Panner tikka- it was literally water like gravy, no taste, no salt, no spices, just food color. Second was daal tadka- it was heavily added with curry leaves no daal.   The Bad taste and so less quantity of dishes doesn't justify high prices on menu.

vX6vUwHdTP6mi_0Mw5ggxw.text: Wanted to order Bhel Puri.  Even though it was on the menu, No...they wont serve it. Only stale buffet served. Sorry did not care for this.

02i_spIv7p1rDHsLk6PmPQ.text: Probably the most tasty Indian food in LV. The variety is wonderful. There is something for every palette.

G4mqmwoP9MBiSTzbbW9YQg.text: Holly mother of goodness.  This was one of the best Indian restaurant I've had in Las Vegas. Our server was decent, not the best, and she tried to help us navigate thru the menu but a bit awkward and keep on pointing to the specialities, aka expensive ones. But she was still attentive and knowledgable, and very patient as the menu was different from Indian places we've previously tried.  We had the stick naan with dipping sauce (can't remember the name), Maharaja Tikka Masala with chicken breast (#3), and Rogan Josh with lamb (#3). The stick naan was ok; we will probably get regular naan next time. The two curry though, oh my... I wish I can dip myself in it. We were so full but cleaned it good. The texture, spice, flavoring, and the aroma were just amazing, we stopped talking much and kept on eating. I could probably do #5 but my girlfriend, who is just getting used to spice tapped out at #3.  Since this is close to my workplace, I am sure I will be visiting for lunch buffet shortly.

CqVcw_81ktVNV3nMdXW7-g.text: Pretty tasty. I went here while in town this week on a business trip.   I ordered the rose lassi ($5) with soy milk, and we ordered the Naan appetizer as well as one of the more popular ones, with cauliflower. That one was a little spicy but very tasty.   I usually get chicken Tikka masala so I decided to try their mango masala. The taste was very similar to the Tikka masala but with chopped mangoes in the sauce, which I never would have thought would go well in Indian food, but which was very good.   Waitservice was good too and our waiter recommended some dishes to us.   They get 4 instead of 5 stars because we each got a tiny portion of rice, and when one friend ordered more, there was a $1.99 upcharge. Also I felt like our waiter did try to sell some of the dishes too much, like the Naan app, which we did end up ordering.   Overall, very tasty, and I would visit again.
