Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cauliflower appetizer

wBOM3cUKKC_MLcy-ho4MyA.text: The food was very good. We enjoyed it. We didn't order as much food as we normally do and we were full...even had leftovers to take with us.  I gave it 4 stars because of the service. They didn't fill our water and I felt we were being rushed. They close at 11:30pm and we got there at 10:30pm. As we were leaving, the gentleman asked if we enjoyed our food and then said just in time we're closed. Something like that.... I just felt rushed...

Km2SUcxZ3xryyjs0ggG5wg.text: Ahhhhh man!! Have you ever had Indian food? Me neither. Until I had lunch with a friend for the buffet. The place is not very big but tge wait staff is great. The Naan is made fresh!! Kind of like Olive Garden bread sticks, except it's Naan!! The buffet had a good variety. I love curry so I enjoyed this very much!

HVdrnSwNjt2Fq0UaDvy9sA.text: Strongly recommend their food - great and diverse list of menu to choose from, apparently mentioned to be using organic produce.   The service is little slower as your food is made to order but is all worth the wait. A very interesting and fusion blend of alcohol menu.   They seem to be super experimental with their cocktail menu, one has to check the kinds of lassi they serve with infused alcohol. The interiors of the place is full of modern art that also reflects in their food which is a good blend of traditional recipes tweaked to accommodate the modern day diverse palate.   Definitely coming back for more food during my next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable pakoda and beer
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appealing poster
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting interiors

O4gM2-toG2seungAZLffoA.text: Very good food. Buffet is great. Has explanations of what the food is. Had goat was pretty good.

amhzL_EZ64qZF-lWMG0Wzg.text: I have never had Indian food before because of what happens to Ben Stiller in the movie Along Came Polly. It traumatized me and I have been afraid to try it but it's always looked so enticing so I decided to give it a try with a couple friends.   I went on a Sunday night and it was pretty busy. Fancier on the inside than I was imagining. I noticed while drinking some water, their cups said Ikea on the bottom- just thought that was funny.  I ordered the Mango Marsala at a level 6 for spiciness. (Hot Cheetos are spicier than that was.) I am pretty sure the waiter forgot to put our food order in because multiple tables that came after us, received their food before us. I wasn't particularly upset with that, I understand people make mistakes and I felt as if that wasn't a common situation here, so I let it go. The food was very good, sweet with a little bit of spiciness in the aftertaste. Honestly, the perfect balance. I tried what my friends had ordered and I wasn't too big of a fan. I would come back but I would most likely get the same thing again.

CR-18C3TbhSUuAW6gbdIIw.text: I dined here for Sunday buffet lunch for the first time yesterday and it was spectacular. My friend had been there many times before and his recommendation was spot on. Because it was busy, we put our name on the tablet near the front door and only waited about 8 minutes for a table. There were a lot of options, mild-very spicy, and all flavorful and delicious! I will be back!

JNfxlwuqdyT_152Gal8iKg.text: Worst service ever. Waited for roti and saag panner for 30+ mins. No responsibility whatsoever to the servers.

lVzKTrSSSxXtiS7LbPBmiA.text: No more than a 3.  I have been seeking for Himalayan food in every city I visit. Mint is below average to be honest. We didn't have the best service: the guy couldn't explain the menu items for us. I ordered the cauliflower  dish and it was awefully small portioned compare to the price. I bit my tongue because the buffet was a lot cheaper for the same price.  And I was expecting to taste more spices as I did in other restaurants. The spice is what delivers the uniqueness of this cruisine... we came to the restaurant to taste what we cannot make at home.   My friend says the buffet was good. But to me the cafeteria feel kills the culinary art. Hey don't get me wrong, I eat street food all the time but ...ugh, just sayin

ceV0ndRoVFMzJ0au0sZvWQ.text: Average tasting food but good variety and offerings especially the 2 person meal/Thali

xBcN93eC9gH6D5Ck6hcALA.text: Simple review for this place.  13$ lunch buffet that is awesome. Great quality food with a decent variety. They also offer 10% off if you show your UNLV student ID. Lack of 5th star because if you order any drink that is not water it takes them a long time to bring it. But the decor is nice and the staff is friendly and the food is good. Great place to get your indian fix in.   Oh and if your into the whole Vegan thing they have a lot of options for that on their menu.

ifODLR0VJhO9rqHE3TIzqA.text: Went here last weekend with some friends and was pleased that we were pretty much the only Caucasians in the place...which I take as a good sign in an Indian restaurant. I got the mixed vegetable saag. Not the best I've ever had since it had more mixed veggies than sauce and was way spicier than my friend's dish even though I ordered mine mild and she ordered hers at a 5. The hubby got the Mighty Momo with chicken. I didn't think they were that good and would definitely be more appropriate served as an appetizer than a main dish. One of our friends got the lamb lollipops which he thought was great. The garlic naan and paratha were ok...I've definitely had better. Give this place a try, they have a pretty interesting menu.

tbpa15VjHHeOmqzC6GZhtg.text: I am typically not a huge fan of Indian food, but this place has changed my mind.  The decor is very modern and the restaurant does not have that usual smell that comes with Indian cuisine.  The meal is buffet style, and although I was not certain what the items I was putting on my plate were- they all tasted yummy.  I especially loved the garlic naan bread with the sauces they provided.  So good!

nEvSCTjHRRDmYMEBko46ug.text: First time dining here and I was very happy with the selection of food on the lunch buffet.  The decor is lovely.  I loved the Tikka Marsala.  And, I loved the fact that the Waiter ordered me some fresh garlic naan when I was first seated (never experienced that any other Indian buffet).  All the servers were cordial although I did find it a bit odd that one guy ringing up the bills was wearing ear buds the entire time I was there.

WRLCimw4PxwEvHZuIspZBg.text: This is one of the best Indian restaurants ever! And this is coming from someone who's eaten at dozens of Indian restaurants in a handful of cities across the US.   I had a veggie salad to start, which is sliced tomatoes, cucumbers and carrots, thin green chili pepper strips garnished with onions and lemon wedges, with the perfect amount of Indian seasoning sprinkled over it. Unless you have super high tolerance for extremely hot food, I suggest you go easy on the chili peppers but the rest of the salad was awesome.   For the main course I had Aloo Gobi Masala (potatoes and cauliflower in a curry sauce), brown rice and an order of buttered paratha (multiple thin layers of whole wheat bread) with fire roasted garlic. Aloo Gobi tends to be a standard dish at Indian restaurants, though the flavor, consistency and oily-ness of the curry sauce often differs from one restaurant to the next. I have to say it is out of this world here! It's like you died and went to Indian food heaven! The paratha was also outstanding . . . a little heavy on the garlic but I happen to love it this way. And it's such a pleasure to be able to get brown rice at an Indian restaurant. Very few offer it though I'm not sure - in this day and age - why this remains the case. The meal was absolutely perfect. The dim lighting, plush decor and warm ambiance of the dining room was a wonderful compliment to the wonderful food. No complaints about the service either.   I had such a great experience that I came back a few days later and tried their Karma Korma with veggies, along with the garlic paratha again. The veggies were perfectly cooked and the seasoning was heavenly. The sauce was nice and creamy . . . coconut milk-based I think. Regardless, it was one of the best vegan Indian dishes I've ever had.  If you like Indian food, you HAVE to check this place out if you come to Las Vegas. Absolutely outstanding food!

t6pY4CgWtZNfoPP6l4awkA.text: I love this place for lunch! Never a big crowd, and they get you in and out quickly. But, if you're not in a hurry and want to sit and check emails or play or your phone, they're cool with that too. Service is quick and the food is amazing. I've only ever had the lunch buffet, but it's on the top Indian good I've had. Must try's are the lentil soup and the garlic naan. Both are the best I've ever had.

llTL2R4IArLBKeHkwqVFqQ.text: I wanted to love this place more than I did...the server was very friendly but the only one in the place so his service was a bit stretched. The "bust boy" walked by our table several times leaving 3 dirty app dishes & glasses right at the end of our table before finally picking them up. The food was ok, some dishes better than others. The shrimp was waaaay over cooked and dry.  My dish was very spicy at a level 3 and my husbands was not hot at all at a level 4.  Prob would not be back again.

IoTABNbKVCVqvMZszyvXng.text: i had Buffet last week and all the varieties were too good. Particularly the indo chinese foods tasted really Good.

CZhSA8XX-1wHaqDxEL4VsQ.text: We had a lunch buffet for 13 on a friday afternoon.  - Hard to find parking. It's in a small area, so walking just a couple min in fire bc you parked so far is a pain - Clean. To my surprise, the restaurant is pretty elegant. nice plates and fancy cup glasses. - comparing my experiences with indian restaurants near UC Davis, the food is not spicy at all. I was expecting it to be packed with flavor, but curries were nothing close. For my tastes, overall somewhat bland and dry. - Garlic naan was great! fresh! But comes with a caveat. it takes forever for you to get some.  - Although it is AYCE, Don't expect to be coming back for more and more. Not much of a selection to choose from so I would say at most 3 plates. After a while, the food gets redundant.

DKgKMX5LKO93kk01_hiFgQ.text: This place is good every time we go. This time we got there right at 11 as they were opening the buffet. All the dishes were out, hot and delicious. The staff is friendly and courteous. I make it a point to bring out of towners here. Delicious, authentic Indian food.

aH0ofJO_mNMkxnMNsAvsLw.text: Tasty; affordable (which is rare for Vegas); cool decor; and excellent customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian pre fixe entree.

S47EEWnZO8y1egnv0yAIKg.text: The food was really good but the service is slow and disappointing. Everyone got the prix fix dinner which i highly recommend.  But we came in a big group and at the end when the bill came it didn't add up.  I had to complain multiple times before the employees figured out that they added gratuity but refused to say it out loud. I think the server wanted an additional tip on top.

jq8Rl3VnirULFyZfR-zJ2g.text: Mouth watering food. Very quick service and polite staff. Each staff greeted with a smile. Indian Prix Fixe Dinner for two included Chicken Tikka Masala and a few other sampled entrees. Delicious!!!

fJNzWsLdvB6sOaJhJwUqIQ.text: Horrible attitude of the manger.. we had a reservation and they made us wait from 7 PM and we did not get the food until 9 20 PM and we just had to walk up and leave. The manager was not even sorry and did not seem to care at all. Avoid this place..  I never review however this place is so horribly managed with their tablets and smartphone apps that I went ahead and made an account on yelp just to write this review.

y2r_z6HWpIk0agt1LpyYVg.text: This place is fantastic! If you're looking for authentic and fresh Indian food you definitely need to check this place out. I've been here many times for their lunch buffet and never leave disappointed with the food, service and atmosphere. A True gem in Viva Las Vegas!

KuR_RX1p4J5CPPrLJLKqmA.text: Feel: you enter this place and want to feel good about this place, good lighting comfortable seatings et all. Good music.  Menu card: i love elaborate menus, ones which tell you details and makes you imagine and times salivate :). This one takes it a step ahead it even details items like gluten free, jain , halal etc.  10 on 10 for menu.  Service initial: 1. The manager asks for scale of spiciness. 2. The waiter clearly asks for water with ice or without it. How many Indian place do so?  And the good part ends there, rather miserably.  My friends, veg asked for a thali for 2. Question: how can a thali for 2 have only 1 nan? Lamb lollypops, not well marinated and rubbery. We were asked to rate the level of spice in food, we asked for 8 and got a -8  0/5 for food. There is an apt hindi saying: unchi dukaan feeka pakwan (only pomp and show but no content).  A good reataurant has to be flexible, we asked for a thali which had kheer for dessert but we requested to substitute with gajar halwa ( available on a different thali ). The request was rudely turned down not by the steward but by the kitchen, we never got what we asked for.  The waiter goofed up plain rice and jeera rice and tells us not to worry he will have the ticket updated. I love food and feel bad when my love for food is weighed in currency.  Service 0/5

KzlR-AvF7K42h4KMmiXkBA.text: The difference between their gulab jamun and heroin is that one is a hopelessly addictive substance, known for its ability to wreck one's health and soul, as one lies, cheats, steals, and even kills just to lay hands on a little more, to get that blissful feeling, and the other is an illicit narcotic.   Everything else on the lunch buffet was pretty good, too. But, when I'm 750 lbs and diabetic, it'll be Mint's gulab jamun to blame.

pKqAZggV9qBf5HZeuAwjoQ.text: Very good Indian food! I don't do spicy very well so on a scale of 1 to 10 I ordered a 1 and still thought it was hot. But I think that's just me - I'm a wuss! We ordered the Indian tasting menu for two which I think is reasonably priced and you get a lot for what you pay for. Would definitely come back and try other tasting menus. The menu is pretty extensive and kind of overwhelming which is why I went with the tasting menu which simplifies things for you if you want to try several things off the menu but aren't sure where to start.

Ee3mNwmC_o5ttvadBXB5Mg.text: We went there for lunch buffet and the food was very disappointing. Even their lassi bar was not good. Will never go back to this place again.

RwQita2e2w-TdLWvkediGg.text: the food and service is great here. it's much fancier than the older version, looks like they're revamping the interior.. but i was most floored when i saw the words "vegan" and "organic" on menu items.. i had to do a double take.. and was pretty skeptical while awaiting my dish but was pleasantly surprised - the food was fresh, not too salty, perfectly seasoned.  oh yeah, it's about 50% indian & i recommend this place for indian food too.  PS.  TRY THE ROSE BALLS ( don't remember the actual name on the menu) they are the donuts thingys flavored with rose water. i've tried these many times in different cities but these are hands down the  most delectable.

gEHq9QJdVyxQaB5K3US8LQ.text: Phenomenal! Excellent portion size and flavor through the roof. Super courteous staff. Menu is awesome--so many options: vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, lamb, fish, chicken, etc etc etc. And the price is right! Enjoy!

WHPRRiFlieu-FCGnSizQNg.text: food was good, but the service took forever, portions weren't very big either - was excited to go after reading all the reviews, and instead got on the road back to cali pretty late and still hungry. maybe save this place for a night you're still in vegas instead of on the way out

Z388NyiPZPg19qkvU3N1vg.text: This restaurant,  in a small shopping plaza, features the cuisine of both India and Nepal.  We shared traditional Nepalese entrees of chili chicken and meat momo as recommended by Max Jacobsen.  The waiter asked how spicy would we like our chili chicken - Indian spicy was my reply.  Wow - call the fire department - we are talking smoking hot!  Each order of meat momo order includes 9 momos (I love that word) which are steamed dumplings stuffed with ground turkey and vegetables.  We also ordered naan, 2 mango lassis (yogurt based beverages) and 2 desserts (khir and Lal Mohan). The former is basmati rice in milk with raisins and nuts and the latter is similar to or the same as Gulab Jamun, but a bit denser

73-SNFxbVCSBTBmMosWm5g.text: Dinner review. Excellent staff - humble, paid the right amount of attention to me. Excellent food: I had the sauteed cauliflower and potato vegetarian dish. Try the ESH 28, a german beer - a strong beer with a very smooth taste.

sy2L41hcxsGrv-pDfPEdIw.text: Me and my friends went to the lunch buffet for the first time , so this review is for the lunch buffet only... The selection is very limited with a total of about 10-11 items (that's including the 2 desserts and 3 soups but not including the chutney bar, which has about 5 chutneys, which I don't care much about..)  , the food is OK for the price, but not the service, me and my friends just felt like we weren't welcome there, the servers never greeted us when he saw us walking in, also very slow when it comes to taking away the plates (we only had 2-3 plates each), not like it was busy in any way, the restaurant was half empty despite it's small space. During the (granted brief) time we were there he never came to our table to check if we need more naan or not..... After we got our second plate, the server gave us the check without asking, and without saying a word to us... We gave him the money and were supposed to get 8 bucks something as change but he just assumed that's the tip for him, which to his credit he was right, but I still expected him to bring the change back first, but he never did... Of course when we left there's no acknowledgement or goodbye in any form.... Their bad manner and service "might" have something to do with my friends being Chinese ? A form of prejudice ? They didn't think we'll tip? we weren't wearing suits but t-shirts and jeans? I don't know for sure.... We won't be back, that's for sure.....

zTTQNe65yEfWLiEwGT-EWA.text: The food was not exceptional, just good solid vegetarian indian food--but wait! The tibetan food was really good, and I hadn't seen a lot of it before. The sauces were a little underspiced, and the vegetables a little not varied enough, but I still definitely recommend this place. Its menu has a lot of attitude and wonderfully designates all the dishes which can be made vegan--I really appreciated this. The only really downside of the dinner was the owner, who was chatty to an extreme as we were trying to leave. I recommend the channa masala and the tibetan dish similar to yakisoba.

O7Lu9Za7R9nDM-iYHX4-4w.text: After reading the mixed reviews about this place, My husband and I took a chance and went in for lunch. We were seated quickly and our waiter took the drink order. My husband got his drink right away, I had to wait 20 mins and having to ask three times for my glass of water. We asked our waiter if he had any suggestions and he said yes I recommend any of the samplers.He told us it was more then enough food for two people. So we ordered one of the samplers and an order of samosas for our appetizer. It took over 30 mins to get our food and once we did it was barley enough food for one. The food was dry and very bland. We asked our waiter about the samosas and he said he had already given them to us, Turns out he gave them to the table behind us. He had to re-order them for us. The manager ended up giving us the samosas for free. We left this place hungry and ended up going to Mcdonalds on the way home. I will never go to this place again and do not recommend it to anyone. If I could give zero stars I would.

IaFZ0q8sem77M_vr1pK5XQ.text: Simply just delicious Indian food. The owner Kris is very attentive.

Ne6Pg41bUK76CEHd8t_foA.text: First time going. Clean, Everyone there was very nice.  Food is good. I will be back to try the other entrees that sound delicious.

UIljDeAoBj_XtTD_yLvBWA.text: I went here a few days ago because it's like 2 miles away from my house. This place has been a few different restaurants in the few years I've lived on this side of town. It was a Himalayan restaurant, and now it's Indian restaurant. The decor inside is very basic. Moss green walls, some black iron pieces on the walls but was largely devoid of cultural ambiance that I particularly like in ethnic restaurants. I feel like decor really adds to an experience, it makes it feel authentic. This place didn't really have that. It was new, so maybe that's why it was so sparsely decorated. I took someone here because they never tried Indian before, so we just ordered the Indian Sampler. The Indian Sampler had about pint sized versions of coconut curry vegetables, lamb vindaloo, chicken masala, lentils, tandoori chicken, yoghurt, kheer, and one other that I can't remember. It was accompanied by 2 pieces of sliced garlic naan and basmati rice. The coconut curry veggies were fantastic, the flavors were excellent. The lamb vindaloo was good, not great. Not as spicy as i'm used to, but not bad. The tandoori chicken was kind of a joke,  it looked like two cornish game hen legs. So micro chicken legs, I thought that looked horrible.  We ordered lychee lassi and mango lassi, and for whatever reason I was served lukewarm mango lassi. I've never received lassi that wasn't cold, so it was a little different for me since the lychee lassi was served over ice. The service was good, no complaints on that. The owner chatted with us a little and was friendly. All in all, it was okay. It wasn't great, the price points are lower than Origin India, so i'd go back if I wanted to pay something a little more moderate. The experience was fun, nothing mind blowing. Origin India just blows it out of the water as far as the quality of the food and ambiance though, so i'd much rather go there if I had a choice.

Bd50jL7Vsqyssq2w5tUaWA.text: i went to this place last week with my sister and two other people who have never tried Indian food, and we all loved it. We had the Indian sampler for $30 and the Vertical Vindaloo and it was all delicious. The sampler, one other entree and extra order of naan was enough for the 4 of us. The service was also great. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone who wanted to try Indian or even just something different.

xaqR3hg6M5OcDvK_fWK--g.text: Not worth the trouble! The wait here is crazy and the service is mediocre. The food was good, although spicier than I am used to. I think I'll stick with India Palace instead. They have better food and better service.

SwQAjJ_SUKTEmdYADjaQlA.text: Nice and casual. Foods are not super salty and greasy. Kids friendly too!

3GfO2BsC-bb3GbRvTxBC0w.text: Now I'm only giving this restaurant two stars because of service and the taste of there food. I'm from California and have been to many Indian restaurants from San Diego to the bay area. My aunt and uncles also own a couple of Indian restaurants and I've had Indian food when I've visited India so I know how the food should taste. I went to there lunch buffet which is ten dollars ( not a bad price for a buffet in Vegas). Now even though the price is low, that doesn't mean the quality of food should be low. When I went i noticed that the food was cold and that the containers in which they house re food were all open. This is very bad because that food is exposed to air and bacteria the entire time that the buffet is being served. The food also didn't have any flavor(the somasa were round and only had potatos, they were more like thick potato chips and the chicken tikka masala was very plain and didn't have any sweetness or spice). Indian food should be either spicy or somewhat sweet, it should never be flavorless. When it came time to pay, I had to wait ten minutes because the two guys at the register were on there cell phones and very slow to process my bill. I left them a 4 dollar tip and as I was leaving one of the workers says bye to me all while still on his cell phone, this in unacceptable customer service. If you want to try Indian food, I recommend you try some other place because there are many other Indian restaurants in Las Vegas

06RRp1qVoORh4Uf71hfKOg.text: Me and My Boyfriend came up on Mint Indian Bistro accidentally. We both come from the Bay Area and we LOVE Indian food, eating Indian food at LEAST once a week. We came hear to Vegas and the first thing we did was get on Yelp and look up which Indian restaurants were available here. Unfortunately I didn't come across Mint. But Thankfully while driving down Flamingo on our way to settle for...Del Taco! haha, we came across Mint and we hurried to turn the car around and see what they had to offer. I tell you now that it was the best decision we've made since visiting here. There food has so much flavor, no doubt probably the most healthiest Indian food I've ever had. This place is CLEAN!!!, tidy, music is great, food is Delicious, and Chris the owner was very intuitive and conversant with us a lot, which is what we love =] if your ever in the area PLEASE stop by here. you WON'T regret it.

4d4xQKHo5M5o3lTiTLTmMg.text: Terrific Indian fare with great ambiance and plating. If you are going on a date and you want Indian food, this is a great place to go.

JvVWcUzeLtZxhs1dDFMG7w.text: Went to this restaurant because my brother saw a lot of "Recession Special" ads on billboards and since he was craving for Indian food, we ended up going there for his birthday brunch.  Presentation was good, portions were on the "smaller" side but then again, majority of Indian food comes that size!  We had the Lamb Kurma, Tandori Chicken, and several folks in my party had the "all-you-can-eat".  The place was PACKED for a Saturday afternoon -- and there was only 1 poor waiter running around pouring water, taking orders, cleaning tables,... and he was probably the cook too 'cause we waited and waited and waited for our food.  Not being too "graphic", hours after brunch, I wasn't feeling too great.  Later that day when I told my brother, he said, "Oh,... I forgot to tell you that last week when we tried to come for lunch, the Health Department shut it down due to some "pipes issues", supposedly."  Nice....  bro!!!  Happy *@$#(*@(*#( Bday!  :-/

5epnjfAK1ljRwHoiQeoLKw.text: I had planned on visiting this restaurant during our visit to LV Christmas 2012.  Took the bus off The Strip to the Atomic Research Museum across the street from the Mint Indian Bistro.  After the museum, we walked across to the restaurant and joined the line for the Sunday lunch buffet.  We added our name to the list, which was on a tablet (Ipad perhaps) with the help of another customer (this was a new experience for me).  The restaurant is only so big and we must of hit a popular time.  Polite host and waiters.  Waiter was great, especially for a buffet.  We were a bit out of place, as we are not Indian.  But I saw that as a good sign as we waited; it  must be really good Indian food.  It was great.  My wife thought it was too hot, but she likes very mild.  The flavors were wonderful.  I've been to Indian buffets before, but this was more extensive. This will be a repeat should we return to LV.

ZR3c9i47pfKKgrLN6LcdZw.text: Mint is ahead of the game, definitely one of my top spots to eat in Vegas.  The service is great and they're very friendly and easy to communicate with, even with English speaking customers.  They even gave out two complimentary dishes since I've been here as a trial run to open up new items for the menu.  They are foodies as well, and know what to suggest and to whom.  The food we've ordered all came out very prompt.  The dishes here I found more delectable than the other Indian restauraunts.  Vegan, vegetarian, and meat lovers all alike with feel welcome here.  The music has a mixed playlist of Indian music along as well as techno and other genres.  Come try it out cuz this place is awesome.  Mint even has a ghost pepper inferno curry dish where you appear on the wall if you dare to try and succeed!  Kudos Mint. Good eats.

023XLglnAigyRYw1RsG-2g.text: I was excited to eat at this restaurant. But, honestly the food was just okay. I opted for the Pre-Fixed menu because according to Mint Indian Bistro, these dishes are supposedly their most 'popular' dishes. I was disappointed by the soup starter. I had two scoops of it and was done with it. The fried veggie appetizer was decent,  but nothing great.   Then the entrees came. The two meat dishes were good. I believe one was a chicken dish, the other was the lamb. The other vegetable entrees were forgettable and bland. The rice was plain and nothing to brag about. And I chose the garlic naan, which was dry. They don't brush it with any ghee to add an extra layer of flavor. Just chopped garlic on a dry naan.   The dessert was almost inedible. I chose the round 'doughnut' hole thing that was swimming in a pool of butter and something sweet, maybe it was honey, which in theory sounds pretty good, but it's like eating a soggy sock soaked in sweet butter. After spending $65 with tip (had a $5 indian beer), I felt like I was massively ripped off. Also, if you are hungry, the portions for the pre-fixed for two is quite small, in my opinion.  I've honestly had much better indian food in Hawaii. If anyone ever visits Oahu island. There is a small hole in the wall called Cafe Maharani. The food is amazing, but just keep in mind the wait can be horrendous, so call in your name (to put you on the list as you make your way there) or order take out to avoid the (often) 2 hour wait. My favorite dishes are the Chicken Marsala, Shrimp Do Piazza, Cheesy Garlic Naan, well any Naan. The saffron rice. Well, any of their flavored rice. And, any of their creamy lamb dishes.   I was also super bummed that our server was inattentive. Our water glasses went empty for a significant amount of time in between the meal and each set of food app/entrees/desserts were delivered by the bus boys. Our server only took our order and then brought our check.   They were slightly busy, but no where near a 2 hour wait. There was only one party waiting to be seated when we were leaving, so I just felt like more effort could have been made to providing better service.

MII6CJzvIXqi5K0mzRPeBg.text: Great food...good buffet. Highly recommended.  Tried veg and chicken biryani here. it is really good. Just one note though, fried idli not that great.

HkHbhHe4-NLeibTueVJ2rg.text: Excellent lunch buffet. Worth every penny. Never been disappointed. Fresh. Tasty. Spiced are just right. Garlic naan is great. Service always tops.

_VW2z1MVBmHCKgi1RokpVQ.text: Excellent food. They have two locations. Both served really good South Indian food. Highly recommended

ultbVYUDTkWM3wZfUFhorw.text: Like another reviewer mentioned service here is always awkward and uncomfortable. While I was still placing my order the waiter said you should order the full size of curry because the small size is very little. First off I was not finished ordering and I just felt like he was trying to up sell me. Also I have been here before so I know the portions and have been served by this same waiter.   On this visit, I ordered the mango lassi; garlic naan; chicken tikka masala; andhra curry. Mango lassi is still my favorite in town. I still don't understand why the garlic naan is not cut so when it comes out piping hot I have to wait a bit to actually tear it apart. The chicken in the tikka masala was dry even though it is buried in a cream sauce. The Indian spices in the andhra curry are overpowering to where you cannot taste the coconut milk or the fresh veggies.   The lack of attention to detail paired with the uncomfortable environment gives MINT two stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andhra curry

dCELJSdNODLA6GtEw8GeHA.text: We were hoping to find our new favorite Indian place.  The sign said they opened at 4:00.  It was 4:05.  The man said we would have to come back at 4:30 because they needed to clean up the buffet after a busy lunch.  I asked him what time it was.  He said 4:05.  The sign said they opened at 4:00.  It was 105 degrees and we have two small kids.  We went to Firefly instead.  It was great as usual.

aWSFY1_Z5AvNcgYzBsUdqQ.text: Very good food, great selection at the buffet. Some of the best I have had. Only 4 stars because I wish they would have had a couple more of my favorites. The service was also outstanding, asked often if everything was ok or I needed anything, but not so much that it was over whelming.   Highly recommend this place if you are an Indian fan or just wanting to start trying Indian.    Also their lunch time price was very good, inexpensive.  Great place!

GluHfovrXq7oXpCbhYaXMg.text: The Amibience is really good!!!  The drinks were good also.  The masala Papad was really good for starter.  Now to the food the kebabs were good but was missing the lemon sizzele...  they were spicy and good..  The tandoori chicken was bit dry but good The buter chicken was well like any other places butter chicken.  Nothing much more then regular!!  I give it 4 star for Ambience !!!!  But 3 star on food.  Good place to take someone just for show!!!  I heard the owners have started desi burrito around the same strip mall!!  Interesting concept I have not tried it but will next time im in vegas..

a0QzT2p2VmYZOlSGPm-rpw.text: Great Indian restaurant. The food is amazing, very good ambience and service. I was here early this year and decided to try it out. The food didn't disappoint at all. Highly recommended if you are looking for Indian food in Vegas.   Trumps all other Indian options in town.

mYcZNCTOfu61vI_ZHV72UA.text: I love this place! The menu is very clearly marked with what is gluten free/vegan/ halal, which I think is wonderful. I am Celiac and always feel safe eating here. I am a particular fan of the lunch buffet. The price is spectacular for the quality and amount of food that you can get, and the food is clearly labeled for safety.   I am a huge fan of the pakora (veggie or chicken, both are delicious) with Tamarind sauce. They also have the best Chicken Tikka Masala I've ever had. They have a gluten free Naan type bread, which is made with buckwheat, but I find I prefer the papadan for the texture and flavor. The mango lassi is delicious as well: not too sweet, but cuts the spice of the food beautifully. I don't particularly find their food hot spice wise (I had the medium spice level and didn't feel like there was much there, then again I'm quite fond of and used to spicy foods.   The waitstaff is very friendly and pretty quick with service, I've eaten here many times and never had a problem! I definitely recommend it, as I think it's the best Indian food I've had!

5Etxq_5mC7I7n-fuCFwMRg.text: So the reason I'm giving this place a 3 is because the food is ok and service is slow and not as friendly as I'd expect for a place like Mint Indian Bistro to be, but I do have to give it to them for the atmosphere and setting of the place. They have a Lassi Bar which is a pretty neat concept and the big booths were nice and cozy as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Masala dosa
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LcsoBLJA1dKTk2Rrm2ds_g.text: This restaurant is very unique. They serve authentic Indian dishes that are full of flavor. All the curry dishes were delicious. This is my second time having Indian food and I was not disappointed. I suggest going during lunch time and having the buffet so you can taste all the different types of dishes. The service is great. All the servers were attentive and making rounds to consistently refill our drinks. The restaurant is located just slightly east of "The Strip" for those who out of town/tourists. Definitely well worth trying them out.

XG2l2QT0LzylExYOJEwFEQ.text: Very friendly staff! Absolutely great spread for an Indian buffet. The special item I liked is cranberry rice, don't miss it.  You get plenty for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians!  For family and group of friends I recommend taking the booth, so that no one can see you devour the chicken tandoori! :D  We were there on a Tuesday noon for lunch, not much crowd, so it was quiet and the Indian music stayed in the background adding to the subtle ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious garlic naan and cranberry rice!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar and the buffet spread!

D9tCeSt77E8i3yB4xGS10Q.text: This is one of my all time favorite restaurants in Vegas.    It's off strip, which means the prices are WAY better.     The setting is small, but inviting.     Forget those two dimensions though and experience the quality of the food!  I recently went with two people who don't like Indian food and when they left they said they planned to bring their family back next time.  While eating they kept muttering between gobs of food, "This rice is good!" ,  "This chicken is fantastic!", "Excellent Naan!".  Incredible menu.  Incredibly prepared.

Lj_Ggqh-3wEsEzyNuFHnfA.text: Pathetic service and uninviting gesture from host and the servers.  If you are a couple going for dinner, or a group of guys please note that they don't serve the meals at the same time.  I went with my wife and my meal arrived 30 minutes after my wife finished her meal.  The servers don't even have the courtesy to ask if you want the meals at the same time.  I thought that's common sense two people would not like to have meal one after other.  Also, very importantly the manager wasn't present on premise so the servers had their right to argue with the customers.  I think they need to learn to treat people nicely first and then serve them food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty plate - meal hasn&#39;t arrived yet Dirty plate - meal is over 30 minutes back

QzBwdZSJWZA5HgAMH_72XA.text: Best taste Indian food in Vegas.  I am a Vegas Local living in Vegas since last 2 years and have tried almost all Indian joints and have not come across any place that gets the taste right like Mint. Be it North Indian( Tikka masala curries), South Indian( Dosa, Utappam) or Western ( Pav Bhaji), Mint gets all the tastes just right.  Kudos to the amazing Chefs here!

qIWSlAiwwb5mAn7NJWEcGQ.text: Been here a couple of times, the first time was a really good experience and hence I went back again last week. But the food was really sub standard. Not too sure if I'd suggest this place or not. Lol

Vuyq82aUo9AGbJGwhSwQww.text: This place is amazing, I love to come here to eat, is always delicious. They are very professional and knowledgeable about all the allergies and they are been around for long time and the food is always good.. I totally recommend Mint Indian bistro, is the best Indian food in town

pARBNkLF26nZ-9xxQZSXuA.text: This was my second visit nearly after 6 years. The management has changed but not the food quality. We ordered pick up. They took our order even at 10.45pm and made the fresh food. Chicken chilli was awesome. Biryani was good and fresh. Overall I would definitely recommend this place. Cutting a star as they didnt have dum biryani on the menu.

1BzWFNrWUjHXjiN-JVkHtQ.text: I went here with a friend. Being vegan, I was completely stoked about their menu... They have quite a bit of wonderful vegan dishes...  The service is okay. It's always pretty busy... They don't check back very much to refill drinks... But... The food is always delivered quickly and comes out really hot.   The atmosphere is not terrible. They have renovated and from What I hear, it's interior is 100 percent better. All the tables were full, so we sat at the bar. The restaurant itself is always busy... I would suggest trying to make a reservation. We ordered the vegan curry (very hearty... And has potatoes) and gluten free buckwheat bread (I suggest asking for sauteed garlic on the bread) It was good and filling. The spice level is definitely what they say it is... They don't skimp on flavor or heat. By far... My favorite Indian restaurant in town.   They offer a full bar and an extensive wine list. My previous visit was just as good as the last one. The samosas were amazing and the cauliflower dish was pretty tasty. I am excited about their new location on Durango. Having one closer to my house... And one right near school is going to be very convenient!

uweJU274iJ7yIbNCu7H24A.text: Now I can write a review on the food....I was hoping against all odds that I would actually like the food as the reviews were not all that bad. Sadly that was not the case. :(  First minus 1 star - for the annoying fly buzzing around the table... Yes that is a natural thing that they can't really control but it started my dinner there on a wrong note.... So let me add one more thing onto this one to make it more even for anyone that is keeping count....:). After they dropped off the entrees they didn't check back on us even tho there were only 3 other tables... And we had to actually yell across the restaurant to get some water as all the hand waving and polite excuse me fell on deaf ears. :( Service (1/5)  Minus 1 star - I ordered roti and it came out like a thick tortilla... What happened to the layers?? All the roti that I have ever gotten were light and flaky. This one was thick like really thick tortilla that was very under seasoned. This was just a chewy piece of under seasoned tortilla. It was better after I started dipping it into the sauces that came with my papadum. Still was not very appetizing. :( Food (1/5)  Minus 1 star - I ordered my Rebel curry at level 10... When I got it... It was a level 1 not spicy at all. Disappointment since the server even warned me that it was spicy... My friend that I was eating dinner with even agreed that it was not spicy either. Food (1/5)  Minus 1 star - they left huge pieces of a spice.... I'm guessing star anise in my curry that was inedible. Either fish it all out as I understand that the curry needs the spice or ground it up so that I'm not biting into it as I'm trying to "enjoy" my dinner. Food (1/5)  Minus 1 star - for not having the inferno menu. They couldn't tell me when I placed the order. They took my order and then 10 minutes later told me that they were out of the chilis.... but there was no communication about that at anytime at all until 10 minutes after I ordered it. I'd figure that if it was something that u are known for that u wouldn't run out. That's what I think maybe I'm wrong... But this is my review... So minus 1 star  Ambiance was ok. It wasn't spectacular... It wasn't dirty... It was just ok...(2.5/5)  So overall with my first impression mixed with my second "not impressed at all" impression....I will never be going back. I will not waste one more penny at this place. It just was not worth it... And by my count they should be at a 0 star from me. Way too many other BETTER Indian restaurants in town to waste my time at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large bits of a spice in my curry.... Totally inedible. Very disappointing... Makes me think that I will never return...
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rebel curry with rice and salad with chicken in the back....saag (3/5... Very bland)... Rebel curry... Asked for 10 got 1...(1/5)
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papadum.... Finally something done right. Geez (4.5/5)

ojufkgXnpodeg9M6wLIvYw.text: Chris the mgr was so helpful in answering my thousand questions. Taught me some new info when it came to Indian vegan eating. Found another new spot for my Vegas Vegan Experience.

f_jVXXgecCmuUEInHB3g7w.text: Nice small restaurant with delicious food and friendly staffs. Stopped here with hubby for lunch and our tommy were so happy.  Buffet has a lot of choices and the price was reasonable;$12.99 per person for all you can eat. The small pieces of spicy chicken was my favorite but all were good. The chicken tikka masala was not the best was still decent. We will back for sure :)

eu_8o5KpHUV6BhU_JFrI_A.text: So far this is the best Indian restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas! Lots of options to try unique dishes at dinner. Lunch buffet had great choices and even a couple dishes with some spice! They have a spice challenge that I'm trying to talk myself into one of these times. Very attentive staff and on top of everything. I've been twice now and both times have been great!

v_fkrZmmZ1pB4X2g0Gj4lQ.text: Excellent buffet. The naan is baked at a perfect temperature. It's just so crunchy overall and soft at the middle. Perfectly made. Gulab Jamoon is also the best on the buffet. Soft, smooth and served hot. Came here twice during my stay.

t3led8cVVkebz7xaOKRNFw.text: Excellent food, excellent drinks, fantastic location just little bit of the street. Sujal and Dipen are awesome and give us exceptional customer service. Definitely worth many more visits in the future. Thoroughly enjoyed my visit here everytime. All in all must visit place when visiting Las Vegas.

Ze9w6QJMIgZ4I202NnZ46Q.text: Sujal and Jamal have the best customer service skills in the industry.  They always treat me with the utmost civility and respect as a customer.  Because of their hospitality, I am now a regular daily customer.  I used to eat at a different indian restaurant , but this place is now my favorite.  They've earned my business.

GJB4Mr8ISq0cZAYZyIQd-g.text: Love this place, have been here more than 3 times here, well on all of my Vegas visits, and it truly is special. Special because, they have a spicy menu, for people like me with red hot spice buds :) If you love spicy, you need to try their Inferno menu. They have almost every item on their menu which can be converted into inferno menu item. Last time I had tried their Dosa, and we asked the server to make it 50% less hotter than regular inferno, as we were a large group which included people who didn't enjoy spice as much. We all had our ears ringing with heat, it was spicy yet tasty. I kept eating it until I could enjoy it, and straight away chugged my sweet yummy Mango lassi.  This time though I wasn't lucky enough to get the inferno menu, as I had come along with my wife and a couple of friends in afternoon, when they serve buffet. Cannot complain about the food as everything was pretty tasty. They had South Indian items like dosa, idli and medu vada and North Indian items like Naan, chicken masala, goat curry, paneer sabzi, veg sabzi and other chicken dishes. Sambar could have been better as I remember it was last time I was here. We also tried some chicken tandoori and chicken masala from Buffet which was pretty good. Gulab Jamun was the desert which was just ok. I really wish to come some time back in the evening and try their other menu items. In my previous visit, other than than the inferno menu, I had tried their chicken tikka masala and Navratan Korma, which was really delicious. Mango lassi was fantastic and I couldn't resist to try it again. The staff is good and gets the plates out of your way, so that you can go for next round on the buffet. The restrooms are clean and there is plenty of parking available. This is definitely a very good place to eat Indian food, specially when you are busy getting drunk on the streets of Vegas, this place can help fill your appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cleaned it .... yummy food
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet plate with veg options

cowBNQ6IzpQeJrpz4-T4zQ.text: Must try Indian restaurant in Las vegas!! Do try the naan makhni, its very delicious!!

WA4dnc79CqR8kkcgp6C2eA.text: This is my second time visiting this place while in Vegas. As usual it is awesome and the food has been consistent and goat curry is always superb. My kudos to chef and owner team. Keep it up and I will always visit this place when in town.

n6W7lGc0jcdBln0arumygg.text: Came for a Sunday afternoon buffet since I had been craving Indian food. I'm new in town so I was told this was the place to go. While the food was good, the service was really disappointing. Yes, bad service for a buffet! I came at 2:30, the middle of the buffet shift, and they were out of a lot of entrees. I went back twice and they were not refilled. I was ask which kind of naan I preferred when I was seated but it didn't arrive until the end of my meal. I was offered a dosa but still no naan. The beer I ordered also arrived late, toward the end of my course also.  Apparently I had a dedicated server but he never stopped by to check on me, the host brought me the beer. I asked a bus boy a question and he muttered something about my server and quickly waked away. It wasn't that busy but almost impossible to get anyone's attention. Still not sure who my server was...  My naan finally arrived but I was too full to eat any of it or the dosa, so I asked for a to-go box and they tried to say no. I insisted since the timing of my meal was off and they reluctantly provided a box.   The dessert trays were empty so I gave up and left asap. I won't be back.

nERjSGdFVTVMNdkaBCV-4Q.text: Fantastic Indian food. Everything we had was delicious. Our server Julie made excellent recommendations. Will definitely come back.

7zPe_GtnLSogiOIyN5VNMw.text: 1 star over long weekends. Should avoid. food is delayed by atleast 50min.  To compensate was served papad

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5zAx3uLz9Wbww5cIdy2kcA.text: This place is terrible.  Just went for dinner yesterday.  Its extremely spicy for level 6 for tomato soup.  When specifically asked for reduced spice level, the fried rice they brought next just blew the roof of my mouth. The Idli they brought was microwaved and not fresh.  Don't go here.

R81b1miaucDwh0khubGsiA.text: I was in the mood for something different this weekend instead of the same thing I always eat on weekends which is usually fast food. Tried this place at the recommendation of a friend.  I drove pretty far to try this spot and was looking forward to great Indian cuisine.  I was really disappointed to say the least. I even forgot to take pics which I never do.  The group I was with tried the -Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tika Masala , Chanan Marsala ( I hope I spelled it correctly be- it was curry chickpeas) and Chicken Curry, Samosas, Garlic Naan and the Cheese Naan.  There was very little flavor in the main dishes, the samosas were pretty good and the Naan was the worse I've ever had. I would not go back and would keep my $100 in my pocket.

6pWSB_9uW4Xyjb4cARSSgg.text: Awesome tasty food. Especially the Paneer Tikka Masala was the best with right balance of spice and flavour. Best Indian place to go for in Las Vegas .

VX2YEJMDjnF7W8BsnHx9Dw.text: Had a very nice curry for dinner. I want to return to Vegas so I can try some more of their curries.  Yum yum.

bJMTeTIaUmJGOhkazTMtuA.text: The Lunch Buffet is from 11am-4pm. They have a small selection but everything tastes excellent. I've never been disappointed here with any meal.

qumFazPntAuEfgy-c7qaBQ.text: They don't let you order from the menu when they have the buffet that sucks because their buffet is garbage low cost dishes the items on the menu are made much better. Taking off that option is just plain dumb

QN3jpC4N5afEC1-5aWIFzw.text: Very clean. Excellent food. Service very fast and friendly. Best in Vegas so far. Small bistro.

wvIvi6fbgAo0HyX0QJS0OA.text: Without a doubt the best Indian restaurant in Vegas! I probably eat here at least once a week. I come mostly at lunch for the amazing buffet, but the dinner is really good too. I cannot say enough about how good their food is!  The guys who work there and are servers are so good at their jobs. They are always around and are so responsive. Plus, they have a really good beer menu!

e7uNZ81bTmou9xZ9loTThA.text: I went to Mint a couple of weeks ago with a bunch of fellow computer scientists for a birthday lunch. The place is pretty small and the buffet area seems small, but the selection is decent. If you know me at all, you'll know that the first thing I look for is Butter Chicken. A quick scan of the lineup reveals a disappointing no. So right off the bat, this puts them at a disadvantage against Namaste.  Then I found the Goat Curry. At an Indian buffet, I really only need one go-to item and luckily, the Goat Curry was off the hook! It's not quite the Naan heaven that is Butter Chicken, but paired with rice, I enjoyed every morsel.  As for the Naan, I like how they bring it out to order. This can lead to moments of Naan-less agony, but at least you know it's always warm and fresh when it comes to your table.  The Garlic Naan has an overpowering aroma and is the only way to fly.  I haven't tried any of their Lassis, but that will definitely change today at the CMYE. I love me some Mango Lassi, but the other flavors are intriguing.  Overall, I'm definitely a fan of this place. Quite honestly, I'd pick Namaste over Mint for one simple reason (which should be easy to deduce by now). Still, Mint is a solid lunch buffet choice.  EDIT: I've since been back and I'm not sure why I thought the buffet area is small. There are quite a few dishes from which to choose. I guess it's because I only found a couple of items that interested me.

L-8ZrpBRCHGj-k20BojhEw.text: I came here with a large party of around 20 for the lunch buffet and we had to wait a while, which is fine, I understand since they don't take reservations but they were not willing to seat us outside since they lacked the staff to serve us.  I had come with some older members of my family so even though I tried to convince him to let us at least seat them, the host responded rudely with "Let me do my job"   Later when we were seated, food was alright, about 3 stars and a family member asked for some naan and a waiter responded, "it takes time sir" in a rude tone. Honestly, the naan saved the lunch since it was fresh.   Would I come back here for the food? Unless I really wanted Indian food, probably not. Service and staff was very bad and food was very mediocre.

Yn5QukP6R35aiBc35VAYJw.text: I never really had Indian food in Vegas, but wanted to try some nice place. The reviews for this place and Tamba were nice, but wanted to find some place off the strip and with easy parking so picked Mint.  The place looks little shady from outside, the plaza was dark and the restaurant did not seem very brightly lit from outside. But don't worry it's a great place from inside. The decor is nice and upscale. It's a quite place, with comfortable seating. The lights could be brighter. There were few other table's occupied (All by Indians) - A good sight if you are looking for True Indian spicy food and not tamed down for the American population.   The waiter was nice, pleasant and took out his iPhone while talking to us. Realized within minutes he was noting down our order with an app from the app store. Also said they own a software company and are going to start using their own app in some time.  Coming to the main part! FOOD! It was really good.  We ordered Mint Lassi and Masala Chhas. Both were very Indian and really tasty.  Their Menu is very well organized. Great for Vegetarians and Vegans since each item says if its good for vegetarians or vegans. Very happy to see how they describe each item in the menu really well. One of the best organized Menu's among all restaurants (Comparing to all Indian, American etc. restaurants).  For the main course we ordered Paneer Makhani, Daal Makhani and Chole With Naans. Everything was really good. Daal Was very tasty, although the color might make you think its not the best, but trust me the taste is nothing short of what you find back home. Naan's were also very good.   They also have Nepalese  food but did not try it, but would love to try that too.  Overall great place if you are looking for True Indian Food. Would definitely go back again.

NDuKqQn73zAVqiSyvla7SA.text: I've been here many times for dinner, but not buffet.  This review is for the lunch buffet.  There were many items in the buffet line, ranging from vegetarian to meat courses.   The quality and taste of the dishes exceed my expectations even more now.  I love goat karahi.  I have been to many Indian restaurants where the goat karahi isn't consistent.  I know I can count on Mint to make sure that each piece is tender and flavorful.  I mixed my tender chunks of goat meat with slices of onions and cucumbers, then squeezed lemon on them and tossed it around some more. It was delicious, and the naan was great as well.    However, goat karahi wasn't the only star on today's menu (according to me, of course).  I have tried tandoori chicken at many places, but I find it lacks flavor.  When Debbie said that the tandoori chicken is her favorite, I decided to grab a piece to give it a try.  Boy was I glad Debbie raved about it.  It was SOOOOO GOOOOD!  I tore off a piece of this delicious chicken that bursted with flavor and put it on top of freshly baked garlic naan. I then dipped it into the tamarind chutney and wala, yummy-in-my-tummy.    I was full at this point, but still had to eat my favorite dessert, khir.  I was super excited to see this in the  buffet line.  I love the basmati rice, slow cooked in milk with a dash of cardamom.  I got two servings, one for Roland, and one for myself.  Somehow, they both ended up being consumed by me...Oops...Khir...I can't help myself.  I also had the Lal Mohan.  Again, tried this at other places, never liked it.  Luckily, Debbie also raved about this so I gave it a shot...thank goodness I tried it because it is DELICIOUS.  And the staff, attentive and friendly, as always.

VLMh3z6KbbBJOL5mo3l_1Q.text: Food is amazing here. I have been to many indian restaurants at different cities. This one really stands out as one of the best.

lt4EddYnRm3B7ppIboU_GA.text: OK, this is all about the inferno menu which is no joke. Sure the waiver seems a bit ridiculous (and full of grammatical errors), but after attempting the inferno curry, I don't blame them for the warning. It's just so. damn. hot. I'm a 10 at every Indian and Thai place in town, so I figured this would be a fun challenge. I had my naan, large Kingfisher, and dove into the curry pot. At the 3rd bite, I could no longer feel my mouth. It was awesome (no, really, I'm a crazy person). There were so many ghost chilis in that pot that my insides actually radiated heat for 2 days. This place is cool - but next time I'll stick with the vindaloo!

tH_0j0ZNjjUnyQWrBjb5qg.text: Wonderful flavors! The weekend lunch buffet included a nice variety of favorites like goat curry, vegetable korma, and saag. There were also new flavors to taste. The naan is delicious. All of the staff members were polite and friendly. Not an empty seat in the house!

S8rUUJSMXd6Ji8VSB7ETEg.text: Very good food. All the buffet items were very rasty.I loved their garlic naan and chole. Gulab Jamun were classic!

AvgGL8WvLRrzS-3_doPavA.text: Absolutely a must for Indian food lovers. Had both the lunch buffet and a dinner there. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality if the buffet. .. a HUGE variety of gluten free dishes!!!

vzI6yX5EHPs3Bpetcm3qjA.text: Always a treat to come here whenever I'm in Las Vegas! A wide variety of Indian food from different parts of India, and even Indo-Chinese selections. Their lassi bar is also great! I always get the mango lassi, and it's better without rum in my opinion. Service can be a bit slow, and it can be quite crowded during peak dinner times. But worth the wait!

Ys3pBG3SAvZ5WcQYGJXfhA.text: We have been here one other time, but we think it was even better this time round. Took some friends and they loved it as much as we did.  The flavors, the regions, all the fresh and organic ingredients, really made the food outstanding. Good staff that is helpful in ordering the right combination of dishes. Delicious and would recommend it highly and priced right.

l7nWRoVW83jHAwh-czm8qg.text: OH MINT HOW I LOVE YOU!!!  Best service and best food!  My husband and I have been going here since we first started dating and now our two kids even love it!  Forever a Mint lover!

rdopIn4FQAKutqOIYpAMPQ.text: Worst food and Worst service ever. The waiter started talking rude to us, we were ten people. No respect to talk to customers.

qO915uON91C5pXUKmqM1KA.text: Pretty tasty Indian food. Some dishes were whatever like the fried okra but I got idli and my brother got dosa and both plates were cleaned. The aloo bengan and chicken tikka masala are delicious as well. I tried the pander tikka masala and it wasn't too great, decent though. Overall I  this place. I've been here a couple times oh and also I'm Indian so... I would know. The service is always pretty great in my experience.

VQ-q1QMe01PTJqM2tpMglA.text: NOTE FOR THOSE WITH RESTAURANT.COM CERTIFICATES: Apparently they have a conflict with restaurant.com and aren't accepting their coupons. HOWEVER, they honored the discount themselves and told us to get a refund for our certificate and will probably do the same for others. He looked upset a bit explaining it so it's probably something ugly... I thought it was cool that they will honor it themselves to help out the customers. ********* For years I ate Indian food on a weekly basis and for a while I stayed away since I burned out and the BF never had Indian food before so away we went. The drink selection is one main reason that made me really want to try them. We are beer nerds so it makes for a lovely surprise that a unassuming Bistro would have such an impressive drink menu. The BF wasn't sure of what, and our server (I think possibly the owner) asked what kinds of flavors he likes and gave a few recommendations. I always appreciate a place that knows what they sell since it seems most people don't care about beer the way they do of wine. The BF took his suggestion of a Augustjn Abbey Ale ($7) and I had a Troubadour Obscura ($7) which the guy poured into TULIPS with care to produce a proper head! I had a nerd moment that they had the proper kind of glasses and someone cared about our drinks as much as we do. He treated it like a sommelier would a fine wine. While we waited for food we were served papadam with a tamarind chutney and a cilrantro mint chutney. All really finely made. For food we really couldn't decide to we went with a Indian Sampler ($30). It doesn't look like a lot of food, but we were both comfortably full. It includes: *chicken tikka masala- this was a lovely tikka. I've had a lot and this was one of the better ones I've had. Very robust, but balanced. The BF loved this and raves it's the best curry he's had and he had a foodie moment (aww, I think us Yelpers are getting to him...maybe he'll change his mind about doing reviews one day). *lamb vindaloo- the lamb was very tender and the sauce complimented it very well with a bit earthiness, tangyness and a tad spicy. *tandoori chicken- crisp and nicely spiced outside, juicy inside *mixed veggie curry- had a good mix of cauliflower, zucchini, beans, peppers. The curry had a very light and fragrant flavor to it...I can't quite place the spices, but I liked this. *chef choice of lentils- today it was daal. I like daal since it's earthy and comforting. *we got yoghurt, basmati rice, and garlic naan as well. The naan was pretty noms here. *Khir came with it for dessert. It's a rice and milk porridge with raisins, nuts and cardamom according to the menu. When I was eating it, to me it tasted more flowery than just cardamom, like possible orange blossom water was added. It's the kind of light dessert that would be amazing for a hot summer day since it's served cold and has such bright flavors. We also ordered another dessert that I thought I had and loved at another restaurant and at friends house but haven't come across it in a while. Turns out it was what I was looking for! Lal Mohan ($2.99) the description says it's served cold, but it's served piping hot! It's these round pastries that are fried so the outside is crisp and the inside has a creamy kind of dough. They throw it into syrup and it absorbs it so it flavors it throughout.They come 3 to a serving in a shot glass, balls are about gumball sized so you don't get much of it, but it's quality. It's a comforting kind of dessert that would be a good for people who like fried mochi with honey, warm donuts, zeppolis, beignets. The service was friendly and helpful. I like the little details that show they care like having proper beer glasses or giving us warm plates. Utensils were impeccably polished- no water marks at all. It felt very comfortable with the warm decor and the good staff making you feel good about being there. I just got a strong feeling that they are proud of this place in the pride they take for the little details. I haven't been this surprisingly satisfied in a long time. The BF was super happy with discovering Indian food and having a food epiphany of sorts about it....days later he's still telling me about the tikka and how he wants to go next weekend. Definitely we will be coming back for a la carte and also the buffet sounds like a deal. If our next experience is as good as this one, it can quickly grow to be a favorite.

Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian Sampler

MT9JDMKxQga0bu0kdyCGKQ.text: Everything about this place is on point. Every time I come here, either with my fiance or friends, I feel like I am treated like royalty without it being overbearing. Staff is very friendly , interactive, and professional.   Food is incredible, I always get a different dish to try since everything tastes like an explosion of flavor in your mouth. Garlic Naan (get with butter, well worth it) is a MUST. Delicious. Could eat this for my meal.  Also, a nice little plus for you spicy food eaters out there---When you first open your menu, there is an entire page dedicated to "inferno" courses. I don't know if you have ever had a ghost chili or not, but these meals consist of that and habeneros. On a scale of 1-10 in spicy, most of them are 30s-50. There is an inferno curry that gets you a fifty dollar gift card and a picture on the wall if you successfully eat the entire meal. (after you sign a waiver of course). I haven't had the pleasure, but the inferno kabobs had my mouth pleasantly on fire.   Love this place!

lwuy-Mk4Qgylzg4AxibvQQ.text: My favorite Indian lunch buffet in town .. Clean restaurant with excellent service and lots of options. Parking is a pain and you may have to search for a few mins. Good prices and quality

ATVR3V3wXgWbhsoA5wC6nQ.text: Very nice place in Las Vegas for Indian food. You will love this place. Food is good. Chai is not great. It's too strong

LblWGHA2dFNEFupVvs2O9Q.text: Great food and atmosphere! Loved the biryani and naan. Staff was attentive and took great pride in their restaurant. Super clean as well! Can't wait to take the family back to try the pineapple fried rice!

dzvKPGe50NseNVjWyboRqA.text: I came here for dinner so i have yet to try the lunch buffet. I came with two friends and we got the Indian prix fixe tasting for two and got an order of chicken tikka masala as well. Our server was nice and friendly and the food came out in a timely manner. I liked how we were able to tell them the level of spiciness we wanted for our food. That's the thing with the Indian lunch buffets, you get what's there and sometimes you just want a little more spice. The food came out in these small looking pot things and I was worried it might not be enough. It was a lot! Those things are deceiving lol we did ended up getting more orders of rice and naan bread because you just need that to soak up all the great sauces in the dishes. I can't wait to go back and try their lunch buffet next.

NsmCOQxHj3p9pUghwY_EKg.text: Lemme just say first that I don't handout 5 stars. But this place really deserves it. I have very high standards when it comes to food. Especially Indian food. But I wiped my plate so clean they probably don't have to wash it anymore.  The food was perfect and the garlic naan is a must have. Definitely will return to this restaurant.

C6IgKB-f2kuzhJy0kPKxTQ.text: Butter chicken...garlic naan and tajmahal beer. Soo good. Will definetly try this place for their lunch buffet. The staff is extremily nice and great customer service

hoDrVV8-3ZUDFwcTY5SUIA.text: Ever since the Mint Yelp event, I've been DYING to come back here but hadn't because of lack of somebody to come here with. My friends are unadventurous eaters and unfortunately, this is a place my family would never eat at because well... for example, my mom's favorite food is saltine crackers and milk.  Anything remotely spiced is shunned and I get a lecture about how I need to be normal and eat stuff the family will eat (read: bland and processed.) Zzzzz.  I've had the mind to walk down and just eat here by myself when I'm at school, but I'm afraid I'd gorge myself on the much talked about goat stew, the delicious gulab jamun and the KILLER tamarind sauce. Seriously, you know how there's that nasty tasting cake called "better than sex cake?" Well, if there's a food on this planet that should have the title of "almost as good as sex," this tamarind sauce is the only one that could possibly be a contender - it's crazy delicious.  After volunteering at the Las Vegas Rescue Mission on 7/16/11, I needed to grab some food before work because I felt faint, thanks to some vegetable and fruit only fast that I was on. Being a non-vegan, looking for vegan food, I had only one place in mind to go - Mint.   My sister waited outside while I walked in. After a few minutes of perusing the menu, I noticed that it was laid out differently than it was when I came for the Yelp event - it was much easier to find the vegetarian and vegan options.   I'm supposed to eat only vegetables and fruit on this thing- no dairy, no meat, no nuts, no grains, but, dang it, I was in a hurry and after 5 days of eating dressing-free salads and drinking juiced cucumbers and carrots, I was dying for something filling and flavorful. The meat options all looked killer and I wouldn't mind eating... well anything on the menu. It all sounded great. I settled on potato and pea samosa and a half order of malai kofta with 10 spiciness, hold the rice and the naan. (Less than $10 total.)   The service was good. I chatted with Smeet about school and work while I waited. He told me the kofta wasn't vegan. At that point, I didn't care. I'd settle for vegetarian for this meal. Friendly service anywhere is always good and in about 15-20 minutes, my food was in my hands and I was out the door. I basically ripped open the container and devoured half of the innards of one of the samosas while simultaneously changing for work in the car. I took the rest with me in to work and chowed down.   Ummmm... the malai kofta was SO good. Maybe I was deliriously hungry or maybe it was just that good. I've been craving more of that kofta like crazy. It was spicy, but not overly so, and had the creamiest texture. It was delicious. How wonderful it is to have something spicy! The remainder of the samosa had the mint and  the ZOMG! tamarind sauce that Smeet included in little containers, poured over them. It was the best thing I'd eaten in almost a week. I wish I had ordered double the amount of food.   Would I go back? YES. As of this writing, I have 8 more days to go on this Vegan thing and I have a feeling I'll hit up Mint at least two more times to grab some more delicious food before I'm done.

etb1b-GwKmqxIu-VpLEhlA.text: Came here with some friends for dinner last Saturday and it was absolutely delicious! we ordered the veggie curry and some other yummy vegan dishes -- good teas too :) highly recommend!

AdRIibsKZkGKttcOC882dw.text: This continues to be one of my favorite places in the country.  The staff are friendly and everything comes fairly quickly.  I'm amazed ( but glad ) that it hasn't caught on where you need a reservation, but to this day you can almost always walk right in and get a table.  The atmosphere is nice and comfortable.  Every dish i've ever had over the last 10 years has been delicious.  If your ever in Vegas, do yourself a favor and get off the strip and out of those high priced mediocre restaurants and hope in a cab, there are so many gems we have found over the years and Mint is at the top of the list!

GnsRvsnrtufrws7eTPobiA.text: Great service and great food!  My only complaint is that the portions are a bit small for the price.

6izwDa6Ei9JCVCgAyznowQ.text: Food was barely average and service was slow.. ambience was below average.. tables very beaten up.. flies inside.. do not recommend

1EWQLJSDgzW10k0N9N-jzg.text: This is the best Indian in LV and rivals some of the best I have eaten in the states and abroad. There are Nepalese dishes-a very rare treat. There are dishes from Mumbai and from the North of India. Besides the variety, the quality is excellent and quite authentic. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The Buffet is the most complete I have ever seen!!!!!! From Coconut Chutney to Goat Vindaloo, I will sample more dishes when I return. Excellent!!!!'
