Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soups and Rice
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a corner of the Buffett

dtO5AxK54wFBstNFUJcMog.text: My friend recommended this place to me and I am so glad I decided to give it a try for dinner!  The area the restaurant is in is a little sketchy and from the outside looks pretty unassuming.  However, once I was inside, I felt like I was in a whole new world.  The place was decorated in black and grays that gave it a chic feel.  The service was awesome and our water glasses were never empty.  We went on a random weekday and the place was pretty crowded so I would recommend making a reservation a head of time just in case.    Now for food recommendations: -Buttered Garlic Naan - came out fresh and warm, dipping sauces that came with it were delicious as well ($3.49) -Rebel Curry - excellent, got it with the chicken ($13.99) -Tikka Masala - so creamy, yet spicy, got it with the chicken ($13.99) -my other friends got the curry pineapple fried rice with chicken ($8.99) and the stir fry hakka noodles with chicken ($9.99), both really enjoyed their dishes as well  Their menu is pretty extensive so I would recommend you check it out on their website beforehand.  I saw that they have a lunch buffet too which I will have to come back and try!

KzsCgwGozBPXyMmV51Sosw.text: Came here for our 1 year wedding anniversary and we'll probably be coming here for every anniversary from now on! Everything was delicious.  The staff was excellent.  We had the vegetarian Pre Fixe and there was so much food! Best Indian restaurant in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Samosas and Pakoda

GzRxT8OXwWDozBJAVs7-lQ.text: This is the best Indian food I have found to date! There menu can be overwhelming for the new inexperienced Indian food foodie.  I love starting with their Naan, warm bread toped with roasted garlic and butter. My favorite two entree's are the Mahakali Mango Masala and the Andhra Curry. They are signature entrees.   The mango masala has fresh vegetables with mango chunks that are cooked in an onion/fennel-seed base. I get it with the chicken ($16.99), but you can also get it with the lamb ($18.99). It is served with long grain white rice.  The Andhra Curry is a spicy curry mixed with coconut milk. It is very favorable with it's combination of spices. I think this dish is best with lamb ($15.99) but have also had it with chicken ($15.99). Dinner for two is about $45.00 with bread, no alcoholic drinks, no dessert.   The restaurant is nice and the atmosphere is romantic. The service is usually good - although it can be slow at times.

xy7q-3XoXFZ7rUG93_fxiQ.text: Delicious Mysore Dosa, Garlic Naan and Sev Puri! Staff is very well trained and even though it was quiet late they accommodated our orders. Has plenty of parking and is open late. They are very consistent with the spicy flavors and their naan breads are the best!

kQl7FmWw7i7iwfIiO8rpLg.text: Great food, Terrible Service.  The food here was good like the kofta and kabobs. But the service here was horrible. Everyone didn't hassle to get orders and things done. Staff waited until someone complained to finally get something going and that too took at least 10 minutes. The place is really small but again food was good especially if your craving Indian in Vegas 3 out of 5 stars

lfvTEI8jUODtv8ozhIj72w.text: Awesome food! Very authentic, and tastes great! Not too expensive either. However, the area is a bit sketchy. Nearly every time I visit I get harassed in the parking lot and asked for money...I know not the fault of the business but it still prevents me from giving them 5 stars...I wish I could give them 4.5 stars.

cGIgGCZ4ExFk-FXWNlTwqQ.text: This restaurant is on Indian row, a bunch of Indian restaurants to choose from. We are glad we picked this one, such good food. Their Lassi was really good, and had multiple flavored. They ran out of a couple, that sucked. But what we did have we loved. We will be back again when we are in Vegas. A great find.

V6hDE_BWL3Qg9-vXgcczBw.text: BEWARE, bread they offer is not free (we got tricked into that so dont make the same mistake)  Service : 4 stars  Food : 5 stars !!! Best indian food we've had.  Aahran curry was amazing, & get it with lamb, its so tender ((:   Anyways I would have given the place a 5 star other than the fact that the guy tricked us into paying for the bread we didn't eat. Made it sound like it came with the meal..

jzCSoutDQPUVu-QO-kFY9Q.text: Mindblowing food, ambiance and flavor. My bf and I are completely impressed with the quality of the food and the excellent service. The lunch buffet area was very clean and everything was fresh and bursting with flavor. Amazing vegan options that were plentiful and clearly labeled. My only wish is that they had vegan desserts but regardless, at $25 for lunch for two, we're already planning on going back tomorrow!   If you are staying at the Hard Rock, it is quite close and easy to get to by walking. We highly recommend checking out this place.

08TrXcfmzO4Sst1Kq-iFqQ.text: We went for the lunch buffet.  It runs until 4pm which was great.  I found lots of vegan options for me and meat options for my husband.  All items are labeled for people with food allergies or limitations.  Helpful staff, very friendly.  They offer you regular naan bread or garlic naan bread and bring a fresh order to your table.  Very good prices.  I definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lunch Buffett was so good!

8WWAKrMsRz0VDvHNOQ3ihw.text: I have not had the pleasure of trying many different Indian Buffets in town, but I feel pretty lucky because on the first try, I got it right!  I basically looked up other people's reviews, and they all stated that this place was a must try. My mother's usual Indian buffet place, IHO, is just not very good. But she would always go there because it's "what she knows," and she was comfortable with it. This day, I suggested we try someplace else, and she was open to it. As soon as we got there, she kept stating how everything was so good, even better than "her" Indiana buffet place!!  I ordered a Mango Lassi, and it was very good. Not as sweet as some I have had in the past, which is a plus. They have a small veggie/chutney/soup area. The food was hot and fresh. The tandoori chicken is delish. It is not the best I have had, but for buffet, it is really close. Throw a little mint chutney on it, a squeeze of lemon..... Mmmm. Yum.  They bring out hot, just-made Nan for you as well, which is very nice. I rip off pieces of the nan, and use my hands to scoop up my food. I am used to eating with my hands, since Africans also use a food (fufu) to scoop up other food with. I saw one other person eating with their hands there, so I felt a bit less weird doing it, but most used utensils.  It is usually a little warm inside, so wear layers you can take off. Especially if you like spice!

HOMU8MKtGEBl-NEd2aUnXw.text: Great food and ambience one of the best places for Indian meal in Vegas. Must visit if you love spicy flavorful Indian food. It is pretty close the strip so a convenient option if you're in Vegas. Staff is good n cooperative. Went there twice in a 2 day trip.

nwbNExVRaX7G3rHat7YbXg.text: This place is off the strip. It's in a little strip mall type and when you get there, you wonder what you will find. You walk in, and you still are not 100% sure. But once you sit down, the servers are just as friendly as can be. They are are ready to help you choose and tell you what you are eating.  Try one of the samplers with a friend. Well worth it. When it started to come (there's a few courses), the server let us know what it was.  The taste of all the foods we ate were wonderful. The servers were great, the location was good. The only down fall is that sometimes they took a while to get back to you once you had your food.

9kvbUpQLpXrB0t6LP-M0-A.text: This is one of my worst experience so far. The attitude of the servers was very unfriendly and uninviting. The portion size of starters was very small. While ordering food we weren't sure if we were under or over ordering and when we asked the server he wasn't helpful at all. The food waiting time told to us was 40-50 mins and the reason told to us was that the restaurant was very busy. The food was terrible . Malai kofta was very hard and didn't taste at all like the dish is supposed to be. Aloo tikki was buried in the sea of uncooked pea curry. Pao bhaji was smelling bad. All in all our experience of spending 2.5 hours for eating 2 course meal couldn't get worse.

VQqKGHG0D47sdxJjl0qCrw.text: Went there yesterday, one of the worst Indian restaurants I have been to. Taste is bad and the guy who was managing the seating of customers (may be owner) was rude too. We waited for an hour for seat then 30 mins for food..

Av90jRhuzSwCTRFCNhky9g.text: If you like Indian food, you MUST try this place out. BEST Indian lunch buffet you'd every get for $9.99!!! yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... yelp.com/biz_photos/UV2J... The variety is unbelievable, including several chicken and lamb dishes but also many vegetarian ones. I've never seen an Indian buffet with that big of a spread! There is also a salad bar. Everything was delicious! The Garlic Naan was out of this world! The chicken curry and fried chicken (strip) were very yummy and the chicken tandoori was the best I've ever had! They even have desserts! Love, love this place! You will, too!

o4ZLwR5ALNsAAIxw5Yre1w.text: The worst restaurant and service I have encountered . The service is so bad , made us wait for 1 hour . After the wait , they served us cold food and the appetizers were old old and the chicken they served is literally like rubber . The beer served was not good . On the whole we wasted so much time in Vegas on this restaurant . I am extremely disappointed . Will never recommend this place . If Yelp had a zero star I would prefer that .waste of time and money .

GazAY0mYOr9jzsPQg36AYQ.text: 5 stars all around: ambience, cleanliness, service (shout out to Biru who helped us order the dishes we couldn't remember the names of), quality (SO, SO FRESH), and flavor (we tried the papadum crackers with chutney, garlic naan, chicken tikka, tandori chicken, garbanzo bean dish, rice pudding, and chai). My husband and I will be a regular!

8Y20zZU3NMno_FF78UnizA.text: Came here to have an early dinner with my friends. The food is literally amazing. Order butter chicken with naan bread. I have to take off one star because I feel like they up charge for everything. The naan should be included in the price just like the basmati rice is included. It's not a lot either. On the upside UNLV students get 10% off. Too bad we found out about this awesomeness after we paid our bill. Overall great service and great food. Will definitely be returning.

i1-Uj1WEaN8LU1NZLxgOlQ.text: good stuff.  gets busy, so seat early.  I have an onion allergy, so to those Yelpers with my unique allergy to white/yellow/red/purple onions, they have salad (dressing has onion), rice, naan, BBQ chicken, and some grilled chicken you can pick around the onions.   - a little on the pricey side, but like I said - it's busy.   - nice clean place

wiYAlzYpWKPuhDYOcyoWTQ.text: Good Indian food in Vegas is a treat! Loved the malai kofta. Tasted like made in India

3iLEwI-Hq5fihMDcijFIEw.text: The buffet is great! Lamb korma and chicken tikka masala are my faves and it is included in the lunch buffet! The interior of the place makes you feel like you're in a fine dining restaurant. Prices were reasonable. I will be coming back"

mLo93SR2T7MHK9Z4e_dl1Q.text: This rating is not for food taste because we have been waiting for food more than one hour. When we ask a service person here he just smiled and told this is a normal here. Not yet food come not sure how much time it takes. Checked in 8:30pm and waited for table 30 min given order 9pm and still waiting (10:00pm) for food. So if anyone wants to check in here for eating food please call to this guys and check for waiting time and food delivery time as well.

XNghVx6lqi9aCuOZExsKVQ.text: We didn't have a good experience here. We had made a reservation for 10 people, a dinner to celebrate a big milestone for one of our family member.  This place let us down tremendously. We turned up and they realized they had forgotten about the reservation. Made poor attempts to rectify it. And all along as we waited no apologies given. Manager didn't bother checking up on us and we saw him idly sitting in the corner.  Food was okay. Nothing to rave about.  Customer service total let down.  I had come here reading the positive reviews but what can I say, I left utterly disappointed. I wouldn't recommend this place. There are better Indian joints in the vicinity.

LCMbKKJ9p_H8h4-Qhbuiaw.text: Yummmmm!  I was reading through my reviews and realized that Mint was missing!!!  I have been here about a dozen times and evey time I have left happy and very full!  I have not tried lunch or the buffet. We have been here on date nights and brought friends here for dinner only.  The only con I have is the service can be slow, well most of the time the service here is slow. They always seem disorganized and usually forget an item or two that we order. I understand duh this is not fast food...the guys just always seem flustered. We always overlook it and never are in a hurry to inhale food anyway.  Being vegan we have TONS of options to choose from and we usually just tell the server to pick a potato curry dish, a veggie dish, an app and a chef special creation. We always get two orders of garlic bread we order extra garlic and it's amazing!!!!  Every meal is different and every experience has been very flavorful and fresh! When you let them order it really does make for a more unique and special dinner.  Organic tea selection is top notch and my fav is a rooibos called African Sunset. Warm and yummmmy.  The lassi choices are amazing. Between the lassi bar and the hot teas...it's tempting to go here all the time just for beverages.  OH!!! I loooooove their vegan and gluten free options for beer and adult drinks. Very nice! The large selection is amazing!

40ZvmwGkkVYh9mZOKUUDjg.text: ripoff. $45 for their meal for 2  is ridiculous.. no refills either.  dessert is 1 gulad jamun each.. absolutripoff. save your time and money and eat elsewhere.

l7bhWut9kHmG74OMIOGSSQ.text: If I could give this place more stars I would .. The buffet was AMAZING .. I had curry chicken and goat and two types of soup ,I don't eat goat but this goat was better than the chicken .. I will be back

xfgMflmK3QaiTts750kIqQ.text: Favorite Indian spot in Vegas!! Recommend calling in because it's always busy and for good reason

2scKwlW1vNlwe2GshAcBnQ.text: I know this rated 4 stars with 855 reviews and that drew me to this place. Had the lunch buffet... no taste.. looks like someone trying to make Indian food out of an online recipe. May be dinner entrees are different. If you are looking for a delicious entree, your money may be spent better elsewhere.

Xlli3LRbOQugsGiIIGXenA.text: Good ambience and neat place.small and enough portions of food servings . Taste was okay,  with lot of options on the menu card. Try the inferno menu if you can.

FhOFBYFWBKiBv2nbGmoccA.text: Consistently good and always a great meal! We have been to both of their locations many times and it is impressively consistently good, swift and friendly service, I recommend!

Jiv1KBWR45BKE4AJts8sNg.text: I met some co-workers here for their lunch buffet yesterday. Let me start by saying my one experience with an Indian dish in the past was less than pleasant and I hadn't braved it since. Let's just say Mint has changed my mind entirely. I loved each of the dishes I tried and will absolutely be returning! I don't remember the names of any of the dishes I tried but I sampled a little of everything and they were all delicious.

nYv7cexzl_D8o9JSf63KtA.text: Great food! Awesome beer selection that includes rare beers from Germany. This was our second time eating at Mint and our first time bringing our kids. The kids menu has actual food that the kids can eat. Not like other restaurants.   We will absolutely return. Next time with more friends!

sYXKxS8UGUHPYFgn8etcCQ.text: The buffet was delicious! There are options for vegetarians and meat eaters! The mango lassi with rum was also pretty tasty! The location was off the strip but so agree worth the trip!

TGm9dYzSFNttAi2MwWNfdA.text: Pleasantly surprised with this place. We got seated right away and no reservation was required. We ordered the Pav Bhaji ($11) as our appetizer with extra bread ($1.50) which was just a hamburger buns with a little bit of butter added and not the traditional buttery rolls. I also orderd a mango shake which was creamy and refreshing for $4 not bad! For our main entrees we got the clay oven chicken tikka ($16) boneless pieces which came  in a sizzling grill with lots of onions and some plain basmati rice on the side. The chicken was really well marinated and you could taste the flavors. We also decided to order the garlic naan which was $3.50 way too over priced for 4 small pieces.   Overall, we enjoyed the food but it was over priced so not somewhere I would come all the time. It is located 5-7mins driving distance from the main strip area so I can kind of see why it's pricey. The restaurant is located in a plaza with plenty of parking and the staff here is very welcoming and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tikka Pieces with small naan piece.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pav Bhaji

punt2CSMmlmPlvsKj5ZLfA.text: Good things come unexpected, so was our decision to eat at this place over Thai cuisine. We went for lunch buffet for our brunch after a late night party. And we were not disappointed even a bit. There was a big variety of Indian food, right from the North Indian cuisines to South Indian dishes and from western Indian delicacies to Indo-Chinese dishes. We tried and ate them all. We even received 10% discount for checking in on Instagram. Food place, good service, good staff, highly recommend this place for Indian food lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fAwg1qktUaEoxdHccddJsw.text: Stop looking for the best Indian buffet in LV and go!! Ate way too much (I say, but don't mean. I'd do it again tomorrow.) Super flavors. Good heat. Good number of offerings. $12.99. Yummy baskets of garlic naan included. Veg Tikka Masala was to die for.   Place is cool, modern. Nicely decorated. Small seating area and the locals obviously know this place is great. Stayed busy, busy. Small seating area. We were seated right away and there was never a wait while we were there, but wonder if that's ever an issue. Servers were attentive, but when sat and chatted awhile never made us feel rushed. Oh, I want this food every day (or at least every other. I might not be able to eat again for awhile.)

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ioYovo5b1ay4Yrn3WKqD4Q.text: I enjoyed an incredible vegan feast here!! The service was excellent and the food outstanding. I was extremely impressed by the customizable menu and the ability to make many dishes dairy-free.  This was the first time I had saag (creamy spinach) in years because of their non-dairy options!  Also, the fact that everything is labeled makes it a breeze ordering. All Indian restaurants should look to Mint as a shining example!  P.S. their desserts are DELICIOUS

ALgbqiJsjFGljyBApDSEBQ.text: Their Buffett was ok , not that great.  The idlis were quite dry and chewy. However they had a great choice of items in their buffet menu. It's still better then other places I have been .

2d-fJD3JChnB0mAruUDQ2w.text: Best Indian I've had in vegas. Highly recommend starting with some garlic naan, and for the main the chicken saag. The main was delicious. Perfect amount of everything and not too buttery or drenched. Chicken itself was great too and fresh. I asked for a 3 on the scale of spicy which was already pretty hot so keep in mind not to go too high if you're sensitive to that stuff. Only issue was the service. Waiters took a while to come around as it is crowded a lot,  but also they bring the meals in different orders and not together which is awkward and weird when eating with a group of people.

3TConpEbSxNRSPOdTi2ryQ.text: I've eaten at both locations in Vegas and ordered take out, dined in, and had the lunch buffet. The dishes are delicious but the naan is a little too crisp for my liking.   They do offer a weekend buffet with many vegetarian and meat options which is AMAZING!

muqPbckxRKkAu6iIPQld3A.text: Well, I tend not to write reviews often but sometimes there  is need to do so. Walking through the doors, we were met with really rude customers exiting MINT Indian Bistro and then was greeted with a relatively rude waiter who asked us to sign in on the waiting list. Thankfully, after 5-10 minutes we were politely seated by different waiter.   Once the food came out which took some time, it was really Good! The Samosas, naan, chicken vindaloo were excellent. The lamb and chicken seehk kabob were good but a tad dry. The mango smoothie was pure mango goodness. I must say that the urban inspired artwork and decor is progressive; if the customer service matched the food quality and engaging artwork MINT Indian Bistro would probably be 5 stars.

kRLxpCw6moy0RlUWNgb14Q.text: Decent selection which seemed like it was not as fresh as it could be. Good flavors . The naan was dry and the tables were not bussed as quickly as they should be. All in all just average

X_6_zwNugg8ASh9mQ4G7uQ.text: Must go if you are in Vegas and want to eat Indian food. We went for lunch buffet and were full after eating so many vegetarian varieties. I would definitely come back.

UUdhRSIXJQUUe_YZjm8nvw.text: Great spot for lunch buffet as we wait to check in. They have an "Inferno Curry" challenge but those days are in my past. I like to taste my food. Tasted pretty good, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kmr0veqLNHIwlveJAJ5zkA.text: We enjoyed the food the service was fast but the portions size were really small.i expect that whenever I'm going to spend above $50 at a regular restraunt for dinner then I expect to be fully satisfied. The portions were very small. Overall the food was delicious. Would've liked to try more but at the price they're asking for the food and the portions they serve I may never come back, it's not worth it.

KbOVDn9ihKxu9hhyN2775g.text: Starters - very good Main course was decent. Dal makhani was fine, Paneer tikka masala could have been better. Parantha and naan were excellent. The reason I am giving it three starts is because of the service. It is awfully slow. We went there Monday evening and waited for an hour before being told it would take another 30 minutes and we left. The reason we left was the staff did not care for the people waiting. The tables were empty but nobody cared to clean it up and get the next group of people. They might be awfully understaffed but I did not see the urgency in the staff that was there. We went back Tuesday because of the excellent reviews and had an early dinner. Again, the service was awful.

lkmWfpDLHbkABEoKJ5aHwg.text: We were here with some friends for a lunch buffet. The foods are fairly nothing special. This location was a little too top to find a parking spot. Anyway,  I graded tri- stars

g1MxQrtG8QS_EUxOGHbnig.text: Oh my goodness. Such a rich menu with so many gluten free options. I wanted to order everything.  Lucky for us they have a tasting menu for $44 for two!! Maybe 8 or so dishes with soup tans appetizers plus dessert.

LSLp07ffKkMuWDG9Mn3ktw.text: This has become my favorite buffet place after trying for first time. Every dish is tasty and there are many varieties of dishes

SwHq-K24-wUyVqdqGky_iQ.text: Best Indian restaurant in LAS Vegas..service is great ...highly recommended...Dosa biryani must try

gWRxO0b5k8MCmPTibSm8ow.text: I went here to meet up some friends for late lunch and surprisingly, there was still a wait at 1:45pm. They have an iPad by the door so you can put your name down and the number of people in your party. I waited 10 minutes which isn't bad.  We came here for the lunch buffet since I've been hearing good things. Our naan took a rather long time but at least they gave us unlimited garlic naan.   There's another Indian restaurant a few miles away from here that also has a lunch buffet but that place turned me off when they kept giving me excuses as to why they can't give me garlic naan (i.e. "We ran out of garlic" when there's a supermarket right behind them). This place is in a better location and looks nicer and cleaner. The service is better too. For less than $15 for a buffet, you can't go wrong.  I liked that there's a good variety of dishes for their lunch buffet: tikka masala, palak paneer, tofu, veggies, spicy chicken, curry and other savory dishes. Their gulab jamun was just right - hot, sweet and cheesy balls. Yum! The food was excellent. Hooray for huge chunks of chicken! The sauces were spot on. There was this mystery dish that we all tried without reading the label - was it cheese or was it tofu? It was the texture of cubed mozzarella without the stomach ache-inducing property of cheese on somebody who's lactose intolerant. So, it probably was tofu.  I'll definitely come back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My experience was...hipster
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gulab Jamun
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan

jiUFm1Ehzsskg5p-c-slHA.text: Definitely the best Indian Lunch Buffet in Vegas, you get 3 choices of Naan and also the variety and choices of food are exceptional! The staff here is also very kind. They greeted us and sat us right away! Definitely will be coming back!!!

LeCqPJePUZzCIqQJYp2V1Q.text: The food was pretty good but the service only passable. We were seated and in an almost empty restaurant and waited too long to be asked for drinks.

NxzuYV40MuKInDjM9Vjefw.text: Had vegetarian dinner here. One of the best entrees and breads that I have eaten. Highly recommended.  Friendly staff. Btw,  we met a staff member here who resembled indian singer 'Benny Dayal'. He happily had a group photograph with us.   Nice cartoon painting on the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cartoon painting

YXE1gD69vW8ITW0S0rHi2A.text: Don't be detoured by the parking it's worth the tight squeezed spots. They accept reservations but it's not necessary and also offer take out. The menu includes a quite large Lassi selection as well as a large selection of wine. The dinner menu features dishes that are from different parts of India along with the standard popular favorites. First class service. Great place for a date night or a group.

bvyxwgS3BcCQP_h62Varlw.text: I've been to Mint 8 times about half the time for lunch buffet and half for dinner.  Tonight, we stopped for dinner to try their new menu.  NOTE:  They have many new items on the menu and they continue to have their original items.  The first page of the new menu is the Inferno menu.  All dishes on this page are made with ghost peppers.  You have to sign a waiver before eating from this menu our server RS told us.  There's one challenge that if you finish, you get your photo on their Wall of Fame and you get a $50 Mint gift card for future use.  I don't think it's accepted by any hospitals.  (Michael K, this might be something you'd want to try!)  In addition, the new menu has soups and salads and appetizers of various kinds.  There are so many things to try it seems like a good UYE with 5 or 6 people to share the items.  For tonight, I chose the Vertical Vindaloo with lamb.  The menu change also allows you to order vindaloo and choose the protein you want--cheese, lamb, veggies, goat (bone in), swordfish, shrimp--and you choose your spiciness from 1 to 10.  I chose  7 and I could have had more spice.  8 or 9 next time.  My wife ordered the Maharaja Tikka Masala with chicken breast (again choice of protein similar to the vindaloo).  She chose a spiciness of 3.  We also got an order of buttered garlic naan.  Everything was excellent!  The vindaloo had good spicy flavor and the sauce was very flavorful.  There were cut potatoes in the sauce, too.  My wife enjoyed her dinner and she also expressed that it could be spicier.  Wow, are we going to 4 or 5 next time?  What happened to my gabacha?  The naan was the tastiest we've had here.  It wasn't quartered like other times but served in one large round that we tore apart.  After dinner, she got khir and I pistachio kulfi.  I've had the khir before and while good, I wanted to try something different.  The pistachio ice cream was really, really good.   I asked RS if it was made in house or could I go to the Indian store and get it out of the freezer.  Sure enough, it's made in house.  There goes that idea for a repeat.  RS was quite a pleasant server!  He refilled my iced tea when I was getting low and he gave us chance to look over the menu with no hurry and then was ready to answer any questions.  I have a couple of other Indian restaurants to try, but for me, either for lunch buffet or dinner, Mint tops all the others.  It is very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Khir.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio kulfi.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some plated vindaloo.

wFRmMmYP4KiXnizcfTrheA.text: My go to place in Vegas when I'm craving Indian food! This place is pretty good, they have all my faves including chicken tikka masala and the fried donut balls are amazing!! The only thing is that this place is a little on the pricier side for a buffet and last time we went they were really understaffed and we had to wait a long time for the waiter to get us water, drinks, naan bread etc. I think they had 2 waiters for the whole restaurant. Overall i still like this place a lot and would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tikka masala ! So delicious but a little on the pricey side

APWqh2BuXx7loDW2n6LVog.text: I came here for the lunch buffet and it lived up toy high expectations. We were greeted warmly and since it was our first time the waiter explained everything to us. Basically unlimited refills of everything including their garlic butter naan which was very fresh each time they brought it out to us. The curry I got was aloo gobi, vegetable korma, mushroom saag, and I had some of the chicken tikka masala. My favorite was the veg korma. It wasn't too spicy and had a nice sweet flavor to it. Total it came out to be around $14 so it was definitely worth it.

LSKqhvT_Kc2FsHDdkBqMDw.text: Garlic Naan - YES PLEASE   Before you get rice, try the naan with your food first. You'll see a delicious basket of fresh glistening garlic naan and you'll regret getting full from rice.   Tikka Masala is just amazing, so much flavors. If you go for the buffet make sure you go to the second one. There's a Vegetarian Masala and one with chicken. (the veggie one lacks flavor) this is the dish I mainly go for   Mixed Pickles - A little sour but must have when you eat the food   Everything at the buffet is worth trying. Keep your mind open and enjoy the food!

f96TXrEtcSreT-lOQ9G49A.text: They definitely have good cooks & I highly recommend this place for anyone desiring to try Indian cuisine. Regardless of buffet or a-la carte, please be sure to try their "Mutton curry"

xmqi5xvWydJ1DpqBvlxZ8Q.text: So I was here Monday, the buffet was amazing. On Tuesday however the story was different because on Tuesday the buffet was actually Monday's. One of the dish was going bad as well.

XpxJCTast2EjL3oqzYTj-A.text: This place is simply awesome- the restaurant has authentic Indian food, something similar to what you find in India; not Americanized Indian food which you sadly find in most Indian restaurants in the US. Having said that, the service is equally awesome here - the server was helpful in his suggestions. Lastly, good lighting and the background Bollywood music made the food even more enjoyable.

e7buQtyfPPHf0Q7v576elg.text: Best Indian Food in Vegas!! We had the lunch buffet! great selection of different dishes on the buffet. The food was seasoned perfectly. It was also hot and fresh. The garlic butter naan bread was the best I've had. The only thing that kept the experience from being 5 star was the service wasn't very attentive and the noise level was loud. I definitely recommend Mint Bistro for their excellent food!

Wf4InUpEOwT0ooc0TGhhyA.text: Went in for a dinner on a Saturday night! Heard some good reviews from the hotel staff and Uber drivers so we had some big expectations from this place!!  Unfortunately it was nothing close to what we expected!   The interiors: okayish! Nothing ravishingly amazing to talk about.   The staff and service : this is a very mixed review I would have to put in. Some of them were very nice and polite but some although not being or server were so so loud that we could here them talking to other guests and servers loudly and it was irritating.  The service began smooth and was quick in the beginning. They took out drinks order, food order quickly.  Got our drinks out super quick. Got the starter out quick but here is where they failed, we had order a thali which has starter, soup, main course included.  So, starters served, soups served. We got done with both, and then had to wait for 35 mins for the mains to be served!!!!!   Food quality and quantity: for the price the thali quantity is ok! Probably having unlimited rotis/breads would be a better with so many curries to finish. They only serve 1 garlic naan each thali (small)  We did not like any curry, vegetable in particular to be honest. We did ask them high spice level which they probably forgot!  The lamb was undercooked and the curry tasted like raw onion and tomato paste!  The dessert served was good though.  Only this I would recommend here their lassi cocktails/mocktails.

_FkSQi16mSMxJOF89G4W5g.text: The food is pretty good, but not my favorite. I definitely would visit again in the future. The only reason I'm giving this place three stars instead of four is because I couldn't help but feel a little ripped off.   My boyfriend, two female friends and I came here on Father's Day (just for lunch, not because of the holiday), and they informed us that the lunch buffet would be more expensive because of the "Father's Day Special". What comes with the Father's Day Special? Absolutely nothing for the female diners, but a free drink and side for male diners. I guess it makes sense if you're taking your dad out for lunch... but my boyfriend isn't a father, and the majority of our party was female. None of the items available for the buffet were any different than normal. So we were basically charged extra money, but got nothing extra out of it.

8TcCkUhDa42819QkxojfwA.text: Absolutely loved it!!! They're menu had a lot of options-vegan, vegetarian, gluten free! I'm vegan and I had they're karma korma and it was so tasty!! They're service is great too and the prices aren't bad at all. If you haven't been here, u have to check it out!!

jk2G5pDpzU6qzC0yKb-bVg.text: Food is very good. The service is terrible. We have to wait 30-40 mins for food to arrive for which I got response saying the food will be fresh. After food arrives, they didn't give one dish in our party. After repeated asking, the dish came after another 20 mins. By that time everyone else is done. When asked about it, I got a rude response saying kitchen is busy. When I said the service should have been better, the server said food is really good here. I guess he meant "they don't care of service". I wouldn't come here again.

r38GqaGxnrTdaZyiLs1tEg.text: If you would like authentic East Indian food, amazing customer service, and excellent prices, then Mint Indian Bistro is the place to dine at! They have amazing garlic Naan bread that melts in your mouth! They have vegan and meat dishes. There's lots of gluten free options! Their Rice's are amazing! Their curries and chutneys ama sauces are a delicacy! Their buffet is reasonably priced!

BbmCstZfqAJTTAvO73BQgA.text: Great Indian buffet, the food is on point with northern and southern Indian dishes. The staff is always friendly.

I-nb0PVz06kACCe2xZobTw.text: Came here NY day to celebrate my friends engagement.  Kind of a random location, but not far from the Tuscany (which I love).  Had the lunch buffet and everything was very good.  There were also a lot of Indian people, so you know that's a good sign too.  They have a little bit of everything to suit all tastes and spice levels.

Ub0uc4FhBsOQNeby4ATnKw.text: Very tight place. Tables are placed too close to each other. For a vegetarian such as myself, I didn't find that much variety in their buffet. There were 3 or 4 veg dishes out of which I only liked 2. Food was tasty though.

C-WFNms7RB76o4qxLTRtVw.text: Below average restaurant.  Tried their lunch buffet last week.  Taste and quality of food was below average.  Food was very dry and not fresh.  No variety.  It's a small restaurant.  Restrooms were stinky.    Won't recommend this restaurant at all.

KxRnceJ8urzDyY8y4SNFOA.text: I was so disappointed. After making our order we had to wait for 1 hour and 25 minutes. The guy was telling us food will come shortly. But it was never ending time. Also the manager was so rude. Didn't even say sorry for long waiting. I've no idea when they're gonna learn some manners.

ndUiyvCfgG8PbgRID9cuyA.text: Absolutely one of the best places Ive eaten out in this pathetic town. Service has always been decent; sometimes slow other times on the spot. But it's the food here that blows other places away. It is consistently delicious and has been for years since they changed their name fromHimalayan Cuisine. Everything I have dumped in my human eating hole from this place entices me to act out Meg Ryans orgasm in WHMS. Eat here. If you are disappointed go seek medical attention for your taste buds.

AF0R6GFEhflPlyZ25EhZmg.text: Visited Vegas this week with my boyfriend and his coworkers and it was our pleasure to  take them to this place. Again, fantastic service, great food and fully bellies. The waiter had us all laughing and talking and the food had us in a bit of a coma.    Thank you thank you and we will be back again.

4wPu3p1PxKK9WJKZMWaj5Q.text: If you live or are visiting Vegas this is a must! The food was amazing and well priced.  I was dining with a Vegan and though I don't typically eat vegetarian or Vegan the food was amazing and I couldn't tell the difference. Bold flavors, a foodie paradise! We had the vegan tasting menu all was really good, except the desert, some things just can't be vegan sorry lol

CkgJigid0XTkS_fR-wKAog.text: Service is decent. Food is ok. Definitely not best indian food I have had. Good for them they are in vegas where other indian restaurants are pretty bad as well.

tIy36SUjsHVlPAYY4rqzVg.text: One of the indian restro in Vegas.. Authentic food... Simply love its aaloo tikki chat, paneer tikka and chhole. A bit higher on price as most of main course dishes cost at least 12 bucks. But trust me its worth. Quite near to the strip and airport as well, thats an added point. They also have inferno dished if anyone is looking for. In short if you want quick authentic indian food, this is the place.

geLJWABemW1DDd-ohwGkUA.text: I went into this place mainly because it was not too far away from my hotel and a quick glance of reviews that told me that this place was going to be ok,   This place serves a combination of Indian and Nepali food (Nepali food gets branded as indian food -even though I feel that Nepali food is more lamb and lentil(pulse) based).  I loved their unique drink menu. I don't think I have seen spiked Lassis before and that definitely was the highlight of my eating activity there.  We ordered Sambosas for appetizer followed by a few vegetarian entries. Food overall tasted real good and the spice level was almost to the level we ordered  (one was ordered spicy and was mostly spicy and the other was mild). I will definitely stop here on my next trip to vegas.

D5aCR5JtDiI6KW9cn7m6gg.text: Definitely over priced for the quality of the food. 4 people almost $200 only ordered a couple of appetizers and 4 curry dishes..

tKx-bde_tydRsZ0rLr5GdQ.text: No ala carta at buffet hours. If you are in a group and if some likes to order special food it's not possible. In buffet naan was serving slow like for 4 adults they give 1 naan 4 pieces we have to wait 15-20 mins for next round of naan.

9KhPcC1uOgPwUz5LaTy_TQ.text: The food here is absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the lunch buffet, since you get to try so many of their dishes. As a vegetarian/semi-vegan, I also appreciate the variety of veg options available, as well as the labels they have on the buffet line noting if foods are vegetarian or vegan.  The staff is very nice as well. Recently my boyfriend and I arrived just before the lunch buffet was scheduled to close, but they said we could do the buffet anyway, and even brought us some vegan naan!

EwXikP0eiQU9cNijyzoxQA.text: The lunch buffet is one of the best Indian lunch buffets I've ever had.  With a great mixture of meat, veg, and vegan dishes so many if them were delicious.  The tandoori chicken was covered in grilled onions and lemon wedges (awesome), the garlic naan was soft, warm, flavorful and the size of a side plate, and the rices were perfectly cooked.  The goat was tasty if you like the flavor of goat.  There was also a dessert called Gulab Jamun which was like donut holes soaked in syrup.  Each bite was like a juicy sweet sex party in my mouth Lol.  The only thing I wished was that the signage for the buffet items was more detailed.  Some of the names meant nothing to me.  I might not've tried the Gulab because I thought it was either a floating fruit or some kind of egg.  Lol.  Try this place, it's great.

leHYRVQL9Sh-Rydv2BXFlg.text: I love Indian food, usually a hit and miss for quality. Mint Indian Bistro is surprisingly good. I went on a Thursday night while in town for CES. I had the Kwati soup (beans), a chicken curry (spicy), rice, buttered garlic naan bread, and tap water. The service and the food were very good.  The pricing fair. The ambiance is typical Indian. The seating is somewhat limited -- so if in a group, consider reservations; I bet there is a wait on some evenings especially Friday and Saturday.I'd good back in a heart beat.

XQeRK0X6X34aB7PWeNWg4g.text: Excellent restaurant. The buffet is awesome where it's mandatory to finish things off with gulab jamuns. Some other things to try: hot and sour veg soup, vegetable biryani, and masala dosa. The service is first class. Looking forward to going there in a few weeks.

Te_M0lkTugPgtqcaLG0gIA.text: As a guru Indian....this is the best Indian food in Vegas.  Don't waste your time going anywhere else

b7Tf_58JOc-Gzu3aEIl3TQ.text: Stopped in for the lunch buffet after a morning of golf, on the recommendation of some of my Indian coworkers.  What a great find!  The food was reasonably priced and tasted great!  A little spicier than most of the Indian restaurants I've been to, but that doesn't bother me.  The buffet was pretty big - I really like the chicken korma and tika masala, and the galob jamon for dessert was everything I hoped it would be!  We had a mango lassi, and a cherry lassi for the first time ever - both were really good.  Can't wait to go back and order off the regular menu!

BJ32uWzGDt2p5Y8oWLUCXw.text: Awesome food experience, especially the combination of non vegetarian foods with vegetarian stuffs. Chicken korma is one must thing to be tried. There is not one dish that I can say was sort of out of line because every single one of them was finger licking good.  Ofcourse, one should never miss the gulab jamun (indian dessert dipped in sugar).

IjK0dhw7CkpxzLNE1hpzBg.text: Sitting at the Mint, ordered 3 different wines and they were out of all 3 of them. My friend had decided to get Ras malai as soon as she saw it on the menu and come to find out the didn't have any. Why list them on the menu if you don't plan to carry or serve this food. Moreover, we asked for not too spicy food and one of our curry was really spicy. The service was good, food when not spicy was as good as other indian restaurant in the area, and the decor is very bland. Maybe i went here on their off day so gave them 3 stars, may return to see if things have improved, otherwise there are better choices out there for Indian food.

vzl0wir_XkdlphSYycUm1A.text: Mint is a nicely outfitted casual Indian/Himalayan restaurant near UNLV and DRI in the center of town.  I have been there for lunch - they have a very good buffet - wider range of options than most buffets of this type, high quality ingredients, and very good mix of salads, soups, vegetarian dishes, and dishes with chicken, paneer, goat and other items.  Restaurant is very clean, service is professional, and providing fresh naan made to order as opposed to providing this on the buffet line is a nice and high quality touch.  Toughest aspect here is tight parking in the shopping center (not the fault of Mint, and can be dealt with).  Highly recommended.

i2FoT_6Cb-iFnQ8u0cnhTg.text: All fire and no flavor. Vindaloo was pretty hot, but no complexity.

TMym-j-uvGDLjPhTJk323A.text: I have become a fan of east Indian food and Mint Indian Bistro did not disappoint.  The goat curry and the eggplant curry were delicious.  They of course had other curries.  The service was excellent.  They could be more friendly, however, they were not "standoffish".  This is a must try in Vegas. Yummy!

Mdb84ofEBJYfrbMqDA03Qw.text: I've only gone for the lunch buffet. Every time we've gone, it has been ridiculously crowded. The restaurant is small, and the tables and chairs are so close together. The food is good, but I prefer other buffets. Someday I will try their dinner menu to compare.

f3nl-yXGOEvoxdZfycXlPg.text: Me and my fiancee finally got a chance to come here. We ordered one of the dinner for 2 (can't remember the name of it) but its a sampler. All of them were awesome. I cannot wait to go back.

6aRA2OPs0FsIZ0FIdvr4wA.text: The food and service was wonderful. We had the vegan sampler for 2.  Way too much food and left very happily full.  Highly recommended.

4wZDogdSi24xdCjlOXRMoA.text: We had dinner at Mint tonight and it was amazing! We had a few items: Potato and Pea Samosas - these were ok, a little too much seasoning for my liking.  Vindaloo (chicken thighs) - Full portion - very good with a tomato base. It was a great recommendation by the waiter Tikka Masala (chicken) - *our favorite* - this was the best Tikka Masala we have ever had.  It was absolutely delicious.  We also had a full portion of this.  Garlic Naan - also SO yummy!   Between all of this food, my hubby and I were stuffed. We could have even passed on the samosas and been more than full.   The staff was also very attentive, and although the restaurant was packed, we only waited about 10 minutes for a table.    Overall, thanks Yelpers for all the great reviews! It was a fantastic choice for dinner.

6KJ497-37dhBztwUVrocXw.text: Oh wow.  How do I describe this place?  I've always said that any ethnic restaurant where people of that ethnicity fill the place must be either good or they pay a lot of people to sit in the window.  IN this case, it's the former.  I went with an Indian friend and she was in heaven.  I've been to India a couple of times and the food here is as good as anything I had there.  Prices are reasonable.  Warning: if you order the Inferno curry, the waiver isn't a joke.  This curry is made with pure Ghost Peppers and it will take a half-gallon of lasse to cool the burn, but it's delicious once the burn subsides.  I loved it.   In one word: go.

-AAtwgdYXqzZSw6xmNVAcg.text: The food was pretty good. The dosa and nan were very good. The lamb vindaloo and chicken tiki masala were just okay. Certainly not bad but not the best I have tried for sure. The service was very slow.  It took 45 minutes from when we ordered to get our food, that's not an exaggeration.

y0M74wDvGItVn-X-AtKDZg.text: Possibly the best Indian food I have had in Vegas so far. I had the Rebel Curry, which while not being spicy at all was very tasty. My friend had the Chana Masala. We also split a couple different kinds of Naan. I thought the dining area was nice, the lights were dim and the tables were spread out enough that it was pretty quiet in there. We also tried a few different deserts and they were very good. The menu was huge so I will definitely be coming to try some more dishes.

MQqqcO9DQNL_1dJlve0y-A.text: Very good food and prompt service. Lamb Khorma is amazing. waiter  had exceptional recommendations and could explain the spicy index to my wife. Ask about the beers bc they are unique.

qexru8bFiMzaVNLecnAOdA.text: This was our first time trying Indian food and we are now huge fans!  The flavors were delicious, the service was attentive, but not too pushy.  We ordered the sampler for 2 and we were able to try a bit of each of the popular dishes.  We'll definitely be back for more naan!

2DibmEqUxe4QdeWUyD0BXQ.text: Was in Las Vegas on a Business visit for 3 days and stayed really close to this Restaurant. The first day, I just had Bhendi (Okra) Masala coz I was badly craving it. It was really good. The second day I chose to have Schezwan Fried Rice which wasn't disappointing either. Overall, good food and in a nice city. Cheers !!!

-q635f7L44IFL7sVqpY9tA.text: There's two kinds of Indian food, the greasy comfort variety or the savory, authentic kind. As this place also serves Himalayan dishes, one will find the food here is quite pleasantly the non-greasy, delicious kind. And if vegetarian and vegan dishes are your thing, it will be even better. All the items on the menu are clearly marked and the waiters are very receptive to questions. The pakora and the paratha is so tasty, as well as the chau chau. Also, there is a great variety of beers.

fqRhYGFZ94r3J-xPvJjSzA.text: Loved the fact that there was papad as soon as we came in super hungry ! The buffet had a good spread. I've given just four stars although the food was great, Cuz the restrooms were super bad :( they wouldn't fix it even if we requested for it .

Lv7EDlC6yLfbHomNNfVvoA.text: This was my first Indian restaurant in Vegas.  Went with a friend and it was great....I'm looking forward to going back and maybe try the Inferno menu....I'll sign the waiver!!!  Everything we had was darn good.  I can not remember the actual name of the dish I had but it had Mango and Chicken but it was super.  My friend had a veggie dish based off of a butter chicken curry....and he said his too was good.  I've been telling my friends all about it.

786L7moi977uHmcElUFlWQ.text: tried this place for the first time tonight. LOVED the food and the service was great. can't wait to come back and try different stuff

pum_mSpZkKFTUz7z4485Sg.text: Excellent service and an extensive menu. Great value in all ways.

s_n7rolWYDKXBOoOe_0P4Q.text: If you are in Vegas and looking for Indian food and don't go here you're not living life correctly.

0mxWhoWl625fy6miweoqpA.text: Cool half moon booths. Great service and attentiveness of staff. Food was solid all around. Extensive menu, including Jain, Gluten free, Vegan, Vegetarian options. I had the lamb vindaloo which I give a 7 out of town. Naan was good. The owner was very interested in feedback and once he found out how much I love vindaloo asked me to come back and try it after he made some subtle changes to improve it. Orders were taken on ipads. I will be coming back, had a great experience overall.

f_ui2U6ovIDjQyHaGWpJlw.text: Excellent food!! I highly recommend this restaurant to all of you..i tried lunch buffet and ala carte both...absoultely delicious!!

VIdtLukcAMVlg8Y2aeqr3Q.text: Food was beyond incredible. Hospitality was pure class, This is by far Las Vegas best Indian restaurant, It's on the higher side but worth every penny.

6Pv44UrjWtHY-Mi93sIxew.text: I visited Mint indian bistro twice during my second trip to vegas. It was great as usual. We booked the table in advance. Food was really superb. The starter gobi chilli and the dessert ras malai was extra ordinary. Staffs and Their customer service is very welcoming. The quality of the food remains high during both my visits. Their south indian delicacies masala dosa was really great. Since i am from south india i was very particular about sambar( dal soup). Their sambar was really delicious. I loved the masala dosa totally. I will surely come to Mint whenever i visit Vegas.

hrgcSFMcCngjWtaM1VNnjw.text: We reached the restaurant late in the night ~ 11:15 pm and they were nice enough to accommodate us - a party of 6.  We enjoyed really nice preparation of Indian meal. Highly recommend this restaurant.

1vp3zrRjzfNjlMJORYcnkg.text: On of the best Indian food I had in US. The taste was really good and the variety in the lunch buffet was great (both veg and non-veg). The Naan and Tandoori Roti were hot and crisp. Plus the price for the buffet is actually a steal. If you are in Vegas and craving for good Indian buffet this is the place to go. Perfect for family. I am going there again when I visit Vegas.

_l-tj8j30_0vb4xPiYwDpw.text: I always look forward to eating at Mint whenever I'm in Vegas, its my first stop after getting out of the airport in my rental car.  Waitstaff is always friendly and helpful.  Food is superb.  I usually get the handi biryani.  Wife usually gets the daal.  Always busy when you go, which is a good sign.

4CdU4rdx47OdzmxbxuM4IQ.text: Best Indian food I have ever had. Too bad I don't live in the area. We had mango masala. It was amazing. They have so many different options that I have not seen at most Indian restaurants. We loved it. Kind of a weird neighborhood, but fantastic food!!

wlmJ1DabpgdugDFZ-Fhxlg.text: Recently re did their decor and it looks a lot nicer then before!  Everything I've had to far has been great!   My favorite is the vegan Karma Korma- I love that they have so many vegan choices!

6my4mhPuk-c7yUbQvuBeaw.text: Mint is located a few blocks from the strip and practically across from the University. This attracts both visitors and local students to their restaurant.  The lunch buffet is what I usually go here for. With the UNLV discount, it is an affordable and tasty option.  During the daytime, the interior looks bright and airy. At night it has a moody romantic atmosphere. The servers are always friendly and I'm so glad they are very accommodating for people with food allergies. The menu is clearly labeled with icons indicating Veg/GF/Nuts/Etc.  Onto the food! Goat curry and any paneer dish are the things I make a beeline for. The goat is tender and full of flavor every time I come here.  For dinner, I usually get takeout on my way home. I've tried the Rebel Curry, Saag, Rogan Josh, and a few others. There's lots to try here.  Dinner or lunch, Mint does not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tikka masala is divine... Swoon...
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tandoori is delish!!!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing veggie samosas!

v0wW-GLhUZx2IjelDanzFw.text: I'm very impressed with their all u can eat buffet.  I'm usually not a fan of all u can eat indian buffets because it usually lacks quality.  But not this place.  Although their weren't many dishes to choose from, the dishes that were avaiable were amazing and so tasty.  The all u can eat Naan was awsome.  The buffet definitely makes me want to try their regular menu.

3INQ6mRK_KR8aE2GJS_EDA.text: Don't expect tasty biryani over here...  Breakfast food kind of okay.  Went to this restaurant based on ratings,  but taste is not good as rated.

LAd83nkWsLeo-iXDXpvkqg.text: Tasty Indian cuisine.  Had the buffet, several varieties to choose from both in vegetarian and meat dishes.  I sampled most of the buffet food and found all. choices to be good.

D_tTzpwWk43fgNhnC1bb_Q.text: The staff and food was amazing. We all left full and excited to some back. The menu has lots of amazing options. There are 2 locations both with amazing buffets. We were to late for the buffet.

Y-5Bu4TtUjaQiA-6Yi4niQ.text: I along with few friends visited this place and thoroughly enjoyed the lunch buffet. Good selection of items and taste was good.

iZOmEzeG-aT5Xn9rX91QfQ.text: Me and my family are very picky about Indian food as we want it to be perfect! This restaurant was EXCELLENT, from their customer service to food, it met all our needs! I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone whether you live in Las Vegas or your visiting like us. I had never tried pindi khurkure, actually never heard of this dish. Pindi Khurkure was so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5lnSIM7rUSIPp425hMe8VA.text: Just awesome food.  We ordered 1.mysore spicy masala dosa  2.Idly sambar  3handi biryani  (chicken) available in veg and mutton also . Ordered twice ;p 4. jeera rice  5. dal tadka  We loved handi biryani and dosa of all too different from other restaurants we had before in US.   Definitely will visit next time.

F6_3CCIHrJv5k3yec6c7Hg.text: Amazing food, great price and close to the university very vegetarian and vegan friendly. The vegan lassi is fantastic on hot Vegas afternoons.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan buffet options

U8egdcNG6gqvS4T58pF9SQ.text: Finally found a great Indian restaurant with a great selection. Ordered the Chicken Saag, garlic and butter Naan, Lamb Saag, and Chicken Tandoori- all met expectations and then some!! Every dish was seasoned to perfection- I ordered spice level 10- was perfect! Hubby ordered level 3, was perfect for his "mild" spice level. It took us awhile to try this place out- nice ambiance, great service, excellent food- who could ask for anything more?

20MxXgkWQQNFs-syZ5RJyQ.text: 0 star not good . Parathas were bad service not good . Masala dosa was bad Tummy upset   Not recommended

VcoLQFhr_odIzbVSbUIGaA.text: We went in for the Inferno curry challenge, or I should say, my friend did, I did try maybe 2 teaspoons which was way more then enough. Now my friend eats hot food, ghost wings, scorpion peppers, but for some reason this put him almost down to his knees, I can definitely understand why they have you sign a waiver, over 1800 people have tried it and only 30 have accomplished this astounding feet, all 14 ounces of it!   They are very accommodating on anything else that you want to eat with it, they brought him yogurt, milk, Salt and sugar in separate bowls, which I have never seen before and even some mango putting...he drank some Pepto-Bismol after and still had issues five hours after eating the curry.    As far as the establishment it was A+, along with the staff and Food, they also have a Very wide selection of craft beers to choose from, if I'm ever back in that area I wouldn't think twice about stopping back in, I just would stay away from the Inferno!!!

i6PIa1Gv__yNJ2AP285SSw.text: Always good and consistent delicious Indian food. The lunch buffet is always fresh with many choices. Staff is always, pleasant, efficient and attentive. My favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas to bring out of town visitors.

T0xTbPI1DxJZSekj8TeQ1g.text: Cheap eats in Vegas is hard to come by.  You can easily spend 30 bucks on a burger.  Mint Indian Bistro has a lunch buffet for 11.99!  It's off the strip but not far.  Good variety.  Complimentary naan, excellent attentive service.  Not the best indian food ever, but not bad especially for the price. A+!

EJA2i4RI8mTysV4PPLSVEw.text: Yummy food.. amazing service , value for money all in one place !! the buffet .. has many options for vegetarians too.. one of the best Indian restaurants I have visited in US.

u1x-6FmE5OEC5eGU7WEl-g.text: Good food, normal price and nice environment.  I have never seen a well organized menu before this one. I recommend this.

JcKiHESBdBe6cQHe2MJRQw.text: Must try Indian restaurant if you are visiting Vegas. Only minor issue is it takes a little too long for the food to be served. If you are willing to be patient, you will be in for a treat.

fOHZUx8SgbiL9mQ97zZS-g.text: Solid 4 stars!  Is nice to get away from the strip if you're there for an entire week!!! The ambiance here is great! Very calm and the service is great.   They are so high tech! The waiter took our orders with his iphone and it was submitted into the kitchen! He said the owner created an app. Genius!    You can never go wrong with Tikka Masala!! We came here for dinner with a party of five. No buffet--a la carte.   We ordered an assortment of dishes, but my favorite was the tikka masala with garlic naan.   I also ordered the peach lassi, which was pretty good. It tasted like a peach yoplait! hahaha  Oh, I forgot to mention, but they have a GREAT, extensive selection of alcoholic beverages!!!

nabvZv_4YCrM0Mcd9Yhzcw.text: Me and my friend dropped in after a road trip from Zion, we were dying for food being on the road for long. The very first thing we ordered was Masala Chai and Lassi, and oh dear Chai was so perfectly made with right amount of ginger and cardamom which made us shed all our tiredness right there. Trust me, am the person who is very picky on chai and flavors in Indian food and the moment i tasted the Chai i knew this place knows how to get the authentic Indian flavor. We could not resist and ordered a lot of food including Daal Maharani and Paneer Curry with some Garlic Naan. We had a hearty meal and were very satisfied with their preparation. Keep it up !!

OQ46SljBmn6_5KngOQhe3w.text: Always a great atmosphere. Good greetings and service that you would expect from higher end restaurants. Very well run and the food overall is by far the best Indian I've had ( am from India ) cheers. Try the lamp stir fry with your kingfisher beer. Awesome combo with the spicy lamb and beer

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hkwXLTEvYC4u6-4fTnYI0Q.text: Wow after so many GREAT and AMaZING meals I ordered take out tonight and half the food sat 20 mins on the counter waiting for the other half poor deal and cold food DONT DO TAKE OUT THEY WILL SCREW YOU

uFB375chEpTFuyP0dUSA_A.text: Before I was going to write this review, I wanted to check out Namaste so I can compare both lunch buffets.  Let's just say Mint Indian Bistro won hands down!  I've had both the lunch buffet and ala carte dinner, both were great but the bargain is definitely the all you can eat lunch buffet for $10.  They had a good variety of both vegetarian and meat dishes, including chicken korma.  They make some of the best around, great flavor, creamy sauce.  My fellow diners also loved the lunch buffet, one even exclaimed "if all vegetarian food tasted this good" he'd be a vegetarian!  Buffet includes tandoori chicken and a lamb dish and they bring warm Naan bread to your table.  They also have an extensive drink menu- large selection of Indian and Belgian beers as well as specialty cocktails.  This is a definite "WILL RETURN" spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xRh_dOYGyREMIfaoGrYQmg.text: Great food, great prices, great staff. The only complaint is that the parking lot is too small, but I guess that keeps traffic to a manageable level!

tioBq1sjXUPzbs0L9jlQTg.text: Incredible. Great service, atmosphere, and food. A magical place for vegans and people that are gluten free. The menu clearly states all allergen info and the server was knowledgable. Food: egg plant, okra, and yellow lentil dish were amazing. And gluten free bread! We went twice in 4 days. Highly recommend.    Joshua

k6tWgOxuS9uBW7FhaGTlUg.text: This place has good indian buffet, love mango custard here. My all time favorite when ever I am in Vegas.  I am an Indian. Love the food here, homemade fresh.

5Oed_KbHJ2tNvHwJp-GKlQ.text: 4.5 stars!  Came on Saturday for the lunch buffet and was happy to walk in and see quite a few tables of Indian patrons.  That lets me know that the flavors are authentic and it was.  Even my cousin who spent some time in India was impressed with the quality, flavors, and selection.  The buffet consists of a mixture of North and South Indian dishes, and every dish tastes so distinct with it's robust spices and flavors. The vegetarian dishes are so flavorful they have the power to convert any carnivore.   After devouring 2 full plates, another cousin even made the comment "I am willing to become obese for this". That, in itself, is a testament to the deliciousness of Mint Bistro.  We actually had to practice some restraint from consuming the entire buffet ourselves.  We will definitely be back.

3LnrS1O9JnsuzOjpLHtH2A.text: With so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas there are very few that we've been back to more than once, and Mint has become a favourite.  Though it doesn't look too fancy from the outside this is the best Indian food I've had since moving here,  and the large and inexpensive cocktails are great, too. Big tables for groups + booths in dark and quiet corners. Three visits so far and loved it each time. We'll be back.

ox5xSVNibHVyjIR5sqnpYw.text: 3.5 stars.  Slightly better than average Indian food.  And when you tell them spicy, believe me, they make it SPICY!  The staff is super friendly and the prices are a nice break from the typical overpriced Vegas food.  And this was probably the best meal I had during my stay in Vegas... and the cheapest... and no ditzy waitresses/waiters.  Woot.

aonDlAge8o1ecwIdJUrjSw.text: I have been here at different occasions during my trip to las Vegas! They have been consistently serving good food. Naan and gravies were tasty and so are their dosas. Lunch buffet had good options for vegetarians. On the other hand the service was not prompt. This is not a place for quick bite! Be prepared to wait for a while. After all there is no harm in waiting for a delicious food :)

KksQklmp53TXyj9N1yhqsw.text: This place feels upscale, but in a welcoming the working class kind of way... Torrance and I had the lunch buffet. $10 for this??? And you get fresh, hot garlic naan? It seemed too good to be True. Why did we wait so long before coming here? The staff was friendly and attentive, more than any other buffet that I have been to. I advised one of the staff of my husband's tree nut allergy and he walked us to the buffet and pointed out every item that he should stay away from. Tikka Masala has cashews!  Every item that I had was delicious. I want to go back again... very soon!

EiKk7B8mJ4vxJvvNxskqNg.text: I love to eat, no surprises there. But what I really love is a cuisine-specific buffet. I'm fond of smorgasbord buffets too, but there's something about just Indian food or just Chinese food or just Mexican food, and endless amounts of it, that make my heart go pitter patter (in an excitement way and a high blood pressure and cholesterol way). So when in a panic of needing Indian food and needing it now, I met my girl Jaime W for some AYCE yums.   When we arrived, we were given menus. "WTF FOR?!?" I thought. It turns out that in addition to their delicious lunch buffet, they have a hefty selection of drinks, alcoholic and non. Next time.   I started off wrong by getting a small plate instead of the bigass one necessary for all Indian food pursuits. It didn't take me long to fill it up. I did not care for the green salad--too peppery--but hey, that's the beauty of the buffet. Chutneys all were so winning, especially combined with any of the other various items on the buffet. You can't go wrong with mango chutney and paneer tikka masala, amirite?   The menu is SuperMenu, so clearly marked for anybody with dietary restrictions. My only dietary restriction is having only one stomach so I'm not concerned about vegetarian/vegan/gluten free but if that's your bag, here's your place. I also like how there are menu suggestions and they let you know that some things are desserts (except those little donuts. Those are marked wrong, they are for every course).   Definitely will come back for the dinner menu and for the buffet again. Can't complain about a thing.

eU71OB6p3haD1ALgwIE2jA.text: I went here with some friends during our recent vegas stay. It was really awesome. Going to vegas, people always rave about the food, but I've never really found anything food wise that I cant live without.  I am a vegetarian for almost 9 years now and most buffets are meat/seafood heavy and I just don't see the value in paying for salad.  That makes indian food a really attractive option for me. I was with 7 other people and we settled on indian after a little bit of back and forth negotiations.  I am really glad we did!  First, its a little off the strip so parking was easy to find.  Coming with 8 people isn't always easy to accommodate without reservations but Mint was more than accommodating.    We had excellent service.  We had a free appetizer and our glasses were always filled before we had to ask.   The menu was fairly extensive.  There were a lot of options, including many of the traditional indian favorites: naan, kormas, masalas, etc.  The portions were generous, served quickly and hot.  My veggie korma was really good.  All around everyone was very happy with the dishes they ordered.   Some of the items we ordered included:   Veggie Korma Lamb Korma Naan- Garlic and Plain Rice Dinner special menu set 1 Mango Lassis And Chicken Masala.   The korma was smooth and not gritty.  Gritty korma is a pet peeve of mine.  The dinner set came in traditional metal serving trays with many little sides.  They didn't make a fuss in my request to substitute 2 of the meat options for vegetarian options.  The vegetables were cooked correctly and not mushy/overcooked.    The spice level was low for me but I also have a very high spice tolerance.  Everyone else seemed to think it was around medium spicy.   We split the check in 2, which they didn't give us any heartache about.  I'd recommend it as a nice, calm place to get a solid, tasty, dinner while in Vegas- especially if you have a larger group and don't want to fight with the long lines at buffets.  Also Mint is really vegetarian friendly.  All in all, a great experience. =)

Fklpw6_OoyOb6Eb0mlFN3A.text: I had a buy one get one entree coupon to this restaurant, so I decided to stop by because I really like Indian food. It was buffet time there, and most restaurants don't honor the bogo entree coupons for buffet, so I was thinking it might not go as planned, but the waiter said I could use it! Great deal. The other bonus about this place besides how good the food tastes, is that it offers gluten free food actually labeled "gluten free." I have celiac disease so that meant a lot to me. Thanks Mint Indian Bistro. I like you guys.

eOS4OJKt54sDiDcYXoeg_g.text: I hate buffets.  Ever since I was about 9 years old and ate a horrific piece of cold fried chicken at the Circus Circus buffet, I pretty much avoid them unless they're being paid for or someone I know really wants to go with them.  For a while this even extended it to restaurants I liked or cuisines I enjoyed that offered buffets.   I would skip those and order a la carte.     With my recent love for Mt Everest's lunch buffet and my complete obsession over Indian food in general, I figured it was time to venture out and try another.   I'm ridiculously smart for this decision, because Mint blew me away at lunch today.  We were seated and offered a choice of naan and I ordered an iced tea before going up to grab a plate.  Naturally I skipped over the fruits and veggies on the first cart and went right to the rice, pakoras, and varieties of dals, curries, and chicken dishes.  First thing I noticed that I appreciated wholly was that each item had notations on whether they were vegan, vegetarian, had glucose, or had jain.  One of the friendly servers heard my friend and I seemingly confused over what that even was and she explained it (people who dont/cant eat garlic or onions?  Perish the thought!)  I annoyed her with my lactose intolerance issue as I do everyone that I encounter in a food establishment, but still took my chances with just about anything that didn't say "paneer" on it.  My goal at Indian buffets now is to never return for a 2nd plate.  Of course this just means that I have a mountain of food on my one and only plate, and Mint was no exception.   If I went back for seconds they probably would have closed down for the day.  Pretty sure I was triple stacking items and just letting them all ooze together.  It's like an fountain drink suicide indian style.  The only negative I can think of on selection this day was no samosas.  Seemed like a greek joint without falafels.  Got back to the table with my iced tea waiting and a basket of fresh, hot naan followed shortly after.   EVERY single bite was delicious.  I wish I could go into greater detail on each component, but it wouldnt be adequate.  I probably had 12 different items on my plate, and I repeat:  EVERY bite was delicious.   Price was standard and worth every penny.   One final exemplary service note which might have just been circumstantial, but on the receipt it noted that the naan was with (no butter).   I think the woman that was working at the front of the line may have informed our waiter to hold the butter on the naan as she overheard the two lactose intolerant weirdos in line discussing it.   Way to make us feel welcomed!  Gotta go 5 on this one.   Though I'm starting to wonder if there are any Indian restaurants here in town I DONT like....

8KrA_lrb9xMZPiscUbP1mw.text: It is difficult to find a place to satisfy my girlfriends and I since we have a vegan, a picky eater, and someone who has never tried other ethnic foods besides Mexican and American.  It was pretty pack considering it was late Sunday evening. However, we were able to get a table right away and the food came out fast. They have a huge menu that is also vegan & gluten-free friendly (I guess all Indian food). The menu is well organized and laid out with symbols next to each dish to help the diners that have diet restrictions. Almost every dish can be made into vegan or vegetarian. They also have chicken, tofu, and cheese options. We ordered the onion/cilantra paratha, organic veggie samosas, mighty momos with veggie, chicken tikka masala (Hot level 5-it was not spicy), mixed chef's killer kabob, organic alo gobi masala, monterey jack cheese naan and lastly mango and pistachio kulfi for deserts. Not 1 bad dish. Everything was very good including their chutneys. I do wish they gave more rice since they only gave us 2 small bowls to share between 3 people. They seemed to be reasonbly priced.  Our server, Ronald was great and very helpful. The ambience of the place was nice, too.  It was relaxing and calming. You know it's a good Indian restraunt when it is packed with Indian diners! Overall, we are very happy and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved it!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZPBKjjmeV3xXKMwMHPXECA.text: I really enjoy their lunch buffet.  Every time I eat here, I leave full and satisfied.  I good place to eat for sure.

q71nfxG26D6dbz4EdLQoGQ.text: Great great food.. Fresh crispy nun.. Delicious rice.. All dishes are simply FABULOUS.. the sweets & fruit salad are great... & the buffet was only $10.99/person RECOMMENDED x10

E8xVow-KdCKEUnejfVvFHg.text: Before you read the review, you must understand a few things. 1) This is the only "Indian/Nepalese" place I've eaten at in Vegas 2) The only other "Indian" food I've had has been homemade by ethnic Indians or at Diwali events.  3) I am not an expert in either of these two cuisine types, but I do like good food.   We came here for a dinner with some friends. We had a friend in from China, and since she likes to eat, we decided on a place where we can try something new, while socializing. We also know that Indian food meets many different dietary wants and needs, and this place has decent reviews and reasonable prices, so we came to Mint.   We arrived at 7pm to a very clean and modern dining room. The dining area was a little over half full. The clientele seemed very diverse with a mix of cultures and varying levels of dress.   Mint easily accommodated our party of 12, which was nice. We had a nice big table and were not cramped, nor did we cramp the other tables around us. The staff seemed friendly enough. However, we were waiting for 2 members of our party to arrive for about 30 minutes, but our waiters never asked for drink or app orders. That wasn't a huge issue, but once we ordered apps and drinks our waiter didn't ask us for our dinner orders for about another 30-45 minutes. We were all engaged in conversation, which I guess could have encouraged the waiter not to ask us. Overall, we were there for 3 hours, and the service was only so so.  The food was good. The wife and I shared the vegetarian sampler platter. Everything we had was distinctive, flavorful, and delicious. I don't know Indian/Nepalese food too well, so I can't say how authentic it was or was not, but it was pleasing to my palate. We asked for a level 7 spice, but I am pretty sure the waiter did not accommodate that as our food was not too spicy. We like heat, and only one of our dishes had a bit of heat.   I was very impressed with 2 things: 1) The wide selection and friendliness towards vegans and vegetarians. We had more selections than we knew what to do with. I am really excited to go back to Mint just to try some more. 2) Beer selection: There is a great selection of Indian and European beers here. They range in price from $5-$19 a bottle, but they have selections here I've not seen anywhere else in Vegas. Additionally, they do have a "beer of the month" which they sell cheaper than the others. This month the beer is a very good Belgian White (the brand escapes me).  Overall, it was a good experience (other than the service), but I think I will be back.

2n0m_uBmj9iWGtP3UoIzBw.text: The garlic naan is exceptional!  Stopped in for the lunch buffet and the selection was wonderful -- had all the basic Indian dishes.  There were a lot of vegetarian dishes I winced at.  For $10/person, it's a great deal.
