Clean and modern, with funky art hung up on the walls.   For appetizers we had the garlic naan with makhani sauce and the organic samosas, along with some lassis to drink. I had the mango rum and my friend had the lychee rum. The mango was thick from the puree and yoghurt, and a little too strong from the rum, but good overall. The lychee one was perfect! Both the  naan and samosas were delicious, but the garlic naan was my favorite, and the spicy makhani sauce : )  The entrees we went with were the veggie tikka masala (8/10 spicy) and lamb vindaloo (10/10 spicy) with basmati rice. The veggies were perfectly cooked, the lamb was tender and flavorful. Sauce was well seasoned, and the spice definitely matched the level. 10/10 had my nose running, but it's all good, the pain let's me know I'm alive hahaha. I'm gonna need to train if I'm gonna try the inferno curry challenge (which according to the server is at a 110/10. Basmati was ok, but next time I'm getting extra garlic naan to have with my meal.   DESSERT! We were fat kids and ordered 6 of the mini desserts, because they were sold out of the 7th one. So! We got the Khir (rice pudding), Gulab Jamun (milk based pastry steeped in syrup), Pistachio and Mango Kulfi (ice cream), Mango Custard, and Gajar Halwa (carrot pudding [like, steamed pudding, not jello]). All so good, even after stuffing our faces with food prior. The gajar halwa and gulab jamun were too sweet for me, though.   Great first experience for me, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango rum lassi and lychee rum lassi.
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DESSERT!
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb vindaloo.

c-q6PN6qFM0ITWZRJ0OPEA.text: Food is excellent, clean restaurant, bathrooms clean, manager is very friendly and helpful with the menu, good prices, can't wait to come back

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good food, love the chicken masala, will for sure come back, good prices, great service

HAYyfYvbu-bsqcnSGn0j1g.text: This has become our first choice for an Indian food buffet on the West side!  Always clean, well managed and excellent service.

_NuzEM0XZz-jVYDWM20oIg.text: We love Indian food, so every time we visit a new city, looking for an Indian place is a must. So we came to this place for lunch with our daughter who also likes Indian food. While we were waiting for our table, we saw a lot of Indian people came out from the restaurant, and more were coming. Then we knew the food must be good and authentic. When we walked in, the place is small compare to some other Indian restaurants we have been to, but very cozy and modern. Everything was very tasty, my favorite is the goat meat, it was cooked perfectly, tender, juicy... the chili chicken was good too.   My hubby didn't like goat meat so he had other chicken and veggie dishes which were all very good.   Not greasy or heavy, not salty but very tasty! I am glad that we had come to this place to eat!

xjfH8d8YsdcOMFimZg_YLg.text: It was my first time trying Indian food and this place was amazing! They have a buffet so you can try a little bit of everything and it was all so good. The service was very fast and they were sure to keep bringing us naan and refilling our drinks. I can now say I love Indian food and will be sure to come back soon!

r-lC8hzLMcPB9lpBdQt2yg.text: The staff here is exceedingly rude and impolite. As far as the food goes, I've had better. The biryani was extremely dry.

oHR5zu2mDxrVSpai7VkQuA.text: Been to about 5-6 Indian buffets in town and this has taken over Mt. Everest as my new #1.  Something to rave about... 1. The garlic buttered naan was the best I've had at any buffet in town, soft, hot and airy and they bring it to you in an individual basket to ensure it's fresh. 2. The curries are good and the meat/chicken is good quality...I noticed buffets like to go cheap on the goat, giving you some fatty parts and straight up bone, but not here. I had some nice chunks of goat meat in the flavorful goat curry and it was tender...nicely done. 3. They had two kinds of soups, both had a good spice, one with a nice tomato broth...soup on an Indian buffet is a nice touch. 4. Making an entrance was chicken vindaloo...not too many buffets put out a vindaloo because they figure most people don't like spice...I love spice and wish it were a touch hotter but glad it was there regardless. 5. The Khir (rice pudding) was also tops as were those gulamon (?) super sweet carb balls...  Let's bitch... 1. Vegetable pakora was kind of dried out...they had made a ton of it and it just sat there...but who the heck goes to a buffet for pakora? 2. No vegetable samosas...I would have hit that but not a big deal...they said they change things daily so maybe tomorrow is samosa day. 3. They had chicken tika masala and paneer (cheese) tika masala in two different bins...I love paneer dishes so maybe instead of giving me the same exact curry twice and calling it an entirely different dish, make a paneer palak (spinach) dish with the paneer and keep the chicken tika masala up there as well...just an extra flavor rather than the same flavor over again.  Word is they are opening a new location in Spring Valley off Flamingo and Durango which is awesome because I know I'll be there 2-3 times a month minimum.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat curry and chicken vindaloo. No fat or bones in the goat curry- outstanding
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty soups
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carafe of water--smart

Y94hi10ZM4xVYTxyjZJcuw.text: Ask for Julie- this is your FIRST STEP!  She is a server extraordinaire!   If she's not working that day, the guys are very helpful and attentive there as well.   If I were to take away a star- it would be for the packed times and waiting during this cold winter season.  However that would seem unfair as the food can not be rushed and it's not the restaurant's fault that I want to eat at the same time as a lot of others.   The food is delicious.  Julie is my go to person simply because she's always recommending dishes for our group to try.   She hasn't missed a beat thus far.   The foods enjoyed:  Buttered Chicken  Lentils pot has an amazing taste and good kick to it Samosas are consistent in taste- every once in a while, it comes out just warm Masala- chicken is great- shrimp is at times over cooked Sag Paneer is good Garlic Naan is worth ordering a FEW TIMES Aloo Gobi was my favorite   They also make a semi-sweet Lassi that has me ordering 2 at times.   Overall, bring your appetite and look for Julie!

0XbjoNzKfPnus1ABkPi5hA.text: This place was da Bombay.  Did the lunch buffet which was only $12.99, and included naan (or some other breads).  The dinner quality is probably better since it's made to order and there are more options, but the buffet is a good way to sample a lot.  I  really liked the one with the paneer cheese.

fwAsk2Fd_OnAh0_HJgGoSg.text: Food tasted good, there was lots of selection. Service was good as well. The reason for three starts, however, is because they charge 1.99 for a small bowl of rice. And when you order your entree you don't realize this is going to be included, even if you never asked for it. Really respect him for the great menu and the detail they put into it.

eKTBNUl3nd1-dvw5T5kyKw.text: While there are many Buffet options to chose form in Vegas, I believe this was a wise choice! We have tried other buffet places which turned out to be a disappointment but I believe this buffet place lived up to the reviews! There was a 45 minute wait but hey that's what happens on holiday weekends! It is open till 4pm for lunch buffet which is much longer then other places around here. The food was really good. There were tons of varieties. They have the normal traditional pubjabi buffet but they also had things like bhel, idli sambhar and Noodles.   Service was definitely commendable. Parking was easily available as well. I would recommend this restaurant and we will definitely come back.

fOiV-4hkg1jYJC4_HzHgVQ.text: This is my 2nd visit. My previous visit was my first time trying Indian food. We were pleased with the meat tasting platter. Since then we have expanded our Indian horizons, each finding favorite items.  We decided to return to the beginning. The decor had not really changed much in the three+ years between visits. We walked in at approximately 530 in a Saturday evening. I like to go some place early enough to not feel rushed and to see the service at an easier pace.  So...we walked in, and stood there. It is a small location and there were several tables together in the middle of the dining area for a family group. Eventually, after having staff walk by us,  we were seated in a booth in the middle. Then the person who seated us walked away. No menus, nothing said. We waited patiently. After a bit of time another staff came by to take our drink order. We asked for menus and ice water. Looking flustered,  he went away and came back with our menus. Which are extensive. We eventually agreed to try the vegetarian tasting platter, (forgoing my usual Korma) to taste different veg forward dishes. When another server came to take our order, (still no ice water), we placed our order. Then he excused himself before we could say anything else. He came back, again and told us the vegetarian tasting menu wasn't available. ( A nearby table had a platter delivered while we were waiting but it must have been meat.) So we took more time to wade through the menu. I, of course, ordered my Korma. My adventurous husband ordered a paneer dish. We also ordered veggie samosas. I requested a Mango Lassi with Rum. (Yum) Hubby had an imported beer.  The samoas arrived. Unfortunately without plates to eat off of, or utensils. We waved down a passing staffer. He obliged. The samoas were, ehh. The two sauces were quite good.  Then our entrees arrived with Garlic Naan. Strangely,  they left us with the used plates from our samosas. ( Environmentally friendly by saving water?) The Naan was great. The rice was well cooked. My Korma was..average. Hubs was happy, but we both agreed it was unlikely we would return. Despite the restaurant being closer to our house than other Indian favorites, the horrible service, ( I only pointed out a few instances) average food and general feeling that no one working there could be bothered wasn't worth another trip.  So off we went. Our wallet lightened, but our appetites left disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aeG6JgB8Ugrfmjc0Yybt9g.text: Came here for dinner after a long day of hiking so we were starving! This location is huge! There's a bar/tv area on one side of the restaurant, buffet is towards the back, and booths and tables filling up the rest of the space.   The food:  Rose lassi - it had a slight lychee taste to it which I enjoyed! Wasn't overly sweet and did a great job of toning down the heat from the food.   We got the non-vegetarian pre-fixe menu which came with 2 appetizers, 8 entrees (samples), 1 type of bread (we chose garlic naan), and 1 choice of dessert. This was plenty of food for the 2 of us! This was also perfect for us because we didn't know what we wanted to eat so with this, you get to sample a bit of everything! I think the garlic naan could've used more garlic and butter taste to it, but everything else was good.   Service was attentive, and food arrived quickly. Would love to come back to give their lunch a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert from pre-fixe
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non-vegetarian pre-fixe
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer from pre-fixe

5mZCydIz4RUTe0B1kDyVQA.text: It takes a lot to make me post a yelp review, but I had to talk about my favorite Indian Restaurant in Vegas! Whether it is this location or their Summerlin location, Mint always delivers! Service is friendly and their food is out of the park. The menu is huge and descriptive and food arrives promptly and is so so tasty. I'm a strict vegetarian and the menu is clearly marked and has tons of options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. I always recommend for people to try their Vindaloo, Tikki Masala, and the Naan Mahkani! This place is addicting and I have tried other Indian restaurants in Vegas and none of them compare!

v7ZhisoOmevEI77EjWg_UA.text: I have had the best Indian food in America.Authentic taste,good ambience and affordable food.Calm family oriented spot.Servers were so helpful and friendly.We ordered Lassi, Hot and sour soup,methi malai,dal maharani,paneer tikka masala,naan and gulab jamun.Everything was so tasty,not a single complaint .Overall -Awesome Experience.

Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HB9i2rEjiOEehtalPdU0UQ.text: Came here for the Lunch Buffet. Bomb Indian food, the buffet allowed me to try multiple dishes ayce highly recommend the lunch buffet to try everything including the Garlic naan

CdDC30NaktOXIt-bySKnfQ.text: We had dinner here recently. Made reservations for 4 on a Sunday evening. Upon arrival, out table was not quite ready so the hostess suggested we sit at the bar.  We were handed menus for drinks and food and after sitting for 10 minutes, no one asked us if we even wanted a drink.  So then we were seated and the waiter finally came around and asked what we wanted. I asked for the Momos (Dumplings) right off because they take the longest to make and the waiter replied that they no longer have them on the menu (which they still were) because they were so popular they couldn't keep up making them. Huh? What? We gave them our drink order, and the waiter replied that the beer my daughter wanted was out of stock......though they were on the shelf at the bar. Long story short,  4 stars for the great food but service sucked.  Never came around to see if we needed anything else, my husband had to wave down waiter for another beer.

KcxNJxCoNDlPMkozEGKlSA.text: We come for the butter dosa and we stay for the mango masala with paner and black lentils! Truly everything on the menu will exceed your expectations. Service is excellent.

qgVsYa6D85_RDRoJMa1a1w.text: Love the Mint.  Superbly tasty lamb roghan josht. The chicken korma was also excellent. Had a n Indian beer to wash it all down!

9JMTEVJtiBVX6k70m3Qbmw.text: Good buffet spread. But the taste was not great. There was no salt in paneer. Sambar was good

ZK7MJJ4rIhayqQmEtCx0bw.text: I had high expectations and they were met around 90%so not bad . Malai kebabs was very good and soft . The customer base was well mixed ethnicity so it tells you two things 1- Indian food is catching up with main stream and 2 Mint Indian Bistro is trustworthy restaurants providing high quality indian food . The chili chicken was dry and I did not like it all . Hard to find good chili  chicken . Hope fully one Day I will find really good one and update you all . But yeh if I am in Vegas I will be back here . I started this review never finished but got it done today . Great job Raj

U9WTKSJ1RDvJNgUsnofD2w.text: This is a clean restaurant and it's kept at good dining temperature. One of the first things I do when I walk in is order garlic naan bread then head straight for the buffet which is 11am-3pm I believe. The food is kept at a good temperature and I have my favorite which is the pakora, chicken tikka masala and the chili chicken. Everything is made well and I can't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7924XNOLUwS9iID8F1kdcg.text: This is some of the best Indian food I've ever eaten. We came here for the lunch buffet one day & we were blown away.   Highlights of the lunch buffet were: garlic naan bread, chili chicken, tandoori chicken, the chau chau noodles & chicken tiki massala.   Service was great! Very attentive. They always kept our naan baskets full & made sure our water bottles were full.   The only reason I give this joint 4 stars (and not 5) is I found a small hair in my food. Other than that, an outstanding experience!

YKeHhRM7k_wxmw45g7bKaQ.text: Best Indian food I have had in America. It was so authentic and they had all the different types of food you can get in the different regions of India. They had everything from Pani Puri to Goolab Jamun.   The price was really affordable and I was full within 2 plates during the lunch buffet. The paneer Tikka was delicious along with everything else. It's not a typical place I would go to visiting Vegas, but I will definitely be going back. I would be very interested to try the spicy eating competition on their wall.

QZEaNSGDM0oSMHo0SJkYEQ.text: Well, this place is hyped up for sure..  Given the reviews I think I expected it to one of those big spreads like bawarchi if you have been to one.. This was nothing extraordinary but a decent one.. They serve bread at the table...  Have a couple of good options.. But the one thing I would say is that having gone to the other Indian buffets in the city this is your best bet.. Mind you, keep the expectations low

TeSj3FqqPUqx9P634Eb19A.text: Right next to UNLV and it is our go to for Indian food! The buffet is where it's at. If you've never tried Indian food go to the buffet so you can try lots of different stuff. Everything has some sort of sauce that makes the food a bit spicy and so delicious! You have to order the garlic naan if you go! Staff is very attentive and very polite

YJcMfJUmcyQTQlhMaRFS4w.text: Omg - the lunch buffet is insanely amazing, every dish is delicious. I am big into Indian food- and from New York, so i know pretty much about Indian food. But this place is a blast- quality of food is 10/10. Service by staff 10/10. Cleanness, cutlery, variety of food- everything is amazing. Price is very decent for this kind of buffet $ 12 for lunch buffet . It's equal to pay nothing for this food. Host is amazing, very nice experienced guy, who knows the likes and dislikes of custmors. Interior decor of the place so beautiful, very decent place.  Strongly recommended.

u_q5Tth7HvFGJBbw2ULIRw.text: Atmosphere: Modern and clean but also cozy at the same time. Service: Excellent to the point where the waiter seemed like he was always there. But hey, it's better than trying to flag down waiters. Food: We got the pre-fixe dinner for 2. There was so much food, it was essentially a dinner for 4! I like the pre-fixe because you can try a little bit of everything without getting a full a la carte sized dish. The dishes here are solid and fresh.

Qr1YrbFHFodp-q7YUhxN8Q.text: We have been to Las Vegas so many times but this is the first time we found this restaurant.  They had so much options on the buffet. You don't want to miss their lamb which was melting in your mouth.  Garlic Naan was excellent. Service was great!  Will come again every time I visit Las Vegas.

hdRXg8Ds4ucWkj_LeS5GjA.text: Just off the strip but well worth the mile or so drive. Upscale furnishings, dishware, and decor make this feel like a treat. Clear labels in the expansive menus made it easy for us to find vegetarian and gluten free options. Mid-range prices, kid-friendly, and laid-back. Everything was so delicious, staff was courteous and helpful. We started with vegetables pakodas (pakora). Then we had Mango Masala, Palak Paneer, and Baingain Bharta; which were all amazing. The Naan was light and fluffy and the rice perfectly cooked. This is a DON'T MISS restaurant if you are visiting the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classy indian place with amazing food. Our new favorite Indian place in Vegas

ypm0RwxHb3uEg-t_RFQ_fQ.text: I give the restaurant five stars the service was excellent the food is fresh and flavorful we shared the vegetarian dinner for two a perfect sampling of their dishes. I will and have told friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was our first time at the restaurant the service was outstanding the food was fresh and flavorful I&#39;ve already told friend.

hQauf1xFXAa3l_yEVTiAbA.text: Straight forward Indian lunch buffet Great value! ($12) Variety Fresh Tasty Large beer selection small and large format, international and micro brews Friendly staff It ends at 2:30 daily, and I would highly recommend this low profile, locals spot!

clkWDVHe_RsCsHJBuLkxUw.text: I've been here for lunch (once) and for dinner (multiple times) and my final answer is that this is the best Indian I've had (so far) in Las Vegas.  It is certainly the best in town if you like HEAT.  At dinner, a great selection of some of the more well-known Indian cuisines, although--like almost every Indian place in town--the emphasis runs too strongly in the Northern/Punjabi, meat-heavy direction.  But nevermind, there is plenty of goodness to choose from.  At lunch, the buffet is outstanding. Actually, it blew my mind.  One erstwhile yelper commented that the dishes were among the "most common" and then recommended the spread at India Palace.  Huh????  Palace is ok, the owners are nice, and I can see why someone needing more room (ahem...) might prefer it, but since when does one find Goat Curry on a buffet featuring "the most common dishes."  No ma'am.  Twas extraordinary and I shall return.  Btw, as far as the service goes...is it awkward?  Sure.  But it is well meaning, IMO.

cDj6CxYqnm-QpjB4uogtFw.text: If you are looking for the best Indian food in Las Vegas, your search ends here. This is one of the few Indian places that nails it down on quality, taste, service, ambiance and price!  Went here for a weekend lunch buffet. Priced at $12.99/person, it is unbeatable good quality Indian food (you could tell by the sheer number of Indian folks eating here and the long queue of those waiting to get a table). The buffet had a varied collection of items including appetizers, salads, four veg, four non veg curries, rice and dessert. Some top show stoppers were Vegetable Korma, Paneer, Idli Sambar, Veg Pakoras, Bhelpuri and Naan. Food was flavourful, hot and fresh (unlike many places where dishes just keep sitting for long on buffet racks). Each curry tasted authentic, distinct from another and cooked to perfection. Also tried their Masala Tea (not included in the buffet) and it was good.  Service was fast, attentive and friendly and this is despite the rush on a busy Saturday afternoon.  Decor is simple yet pleasing to the eyes.  For those of you, who might be tempted to try many other low priced Indian buffets in town (mostly at $9 or $10), trust me this one might be a little pricey but it is top value for your dollar. This place serves delicious food and has great ambiance & service!  Tip: Lunch hour gets real crowded on Sat & Sun, so ditch the long waiting time (sometimes upto 30-35 mins for a table inside and 20 mins for an outside seating) by making it for an early lunch. Also, if you are not used to having Indian food, this could prove to be a little on the spicy side for you.    So what could improve? This is for the restaurant owner/ management/ staff:  1. Do away with those paper cup glasses. They look cheap and take away the charm from the entire food experience. 2. Including a drink in the buffet like Tea or Mango Lassi can help you beat the competition that comes at a similar price.

Ec2C4K3NB1bOmUxrjOYAqg.text: They close during the day at odd times to clean the restaurant but claim to be open until 11:30 pm on Yelp.

D-S-j75WsBvTfmMakjPwfg.text: I definitely will be back here again for sure. Lunch is great! Meat? vegetarian ? It's all good. And it's Delish!! Nom nom nom :)

9PEX9SgzLneRny5I6MfEzQ.text: Oh Yelp, you steered me wrong on this one.  I feel pretty bad about it actually, because there are some things that Mint really does right.  Unfortunately, few of these were related to the food itself.  The good - they bring you a carafe of water and leave it on the table so you can refill your own glass.  This is really nice when eating spicy Indian food (of which there was none here.)  The restaurant is very clean and attractive, the service is very friendly.  They bring naan fresh to your table and the naan was good.  The bad - Most of the buffet was bland, bland, bland.  And I don't mean just 'not spicy' bland, but 'no flavor' bland.  The tikka masala was gloppy, like the cream in it had curdled, but it had little flavor.  I was SOOO excited to see goat curry (my favorite dish ever!) on the buffet... but it was bland, bland, bland.  The meat was good but the curry...nonexistant.  The saag was downright horrible - the worst I've ever had.  Everything tasted like they'd forgotten salt (and I don't like overly salted food).  The creamy tofu curry had no flavor.  The kheer was also pretty dreadful.  They use rice angel hair instead of rice, so it had a slimy wormy consistency and the runny 'sauce' did not taste good.  I usually love kheer but I took one bite and that's it.  The indifferent - the gulab jamun was about average though I couldn't taste any cardamom in the simple syrup, which is a letdown.  The dal was subtly flavored but not too bad.  The best dishes on the buffet were the 'chili chicken' (tasted like mexican-indian fusion but actually had some flavor) and the 'veggie chow chow' which is some sort of noodle dish that didn't really remind me of any Indian food, but didn't taste bad.  The buffet was about $11 per person.  There were a surprising number of indo-pak folks in here, surprising because of how bad the food was.  Normally at the places I frequent in other cities that have a lot of indo-pak clientele, the food is very spicy and flavorful (sometimes too spicy for my pansy white arse even).  But here, it was like the baby-food bland version of everything.  Why were they here?  Is this really the best Indian food available in Vegas?  I shudder to think that is the case.  I hope they were just having a bad day but honestly the food wasn't good enough for me to want to find out, despite the nice touches of fresh naan and abundant water.

vfSnSqU-9q3I3oL5N-WlCQ.text: Very disappointed. Very bad service. We have two kids when we walked in we were told that they will be charged kids price . When we finished we were charged full price for them. Guy name Biru said this how it works . I said when we walked in we were told kids will be charged half . biru said I can't do anything about it . I said your employee who told us he standing next to you and he admitted that he said that. biru said I can't do anything about it .

A9MKO_-I2zSH9BZLRlUcdw.text: It was overpriced and poor quality .. they take a long to time to replenish the items on the lunch buffet.. India masala down the street is much better

WUYWu3E5MhSXGOy_iGuRBg.text: Very Rudy Staff. .....don't  go this place, no respect for costumer. ..no good. We waiting outside 30 minutes & after they say sorry we closed.

Uso1M8QR0EPyOkKsV6Y1dA.text: Delicious food. Great service across the board.  Lamb Vindaloo=excellent  Tandoori Chicken = full of flavor but a bit dry.  Mango Lassi = yummy  Pakoda = perfect Butter chicken = fantastically properly prepared.  Nice chutney's and Naan.

alUp7B8ytqPwsyoJARatRQ.text: The best Indian food I have had in a while! Really good service and the waiter was very educated in his spices!

bznsJ7xNjU2Wof9Sztfz_A.text: I have been coming here for years, and this place is absolutely wonderful: decor, food, drinks, & service. The karma korma & the garlic naan are my favorite.   *Also, if you a dessert person you have to try the gulab jamun.

lI787VmQyLaUXhmY-PTkmA.text: Delicious, high quality Indian food with great ambiance.   I could eat here once a week

0nWglXF6oyyi_An_KMQ8mg.text: About the most Authentic and Consistent Indian food u r going to find in Vegas. This place is always busy hence the customer service issues.  Curries here are fantastic. Buffet is best value in town but A la Carte Diner is way better. If u r going on week end make a reservation  otherwise u could be waiting long however the food will be worth the wait

h2VWeNBrYIu1zsNeZS6KZQ.text: This place wasn't Mint when I originally reviewed it so it isn't fair that they get the reviews grandfathered to them when this business was called "Himalayan something something".    Decent buffet.  4 stars if you eat meat but 3 if you don't.  They do offer a few unique dishes I don't see at any other Indian buffet like their version of lo mein, chaat and 3 kinds of naan and soup.  I just prefer the overall selection a little more at other places.

qiaetM07VeqPdopoLXT6ow.text: This place has amazing Indian food but the restaurant tried scamming me on my credit card. My bill was $59 and change and I was pretty generous with the tip. Left a $12 cash tip. The day after I looked on my credit card statement they gave them selfs an extra $12 tip and I was over charged even after giving them a generous tip.  So I called Mint Indian Bistro told them about my situation and was told that I would be refunded what I was over charged its been over 5days now and I still haven't seen what was over charged back on my credit card. I'm glad I checked my statements and I wonder how often this happens to other guests that dine at this place.

PFoRi8phqqVF00biue2H3A.text: One of the best Indian food experiences I've ever had. We started with the veggie momo (dumplings). Based on the level of saltiness I'm pretty sure they came out of a package but I appreciated they were steamed and not fried. The chutney that came with them for dipping certainly upstaged their flaws as did the courses to follow. We ordered a couple different variations on naan (bread) and they were hot and delicious, obviously right out of the oven. I ordered the chicken curry and the bread came in very handy to soak up all the sauce. I'm not sure what my friend ordered but it was wonderfully sweet, savory and spicy. The kind of heat that creeps up on you and makes you want to eat more of it.  The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive, they had a good selection of Indian beer. One thing I noticed was how cleverly the food descriptions were written on the menu. The imaginative and vibrant language made it difficult to decide what to order because everything sounded amazing!  If you'd like to venture off the strip for something exotic I'd recommend this restaurant.

LGioh07KnzLXUPWIQmj2UQ.text: My friend took me here for the buffet the parking was tough and it doesn't look like much from the outside. Once we got inside I was surprised to see how comfortable, clean and how friendly the employees were. I can see why it's tough to park everyone wants to eat here. The food was so fresh and delicious, the price is right too! They have the buffet 7 days a week at the same price, that is impressive. I told my friends, my one friend took her husband and two sons (middle school) she said, they all enjoyed it very much. Great find!

ZgeVU_ONzV5mUHwbBWObNg.text: I loved this place.  Very clean, great service and great food.  I have never had Indian food before so I was not sure what the items were or their taste.  The waiter was extremely helpful, pulled out his tablet and showed me pictures of the items I had questions on and explained them to me.  I have an allergy to onions so he was quick to show me the items that I could not eat.  I would recommend this restaurant to my friends and I would of course eat here again.    Also, we had a larger party (7) so I made reservations and our table was ready when we arrived at the time given.

8mDocwJ690tsdKcYg-DQfg.text: Almost hate to review this place because I don't want it to get too busy! Love the lunch buffet and have been so many times, never disappoints. Only negative is the parking lot is tiny and always crowded.

vS-1KE81byc82Fx5-sGBcg.text: I am utterly addicted to their lunch buffet. The food is fantastic, and the servers are very polite and professional. I love this place to death.

P0Ceak3ywxU45OIfkN5wvg.text: My husband I were craving Indian food and we decided to try out this spot. We ate at the AYCE for lunch and it was ok. The food tasted like it had been sitting out for a while...but we were there at 2:00pm. I felt like most other Indian places have more of a variety for their AYCE than this one. Like I said, the food was ok...but there are other restaurants in Vegas that are much better.

EVhtSLDiuo04AdWAu6kb1A.text: The restaurant has a wonderful ambiance, and great service. We had the Vegetarian Gluten-free Prix Fixe. Delish.

cHRG_MLYTGFCI4vq3iOCTQ.text: Food was great, but the naan was soggy and greasy. I loved the grilled shrimp. Tucked away in a scary strip mall yet close to the dreaded strip. I look forward to eating here again

9_VyJKSjbOsur_A9aDIzlg.text: In looking at the reviews on Mint; I had my expectations set very high when walking into this small resturant. They were quite busy when we arrived after 8pm on a Saturday night, but the wait wasn't too long, though there wasn't a place to sit down inside (it was a cold night in Vegas). You'll see that I frequent Indian restaurants fairly regularly wherever I travel, so I know what I like and how it compares to other establishments.   My family and I decided to go with the Chef's Northern India tasting menu and were given a plethora of different dishes, though with smaller than normal portions. We all enjoyed the pakora (they called them pakodas) and again thought we were in for the best Indian meal in a long time. That being said, the lamb vindaloo was rather skimpy on the lamb (and it was tougher than it should have been), the chicken tikka masala had great flavor; but was more masala than chicken, and the daal was good, but just a tad undercooked. I was also disappointed when I asked for a "6-7 spicy" I received something more like a 2 or 3. They do have something they call Inferno chili sauce, but I thought my dishes came from a very universal pot that's geared to less spice (and flavor). As other reviewers have noted, their naan bread is excellent. Service was satisfactory, but I never felt like I was being "served" meaning it was more obligatory than driven.   All in all, a good Indian meal, though I have had better for less money.

h3O6pBI2AiEHtj6d6ao1Eg.text: Authentic and fresh Indian food. You can't go wrong. Service is good and courteous. Loved the roti, sambar and gulab jamun.

FHU8EYtwfA15cKZlgck3mQ.text: I've just turned Vegan and I am still figuring out what to eat. A friend and I split the Vegan Prix-Fixe dinner. It was just wonderful. I never knew eating Vegan could be this good. I look forward to my next visit to Las Vegas. I will definitely come back to Mint Indian Bistro.

sbgiU7frCsT9erTX4zzHDQ.text: After a long day at a convention at the Las Vegas Convention Center, my husband and I we looking for a nearby restaurant off-the-Strip (we needed to decompress from an excited, yet stressful day).  Fortunately, we found Mint Indian Bistro, a mile south of the LVCC.  We shared the Indian Sampler (around $30), which was incredibly flavorful and delicious.  Our friendly servers, Rajeev and Biru (who are from Nepal), gave us a lesson on the similarities and differences between Nepalese and Indian cuisines...something we found intriguing!  When we're traveling, we typically like to try different restaurants during our stay.  However, we made an exception and came back to try Mint Indian Bistro's all-you-can-eat buffet the next day...Rajeev's and Biru's hospitality coupled with the food we enjoyed made that an easy choice.  When I return to Vegas, I'll definitely come back to Mint Indian Bistro! :-)

Pz0ArTeyXTeIOyMdBVLW9A.text: I am a biryani lover.  Was trying to get good biryani in Las Vegas.  Tried couple of  Indian restaurants and none met the standards.  And biryani from this restaurant will go to bottom line..even the rice is not upto the standards looks like they are using Chinese rice and the biryani mix is worst.

8CJgmDY8p3dkV6wXtnOxWw.text: Food was great and love how easy the menu is for vegetarian/ vegans- Amazing!

Gs1SBQ5HyIUCvomYCMY-uw.text: I usually find the food in Las Vegas not very good.  (I am an outsider).  My only experiences have been on the strip, so please don't think this is a blanket statement about the entire area.  But, on and around the strip I have generally found the food sub-par and relatively expensive. I don't doubt some of the food is excellent, but I don't want to pay Morton's prices just to get high quality foods.    Thank you yelp.  Without which I would not have discovered Mint Indian Bistro.!  Excellent service with good prices.  We asked for our server's recommendations on a $25 entree budget (for two people).  We had more than enough food and were very happy with the quality and subtle flavors and spices. Also, typically Indian food leaves my digestive track in lurches afterwards.  Not so here.  A great reasonable dinner just off the strip.

msoZWWjqI0Maj_Bl1HcvDg.text: I ordered take-out from here not too long ago and I will NEVER go back. I don't know who does the cooking but they need to stop immediately!!!  We ordered the Chicken Kadhai, Vertical Vindaloo (with chicken) and Boneless Lamb Kabobs. The chicken dishes were both excessively oily and god only knows what part of the chicken they used. I specifically asked for breast meat and that I would even pay a few extra $$ for it. The guy said no problem. I came home and opened the containers and saw this dark, muscle-ridden meat sitting in front of me. Both chicken dishes looked exactly the same even though they're supposedly 2 different styles. The kabobs were HORRIBLE. Huge pieces of lamb that were nowhere near tender.   To top it all off, it was $60 for 3 dishes, some naan and rice. I will never visit this place again! I can make better Indian dishes at home!

rHAw8TaQe4kYEx_uaAkxug.text: I recently tried the lunch buffet there, and it was alright.  You could tell some dishes weren't freshly made and the chicken was also bit dry.  I also felt there weren't enough selection also.  Service was great though.

VbMbm3_6Xdztm8fAFhLSfQ.text: This restraunt provided a less than mediocre expereience on New Year Eve.  There were long hairs in the noodles and the desert smelt like 10days old.  Donot get there and be cheated.  I'm not aware of better Indian restaurant's ,but certainly this one is hopeless

-Oy8QLrF5BthME4GYmVwFw.text: My BF and I were looking for a place a tad more upscale than getting the concierge service at the penny slots at El Cortez--and Yelp led us to a veggie-friendly eating place with a touch of class the was not on the godforsaken strip. We both love Indian food, so Mint seemed like the right choice.   I was first pleased to see that we were the only folks there that didn't appear to be of Indian ancestry, my personal good sign indicator for ethnic fooderies. I was also pleased to see that it was pretty packed, but there was no wait to be seated. The decor was simple and elegant, with lots of blond wood and high backed booths.   Service was spectacular, we had at least 5 very attentive and polite servers. They kept us up to date on the progress of each course, made sure our water was cold and plentiful, and inquired about our enjoyment.   The menu was extensive, with both Himyl and Indian dishes. There was a lot of creativity involved, but the old standbys were also delish. I also liked that the menu let diners know what was veggie/vegan friendly.** Say yes to the samosas my friends. They are the best I have had.** All dishes were at a fair price, and I really liked that you could order half-dishes at a reduced cost. This was especially important when you have no microwave in your hotel, and you were taught not to waste food. Me and the BF were really pleased with our dishes, and two half plate entrees were more than enough food to share and be stuffed--but not too stuffed due to the half portions. I may also have to mention that they serve Frambois, and I would cut someone to have that delicious fizzy nectar.   This is the place that inspired me to Yelp. I knew after seeing a Yelp approved sticker in the window, that these reviews actually make an impact. Yelpers, you got gooooood taste.  So, thank you fellow Yelpers on leading us here, and thanks Mint for being so rad.

cE0uoqQmC81kvA-92svDCQ.text: We went for a sit down dinner, and I was completely satisfied with my experience. Ordered the malai kofta and the chicken tikka masala which both tasted very good. The naan was also very good, maybe a little fluffier in shape as opposed to flat like I am used to, but delicious. This is the best indian food I have had in town so far. Also, the interior of the place is beatiful, lit romantically and well decorated. I will go back for the lunch buffet next time. The service was good and we did not have to wait long to get our food. Dinner portions might be small to some people, i thought it was plenty of food though.

rpMBKo0Qyah6Cmrw-bUxGg.text: This place has the best food that I have tasted in a long time. I love spices and the combinations are the best from 1-10 let's me decide depending on my taste buds. My fav on the menu is the Andhra Curry with shrimp. Every time I visit Vegas...this is one of my stops before returning home.

WIjIGkjyJilT3obGzUkecA.text: It was kind of freaky walking in at 7:40pm to an empty restaurant, but we braved it and stayed.  And it was wonderfully yummy!  Like Sara M., I also thought our waiter was being kind of rude playing with his phone when he approached our table to take our order, but I realized he was using his phone for ordering, what a cute little trick.  I'm glad I refrained from scolding him before I knew what he was doing, because I know you NEVER want to piss off your waiter BEFORE you get your food.    We had the normal stuff--garlic naan, saag paneer, and chicken tikka masala and a large Kingfisher.  All was so great, we are looking forward to coming back next year.  The only disappointment was that the naan was not part of the meal, we had to order it separately, and they gave us a double order because we both said naan.  We ate lots of naan.  'Erp.  And the restaurant did get busier, 3 more tables walked in after us.  It was a Monday, after all.   Service was EXTREMELY polite as well.    We hope to see you next year, Mint!  (so please don't close.)

IMAAARSUk3qFCYabp5lj-A.text: Food was ok.  I had ordered Chicken Tikka requested it to be spicy.  What came back was less than mediocre and not even spicy or tender.  Service was very poor, it seemed that the staff is quite unorganized.  Three stars is being overtly generous.

9wlHSc502cE6_i65kwXUbw.text: Super yummy. Twice in the past week I'm reluctant although giving such a high rating because it is a small place and I don't want to make it so I can't get a seat for lunch now

6jC7NUQkykKFHTFL8gsq6w.text: Great lunch buffet of authentic Indian food!!  Although the restaurant looks unassuming from the outside, the interior is contemporary and the waiters are attentive and friendly.

wu-GpzVr02ATOZtputSn4g.text: Really delicious Indian food and good service.  Some of the best saag I've had in a while and chicken tikka masala had a rich hearty sauce.  Will definitely go back.

H4JMOe06_ZQd2Fv_0j2YhA.text: I enjoyed dinner here a lot - the service was outstanding with lots of suggestions and guidance. I ordered the mango chicken - "how spicy on a scale of 1 to 10...", asked our waiter, "...10 being a volcano and 1 being a babbling brook!" I ummm and then ordered 7. That was a modestly spicy curry with a sweet tang to it just as promised. The  stuffed paratha has some potato and peas, but not enough for my Indian colleague's liking ;).  This place is also a hidden gem for beer. The beer menu is extensive, but there were also an additional 15 beers recently added! "Take a look before you choose", said our waiter as he pointed to the table with 20 beer bottles on. So I did. And came back with a pint bottle of Belgian lager. Very nice with my mango chicken.  Try this place. I didn't try the buffet. All in all, the portions are good - my colleague and I shared the curry and rice and we had paratha each. I had a beer too and the bill was $38 incl tip. The decor isn't as nice as the Nepalese place in Pasadena, CA, but it's pleasant enough.   Our taxi driver didn't know the name of this place but he'd seen it. But, considering Vegas isn't necessarily a place of culture it's no bad thing if Himalayan is a little obscure and off the beaten track.

KCaS6krJcviLsxJRo2TNTg.text: My fave spot! We love their buffet options. They cater to your needs and service was superb. I have yet to try their DOSA Buffet on Sundays. Maybe soon!

qnKtyzVoRO3MCno-YChq_g.text: met up with a friend for lunch. its been a while since ive been here but the buffet is still really good. $11 or $12, i dont remember. they had mint chutney! very good stuff. not spicy though. they had an interesting basmati rice with cashews, dried cranberries, and other stuff. it was pretty good. never had anything like that before. all of their curries were excellent. i really liked the mutton on bone the most. the tandoori chicken was a little dry, but it usually is. lunch had just started so everything was fresh. last time i ate here i dunno if i ate too much but i had really bad food coma. this time i had 3 plates but feel good. maybe its the waiters thick indian accent that makes the food taste better at mint, but this place is definitely one of the better places to get inidian food in town. youtube.com/watch?v=tNwX...

FGKwsVZJEaZwPnrdLsFgyA.text: I think this is one of the greatest Indian restaurants in Vegas. I end up eating here all three dinners while we were in Vegas. This place has extensive menu. Most Indian restaurants I have been to, with extensive menu items are not so great. Once, we ordered lamb chops, fried idli, biryani, chicken kadai, different types of parathas, various lassis, vegetarian grill stuff, etc. We didn't leave a peace :). We just liked all the items. Last but not the least, the staff are also courteous.

7XZWGLAL7BBEoRZ0EmEV-g.text: Love the gluten free designations on the lunch buffet.  Pleasant, friendly and competent service, too.  Highly recommended as a close to UNLV and DRI lunch location.  And it appears widely approved of by the Indian community in town, too.  But be warned, it's tiny.  And most tables are booths, so if you're a 1 top, you're taking up too many seats, if you're 2, you're still a table hog... Best for groups of 3 and 4.

hrrDqxPyjH_jvIgU3OHL4w.text: Normally I hate buffets, but I am going to eat here regularly. They are constantly bringing out fresh food so the food hasn't been sitting there long. It was very tasty and the price was very fair. I am a local, but my European friends showed me this little gem . As vegas tourists for ten years they seem to have found all the best places.

OACUZqpjZuCoRxqblWnKeQ.text: "We are easy on salt". The worst thing ever heardfrom a restaurant manager when complained that the food had no salt in it. I know it's a 4 star rated restaurant but its been more favored for family friends than new customers. Don't ever go during rush hours. They say they have indo Chinese fusion food.  Don't order any Chinese dish as it has no salt in it and the restaurant manner instead of apologizing say that they are easy on salt. I will never ever go back to this restaurant. This is my personal experience.

8xCbXBsHwvfsvbumcOFqdw.text: First time here, had samosas, vertical vindaloo with boneless lamb, cool raita & a strawberry lassi. Everything was delicious, hot, pleasantly spiced not too spicy, I could have had spicier but not necessary. I also had garlic naan which wasn't crazy good buy delicious nonetheless. I want to come here for the lunch sometime when I'm free, it really is outstanding.

Gq62RehD0WKNnHcfUzWziQ.text: Very good Indian food.  Nann was thin and delicious.  Might just be my favorite Indian restaurant.

1hhYAllZG9E56y6awWw57w.text: My husband and I have been to several Indian restaurants in Vegas, and this one is our favorite.  We drive all the way to Mint from Summerlin b/c the closer Indian places just don't make food as good as Mint does.  Restaurant is clean, simple decor, staff is nice, and you can't beat the $9.99 lunch buffet they offer.  Buffet isn't huge, but does offer enough delicious choices to be satisfied.  Also comes with Naan.  I'm especially a fan of the Chicken Tikka Masala...it's my favorite Indian dish and they know how to make it right here.  Definitely check them out when you're in the mood for a good Indian meal.

FYouSqt6l1jdt6oYiQsHFg.text: Believe the 200+ reviews hype. In the words of Nike "just do it". I'm definitely doing it again that's for sure. Fresh, delicious, Indian food for the lunch buffet.  Worth the wait. As you're seated they bring you fresh made naan of your choice, buffet line has vegetarian entrees along with chicken and goat. Mmmm mmmm good!

eEKKMtCRXva4oX24lP2UTw.text: Overall: Great Indian food at a reasonable price.  My boyfriend and I had a hankering for Indian food the last time we were in Vegas and with all the good reviews on Yelp we decided to try the Indian Mint Bistro.  When we placed our order the server was playing with his iPhone while taking our drink orders. I thought this was a bit rude but he explained that they have an app to place orders. Pretty cool. We started off with a salty mango lassi which was delicious.  For our main course we ordered the Indian Sampler ($30.99) that featured garlic naan, veg pakodas, chicken tikka masala, lamb vindaloo, tandoori chicken, mixed veg curry, lentils, yogurt, rice, and a milky rice pudding (khir). We liked the idea of having a little taste of everything and boy did we! The food was outstanding, but the servings were kind of small. I was satisfied, but my boyfriend could have eaten more. They did bring out more rice when they saw we were getting low.    Tip: They also serve Halal meats and they will call a cab for you when your meal is over.

o6mtDViIFDgwxxyH3E7XPQ.text: This place is probably hands down the best Indian food I've had in Las Vegas.  I like rich and spicy flavors, and this place delivers the goods.  I've been looking for an Indian restaurant that would get on my level of spice, so i'm glad I found it here. The Rebel Curry and Rogan Josh are a hit in my book.   Cons:  Parking can be a squeeze at times.  Customer service could use some improvement.

d06JhtF5JYFwZlSugHjAwg.text: This was officially my first time eating legit Indian food. The first time I had it was a week prior but it was buffet style so it doesn't count! I had taken my Indian friend so he could order everything for me haha We ordered four different types of curry - korma, one with lamb, one with butter chicken, and the last one was green lol they were all really good but my personal favorite was the korma - sooo goooooddd :p We had also gotten garlic naan. It was good and all but I needed my rice, so I got rice haha The last thing we had gotten was tandoori chicken. I had asked around and I was told that this is the thing to get! It was a litte dry for me so I ended up dipping and rolling the chicken around in the korma curry. The portions were big! OH! all this food was for six people haha I plan on coming again. And the big plus is that I did not smell like Indian food when I left which is a really really big plus! They also have a selection of beer that's different - I didn't get to try it this time since im on an alcohol cleanse haha

fRVkmyw63PEMhIF_2waakQ.text: We went for lunch buffet. Spread was ok, and taste was ok. Taste was little bland. For $15 buffet, food was not up-to mark, wont go again.

GtyU8aJzTFCBfNyjJMD04Q.text: I love this place. They have so many different variety of Indian food. Pretty much every cuisine from all around the india is available there. Every time I visit Vegas, I go there at least once.

P-jveNthtnO3XaGrvqRupQ.text: Food was delicious. So far the best tasty food in Vegas.  We ordered dinner for two non-veggie option.  Definitely we will come again.

4_9TDcy01ddxcyniFiUJkg.text: In the last month or so I've visited Vegas three times for various occasions. Two of the three times I stayed at the Westin, about a mile away from Mint. The first time I went with my partner, her sister and mom. It was a Saturday evening, so this place was jamming. Being vegetarians we went for an all vegan dinner, delicious. Started with a few papadums with wonderfully flavored chutneys, and we ordered the Chana Masala, Aloo gobi, and the Karma Korma and roti. The vegan Korma was the ultimate favorite! Although service was a little slow, that wasn't enough to deter my partner and I from coming back the following weekend. Rather than dine in, however, I ordered online and picked it up. You guessed it, we had the Korma, and samosas with roti. The food was packaged amazingly, and tasted just as good. Our last visit happened fairly recently, this time we had to commute twenty minutes, so we opted to dine in. This time we showed up around 9pm. Busy, but not too busy. Rest assured, they were packed within fifteen minutes of our being there. Since we don't live in Vegas, and cannot frequent weekly, we had to order the...Korma! Had the papadum, and ordered onion and cilantro paratha  - so good! We kicked the spice to about a seven, and that definitely had us sweating. But once again, the food was exceptional, service consistent, and friendly staff. This is a staple for anyone looking for some really good Indian food. They cater to vegetarians, vegans and omnivores, what's not to like!

z7l1ODlNXqJtT9tHpbM89Q.text: An average quality buffet. Since I have tasted buffet in many Indian restaurants, I felt either number items or taste of items were not that great. I will not go there again.

0LIAmNZ_AUVDS5f5XfHLrQ.text: Horrible food.  They need to change their chef or spice up a little bit.   If you are an Indian restaurant you should cater India and not just one part of Indian community.   Will not come back here. FOOD WAS NOT INDIAN STANDARD.

XxppTDZoLcQZ96gAehpmpQ.text: This place was delicious!! So many different options and geographically oriented delish dishes - they actually STUFF their naan here too. Julia was our waitress and was awesome and very helpful and patient while her and my wife waited for me to go through the entire menu. Rest of the staff were nice too!

prw9-Kc2mRJQ4xEBehwINA.text: I thought this place was delicious as far as Indian food places go. The garlic naan was especially good and so was the Tikka Marsala. Our server was very prompt and friendly. The buffet was a bit on the spendy side but it was excellent food. I would return here again.

ObaWNJeReVQ0Yxtiqd7nCw.text: The lunch buffet has a lot of variety. You may have to sign up and wait in queue during peak hours. We had to wait for about 30 mins when we reached around 2 pm.

q3H-dLc2GmkdeuH0UwMgsQ.text: You will not find better Indian cuisine in Las Vegas! The masala , samosa and vindaloo were amazing.

7XYoMFlT0fZT6zNS3YCXdQ.text: Needs to be more indian for claiming to be indian  1) atithi devo bhav that may be an old saying but customer is the one who make a business profitable keeps it running amd makes it success  2) lemon rice is not masala rice adding tons of spices dont make it indian Each dish has an individual balance of spices which gives it an identity  3) courtesy comes first in hospitality. Lets have managers who manage not boss  Lets just keep it to mint spicy bistro with no essence.

PgUVmsUqPWstOinlIsjQmQ.text: The service is very good and the food also taste very good. Place looks good too. I went to buffet along with two friends and they too liked the food. The price is very affordable.Idli was very food. overall satisfied with the taste. And at last gulab jamun(dessert) gives good finish to meal.

LOPBY9JCt74i1pRNtTuI9g.text: Excellent Indian food.  Worth going to whenever in Vegas.  There's a reason there's a wait to get in.  I've had the lunch buffet in the past and that is good too, large selection of entrees.  Dinner was exceptional as well.  True authentic Indian food, just wish the restaurant was a little bigger.

7EvQ9C6XxMGEN7x4nM1ftQ.text: Perfect for the Indian buffet in Las Vegas , good value for money. Friendly staff. Buffet is open till 4 pm

Nc8KLxUBkQMpWLnNtiFGfw.text: Very friendly owner and workers.  Always quick to refill drinks and the food is good for a great price.

1WsAtvp3dGUvAe7MK91B3g.text: This is my favorite place to eat. I adore the tiki Marsala paneer. My husband always gets the spinach saag with chicken. The staff are always helpful and friendly. We come here enough they recognize us. I I love that I always have enough to take home and have some the next day as well.

6AuNU12Aj7ZUFcoXaxArcA.text: Ambience was good and buffet had a good variety. One of the finest indian cuisine in Vegas.

BfHgTRe5lxAPZX2Pa17y1A.text: What better way to try different dishes than a buffet.    I was finally able to convince my husband to try Indian food.  The lunch buffet was a decent price so let's go.  It's located in a small strip mall off of Flamingo.  Parking here is tight and very few spaces.  The dining area itself is very clean.  The buffet area was also kept tidy and presentable.  Service was good with very polite employees.   Since spicy food is right up the hubs alley, he liked the Chicken Chilli.  This dish is listed on their fusion items.  Very spicy loaded with chilies, green peppers and onions with soy sauce and Indian spices.  I tried a variety of their vegetarian options which I enjoyed! Of course you do have your choice of naan bread that is made there in house.  Fluffy with butter and garlic made this my favorite.   But Let's call it how it is,... A buffet is a buffet.  This one is small and not the best I've ever had.  Just ok in my book.

ySt_lPvnKKS2V_9QbbLa-Q.text: Food was ok would have expected more flavor. Service was ok too the person who took the order was nice however the person serving the food was not so nice. He basically slammed the food on the table.

HACYk-MD15tKtxKgcF24xA.text: I come here every time I'm in town and always bring new friends who leave very happy.  The various nan are always fresh and hot. The lunch buffet is well stocked and has something for everyone and great value.  Parking  in retail plex is not very welcoming but don't let it stop you.

-ezWS3S13mMI7I52QKc62g.text: This is my very favorite Indian restaurant in town. I have dined at this location since it opened on the west side, but have been a happy customer since I moved to Vegas in 2009 at its original location on Flamingo.  At Mint you can expect all your food to be hand prepared, even the appetizers like samosas (fried potato & pea dumplings in a pyramid shape - also available in meat) which are often the pre-made  frozen variety served at many other Indian restaurants. Over the years I've tried a wide range of their dishes, had some of the most delicious meals of my life, and never been dissatisfied. The recipies they use have the incredible, rich depth of flavor & myriad spices Indian food is known for, without being too heavy handed or allowing one flavor to over power the others (I'm looking at you cinnamon).  You can also pick your heat level from mild to ridiculously hot for most dishes, so it's okay those who can't handle too spicy a meal. There is also an inferno section in the menu that requires a waiver & rewards you with a photo on their wall of fame if that's your thing.  I've even taken people there who previously didn't enjoy Indian food, and Mint changed their minds. There are options for vegetarians, vegans, omnivores, and carnivores alike.If you only eat brown, white, or beige foods, this may not be for you, but It's a challenge for me to go & not order a table full of food.  The west side location is bigger & has a room for large parties, they have a much more open & accessible lunch buffet, and they have a pour your own beer by the oz. station, which is pretty awesome. The east side is a more intimate setting. It's location close to this strip means it can fill up quickly during peak hours. Both have daily lunch buffets which are very reasonably priced & delicious. If not *entirely* as amazing as the made-to-order dinner version the buffet is a great way to try a lot of different things if you're new to the realm of Indian cuisine, are short on time (dinner service takes significantly longer), or just like variety at at great price. I'm not much for buffets, but this is one I enjoy.  Here's (only) a few dishes I like to order:  Garlic butter naan: I love garlic, bread, and butter, so this is a no-brainer. It's an oven baked flat bread with crispy edges & a chewy center. I usually order an extra batch to take home.  Tikka Masala: I consider this a gateway Indian dish. It's a creamy, tomato based dish that can be made incredibly mild if desired. Like many dishes at mint, it offers multiple varieties including vegan & vegetarian options. My favorite is with chicken breast (not readily available at other similarly priced Indian restaurants).  Black Dal (Lentils): This dish reminds me a little bit of southern red beans & rice. It's creamy and satisfying.  Mighty Momo: These are little dumplings of joy! Chicken or veggie dumplings with a cashew based sauce. Almost every time I go, they are out of these (so popular darn it!), so they are a special treat when available.  Chilli Chicken: Do you like spicy chicken covered in a sweet, tangy sauce? Than this dish is for you. Also available in cauliflower if meat isn't your thing.  These are just some of my favorites, but they offer a wide variety of dishes from all different regions of the country.   Dinner service can take a while, especially when they are very busy. Don't expect to be waited on hand & foot, or to have the food fly out of the kitchen like you're at (cr)Applebee's.   Mint Indian Bistro is possibly my favorite affordable but still amazing restaurant of all time. Their quality & meat preparation techniques suit me (I am pretty picky about meat, especially in dishes using the whole animal in a pot... I may occasionally consume offal, but for the most part I don't want to know about it). They fact that they are usually busy and full of Indian families is evidence of its authenticy & excellence. I love this place!

WQeDmyofwk6H3HhKz1d2TA.text: I'd say this is the best Indian restaurant in vegas. Delicious food, good service, nice and classy ambience. I am actually feeling hungry as I write this review and scroll through the food pictures.   Highly recommend their dosas, we had the mysore masala dosa and it was really good. The chutneys and potato sabji with it were also very good. Schezwan fried rice was pretty good, it tasted more like veg fried rice and had more room for the schezwan sauce, but it was still delicious. Masala papad was tasty and "chatpata" like you would get in India. Pav bhaji and bhel puri were alright. The pav were not the bombay pav and just burger buns, bhaji was good but not the best. Bhel puri was a little sad, it could have had some onion/tomato/chilli/cilantro. The chutneys were very tangy and yummy though and my mouth is watering as am thinking about it. I really really wanted to try momos but they weren't going to make them that day. Momos is really a thing in the Indian restaurants of vegas, I haven't seen them anywhere else in US.   Service was slow but the servers were friendly and nice. We enjoyed our evening.

BlhZurEiBmov062W3CRW-A.text: The good: great food. Authentic Indian with very well balance flavors. From the samosas to the tika masala and the maharajah, very nicely done. I could eat buckets of those dishes. I was kinda disappointed that they did not have most of their desserts; I really needed some sweets but they had none at that time so it was sad a bit, but the main dishes definitely made up for that.  The bad: service. We were seated in 2 minutes from when we walked in. Restaurant was empty, except for two more tables. It took 35 minutes for someone to come and ask for our drink orders, and by that time, we were ready to order food. It took another 45 minutes to get our food to the table. 5 minutes after our food was served, someone came by to ask how it is, but apart from that no one else came to refill our waters or anything else. It was really disappointing because the food was soooooo good only to be letdown by poor service. Maybe to go next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maharajah Masala
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan

6i4WwaISRmMp66e_jSqzaQ.text: Mint Indian is delicious! It's a perfect spot after being at UNLV as it's right down the street. The lunch buffet is amazing with so much variety and desserts. The dinner menu is massive and they're open late! It's the perfect hangout spot. Ive never had a bad experience here and I would recommend it to all my friends. My go to meal is chicken tikka masala with a spice level of 7.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Maharaja Tikka Masala

ZbgL18UpfiZ_m2cgH1lJ7A.text: This is one place you must check out if you are craving Indian food! They offer a lunch buffet from 11:30am to 3:00pm. We came around 5pm for dinner and were seated quickly. The interior is nicely decorated and clean throughout. They have a inferno wall of fame challenge that you can win a $50 gift card if you complete it and have your picture on the wall. I will be back to try the challenge since I love spicy food.   We ordered butter Naan, topped with fire roasted garlic, Naan makhani, mango lasso, mahakali mango masala with chicken breast, and maharaja tikka masala with butter chicken. The Naan makhani (9/10) is a must try! It was so good that we devour it in seconds. The makhani dipping sauce compliment the Naan bread, it was so good that my friends were fighting to get the last bit of the dipping sauce. The Naan with garlic (7/10) was good too, it had just the right around of garlic. The mango masala (9/10) came with a side of rice and it blew our mind. We couldn't get enough of the sauce that came with it. It came in a pretty small bowl size so we were trying to scrape every little bit off the bowl. The tikka masala (8/10) was good too and enjoyed the mango lassi (8/10). It's a mango yogurt slushie drink.   Overall, we really enjoyed the whole experience. The service was great and the food was phenomenal. We decided we will come back to try their lunch buffet in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naan makhani
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naan Bread with fire roasted garlier
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maharaja Tikka Masala

OxMWx8BrVCDuKzWwbWoV6g.text: I've lived 27 years and have never experienced an Indian restaurant before. How I can call myself a foodie without experiencing this, I'm not sure but today that changed!   I came for lunch and was promptly sat at a clean table and was told their lunch is served buffet style. After ordering drinks, we went up to the line and I wasn't disappointed with the amount of choices there were on the line. Everything that I put on my plate was hot and full of flavor. A few of the items were too spicy for my liking (I'd say a 6/10 on a scale) and I couldn't bring myself to finish them since I felt like I was on fire! Didn't get anything for dessert, but will definitely come back and try everything next time.

td_Lpsxo_KSJLoCAT_WhmQ.text: I have been here for dinner and the lunch buffet. I recommend the buffet for it is reasonably priced for delicious food. The lunch buffet has a great variety even if you are vegetarian. I recommend the mango curry (sweet yet savory) and the mango lassi, which is extra creamy! If you are a UNLV student, you also get a small discount with your ID.

Zt25u0htCpiT50SaDPXToA.text: Wow what a great lunch buffet. I am REALLY impressed wish the selection and quality of food. Customer service was excellent. Beautiful restaurant.

XV0U00cNSb_uVRInvwsv-A.text: I want to give a 3.5/5 but that doesn't work so rounding to 4 Came here to try the buffet. Tbh. The food isn't the best, but it's not bad either. Some of the dishes that we tried in the buffet were good  Things I liked : Mango custard Gulab jamun Chicken Chettinad Veg pakoras  No no for me: Chicken tandoori Noodles

6hCwj-hZs8oZeoUIxLEIiQ.text: Wow. The service here was really great even though we went near closing time. The food was really tasty. I got the handi biryani with lamb, maharaja tikka masala, mango chutney, garlic naan, and lamb kabob. Wasn't a fan of the lamb kabobs. They were very tough and had no flavor. However, the lamb in the biryani was to die for. Super tender it melted on the fork. The mango chutney didn't have that overwhelming taste of vinegar, it paired so well with everything because it was a subtle kick of flavor. Always my go to. If I could eat this everyday I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maharaja Tikka Masala

7e_WxhVhr5rz-e4tBO9Bsw.text: Been here before and it was amazing!!! Came back after a long while on my VEGAS trip and I'm not impressed. The food was bland and service not so great. We came for the lunch buffet. No water refills and the blonde server/cashier didn't even let me finish my question when I asked for bread saying "it's on it way ma'am! thank you!" In a snarky sarcastic tone. --as if she was annoyed.

jeDKInoMWab9A1Pu7FP7eg.text: Small Indian buffet restaurant, they have always been fairly busy when we went during week day lunch time, but they can always sit you with in 5-10 minutes . Decent price for all you can eat, they have lots of chicken and lamb masala options, different types of rice, and all can you eat garlic nan , the nans are absolutely delicious, but save some room to eat the chicken of course.  They also have about 3-4 different soup options too, the lentil soup was great had great flavors of herbs and spices. If you like exotic spices you should try this Indian food.  They also had the sweet dessert balls called gulab, some flour soaked in syrup, so good and chewy, proably super fattening but try it haha   You will also walk out of the place smelling like spices and herbs all day long on your clothes, kind of gross having to smell it all day but food is still great

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lj1k-TQiX6WBcZdMwrZ6Mg.text: Since I wrote about the bad change in chefs, it looks like things are back on track. I have been back two more times recently and everything was once again delicious.  Very glad they made the change.

_0GH3hOZJ-IISFI5QLfNMg.text: Ambience is 3 stars. Not great but not terrible. But the food is fantastic. Great mix of northern and southern dishes. If you want authentic, delicious Indian food this worth the trip. I had the chicken tikka masala and saffron cauliflower. Can't wait to go back

MwTY_HIvGjtOsOEIs8vJAw.text: Every time we are in Las Vegas we make it a point to eat here. The food taste and quality is great. If you dine in the service is great as well.

52I6SQ68C_47OYxzmvNpKA.text: Exceptional customer service.  I can't handle too spicy but they were accommodating to getting me the right spice option. Changed my mind on eating Indian food because now I want to try everything on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jQohbchZ7VUxreqcLDiADA.text: Delicious.  So glad I stumbled upon this place.  Had my first Dosa (excellent), the mango masala, puri rice, and nan.  Sooo happy with this experience.  Cute place, great service, all good.

EyycnFACjRaJqt5v4khfcA.text: WOW!  Another AYCE Indian buffet player in town!  Wish we had visited sooner!  We usually frequent another Indian buffet, but the wifey & I had the afternoon off so we took a little drive to Mint Indian Bistro for their lunch buffet!  We did not regret it!  So many flavors!  With a little bit of heat!  We hit the tail end of the lunch rush - so some of the items were pretty empty in the warming trays.  No hassle though, they were refilled promptly once I asked a server!  We almost had the buffet to ourselves so wifey & I went to town on those Indian eats!  Some of the standouts were:  -Vegetable Chau Chau -Chicken Tikka-Masala -Chicken Tandoori -Buttered Garlic Naan (we must have gone through 3 baskets LOL)  We tried a bit of everything they had on the buffet line!  Taste sensation galore!  Mint's Chicken Tikka-Masala is perfect for the 1st time Indian food eater - gateway to more of what India has to offer!  Sop that sauce up with some of that buttered garlic naan!  Delicious stuff!  Sorry KETO!  We've tried quite a bit of Chicken Tandoori in other Indian spots, but Mint actually makes one that wasn't too much on the dry side from being overcooked.  We liked the flavor on it as well, not too spicy!    Service was speedy, and our water and naan were easily refilled without hassle.  Price of Mint's lunch buffet it a great value as well, around $13 a person!  Overall a great buffet lunch, some great eats!  Mint Indian Bistro, we'll be back!  Maybe one day I'll take on that Inferno curry challenge hahaha!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RdCeZDrKjIwDTtA2pouVAQ.text: The best Indian  in town.  Both locations are great!  Rebel Curry.  Maharaja Chicken Tikka M.  Is smooooth.  Got a spice level 7-perfect.  All the spices, all the flavors.  This location has a great atmosphere!  One trip and we are now regulars!  Staff solid. Great experience!  Come here and you will be pleased  Came back for buffet.  Awesome food.  One problem was a waiter went in front of the restaurant and smoked.  All the smoke cane into the restaurant.  He should go further from the front door.  Ruined my appetite.  I do love the place was just disappointing.

DmiSwwJ8dsYMVtKUvdIwNQ.text: Loved the food there. We took the handi biriyani, chicken tikka and mango-chicken curry at a spice level of 7. It was purrrrfect! Would highly recommend

qYRXJOffYseyTkM09_YWKg.text: Finding Mint Indian Bistro is like finding an oasis in the desert. Where the oasis would be a really good Indian restaurant and the desert, well, is Las Vegas. My experiences are based on dinner and not the lunch buffet. Their staff is very accommodating here and are experienced in dealing with large families and groups with small children. On busy evenings, you can flag down any of their waitstaff for assistance. I've never made a reservation here and have not waited more than 15 minutes during my last few visits.   I love the extensive and almost daunting menu filled with northern and southern Indian dishes. We usually start off with some samosas and the Bhel Puri, which is an Indian snack food made of puffed rice. I always have to get garlic naan with my meals. The naan is an Indian flat bread that's served hot out of the oven and has a wonderful texture. The bread is great for sopping up the sweet curry sauce of their Tikka Masala. Another dish to try is the smoky and aromatic lamb dish called Rogan Josh. If you're adventurous, they have plenty of other delicious dishes to choose from and also serve vegetarian fare.

U9KEvz0ORVFFrRcanqhY-g.text: We went to the lunch buffet and the food was just all right in my opinion. Service wasn't  all that good we had to ask for our waters to be refilled because they never checked on us. Dinner may be better but i usually  prefer lunch.  So not my favorite indian food resturaunt but if i am back in vegas  again and want  indian id go back.

bWLojbCbqh9bLsPQecSGpQ.text: I tried many Indian restaurant they were average but this one has a very delicious food specially checkin masala. Love it

IaPRQ2q8Uiw5HnD6PsINXQ.text: Good selection of good items on their lunch buffet. Servers were attentive but not overwhelming. We had a large group of about 15 (we called several days ahead to let them know we were coming). They did a great job even when we requested split checks which they graciously accommodated :)  A good mix of mild and spicy items to choose from on the lunch buffet. And all is labeled including some suggestions for accompaniments. I will recommend this to coworkers who may want to try something different for lunch.

buAD44BuLXAP8yzI1VkGoA.text: Tasty food with right amount of spices, nice presentation, friendly staff and ambeince is good..  Goat curry, Andhra chicken, kavathi soup are worth tasting..  Must visit for authentic indian food

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oQFPY6_X_rvU6gUUJmp7FQ.text: Come here only if you have 2-3 hours to spare and are not hungry. The service is BAD!! The waiters seem to be lost and are just seen running around cluelessly. The food is decent, not great. W lost our appetite waiting for our drinks and food.

W0WRzJNOo5cht_wgxn6Pog.text: Paneer tikka masala was delicious, paneer was soft gravy mild kids can enjoy. Rice was home style garlic nan was very fresh crispy mouth watering. This is one of best Indian food in Vegas. Worth visiting

onr7LXg71jlTy0SNygRh7g.text: It is really good Indo chinese fusion food. I loved the starters. Biryani was great. However, the Schezwan Fried rice wasn't the greatest.

EAIDOpXcl9OWCY81-dQ5-g.text: This place is great. Rebel curry is amazing. Pakora is great. They will adjust  your spice level for you.

0T-31mad8iaMPNHeX4KAkQ.text: Very good, authentic North Indian food. High quality ingredients too. We ordered dal makhani, roti, Garlic naan, shrimp kabab and egg biryani. Everything was excellent except biryani which was just ok. Staff was quite friendly.  Will visit again.

x8EGuFKIcHjJQru3qApY6g.text: The service is terrible, food is OK. I was there on the weekend, they are supposed to serve warm nan, between the two of us, we were served 1 nan basket, had to wait a long time for a refill, while the intelligent waiters were supplying nan baskets at other tables where the clients had not even finished their earlier nan breads!.  The tandoori chicken was stale, odd sour taste, probably leftovers. The other stuff was quite OK, gulab jamuns were excellent. Sorry not going again to this place. The only reason they are still in business is because of their central location.  BTW, I am of Indian origin and I know Indian food.

BkFcr7FHm0kwweg2AyBt7g.text: Poor service, quite expensive, small portions and average food. Not going there again.

hLgZqm6WH3eNuk5oShIlRg.text: Located in a nice new strip mall. Nice decor & very clean inside. GREAT vegan & vegetarian menu options. Friendly & informed wait staff. Everyone gets a crispy cracker type bread called papadam served with 2 delightful dipping sauces. To start, we ordered Paratha stuffed with potatoes & peas & it was delicious! I ordered the Organic Aloo Gobi Masala (vegan) & my husband ordered the Andhra Curry, a South Indian Specialty...simply AWESOME! We asked for both spiced down to medium spice & it was perfect for us because we like a mild lingering spice. A Must Try off the strip in Vegas!!!
