KgidgGmtTzjsUTNybZ62lg.text: Drove from Los Angeles on the way to New York and decided to go on a Indian food tour of the states along the way. This place is a intimate one.

PEXSMwvq5srry0CJqSvzkg.text: We have been to vegas twice and tried almost a handful of Indian place.. Mint stands out for its not a cliche Indian restaurant, its different and the food is amazing here.. The next time we visit Vegas I m going to eat here more often!

8f0HlkfBM6XZeFrxU759pA.text: This is one of my favorite places!!! I def. Recommend going there if you're in Vegas.  The food is great, place is clean, and the staff is friendly.  We were not in walking distance from them so took a cab for around $11.00 and they called a cab for us when we were done so we could go back to the strip.  They are a 15-25 minute walk from the strip depending on pace.  If you're craving Indian-this was the only place I found it to be satisfying. I tried another restaurant on the strip-which I found to be okay- but not great. Mint was great!!! The harshest food critic in our family was satisfied which is hard to do.

yLspaGUqzm6CqJ_RYx1fow.text: A friend of mines recommened the place when I asked for a good desi resteraunt in las vegas. I wasnt aware it was an indian resteraunt when I called and asked if they served Nihari. The guy rudely told me it was an Indian resteraunt and said bye before I had a chance to say anything back. Pissed me off, and i defintely wont be dropping by tonight lol

ee6WC7LK6HIZjOnWEhWB4Q.text: Awesome food,,, vishal was great, different style, lassi bar is must to try,,,, inferno curry was a kill spicy,,  couldn't finish all, overall food was awesome,, would come here again n again....

Vws2y_hbrCYF0beHLFP0aQ.text: We travelled to Las Vegas for vacation and wanted to have a good Indian food and we had chosen  Mint Indian Bistro as it was rated very high in online. Our choice was the best! Food was served fast even being crowded. They had a wide variety of food selection for all age groups. We ordered the chettinad chicken curry, nan,sambhar idli and masala dosai. Food was delicious and tasted yummy. We visited again before we travelled back to our  home. Thank you Mint Indian Bistro! And thanks to  Raj who took care of us very well. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Las Vegas. Try Inferno curry or Briyani if you are ready for spicy challenge...

ZJRUgPV48OmAeLoH60XT3Q.text: Very accommodating staff.  They put me in an empty section just so I could avoid loud music and then checked on me frequently.  Food was good.

beCdhpywgVz1dtnliR8z3Q.text: If you want shitty Indian food then please come here. Worst restaurant i've been to. Please save yourself the trouble and don't come here. Im pretty sure all the reviews they have are fake.

oPSThJRJUaPM_hvA_oCeFw.text: This is the best place in vegas! We love the food, the staff, and the lunch buffet. We eat the lunch buffet on a regular basis and love getting to enjoy a good meal and talk with the staff. We go all the time... curry addicts!   Great options for all kind of diets and special needs. Vegan, vegetarian, meat lovers, etc.

3f32rxwtTSIb61b_qZOj_w.text: My husband and I wanted some good Indian food, and found this place on Yelp. Such a good find!! We were between this place and another highly rated one on Yelp, but ultimately decided to eat here because of the modern decor and fun atmosphere. We decided to get the Meal for Two that included the Tikka Masala and vegetable curry. The Tikka masala was to die for and some of the best we ever had. The meal for two was perfect! It came with two apps, and assortment of entrees and dessert. We will definitely eat here again!!! It didn't disappoint. You know you've found a great one when you are surrounded by locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner for two assorted entrees.

Z9cr7QODHVhTht3Cbr_FWQ.text: Way too slow in the service. However, the taste of the food is good. Reason for slow service is because everything is made fresh...

8SmGZUoEI3R-IdaoCOrltQ.text: I had the lunch buffet today (12-30-16). The selection is small, the food didn't seem to have as much flavor as other Indian restaurants that I've been to (I've mostly eaten Indian food in the Los Angeles area), the chicken tikka was dry and didn't have much flavor, cranberry rice was not hot, the water they served tasted like tap water, parking lot is very small. Service was mediocre, except for the guy who brought the bill. He was friendly.  On the positive side, the price is very reasonable and they give you as much bread as you want (as far as I can tell).

pEuBlXfuMjT9wmCvaQZcNw.text: I'm a huge fan of Mint, I've tried other Indian restaurants, but Mint seems to have the flavor down packed.  I gave them 3 stars instead of 5 because the service could be a lot better.  I know it's buffet style for lunch, but they tend to let your dirty dishes stack up and they take forever sometimes to bring the naan to your table.  The food is absolutely delicious, but the buffet isn't keeping it warm enough.  Either they are putting the food out luke warm or the warmers on the buffet line aren't heating up properly.  If they could get these two things going I'd definitely bump them up to 5 stars...

TiYljo1AV5HPVn9L-tGdug.text: A good selection for the buffet. The food is solid and the butter chicken was excellent. The overall setting is good.

f-VBqI9DxjHc8xRs6VzX8w.text: Hands down the best Indian food I've had in Vegas, and it might even be the best I've had in the U.S. Butter chicken is my go to dish on most days and I love that they give you the option of ordering it spicy "on a scale of 1 to 10". Tonight I ordered an "8", which was plenty hot and wonderfully flavorful. And because it's not the strip, but not too far away, it's a great reason to venture away from the touristy noise for a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Butter Chicken with a &#34;Level 8&#34; spice volume!

XvvxT4moD8YHdCP91nTlOg.text: Very nice food. Great to find our Indian taste in Vegas. The service was good as well. Overall, enjoyed the experience.

4Dg7ynG_W89D23d3F70uQA.text: Bad customer service here and people are super slow.  I asked the waiter to add one more item to our order and he said he doesn't know who our table helper is and simply left - without letting us know whether he added or not.  Secondly, it took an hour to get the order.  Overall super bad experience.

kJOitHFvuk6HSdwTzjxYUA.text: This is my favorite place in Las Vegas right now. It has some of the best and most fresh tasting food as well as an extremely welcoming and accommodating staff. I have had a positive experience EVERY time I have eaten there I have even tried their lunch buffet. I was a bit apprehensive about a buffet but, Mint did not disappoint. It was such a lovely collection of foods and I was totally satisfied.  I am getting hungry just thinking about how great everything is at Mint!

H_RBs4wsv_UgtvmZVUAjFQ.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in all of Las Vegas.  I have been there countless times and it is always phenominal.  I get spicy 10 and they do not hold back.  Fantastic samosas, chicken Tikka Masala.  Truly a wonderful place.

0LHtpB3qbiBtX0CMawF14w.text: I was hesitant to try Indian food because I had the impression in my head that it was all curry. I knew it's not and still couldn't shake it off...   But I have to say the food was great! We ordered a variety of things - garlic naan, tomato soup, potato samosas, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken and chicken biryani. Everything was very flavorful, unique and tasty. Personally I didn't like the biryani that much, reminded me of kids rice with tomato sauce. But my friends loved it so I guess it's just me.  We ordered a lot and left with leftovers that we took home. Don't order so much it may look small but it's a lot! Also the chicken dishes came with rice.   Service was good, the manager came to ask how's everything and my friend told him that the naan didn't have enough Garlic and salt, so he brought us more on the house. It was very nice of him.    I would recommend if you want Indian food.

phBnycrlRt2LJAUUlRR1Iw.text: The stinginess of the restaurant staff just liked the experience for me... My 6 yr old who doesn't eat outside food took a qtr piece of nan from the buffet bucket.. They charged me 9 bucks for child buffet!! Rules are rules!! I did leave a bucketful of the nan which presumably goes to the trash...as they served me those almost at the tail end of my meal! Unbelievable!!

cPPCVzzVsvpUK64QPMXXSQ.text: One of the best in Vegas. Their lunch buffet is extravagant and you don't believe the price!!

UO34yfoVlvZBO5IccIQKrA.text: Best restaurant for indian spicy food, really taste and smells good!

hiHxwkbRA3uwyFRhcSHgTA.text: This is probably the best Indian food I've had. I typically order things made Vegan just to reduce the fat/cal and they are still bursting with flavor. I've eaten here three times, and have never been disappointed with the service or the cuisine. If you love Indian food, it is 100% worth trying. If you are trying to eat a little lighter, go with the Vegan option (much of their menu can be made Vegan). You won't be disappointed.

1yOzR7XY2AHVnJ10V_h-NA.text: This is a great Indian spot which caters to all types of preferences and classic Indian spices while understanding what customers  want here in Las Vegas!! I recommend this to everyone of my friends and so far they have all returned with 2 thumbs up!

synGbYKb-okJyVA-iJb62Q.text: A long overdue update about Mint - short and sweet, but well deserved.  Mint have clearly listened to the feedback from Yelp over the last couple of years. What we have now is a well-rounded, extremely consistent buffet and a comprehensive menu ready to cater to every food preference.  At 10.99 for buffet it's no wonder that this place can have a queue out the door around lunchtimes.   Plenty of delicious fare to choose from and some vegetarian options for my wife. Oh, and garlic naan that's among the finest in the valley.  Don't miss out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nPTB5MOiS6vCSJHR7zbsdA.text: Indo chienese style cuisine good for a change.  I ordered shezwan rice but what I got was a vegetable rice with lots of chilly sauce put over the top and mixed. Nothing near to shezwan, it was not even shezwan sauce. They should improve on the quality and taste of food when you are charging above $10 per entree. Heads UP!!! they will add mint leaves in every dish on the menu, as the restaurant name itself suggests.

NnmaFHx0jG9QebgGI6iI9g.text: Absolutely fantastic !  My lips are still on fire but the flavors were bold and unaware that they are located in LV. This place clearly beats my favs in LA. The tika masala was rich, creamy, very spicy and white chicken breast was abundant and big. The palak paneer was incredible and spicy. But the best of all were the desserts, the mango custard was too good and the Gulab was firm, yet soft soaked but not soggy. The syrup was buttery sweetness !  This place rocks. We had to wait 20min for Saturday buffet at 2pm but it was worth any kind of wait times!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

UMBbM5yFDITX_otvr2ELvA.text: Taste was good but service was not. Charging for extra roti if you are doing Togo buffet. Only 1 roti comes with Togo buffet. There is no butter in butter roti.

AXawmYm-DxGumabbUYdhRQ.text: Good taste.. Good food  Lots of variety for both veg and Non-veg. Best part of buffet was bhel and sweets ... Loved it!

gd2knMQcYVzcb8gOGLuLeg.text: Mint Indian Bistro is one of the best tasting Indian restaurants in Vegas.  It's also very close to the Strip so you won't have to drive way out to Henderson or Spring Valley next time you're craving some curry from the Sub Continent.  I've had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Korma and they were both tasty.  The Garlic Naan bread is also good because they slather butter on it to make it extra oily and heart stopping.  The ambience of the restaurant is somewhat modern instead of looking like a New Delhi cafeteria as many Indian restaurants here do.  While not as good as my beloved Maharani in Honolulu, I can say with confidence that I wouldn't be surprised to see Richard Parker or Orange Juice eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s located in a little Strip Mall

-AneTxiV3tRCWGyGL0VBXA.text: If you are in Vegas and are craving for some Indian food, chances are that while searching you will come across Mint Indian Bistro. My suggestion is try it once for lunch buffet and dinner. All you will find is consistency in taste quality and customer service. Yes there are multiple choices and this is about 10 mins away from the strip, but with ample parking and great food it's worth trying.  We are glad that we stopped by this place. PS. Gets super busy so call 1/2 hr in advance.

BsSA4wZD-PlWKnHAdrGlbg.text: Amazing food. Amazing service l. The most amazing part is that they offer Jain food. We definitely  over ate every time we have been there. Great variety. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Gqp74ob1L7dGHAu2XRVvVw.text: Excellent for starters... but main course is not good at all everything's is like a tomato pury...

7JowGiJ7NQkLqJnFsaQBHA.text: I've always wanted to check this place out but never knew where it was until I passed it while we were on our way to Mob Month at the library. I definitely wanted to try it so I kept a mental note for after the lecture.   We started off with drinks I had the Rose Lassi. The rose flavor was really delicate ..it  didn't taste like I was consuming a rose garden. My husband had the Pomegranate Martini. He thought it was a little strong and so did I but I don't think that taste can be avoided when you are mixing juice with Vodka. I've had a Martini made with Baileys before ....I think that's more my speed. I don't think it was a True Martini but the taste is much smoother.   I ordered the half order of Lamb Biryani $9.99. It was good but while I was eating it I came across some very strong spices. You know the feeling when you accidentally bite into a peppercorn..it felt like that but I'm not sure what type of spice it was. It looked like a miniature piece of a tree branch but the tender lamb made up for it.   My husband ordered the Chicken Tikka Salad $5.99. The seasonal veggies that came with salad were super fresh. Good size cucumbers tomatoes, and chicken ...beautiful colors. It tasted good too! It's perfect for a late night snack that will not weigh you down. It tasted even better when you put some of the salad on the Naan and roll it up. My husband agreed that I know what I'm talking about it because he liked it . That's no easy feat.   We wanted to try some dessert so I ordered the Mango Kulfi. It's basically a milky mango ice cream. It's not sour like a sorbet... it was pretty tasty. My husband went out of his vanilla box of his basic dessert choices .... he also had no choice because there is no ice cream sundaes here! He ordered the Lal Mohan which looked kind of like like juicy brown eggs. I thought the he might be scared off by it but he tried it and like it. I tried some too . If you are the type that doesn't like too much syrup on your french toast then this may not be for you. I'm one of those people. These are milk based pastries drowning in syrup. It was cool trying something new though.   The service was awesome ! Our waiter helped us decide on the desserts . He genuinely cared what we thought of the food...which was refreshing.  The waiter had a nice warm personality where when he said "Hope you come back soon" ...you have to believe him!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lal Mohan
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Kulfi
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Biryani (half order)

BhLjwD0k0p7bb-DJL0CICg.text: The food here is amazing.  I'm vegan and there were so many dishes that I could eat.  The flavors are so good, it wasn't just the same old curry that you get at so many other Indian restaurants.  I eat on a busy Saturday afternoon but the buffet was never empty.  I especially enjoyed the mango dessert.  Smooth, creamy and full of flavor.  My only disappointment, and this is very nit picky, is that the iced tea did not have any ice so it was rather lukewarm.  The staff happily accommodated our vegan diet by serving up fresh hot roti instead of naan.  My daughter in law is Muslim and this is one restaurant that we can all enjoy a full meal at as the meats are all Halal.  Much appreciated for this attention to detail.

a5-oUPVY_NvoQuNAMBrSxQ.text: I was so impressed with how much the menu had to offer. I haven't been to an Indian restaurant that has different regions of India represented on their menu. Our food and service was great! The location is convenient and the decor isn't luxury but it was nice and felt clean.

dbLQsJsrVnOnjUCwgBcVvA.text: I found about this place through a friend that is vegetarian. I was a little hesitant because of my limited experience with Indian cuisine. I finally tried it.   The decor is nice. The wall art is interesting seating is all booths. They seem to have a decent selection of beers. I like the prompt attention as soon as you enter the door. I am a huge fan of the water service. A carafe of water is brought immediately.   The food. I really enjoy the garlic flat bread (forgive me I don't remember the name). It's got some light char to it. It's warm and it's plentiful. The selection is great. So much flavor. Be careful with the spice (not as in heat spicy but spices spicy); it's yummy but it hurts ones belly. The tandoori chicken was super good. The goat dish was very yummy.   This place is great. Love it. Spicy! Lots of vegetarian options.

29_eWDfrJL112LMg_Keoog.text: Hands down the best Indian restaurant in vegas. We enjoy Indian food and have tried every single Indian restaurant that is open in town at least once. Mint has a lovely environment where every time we go in they remember us and greet us like we're family. They ask us about our kids and really make the experience feel special. The chicken tiki and the Dosa are the best, strongly recommend it.  Oh and they have the ac on during the summer! (We have been to a few Indian restaurants that do not turn their ac on!)

w0FynOBOLL6J7-NTb_n1pg.text: I would recommend Taj palace instead. Taj is cheaper not as crowded, food is better, and samosas are included. The one time I went to Mint for the lunch buffet the food trays were mostly empty, the tandoori chicken was all gone, and I had to wait uber long for my Naans at which point I wasn't even hungry anymore. This place is cramped and gets pretty loud and crowded during the lunch buffet hours so don't expect peace and quiet as you enjoy your food. The only good thing is its located in a convenient location near the strip.

N7oc1vcEa3uX_YlXz-uu8g.text: Food is good. Had Dosa but beware they charge you extra for sambhar and its 2.5 per bowl. Masala was not that great with raw potatoes. Overall good joint for Indian food

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dosa

lXzRYB6PG0O8X7tUwtkzRQ.text: Good decent indian food Mahraja chicken tikka was yummy gulab jamoon was not that good

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb lollipop

U9jtveivxkJy1w2KEQ8h7w.text: The garlic butter naan and the tikka masala are to die for - especially since the chicken tikka masala is halal. Excellent basmati rice and the paneer is top notch. The gulab jamun is also super tasty, and a great selection of chutneys. Nice waiters and nice service.

7FMP3mAd30pJlCblN9gHHQ.text: I ordered and picked up to go, the butter curry chicken was great, but their rice pudding is just ok. It lacks nuts and flavor. But over all I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8heDGX2rZFBDFpsKAH_Kpw.text: Very bad service and food was just ok.... The cutlery was chipped and broken and took very long to come even though there were not many people in the restaurant

liEJMi3BYIlqqT64K6ftRQ.text: On the advice of Yelpers, went to Mint last night. Was very impressed with the room, though small, it is lovely. Was greeted by a cheerful fellow and seated in a booth while waiting for my date. Prompt water, and after a little confusion trying to order top shelf vodka/soda/lime.   I had looked forward to trying either the Vegan or Vegetarian Chef's Dinners (crazy amounts of food, a bit a of everything for $44 $38, respectively) he was reluctant so we went a la carte, which ended up with far less food. They also offer Gluten Free Chef's Menu & have one of the most clearly marked menus I've ever seen describing each item and what categories they fall into, awesome.   The waiter takes your order on an iPhone, which took us a few seconds to register that he wasn't just Yelping :) When I was taking pictures of menu & food, I was asked if I was Yelping and copped to it. He proudly pointed out Yelp sticker on door.   Now, down to food:  I ordered a cup of yellow dal : light, herbaceous and delicious enough to keep around to mop up the last bits with nan. Date had never tried it before and loved it, too.   Two orders of Nan: yummy (too much bread for me, but guess he likes carbs)   Brown Basmati rice: yes, please! They happily informed us it would be refilled on request and it was.   My main course was vegan tikka masala which I ordered at level 8. Some heat, but I'd go 10 next time. Complex, full of veggies and spices and I took half home.   Date had Mango Lassi, which he enjoyed and a usual lamb korma guy tried the vegetarian version level 8, too and ate every bite, most of the nan, and surprisingly, his first brown rice?!   In all, service was attentive, water glasses were filled and we thoroughly enjoyed everything. In my pictures is a cute "Happy Face Rating" which came with bill I thought was adorable. Thought it a bit pricy at $65 + change but that would have been easily remedied ordering the Chef's Menu for 2. Another funny thing: we were trying to figure out what "1 Russian $10" was on check = it was my cocktail ( guessing Stoli)  My date went back today for the $10.99 lunch buffet, which he really dug. Guess he enjoyed Mint as much as I did. Once I try more items, I will update review and am pretty sure it will hold up or bump to 5*. Another plus: half orders! Keeps making me crush on you harder, Mint, you charmer. How flirty is it that they thanked me on the Facebook (c'mon y'all want to say THE Facebook so let's do it...)   Directly across the street from the Atomic Testing Museum: perfect place to hit for lunch before or after. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the &#34;choose your smiley face&#34; w check. They saw me taking pics and asked if I was Yelping. Sticker on door
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan tikka masala
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

y_9qnb7_bTMqiByTBK0FZw.text: Went there for lunch buffet. Food was great and good service. Huge selection of delicious food in the buffet. Surprisingly they had idly chutney and sambar even though sambar wasn't the great one but that won't stop me from giving them 5 star Good , contemporary ambiance. Will be back next time I'm in vegas.

AWFVbbHoJlMOowp1Zfl78A.text: Ate Jeera rice(too oily),dal tadka (was good),Kadhai Paneer (tasted a bit like tomato paste,cream) , papad with mint/tamarind chutney was good,gobi manchurian was good,Chilli Paneer appetizer was good,Naan tasted good,Soup of the day was dal soup aka tadka dal.

SLc82al13hEof5hkefR6Lw.text: The lunch buffet was very mediocre. The spread was not much. And most of the subjis didn't taste fresh . Dal and sambar were the only okay ones.

MOXuS9yro6eIVweKzoS0rw.text: Fabulous Indian food. We were a group of friends from the SF bay area, and were surprised to find great Indian food in Vegas. Perhaps even better than any place in the bay area. We were in Vegas for 3 days, and ended up going to the same place on each of the 3 nights for dinner! I tried the Handi Biryani. They ask for spice level (from 0 to 10!), and I actually noticed a difference in spiciness corresponding to what you order. I ordered 10 and the food was pretty spicy. (spicy = good :)). They also have an "Inferno biryani" which is supposedly so spicy that you have to sign a waiver to order it. The waiter discouraged us from having that and I obliged.  You don't want to risk losing a night in Vegas , right? :) The place is quiet on the one weekday we went, and was pretty packed on both the weekends.

S4ak_WrLu_Linw0mpcMfhA.text: We had dinner here last week, the bhelpuri was came in a teeny weeny cup, and had about 3-4 spoons of bhel in it. Their veg momos were great and portion size was good too. Their garlic naans and onion kulchas were good.  They have a dish (curry) called mango mahakali, this is apparently their house speciality. When I tasted it, it felt like I was having mango milkshake with a hint of garam masala thrown in. This dish was a big let down. Otherwise you can eat here, I would go only for the momos nothing else.

OJOz1Aked6oLYNTIv3yVsw.text: Best Indian food ever!!!! Been here 5 times and the food is never a disappointment. The mango lassi is great also I would've added a picture but I drank it all! Sooo good

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango masala and harayali kabob

0T5ctmhoh8LcjbAwAyyuUA.text: Best Indian food in Vegas. Don't miss the place. Great food and great service though they do take 15-20 minutes to serve any order.

QwpRfRtmYpc7HZUbjdlj2A.text: This is my favorite Indian lunch buffet in town. The food is great and the service is good. The goat curry is really good. And there are a lot of vegetarian options. I've never been for dinner, but based on the lunch buffet I would expect it would be very good.

NVO3lO_wMgDbAaImBXXA-Q.text: The food here is pretty good but not the greatest Indian food I have ever had. It has a nice lunch buffet setup if you are new to these dishes and want a sampling of most common dishes.   I suppose for a buffet you cannot expect much for service, but at the same time there is not a whole lot you need them to do... Drink orders, clear plates, extra napkins. I agree with other posts that service here is not stellar.   The seating here is very tight. If coming with a party larger than 4, recommend a reservation. We came today with 4 adults and 2 small kids and were crammed into a small corner booth. Granted it was at the height of the buffet hours. Would have been manageable if our waiter was more attentive to clearing plates off the small table.   Today just reminded me why I like India Palace much better.

TQTFCiWZErAEuC-88zi7tg.text: Of all the Indian food places in Vegas,  this is my favorite. My wife and I came in for the buffet and it was excellent.   The food is mildly spiced just the way I like.  There are a strong variety of Indian dishes to choose from. The tikka masala was delicious. I enjoyed the veggie khurma also.   We have been disappointed several times with indian food places in Vegas. This is is a must try.   Would recommend to my friends.

zbba87cdLV0eFCBx3kz3Qw.text: Food is mediocre. We did the lunch buffet. Also service is not the best, waiter made us a nasty face when we asked him to split checks. Tiki masala was too spicy. Atmosphere is modern but loud. There are howeverba lot of vegan options which is pretty cool.

CjbgqHudZR6TCVvZE2q7OQ.text: Amazing yummy food, but quantity is very less for the price of the dishes. They could make it better by lesser price or bigger portions. But the food tastes delicious.

CCACycCdvstPCVKT2C0riQ.text: I would never recommend this place to whoever is looking for authentic Indian food , it's not at all close to traditional Indian taste n palette! We went after checking a few reviews but as they say "don't judge a book by its cover" was so True !!!   We tried Mumbai pav bhaji and the only way to describe it was "urghhhh" what did I order !!! Folks from Mumbai will be thoroughly disappointed. The only thing I would recommend n give 3 stars was the bhindi kurkure or okra fritters they were good.  So my friends after a long drive to Vegas if u r looking to relax the evening with a good Indian dinner don't go this way :(

A8QkEiGaxkhPHMBQUu42WA.text: We got the sampler where you get to try 5 different curries, an appetizer and dessert. I LOVED this option! Although I found some of the curries to be kinda tasteless and others to be way to spicy when asked to be mild. VERY kind service. And most of the customers were Indian! Always good to see when you walk in :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Dinner for 2 Sampler

0hQ_6-kQ8QSku6o-J6tJTw.text: Let me start by saying I've been a really big fan for years, it was my #1 Indian food.  Today was a total meal of mediocrity at the buffet. Began with the fried veggies which were both cold & unchewable. Then so happy to see Chicken Korma until I realize it's thigh not breast. Chili Chicken very good as was the Garlic Naan but the rest was totally "off" for me today. Will now search for another #1. Forgot to mention this was straight up Noon & last visit a couple weeks ago was not good either. Is it just me or do others think Tandoori Chicken should be a bit crispy on the outside?

_bm-B4hS3bIoTC5WBJh5qg.text: I don't ever go out for Indian food, seeing that I can just make it at home and most of the time restaurants just don't do Indian food any justice. But mint is really True to the Indian flavors. It's just like my grandmothers homemade food. Really enjoy their lunch buffet. But lunch is always busy so be patient!! I didn't give them 5 stars bc the service isn't great . I had dinner with my Family there and the service was awful.

gR7iMGGeR3n7VXNrloJtzg.text: I travel a lot, and often seek out a Masala Dosa. I have my favorite spots in LA, Berkeley, Seattle. In Las Vegas I have been to Mint twice.  It's okay. I would go again. I just get a Dosa. It's vegetarian and hopefully a bit healthy.  The Dosa here was pretty good. Not the best, but certainly quite okay.  And the restaurant was very clean and nice, which is not always the case.

1KvVbFw-1641pqfdIliGEw.text: As I'm having a thanksgiving lunch here at Mint, I realized some things. First, I've lived here for 4 years and eaten here frequently each year. Secondly, this is the fourth time this month I've eaten here. And thirdly, I have never, ever had a negative experience here. The same servers have been here since I've started coming here and the manager is really nice, great staff.  The food is bomb and always has been. Best Tandoori chicken I've ever had, period. Even though I frequent the buffet, it's never the exact same as the previous trip. They're always mixing it up so that's how I justify eating here so much. I travel, so I eat at a lot of different Indian restaurants because it's a genre I enjoy a lot. This place never disappointments. Stop reading my review and get in the car. As of today, I've written maybe three or four Yelp reviews (sorry, I'm working on more!). But its only fitting this is one of those first reviews, this is one of my fav spots in Vegas.

528_y8KhPkOx9U-qKWrWtQ.text: This is probably the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, with excellent vegetarian fare.  I would recommend both buffet and a-la-carte dining options.

x81e4NiFwh3tTGT5JQgkJA.text: My favorite place to eat & as always Ron gives wonderful customer service!!! The Mango masala without nuts due to allergy :) They also carry around a Ipad so that you could see the picture of the food and they will describe the flavors! Oh how I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Lassi with Vodka &amp; in the back is the Strawberry Lassi w/Vodka $8 each..oh Soo Good. Ron also suggested it &amp; he&#39;s on point
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Chicken Massala is the best thing on the menu

CB9EmTKjXzVGCVl5EQJ9lw.text: I don't typically write review updates this quick, nor do I usually write another 5 star review for a place I absolutely love. There's no point in beating a dead horse, but I popped in for the lunch buffet at Mint Indian Bistro with my Dad yesterday and it blew my mind!  Indian lunch buffets are usually pretty sketch. In most cases, it's the food leftover from the night before, and it's obvious. Not the case here.  Every single item in the line was FRESH, DELICIOUS, and tasted as if had been made right there and then. I know this because I had been here for dinner just a couple weeks back, so I could judge accordingly.  I sampled a little bit of everything. The Chili Chicken, the Tikka Masala, Chicken Pakorda, Saag, Daal Tarka, the Idli Sambar....mmmmmm!  For 10 bucks, this really is the best lunch in all of Las Vegas! You get a ton of food and it's delicious.   If you have Vegan or Vegetarian friends, there are plenty of options in the buffet line as well. Everything is clearly marked, so there is no hanky panky.  Service was great, just like last time.  I can't wait to come back.  In closing, no need to worry about the lunch buffet here. It's just as good as the a la cart menu.  Feel free to eat your meals with your hands, and use the bathrooms afterwards to wash up. The bathrooms are spotless here!

swCP_9x2cdkmpSM2h-Ak0Q.text: The food there was very very disappointing.  Most of the curries were tasteless.  None of the dishes tasted like they should be. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

shl_gG3ju6A40LjsZ4qNng.text: Eating with the locals you can't go wrong! Not a meal I would think of in Sin City Las Vegas what happened here will not stay here. Great food and very tasty and fresh. Usually I only eat Indian overseas as it has no watered down American spins, but this food was great and authentic and excellent presentation. Staff very eager to please but not much on conversation but that's ok cause i came to eat not make friends lol. Clean service and the decor kind of Vegasy if that's a thing. Enjoyed it very much..

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off the beaten path

6mI5qWE3f3_wyt9baUG7qA.text: I discovered this little gem a few years back while on an extended stay in Vegas and remembered it to be quite good Indian fare. Went back last night and my memory serves correct -- really top notch food! I'd actually go as far as to say it is some of the best Indian food I've had anywhere (and the prices are totally reasonable -- not "On-the-strip" ridiculous.) The service was a little on the slower side, only due to the fact that the restaurant was very busy. Lots of Indian customers dining here which reinforces how on-point the food is... although my taste buds already knew that

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan (tamarind, yellow dal, &amp; mint sauce drizzled on top by me)

rA2hlhGhMLFQ0KIRQSuMKQ.text: The food is amazing! Every dish has its own kick. As a vegan, it's very hard to find a place which is vegan friendly. This place taking into consideration all vegans and vegetarians, as well as omnivores. The menu even specify what dish is gluten free. Amazing.  The only reason that I'm not giving this place 5 star is the host - me and my friend came in today and were starving. We were standing in the crowded entrance, not being noticed by anyone. We were waiting for about 15 minutes until someone has finally took our names and put them in the list. After that we waited for another 15 minutes until they called us to have a sit. In all of this time there were 2 tables which were vacated from people, but nobody had a time to clean them for us.  Not very welcoming, but yet, as soon as the food arrives everything is forgotten. And the BEERS! Oh the beers are so good , such a unique and large variety of them with explanation about each one.  At the end of the day - very recommended. Just choose the time that you are going to visit wisely before coming.

mfZkt64smh8fNg2aiEiOAw.text: This is my go to Indian spot. There are a lot of them in the area but this is definitely the best. I used to come here for the lunch buffet when I went to UNLV but now mostly for a nice dinner. The inside has had some renovations and it's very cozy and romantic. They have a modern bar area now but I don't ever see anyone sitting at it. My favorite dishes are the biryani, paneer tikka masala, rogan josh curry, and vindaloo. I love the paneer so much but the goat is also awesome. We tried the inferno naan the last time we were there and that was not the best idea. Not sure how anyone is able to eat the curry. The flavor is not bad but you can't eat anything else after your tastebuds have been burned off. We love spicy food but this is next level uncomfortable. They also have a great beer selection!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat biryani, paneer tikka masala and side of rice
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The insides of the inferno naan with waiver. Don&#39;t do it.

nk-RnV9sBE_pW3MSw0fpnQ.text: The food is excellent and has an authentic flavor. The location is convenient for locals and visitors alike. The prices seem to be increasing with every visit but still reasonable. The service can be slow but the food is worth the wait. An overall excellent dining experience.

GbzVhBPotmVFUjmHYlfjFg.text: The saag and eggplant was 100% good, just like my family would have cooked them. This place is busy but a very short wait.

SE1ulJ9gcgMnEwSjGoYTsA.text: My friends and I dined here on a Saturday evening.  The food was fantastic and they offer a vast selection of Asian beers. We had the tandori chicken and rebel curry. Both dishes were spiced and cooked to perfection. We also had the Taj Mahal beer and it was very good. I highly recommend this place for those daring enough to eat authentic Indian cuisine.

WVrdcOq9OnUBvBFoZysGjw.text: Excellent and tasty Indian food. Really good variety of vegetarian option and excellent customer service. Best place for Vegetarian, my friend had a non veg meal and he also enjoyed it.

4mGMkWo3gK9zQiaMah1_aA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Every time I eat here, I try something new, and I am NEVER disappointed. The VEGAN option are ENDLESS, and the "Bhindi Aloo" is my FAVORITE dish.   This place will be in HEAVY rotation from here on out.

DyetVMPd1UokcX_o_b9JmA.text: What an amazing food they have. We have been here more than 5 times and food is consistently delicious. Each and everything on menu is good. This place serves one of the best Indian food in America.Would definitely recommend this place if you are visiting vegas. Please open a branch in Austin, Tx.

RjOPmLtkJ4muomw-5y_IDA.text: Yelp'd some good Indian places when I touched down in Vegas and this place was the first one to pop up.   Upon entering the low dimmed, Indian atmosphere was definitely given. Also, the aroma of Indian spices from the curry flow through your nose right away.   I ordered two authentic Indian beers " Taj Mahal & Kingfisher ". For the main course we ordered chicken tikka masala and paneer tikka masala, OMG! They hit the spot right away, I highly recommend both!  Overall amazing experience and recommend this place to everyone !

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love that they have authentic Indian beers available !

ylFXRKUtWNRaCN02lnO2Jg.text: One of the best lunch buffet options especially if you're vegan and gluten free. I went through just once and ate so much I only went back for the orange slices to cool my mouth off a bit. I like spicy so I added chili sauce but not everything is spicy in case you can't handle the heat. Definitely don't miss this place!!!

ANvy_KbRa1jUfmzBOJiuWg.text: If you looking for an authentic Indian cuisine this is very nice place to eat. Very nice environment, in love with the garlic bread to start with. We enjoy the buffet very affordable and we enjoy every bite

hhnh6DFU4WIzau4DvYs3dQ.text: Was staying at the strip with family. Wanted to het some Indian food but something where the spice levels can be controlled and adjusted. They did. Food was great! Kids, older parents all enjoyed the food. Tasty yet not spicy.

ojpGcsoghoAohqvxAwEE7g.text: The place had spicy food challenge which though inedible was fun to try. Other than that the menu was pretty interesting. As we went to the restaurant with a vegetarian group who don't eat spicy, we were not able to pick either spicy or meat dishes that we like. But the vegetarian food was also good. We also had the lassi which was very good, one of the best we have had. Next time if we get a chance to go here will like to try the meat dishes for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inferno naan and kebab

rvw0reugQSUWLA1OITvAiQ.text: I am shocked at the high reviews this place gets. We went on Sunday night at 8pm they were busy. LONG slow service. We did not get out of there till 10:20pm. I eat Indian food often. Priced $2-3 dollars a dish too high on their entrees. We sat there 30 minutes to order. 20 of that was no menus because "they were short on menus". Dosa appetizer came 30 minutes after ordering, 5 minutes before food. While food itself was good, between painfully slow service, over priced small entree will not be returning.

J-4rW8QlAh2ARfEg9uWi1w.text: Best Indian food ever! Warm naan that melts in your mouth, warm delicious gulab jamun like no other and a variety of dishes at the buffet.

VDHpY-IWwuKVbm3OINjjwg.text: Came here once before for dinner and I remembered the food being really good but was a little pricey. Came here again on Sunday for the lunch buffet and left a happy and satisfied customer.   We came in a little before 12 and they were pretty much full, 5 minutes later there were people waiting outside for a table.   The buffet looks small but they have lots of items and nice variety too. Salad bar, fruits, 2 options of rice, variety of curry and other dishes, the chicken was delicious! They also have us complimentary nan bread... which was soft, fluffy and full of flavors.   My sister said their chai is the best chai of all places! Some dishes are better than others but overall very good and decadent flavors. They have spicy and non-spicy options, meat and vegetarian options, definitely something for everyone.

-VtUwNWJ6fr0Nul-FsXaPw.text: It's was quite amazing experience. Food was delicious,  especially the fresh garlic Naan bread. YUMMY!!!  I am quite FULL &  happy. Customer service was great especially from the gentleman that was at rhe register, he took great care of me. I will be coming back and bringing friends. Lunch was AWSOME!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tWuEMXF8VQx4LB2rRDPpA.text: I had a lunch buffet around 18 Jan 2015 2:30 Pm closing time, Although food was great,  but I did not like waiter he snatched food twice from plate. He kept on asking me if I am done with food when I was still having meals and snatched the food. Since I was in good mood  did not complain. Now I am back home and getting annoyed on being treated shabbily

Lu8u6qW2UkNmJH0HD6twOA.text: My recent discovery and my recent all time favorite Indian lunch buffet for only $11.99. This place is a bit small, you have to come early or wait in line. During summer months they have patio dining that relieves over crowding. The value and the quality of food is excellent. You even get a choice of naan. There are a varieties of vegetarian dishes, and a handful of meat dishes including lamb or goat and of course the usual chicken curries and chicken tandorii. Dessert is also included.

lake-u-bvE5kaGEVUfCCgw.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! I'd had their food back when they were called Himalayan Restaurant and it was very good. My recent dinner visit was the first time I had actually been inside the restaurant and the first time I'd had the food since they came under new ownership.   The waiter was very helpful and friendly. He suggested getting the Vegan Sampler when we informed him we wanted to try everything on the menu. So, we ordered the Vegan Sampler which was perfect for two people. Every item was amazing except for the carrot (I think) which was a little too sweet for my taste. The sampler comes with two sides of basmati rice, roti and six or seven other items. The soup and Chana Saag were my favorites. I'll definitely be back to try the dosas!

B3dRD9jLmGfx_xOojS5XGw.text: Terrible experience. Service was horrible. they sat us a booth next to the door. Every time the door opened, a cold breeze rushed in. Totally uncomfortable. Then it took them a while to bring waters and even longer to take our order. When we finally got our food, it was very dissatisfying. $21 for overcooked dried lamb on a bed of arugula and Dijon mustard, and they didn't even offer rice. I could barely chew the lamb. My husband did the inferno challenge. Couldn't stomach it. They offered him a tiny sauce dish filled with plain yogurt to settle his stomach. They charged us $3 extra for it. I can buy a whole tub of plain organic yogurt at the grocery store for that much. Still, it was thought to be a courtesy yogurt. Lastly, one of the waiters approached our table and offered us to-go boxes. He never came back. Just ignored us completely along with our initial waiter. My husband had to walk to the counter to get the check. And I walked up later to get a box and a bag. Perhaps it was just a bad night and the wrong dish to order, but still, not going to be returning to this place again.

2-8U1UnQNm5UJhtUu86kHA.text: Very good restaurant! We had mostly South Indian food! Food was delicious; service was ok but they were bit crowded n able to accommodate our big group with little time!

NSKpthVrHVQjzwDT_NVg4A.text: good quality food but crazy wait times! we waited 45 minutes to get a table and another 30 minutes to get food ... so either make a reservation or be ready to spend at least two hours to finish dinner.. well the food quality and taste is worth the wait ...

YA2m-IR9RLNw47xP5s2xZg.text: I always make it a point to dine at the Mint Bistro everytime I am in Vegas. This year we dined here twice, with a rather large group of friends. Impressive on both occasions!  Any restaurant that serves proper Pani-Puri and Bhel really knows what they are doing. The waiter recommended their Andhra coconut curry and it was spot on. Great selection of beers from all over the world.  Definitely the best Indian dining Vegas has to offer!

98TP1B_dDZEw3sqPHkC_KA.text: I yelped and I googled and I yelped when I was in the process of purchasing a voucher from Restaurant.com . The foods was great but not for the money. This is my first time I tried Rest voucher. I took a friend with me. It was definitely a lot less valuable as Groupon (from what I've gathered, there was Groupon offered at this restaurant recently). Groupon imposed no conditions on money spent (I assume you ordered $40 foods or more with your $20 purchase, then you paid the tax and tips on top, for a minimal of $23.24). Rest voucher dictated you ordered twice as much and paid 18% tip, plus tax. For $25 voucher (you may pay $15 for it), you have to order $45 min of food. So the final total was about $49. What's my saving? If I've got the voucher for free, I still paid about $33. How much is my saving then? If I order the foods without the voucher, I would have paid about $49 too. What's wrong with this picture. With this irritation aside, the foods were good. Not excellent, but tasty. I was surprised with a one-page Nepalese section. I have never tried Nepalese foods before. And I don't consume east Indian foods often. So we ordered Nepalese sampler $29.99 and a Tandouri chicken $14.99. There was also a Indian sampler for $30.99 available. The portion on the sampler was so small (2 oz per metal cup) that I could easily finish by myself and still feel hungry. It came with 4 pieces of turkey dumpling, 2 oz red curry chicken (4 cubes), 2 oz vegetarian, 4 small pieces of skewed lamb (in 2 oz cup), 2 oz broth, 2 oz cucumber salad, 2 servings of 2 oz steamed rice, 3 small pieces of brown desserts, and one cut up Naan. Luckily we had Tandouri chicken to contribute a small space in our stomach; it came with 5 small pieces of thighs and drumstick with plenty of onions. I have to be honest, I don't have a fine palate for Indian cuisine. The Nepalese foods tasted like Indian foods. Even though it tasted good, but I had similar or better at various cities. A meat sampler costs $12.99 and Tandouri chicken $8.99 during a visit to Flagstaff (I thought it was a bit pricey at the time comparing to the restaurant in SoCal excluding San Diego). The service was plain ordinary. I can hardly understand our server's thick accent. I wound never have paid 18% tips on this kind of service. The location was off the strip but in the midst of Asian commercial district. There were many Indian and some Filipino restaurants in the neighborhood. So diners, beware what you are getting from Restaurant.com voucher. It feels like a scam to benefit the restaurants. Groupon is a better deal here. I feel the price is at least 50% more than other places, regardless Vegas charm or not. I won't be back for there is no knowledge gain but a bad overall experience and the worse value I have ever had for a long time.

Cz7uu3AREtOeDoJeBmjWgg.text: What an amazing culinary experience!  The flavors of the food are vibrant. The spicy noodle soup was amazing with each spoonful better than the last. It's a vegetarian delight.  Huge gluten free menu

gJivGl4nxOOZYYbqykmmSQ.text: Had the holiday lunch special buffet on Christmas Day! Food was good.. Naan was great!! Liked cranberry rice..Sambar too bad...idlis didn't feel fresh...was crowded..mgr was Gujarati..they also had DIY bhel

Ts3ykBLM2Y2h-dwL58EobA.text: Easily the best Indian place in Vegas. Amazing dishes and killer naan! The friendly service here is always a welcome bonus. Try anything here... you'll love it.

TRoo2QK__8qR7EQnNWf0FA.text: Awesome food.. Andhra chicken and chicken chilly was very good.... I desert Mango Custard and Gulab Jamun were good. They served hot naan, nana were soft and very good.... I didnt tried anything in Veg, but friends liked vegetarian too...

7tiEb8hf3LQ_TQZZtxvaiw.text: My husband and I had no idea what to expect!  We are not familiar with Indian food but the menu and the reviews were super enticing.   For a person with lots of good restrictions this place is a GEM!!! The staff is so helpful and knowledgable of all their food!  Our meal was delicious, can't wait to try more on their Massive menu!

crc-xJrKKuRhGjtb3o9gUw.text: I haven't had Indian food this good since I left Chennai, India. Everything was amazing from the naan bread to the spicy chicken; even the Indian beer! I highly recommend this place.

LWT3UnC57phhtAzoxzqdyQ.text: Truly the best Indian food at very reasonable prices!  Kwati soup, Tandoori Chicken and Saag Paneer half orders were plenty for two people to share!  Wayne Gorsek

xV4_3qKZgzACPrwRi7z89A.text: My husband and I went here for Valentine's Day while in Las Vegas.  We were blown away with how amazing our night was!    The service is nonpareil.  Before we even arrived at the restaurant, someone gave us a call to let us know that the menu was prix fixe and wanted to let us know that we can look on the website to make sure that we were still interested.  And, once there, the staff were all very attentive and we didn't have to wait long for any of our courses to come.  There are many vegetarian options and each course was, quite easily, the best Indian food that we've ever had.  The Mango Lassi is also quite enjoyable.  We will definitely always come back to Mint whenever we're in the area!

ttepdTLwJrjGeYYEVyfsXw.text: Tried Veg dinner for 2 option. Its expensive but Food was good. Sampler has 4 curries almost all are good. Dal is average. Overall food is good and service is good.

4etb7NOpqyDaXau1GFIcgg.text: Lunch buffet was great. Not too pricey as well. Freshly prepared garlic naan was great too. Vegetarian options are little bit less but I guess how much one vegetarian can eat...  It's okay. I Would give three and half stars to this place ( count my four stars as three and half really)

Iwhq6kKRyRaNVCS8qrRzrg.text: Spicy and good quality!  My friend and I love Indian food.  I wanted to bring some over her house to cheer her up.  Usually, I would have hit Namaste (which is not far from my work), but they don't open until 5:30.  So, I thought I would try Mint.  I got the "Indian Dinner."  Honestly, I can't say that I knew all of the things that I was eating, but yum!!

QioBEDOZzwXZx8oFpjTLtg.text: We went there on 12/26. This is our impression. Overpriced. Slow / crawling service. Too many menu choices, menu looks great, however food tastes bland. Would not recommend to anyone.

aHbc8Ray0nmR3NlJ721p9A.text: Fantastic food, great service! Friends love their mango lassi (which is a yogurt drink.)

81SPZkLSiuXuSYaUlMh49Q.text: Visited the Restaurant on 08/30/13 for lunch based on positive reviews and ratings of the restaurant.   Restaurant opened 30 mins late while we waited at the door with small kids.   Found the food very average but the reason for my poor rating is the poor service and attitude of the manager and staff.

AESRK_ZDW74_IE2WadCeMQ.text: We went to Mint for a friend's birthday, and were seated in a large party (20+ diners).  The food was magnificent and I can't wait to eat there again.  The servers were a bit unorganized in taking our orders, but everyone got appetizers and drinks in due course.  They were even willing to give us separate checks without a hassle!  We ordered one of the chef's tasting menus (Lumbini Vegan Prix Fixe) which was perfect -- we were able to try several dishes and loved all but one.  The Vegetable Korma was my favorite dish.  The most surprising part of the tasting menu was the dessert.  The Gajar Halwa (Carrot Pudding) is cold, spice-laden and delicious.  I think it's flavored with cardamom and nutmeg.  Yes, this sounds weird, but trust me -- it was great!   And it is vegan -- no dairy.  Perfectly yummy!  Eat here today!  You won't be sorry.

CtBVs4zhOc0GNmExiBoxYA.text: JUNK.  I'm very disappointed in Yelp reviews on this one.  The flavors were not that great.  Nan bread did not come out until we were finished with our lunch.  I will not be back.  There is another place here in LV that blows this place away.

oe521-Bm9uez5vQMYVmTFQ.text: I've found over the years, that trying an Indian restaurant during their lunch buffet is by far the best value, and a great way to try new things without being disappointed if you don't really like it. I love chicken tikka masala, unfortunately Mint's didn't really tickle my fancy as much as I was hoping it would. It was good, but not as flavorful as I'm used to. That being said, they had other dishes that were delish! I liked their chili chicken, and chicken vindaloo. Their garlic naan was fluffy and yummy, and both rice dishes were good. GIve this place a try!

siU33AWpg-agCXgSik7fww.text: Insanely good Indian. Crave it all week long. 20 minute drive from me but I still pass up every other Indian place that's close to come here. Friendly service staff and amazing garlic naan. Tikka masala here is great. Chili chicken and chili gobi are insane. I take everyone who says they don't like Indian food here and make them a believer. Try this place out you won't be disappointed.

MmgKPj-riUzb7afRd7_vww.text: ok here is why I am giving Mint 5*. We walked in 10 before the lunch buffet was about to close. The owner offered to keep things as long as we like and even cooked up more food that got low. He personally came over talked to use and went the extra mile, to make this a great experience.

uXmprFxB-c05hvHoK3ZeGg.text: They have a really delicious buffet. If you have any special dietary restrictions, this is the place to go. They mark each buffet item as vegan/vegetarian/gluten free & more. I really appreciate that.

9IQPFe51EJ2ImfGFnQKddQ.text: Well I would have given it 4 stars except that the service was lousy - I was there by myself and felt invisible.  They were very nice when they did show up.  Had to ask twice to get a beer.  It wasn't that busy - come on now.    What really pissed me off was the brown rice scam.  I was told my meal came with white race and I asked for brown and was charged $6 extra.  You gotta be f-ing kidding me! ...... I expect to get reamed on the Strip but here????  All that said it is a really nice place.  Very attractive; tasty food and best beer selection I have every since in an Indian restaurant including some Indian beers I had never seen before and the one I ordered was quite good.  If they can up their game on service and stop selling brown rice at gunpoint I would have been much happier

ENFGhTt6-OesceG9-E559w.text: Me and a friend from out of town decided to pay this place a visit. We opted for the buffet and I was privy to the curried goat as well as some other items whose names I unfortunately cannot recall. It was definitely serviceable. I enjoyed the nan(?) the most.

YxiXq6qEVuwCa3RinHahyQ.text: Having recently been burned by overpriced terrible tasting food at another Indian restaurant in the area *cough* Bollywood *cough* we were hesitant to try more Indian cuisine. We were having a tough time coming up with a new place to visit so I went to Yelp. I started looking up various ethnic cuisines and I did a search for Nepalese food. Much to my surprise a place called Mint Indian Bistro showed up. After reading the reviews it seemed like the place had a mix of Himalayan and Northern Indian cuisine. So we made a resolution, we'll try some appetizers and if we didn't like it we would go to a different restaurant for our main meal.  All that plan B contingency stuff went out the window when I looked at the menu. They actually had menu items marked as vegan and vegetarian such that for once I would not have to ask about the ingredients they use in each of the dishes. So we made the plunge. We decided to share the Vegan Sampler and it was good. I want to say it was great, but there were a couple of items in the sampler that I did not enjoy as much as the rest.  Additionally the decor and feel of the restaurant was very nice. They even turned the lights up for us temporarily while we were perusing the menu so my mother could see the menus as she squinted without her reading glasses again.  With full disclosure and all that jazz I would say the food was in the four star range, but the addition of the vegan friendly menu really pushes the rating up for me into the five star range. I gotta help promote any vegan friendly place here in Vegas because they are not as prevalent as they are in other towns.

KMqi3ZIBQDZg4eC8-qKD_A.text: Currently sitting here in Mint writing this review.  We organized a group to come and try the inferno challenge.  We arrived at 2pm so the non challengers could have the buffet and when the dinner menu started at 3pm the challenge could take place.  On arrival we told the staff our plans.  40 mins after arrival they inform us they don't have the ingredients for the challenge.  So wasted trip for us.  No retribution offered, just told to call them in a week to see if they have it again .

0_RZBp1L2qu_no4pN0f2cA.text: Lunch buffet, dinner.. I've done it all.  I really like Mint and all their veggie selections for us non-meat eaters.  The menu is easy to navigate and is coded with abbreviations to let you know which is vegetarian friendly, gluten-free, etc.  I usually opt for the aloo gobi or the chana masala with a side of garlic naan and always end up leaving happy.  Like I mentioned earlier, I've stopped in a few times for the lunch buffet and always leave happy as well.  They can a bunch of great choices for lunch and they always like to keep the "veggies" in mind with a bunch of meatless dishes which are all labeled, warmed up, and ready to go.  Definitely a favorite of mine and definitely a step up from the Himalayan joint they used to be.  Coming back soon and definitely coming back hungry!!

EvPkfXC42WO6p12-0kguTQ.text: Amazing food and excellent service. Off the strip so it's quiet.

JOQsczOSagcgv3KEYQJ5JQ.text: Authentic Indian Restaurant. Great food and atmosphere. Very clean. Buffet is very cheap and you can taste almost all parts of India.

0L8eZxgCGGvNcRpXkmIHAQ.text: Taj Palace is still my favorite although this is the only comparison I have. Mint doesnt have as many vegetarian options as Taj Palace who offers about 6 options including a salad bar. I was disappointed that Mint didnt offer any lentil dishes and the naan wasn't as great as everyone posted. My fiance who is the meat eater wasn't too fond of the goat curry and prefers Taj Palaces chicken tiki masala. Overall, it was a good place to try for Indian food and was crowded for Saturday lunch buffet so that has to say something but we'll stick to taj palace for our Indian fix.

arefzeNBacurVt-gqI9J-g.text: This restaurant is a gem. The daily brunch is a steal! It includes a variety of meat & vegetarian entrees from throughout India and Nepal.  While many others already have reviewed this restaurant, since this is possibly my favorite restaurant, I wanted to add my applause.

Q4uLU-R1XnXKYGy05xzT-w.text: Update:  New decor. Bigger restaurant. Same fabulous beer menu. Same silly menu. But the name has changed and there's now a lunch buffet.  Sadly, the new lunch buffet is almost all Indian food with little Himalayan or Nepalese. BUT....this is one of the best Indian restaurants in Vegas, and I'd even put it up there with some of the best Indian food in the San Francisco Bay Area.  This ain't your typical greasy Indian buffet. The food is fresh and delicious. This is one of the best budget restaurants in town and my old review gave them 4 stars, but I'm adding another star for the new, beautiful decor.  Old review:  1) Why go to a Himalayan restaurant and get Indian food? 2) Maybe it's because this place has been under new ownership for about 9 months but at least half the menu is Nepalese/Himalayan food. Yes, there is Indian food on the menu. But I didn't eat any of it and you don't have to either unless you want to. 3) there is no lunch buffet anymore.  We had the Nepalese Sampler Platter (split one between two of us which was plenty of food for a not-heavy dinner) and it was wonderful! The only thing that looked even remotely Indian was the dessert.  We had some kind of black eyed pea dhal-ish kind of thing that was a bit bland but still nourishing and tasty.  A cucumber, potato, cilantro salad was one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten.  The lamb was scrumptious. I'm not huge on chicken but it was pretty good. There was some kind of bamboo shoot salad that was oddly compelling. No clue what was in it.  And the momo! Oh man it is ALL ABOUT the MOMO!! I could eat these tasty dumplings all day long.  Phenomenal beer selection. Friendly owner. Great food.  If you like spice, don't ask for 5. The 5 was really quite mild.

LBUhOzDCxRXmFsn22TMueQ.text: Wonderful food and service! The buttered garlic naan is the best. My favorite dish is the Malai Kofta and the Lassi menu has every flavor imaginable.  I tried the Rose Lassi and it was delicious.

v9WOZ8cYpcbVHKfXF9d3ng.text: I enjoyed the test of curries and Nan. Food was delicious and customer service was good.

mYmhMDYrCx-LRRJMzmVnlg.text: It was excellent! I was a little embarassed because I couldn't remember what the yogurt drink i like was called (lassi) and couldn't find it on the menu, but they new what i was talking about and brought it right away. It was all fabulous, we will definitely return!

nSVMMGwWtRX1H7tC23nlGQ.text: Great little restaurant.  Different from other Indian restaurant because they also serve Nepalese cuisine.  Nepalese food is like a marriage of Chinese and Indian, very tasty.  You gotta try.  The wait staff is very friendly and courteous.  I'd definitely bring friends and family here.  Their lunch buffet also looks very good but I haven't tried.  they had a lot of the same food as a la carte menu.

eqS-gOZSCWaRkTnL3hU55A.text: I went here with my uncle and his girlfriend when they visited from California.  My uncle liked the weekend thali special because it included a complimentary glass of champagne.  His girlfriend liked it because it was all-you-can-eat.  I liked it because even the thali special wasn't bad.  One of the dishes, the lentil soup, left a great deal to be desired, but everything else was fresh and tasty.  When the lunch special is mostly good and nothing makes you shudder, then the regular menu is usually superb.  I also like that they do a lunch-wallah card delivery service to UNLV.  I might consider it next semester.

opJYwZZAX_Z2iQWdava0jw.text: this place is not to shabby. went for the lunch buffet which was good. the quality of the food was pretty good. the service was great. wish they had more of a variety. meaning not the same type of food everyday, (ate here about 2 different times). the naan here seems to be doughy. its a thick piece, im not sure if they make it like this because they are from a different region but i've had some where it was more on the thinner side. wouldn't mind coming here again. definitely enjoyed my food here.

R_6H0CJOJZMLeJlYktR69g.text: I'm from the San Francisco Bay Area, the hub of Indian restaurants in America but Ion my trip to Las Vegas,  I have found Himalayan Cusine to be the best by far.  DO NOT GO ANYWHERE ELSE FOR INDIAN FOOD!!!!  Their Buffet is fantastic!!   Be sure to try their Mango ice cream, it is heavan.

fbQ1NIS6pesxDqWmjKDL5A.text: Five enthusiastic stars for Mint Indian Bistro!! We dined here last year when it was called Himalayan Cuisine and had a memorable meal. Regretfully, it took us a year to come back. A year in which we undoubtedly missed many more memorable meals. We were greeted immediately upon entering the restaurant and were seated in what I would call the 'choicest table' (actually a corner booth). Our waiter was extremely pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu which was to be expected. We each asked for suggestions, stating preferences and dietary restrictions, and we felt our waiter nailed it as we were all thrilled with our order. I, especially, appreciated the vegetarian and vegan selections. The food was nothing short of heavenly and the naan  could not have been more perfect. The somosas? To die for! Service was expeditious and expertly executed. I would also like to point out that rice comes FREE with the entrees unlike many other Indian restaurants in Las Vegas (which I refuse to patronize for that very reason). The ladies room was immaculate (always a good sign). I cannot wait to go back and try the lunch buffet at Mint. I am an extremely picky diner who expects both top-notch cuisine AND a 'dining experience'...Mint Indian Bistro delivered both handsomely. Five HUGE stars!

JQEmxwsCfc2-QRc7gvaQ1g.text: I've been to Himalayan Cuisine several times now and I've gotten to know almost every item on the menu and especially the owner Rajan. The atmosphere is always relaxing to me even though the place has gotten much busier lately and theres a lot of hustle and bustle. The waiters are definitely not on ceremony and I've had the pleasure of the owner sitting down with me when it was nearing closing hours and offering up a cool new beer or wine on the house. The menu has changed twice since I started coming here and it seems to get better and better. I've never seen the ripped booths that was mentioned by a previous reviewer, but perhaps that was fixed up already. I especially like the Swordfish Vindaloo, the Mighty Momos, and my favorite of them all... the Lamb Sekuwa! I've always hated lamb but this is the exception. As a rebuttal to the previous post stating that the owner was doing business on the premises - on two separate occassions I've witnessed the owner Rajan doing business with a wine representative who had brought samples, and in both occassions he ended up doling out wine to his customers and I felt it created a very friendly and congenial atmosphere. True, it may not be professional, but I've never liked the waiters that stand on ceremony and I like this intimate and friendly atmosphere better. In anycase, the food is superb, and I find the wait staff very friendly and knowledgeable. The beers are without compare in Las Vegas - some very hard to find microbrews and foreign brews.

P7VKLI8KEoKdhvPp915c7w.text: when in Vegas if u want Indian food only place to eat is this ..,...Best Indian food in town.....tried their lunch buffet surprisingly it's very good.....just that the chicken curry(Andhra curry) as stated in buffet tasted more of Goan style otherwise impressive menu. Great service and clean place.....

920rIwpTIdpe-zIu1qsuGA.text: My husband and I went here on a Wednesday evening around 6 p.m.  The restaurant was fairly busy with both dine-in customers and a to-go line.  They also seemed understaffed, and worst of all, the waiters use iPads to take your order, which seemed to be more of a burden for them than a time-saver.  Our waiter seemed like he cared but was overwhelmed.  Some other members of the staff, however, seemed the opposite.  Part of the reason we tried this Indian restaurant was because it has a full bar.  Unfortunately, simple mixed drinks took between 10-15 minutes to arrive at our table.  I would not recommend ordering any of the more elaborate drinks on the menu because the wait time would probably be even longer.  We ordered naan, an appetizer, and two entrees.  They brought out the naan first, then 10-15 minutes later, only one entree.  Then we waited about ten minutes for the second entree.  Thankfully, we were sharing both things, or this would've been way awkward.  At this point, we still hadn't received our appetizer, so we asked the waiter to please cancel it.  The food was actually quite great.  We ordered the Chef's special lamb kabob and the Vertical Vindaloo with chicken thigh, and they were both excellent.  The vindaloo was not saucy enough for my liking, and the "Full" size was rather small for the price.  Other than that, we weren't disappointed by the actual food, despite its strange delivery times.

LmfnXzQSq4GDEloVjbcGLA.text: Nasty food I ever had. They serve stale food. Food is severely bad. When I complain to manager he was  very Rudy. Hate this place!!!... Don't waste your time and  $

QdtsHV8KyILlJ4UTQ6ALVQ.text: Food was good. We ordered to go. It was fresh and tasty too. I will definitely go again

Z9slWkoYaT8J5MtuFtOwAg.text: Excellent indian food! Had the tandoori chicken and the saang with lamb. The chicken cooked perfectly. The saang had big chunks of flavorful lamb, not overpoweringly gamey. The garlic naan...awesome! They also have an extensive beer collection. Its a small place and its pretty busy so i recommend making a reservation. We waited about 20 minutes, but it was worth it. This is my go to spot for indian food in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peefectly seasoned and cooked tandoori chicken...awesome
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a good STRONG beer 9% ABV....Stout

G99hsQcyTFTU2Z5R2_UJCQ.text: So, I went here with one of my friends and I was really excited for the place. We are seated relatively quickly and it takes awhile to finally get menus from our waiter. That did not really bother me too much. But, it gets better.   After ordering a series of dishes, it takes unusually longer than it should have. And, when we got our food, there was hair in the Chicken Tikka Masala and Rice. Yes - three hairs in each one. I was shocked and disgusted at this. We immediately inform the staff of this and receive a half-baked apology. But, they replace it with no problem. We get the food back, but now our Naan is cold. So, we ask for the Naan to be warmed or get new Naan. They oblige and we get new Naan. My friend takes a bite into his potatoes that we got and there YET AGAIN another hair. But, this one being smaller. I have never been to place that allows its cooks to leave hair in the food. It is very careless of them.   I was expecting amazingly service, but was met with subpar service. I expected amazing food, but I was met with hair in the food. I will not be back here. Too gross to eat hair in the food.   Foodies BEWARE!

htyIC19pFOUzx1RTp4JQ9Q.text: Pretty good place. their menu is a very unique as every dish can be made with veggies or meat. Their drink offerings feature Lassi with Vodka or Tequila. Very unique in that regard. We tried the Goat Rogan Josh, Mango Mahakali, Chow Mein and their soups. Everything was delicious with the right flavors, the service was quick and folks were polite. And the portions are just about right. Be sure to reserve a table ahead.

gKC0tHxRut5FS-DUFM7x1A.text: Wish I could give a NO STAR rating !! I came here a year back and the food was pretty good, so I decided to take my friends here. I was highly disappointed by the quality of food !! The Gulab Jamuns seemed like stones, the chicken tasted like it was cooked a year ago ! To sum it up, one of the worst buffets i've been to in a while

U2y70OLa3JdiAxCkZ8sV1w.text: Very good lunch buffet, highly recommend it.  Lots of options, including South Indian and Punjabi.  Very nice from the inside.

tiqb1xTGMl_XQ7Um3uHvug.text: Mint is the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas! Before the remodeling, there was a big Buddha head at the counter to greet you when you walked in. It has since been removed to the side of counter but no biggie. At least it is still there :) The food, of course, is great! We always get the organic somosa, veggie pokoda, and a masala dosa. Always hot, fresh, and good. Make this a spot on your list if you are going to Las Vegas.

iBhmTvK6nbTvf6cexGugsA.text: Consistently great food...  Buffet is always fresh! Their choice to maintain a certain level of heat in their dishes is a risk..  But worth it to those of us that enjoy good Indian food!!

FIzlOTeDobR0SWatjOvldg.text: Don't go. This is short review. Paid over 65$ for three to go males. When I picked up the food. The guy opened the bag showing me the items unopened. I went back to my hotel room toy three kids and wife, I was shocked. The food was not enough for two. When I ordered, I asked if all three males come with rice. the guy from the restaurant said yes. When I opened the bag only one small bowl was there. The one star because the sample food we eat tasted good.

l-wrZhZS1G1GEj-zSOpxrw.text: Lunch buffet was good, tasty and of correct price. Each dish had it's unique taste and never felt it was just dumped to add up to the buffet list.

2eubeRMur24oPjZAtnFxyg.text: We made a reservation last night for 8pm on the OpenTable app while we were out running errands. When we arrived, every table was full and the manager expressed that he thought the reservation was for 8:30. I pulled up the email and he apologized profusely. They seated us to the side with menus while they figured out where to put us. The manager continuously apologized and we were seated within 20 minutes of our reservation, with drinks (which we ordered while we were waiting) and papadum arriving quickly.   My husband is still coming to terms with Indian food (he was convinced he hated it when what he really dislikes is curry, so he's been slowly discovering things that aren't curry), so we ordered the Indian sampler to give him the widest range of options. At least one other reviewer suggested that this wasn't enough food for two, but we found it to be more than worthwhile. True, there were no leftovers, but that isn't what we were expecting. The tray is artfully presented. Each item comes in its own small, circular metal container with naan in the center and extra rice on the side. The containers are easy to pick up, which is really useful when sharing. There isn't really enough naan for two, but our second order came out fast and warm.  Everything expect the vegetable curry was a little mild for my taste, but that was the price I paid for sharing with someone who asked for medium.  I had the lychee rum lassi. I really like the idea of alcoholic lassis, but the lychee flavor was a little mild. I think I'll start with a stronger base flavor next time. Lychee was too delicate.  I had the lunch buffet a while ago and came back based on that. It was definitely worth it.  They did rush us out without be drink menu I asked for after we finished our khir, but when I saw the grandmas in saris sitting outside in a line about five tables deep, I decided that my darjeeling would be just as good brewed at home. They were apparently the place to be on Christmas Eve.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian Sampler. We were happily surprised that the sampler&#39;s naan was garlic.

4EFfuUsAYuV3dE8AF6uuUw.text: Good wholesome buffet selection. Lassi and chicken tikka masala were good. Garlic nan another plus. Good attentive staff.

n6rcZH-_SSvbHIuAQPQHrg.text: Fantastic Indian food. I tried the minced chicken uttapam. Really well made and fills you up pretty well.  The ambience is fantastic and the service is courteous too.

KtmkCo5kbFsbyrUrZ3k4qw.text: This place is overrated! We went for the lunch buffet, food was cold and so was the staff. I was waiting for my drink order for close to 20 minutes. They acclaim for their lassi bar , but my suggestion would be to stay away from it. Rather go for any other indian place in your own city/ town inspite of trying it in las vegas.

gmAWo0W-rlzOlmEd2Th9sA.text: After spending a week in Vegas on the strip, a few of us wanted to unwind with a more flavoured meal in quieter surroundings. We could not have picked a better place - the decor is fine, and it is a very relaxing environment - a far cry from the hustle and bustle of the strip.   We started with popadoms and samosa chat. For the mains we had goat biryani, makhni daal, karahi chicken and garlic naan. It was all very well prepared and presented. The 'hot' dishes were a bit mild for my taste, but after a week of eating at the hotels, it really was a joyous dinner.   The service was absolutely top notch and waiters made sure we were looked after without being over-imposing.   All in all a great place to go and eat when in Vegas if you're looking for great food and the opportunity to unwind.

bCle-QyIK2p-js_cMxQcZA.text: With delicious food, intense spice, and great service, what more could you ask for. I've been for the lunch buffet, dinner, and the inferno challenge all are great. But don't try the inferno if you don't regularly do crazy ghost pepper level spicy...I don't care how tough you think you are  this will destroy you!  A mango lassi  is always a good idea. Thanks.

sb34gYfvGiTv8d5v8k02LQ.text: Great lunch buffet with a large selection of various entrees and a reasonable price. The garlic naan bread was great.  If you are looking for a great lunch buffet, you need to give this place a try.
