ahYflkCVERjt6b-pHfs6ww.text: I honestly never been a fan of Indian food until I have tried this place.  It's small inside and I would only recommend coming for dinner. I came for the Buffet because I was so hungry, it wasn't horrible but knowing what they can actually cook up kinda disappointed me. So dinner time, The garlic naan is just amazing! And chicken tiki masala....fresh and so great. :)  Customer service is great as well!

7YoUzPsP9IM3kb5bIoWwlw.text: Great food and very friendly staff.  I was very happy to such a veriety of vegetarian and vegan options. Got the vegan taster menu and was very happy with it.

8x7dDLdDuZkvuf0j6YojFw.text: My husband & I have been looking for an authentic Indian restaurant for awhile...look no more we found it in this place.  Everything we ordered Was perfect. I really  liked the garlic naan bread. Only complain I have is the portion size for entree could be a little bigger for the price. This won't stop us from coming back, I am looking forward to trying the Chicken Tika & Tandori.   AMBIANCE : Fantastic - very hip with waiters all dressed in black & white  Thank you to  my friend Tana that turned me on to this delightful place

Jjjw72zZg4YYdM9yPMta7w.text: Again "She decided she wanted a Vegan meal". Mint immediately came to mind.  I repeat: "We were quite pleased with everything about Mint from the food through the service to the check."

pFlHcpEJi0SAykWYv2yuPA.text: My husband got our Indian fix at this great restaurant off the strip. You know you'll be getting authentic Indian cuisine when 80% of the customers are Indian. We ordered the butter chicken, aloo gobi, deep fried okras and naan. The food and service was great!  We will definitely visit again when we're back in Vegas.  Why 4/5? I wasn't a fan of the deep fried okras; it tasted a bit charred. The menu was extensive and a little overwhelming. It was difficult to make a choice. We thought it was a little bizarre to see Asian fusion dishes, since none of the Indian restaurants in Vancouver, BC do that.

K9P-7vUF0YJVzHady1NeIg.text: We had to wait for 45 minutes (it was 10 pm and couldn't find any Indian restaurants nearby) before they found us a table. We gave our order while we were waiting but it still took a long time for them to deliver our food even after providing a table.   We tried few chicken curries, chicken biriyani and chicken fried rice. None of the food items were good. Biriyani and fried rice almost tasted the same. Chicken curry was also not good  You order cone dosa for your kid, you get Ketch up instead of Sambar and Chutney..  Two good things - Ambience and Dosas  Will try for better restaurants...

My0XYkQn2jsj-cBMJ1W7UA.text: Parking is very limited. I would recommend car pooling if you are coming with a group. The inside is very quaint. They even have a cute little patio. I went during the lunch buffet and it was pretty good.   I may be butchering the name of this because my phone autocorrected to Andrea and now I can't remember what it was called, but the Ankur? chicken curry was amazing. Chicken literally melted in my mouth. The flavor was perfect. By far my favorite item. The chicken chili was also pretty good. Pieces of chicken made with chopped up chunks of red and green bell peppers. Reminded me of chicken Jalfrezi. Chicken Tikka Masala was a different color than I've normally seen. It was ok but I think I had a hard time getting past the way it looked. I just couldn't' eat it. I prefer mine to be more consistently creamy and a little darker in color. This one was almost the color of salmon.  The Chicken Ttandoori was as good as I've ever had before, definitely worth it.  I didn't see Raita on the buffet line. I probably could have asked for it, but they were really busy and I didn't want to be a bother.   I guess I was really thirsty because I finished my first glass of water quickly, instead of refilling it the server set a carafe of water on my table. Now that I think of it, he never asked me what I wanted to drink. Good thing I wanted water because that's what he brought me.   The Naan could have been better. It seemed to be a little dry or hard. I don't think it was fresh. They were a lot of veggie/vegan options and the ones I tried were pretty good (Potato, Sag Aloo and a few others)  Bathrooms are small, only one stall per sex.

7iNDVNB9n4_A35BPY0wARA.text: I am a big fan...or should I say my friend is a big fan and I tag along...so...Lunch buffet is a good deal....the Indian beer is not....that said- they do have a good selection of craft beer...

mQSp86JZPl41uYxWNlxPpg.text: Good service and delicious food! Loved the buffet they served today (Sunday). Highlights were the Veg Korma and dal. Non-veg dishes could've been better

UK6rto13WJvB2yf4wI8kBg.text: Excellent Indian food in Las Vegas. Nice ambience, tasty food, close to the strip, perfect combination. We always eat here once whenever visiting Las Vegas. Also, they serve few Jain dishes on the menu. It is rare to find South Indian food in Las Vegas. There are lot of North Indian restaurants and it becomes monotonous. This place is a nice change in taste with lot of customizations possible in every dish.

-3-rBoTaU5bKlleskePExg.text: I've been craving Indian curry for the longest! and Mint always satisfies my "fix".  Service: our waiter was patient and answered every question I had. refilled our drinks in a timely manner. Offered rice when I was running low. He was awesome.  Food: We ordered chicken tandoori, lamb korma, garlic naan and lamb samosa. Chicken was cooked perfect, succulent white and flavorful. Korma was so good that I took a piece of bread to scrape off the last drop. garlic naan..who doesn't like garlic bread? The samosa was ok. Nothing to rave about but still completes the experience.   I can't wait to try their lunch buffet. if your on the east side of town..come check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5px8hZsQ-ppTxKKC5UcQ5A.text: My rare 5 stars go to Indian Bistro.  Their goat curry and veg dishes are to Devine.   Goat is the best in US I would say.   Food is not greasy or too heavy which is just perfect.  If you are in Vegas try their buffet which I just had. Money very well spent indeed.

YnZLL9KJkHw0B239QiBdnw.text: All i can say its the worst one i have seen in my life. They are extremely slower than the sloth. No one will listen to you,after calling so many times they will come to you. There will be 8-9 servers in the front desk but no one will care about you,they will be busy in their talks. Coming to the food, not at all good. Chicken pakoda was like chilli pakoda,thick layer of gram flour. Biryani was too oily tasted like fried rice. At the end the gulab jamun,which they put in microwave for 5 minutes and the result was it became like a chewing gum and too hot that we have wait for it to cool down little so that we can eat it.

6R1IoAaHHlRqn_A-akB7Mw.text: Friend took me today for lunch, we had the buffet, I  sampled most everything,  I really enjoyed the goat curry the best. Only my second time having Indian food so I can't name the other dishes but everything was pretty tasty, I'm a Texas girl by birth so I loved the little spicy dishes  best. They offered us bread as we ordered but it didn't arrive until our  2nd trip to the buffet,  but definitely loved  it when we got even though I was totally full by then..the busser spilled water allover my friend as we were waiting on the waiter to return with the change..other than those two mishaps I would have given a better rating..that was the  service not the food...service 2 1/2 stars......food 4 stars.

6GuR3jeFZJZGXkKruulIgw.text: I found the food to be excellent; there are a lot of options they can tailor the spice level per your desire. It is a small restaurant though; not too many tables and it gets packed. The problem I have with this place is the lack of parking space. You may have to park further away and walk over.

xxlx7IGmIjqg4HjR-ujtUA.text: Their lunch buffet is affordable & offers really good selections, especially their chicken masala with the complimentary naan!

mA9SHs0uoj7aEZXzoDCIAA.text: 2 stars just for service..food was sub par..portions reduced...prices inflated...my curry was meh at best... The desert was soggy..

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gulam jamoon ..soggy ..and this tiny portion for a dessert..come on

jVAZMBPpdAsXa_Lusc0tBw.text: Over priced food that isn't worth the hype.   We ordered the variety platter for two that included appetizers and dessert because we wanted to try as much food as possible.  Their  tandoori chicken is really good, but nothing else was impressive.   Our search for the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas continues!

PWSE0r58RJbGb1W2yE_Tjw.text: Best Indian restaurant for buffet in Las Vegas, Great food for reasonable price. I was impressed with the cleanliness and how quickly they refilled the items in the buffet even on a busy day

66_UOCmLuc04-9PBp3IWxQ.text: Friends brought me here who were in the know. Indian friends of theirs had recommended it.  We were not disappointed!  The atmosphere is elegant and the food is delicious.   We started with samosas and a dosa.  The samosas were tasty and the potato-filled dosa was excellent!  We also got yellow dal, raita , naan and tandoori chicken. It was all delicious.  The chicken was succulent and all was well prepared.  The service was very good and friendly.  Next time I go to Las Vegas I will make a point of going there.

oM5zMwZ3YshrMBkzS9JRbg.text: Stopped by Mint based on the reviews here while in Vegas. Interesting menu (want it with meat? Vegan? Just vegetarian? Just ask!) so I tried some things I don't usually order at other Indian restaurants - a noodle dish called Chau Chau, Rebel Chicken Curry, and dal soup. Everything was very good - very different mix of spices than I'm used to at other Indian restaurants, and obviously freshly prepared.  The only negative was that one person in my party ordered channa masala mild, and it came out quite spicy (and she wimped out and didn't send it back).

NCCl_04slWFqfeQrC1566A.text: One of the best indian restaurants,I have been to. Hopefully they open one up in san jose. Naan was fresh, vegetarian curries are well made and spiced to excellence. I want to give 4.5 for this restaurant.ambience is also very good.I would recommend it to my friends visiting las vegas.

kmOR9RIQEeAsgBrID12b_g.text: As usual everything was delicious!  We get the watermelon mintini, chicken tika masala, palak paneer, lamb vindaloo, vegatable raita, and the bhatura, (Sp?). Whatever we don't finish we bring home and it tastes even better the next day!

5Gvb9a7i0mvjRt1sOFXG7g.text: The best Indian food I've had in Las Vegas so far.   Don't get me wrong, Mint Bistro's food is not the best Indian food one can find, but well above, for instance, Gandhi Indian Bistro, which is just a short distance to the west.  Four stars is probably a little high for the food, more like three and one-half. The cons: in every chicken dish that I've tried, the chicken is overcooked. I routinely expect that in chicken tandoori, but not in tikka masala, or even the chicken chili at Mint Bistro. Additionally, the food is definitely toned down for American tastes. I have to load up on the chili paste at the salad bar.  I do the recommend the chutneys here, all of them but especially the mint and coconut chutneys.  The service and smiles on the staff merit five stars. I like to see happy people in a restaurant. That makes me believe the management cares enough to consistently produce a good product.  Finally, the beer selection is very good, though for some odd reason, Mint Bistro carries no American beers, not even some of the premium micro-brews.  I definitely recommend Mint Bistro and my criticisms are only offered in the hope that the management will strive to improve the minor deficiencies I have listed.

4Xfot3sweP-3_lASC78W9A.text: Good food, no parking problem. One of the best Indian restaurants in Vegas.

RKLvEr8RoW_SbkZARXk2Vg.text: We were the only patrons on our visit, so the service was first rate!  Appetizers were flavorful, including the MoMo's that we tried.  I didn't realize the Nepalise element here (Turkey on the menu at Indian places is odd!) but the food was very good overall.  Beer selection was impressive but I didn't have the right circumstances to participate in that.

umv7ADyJT_OQpKowKKjvUw.text: Waited for 10 minutes despite reservation.  No problem, but at least they could have offered us something to drink.  The host and others were very nice and cordial.  We ordered and waited 40 minutes for our food.  It was myself, my wife and our little boy.  The food was awesome.  They were a little skimpy with the Basmati rice and brought some more when we asked.  The beer selection is impressive.  We will go back.

BLsanhmCPMM9qEwEJJDOrw.text: Was looking for a lunch place near the National Atomic Testing Museum and up popped Mint on Yelp. Good choice.  The lunch buffet at $11 was more than we are used to paying but there were more and more-varied selections.  Everything was good but be warned, a lot of things were HOT!  (Even the saag was hotter than the chicken vindaloo!)  They have a large selection of beers and wine, including organic choices, and lassi cocktails.  The bill for 2 buffets and 2 glasses of Loma Larga chardonnay came to $50.  I wouldn't make a special trip here if we return to Las Vegas but I can recommend it if you are in the area and have a hankering for Indian.

ghYZ_IcP8fUuCNh3m-rGqA.text: Indian buffet has always been a noun combination I could get behind.  Or into my belly.  And then I did!  For ten bucks I consumed heartily a fine assortment of deliciousness.  I wish I had more to say, but really, I enjoyed everything I popped on and in!

yhCWYNxxyOocHxMjctwPzw.text: the shittiest indian food you can get anywhere. being from india, i know what the food is supposed to taste like. the food never tastes fresh and mostly smells bad, the desserts being the major disappointment. the service is real poor and during buffets, u have to wait for ages for just the bread. the food overall seems to be cooked in a jiffy using cheap spices and paying minimum attention to taste. hygiene has been my major concern lately, as the food gave me a bad stomach.   the website does not allow a NEGATIVE rating, or I would have gone for that.

E_QeB26JQRg31vk12BkPOQ.text: I like this place and dine there frequently. It's almost always quiet and empty, which I like. The menu is cleverly written and the food has never disappointed me.  Try the makhani!  Service can be a little uneven. Sometimes they will bring dishes without serving spoons, or present a shared appetizer without plates so you have to ask for them. At times I've had to flag them down to get the check.   Sometimes the kitchen is a little odd. The menu says the tomato soup has paneer, but I recently ordered it and it came without it. So I had them redo it. I was there again last week and as I was ordering the soup I asked about this, and had to point to the menu where it says the soup has paneer. No really, it says paneer, I like paneer, bring it to me with the paneer!  I am a little worried about them, however . . . they used to have the biggest beer list in Las Vegas, but now if you want to order beer, they are out of stock of almost everything on the list. They point you to a table where you can look at what is available, and I'd guess there are less than ten selections. Not a good sign that they are not sticking to the brand promise of an amazing beer list. Times are tough I guess, and no one wants to order expensive inventory that is going to sit.

LKtMj6BLLsoRMB6E3y2EQA.text: Very disappointing lunch buffet! Was here for the Christmas weekend, looking for some good Indian vegetarian food. For a cuisine that's so exquisite and simple at the same time, the preparation can't be worse than this. Dal was about the only thing that was good. Bad selection of vegetable entrees and the dishes were very watery. Friends who tried the meat entrees were completely unhappy as well and had the same complaints. The pulav and the gulab jamun was hard and dry. The manager/owner had a bad attitude and was not treating his employees well which ticked us off the most. The lassi bar was a disappointment barring the salt lassi. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

ZSa0CAF-S6QR21NgFp3OJQ.text: This place was a frickin GEM found right closely off the Vegas strip. Authentic, delicious Tibetan/Nepalese food & very testy mango lassie... try the Nepalese dinner (for two) its was perfect, even for 3 people.

XFwI7WFmrVcIHEotWPWxNg.text: I can't stop going back!  $8.99 for students!  All you can eat!  Why not!  I love the chicken pakora with mint chutney and the rice pudding!

_J8I0xTKbGhDtVUtF6Bsdg.text: We had the vegetarian sampler. Plentiful quantity for two people and every dish was very tasty..

Hw1oarAP69d61TByJoraHQ.text: I visited Mint Indian Bistro with a friend and found the waiting staff to be quite attentive. My friend scarfed down the onion and cilantro naan and my lamb vindaloo was good. They have Indian and Nepalese food. Their imported drink menu was very extensive. The decor is above average for an Asian restaurant. Their booths are cozy and would be great for a date. If I lived in Las Vegas, I would certainly be visiting this restaurant often.

R63rl7NhTdBBrUVfnGRM1w.text: Just had the lunch buffet. The service was good & the food was delicious!! I'll definitely be back!

ciioS3DlDMJHUFc9pis1TQ.text: Service is very friendly, 1 million times better than the Indian restaurant we go to in LA valley. The green cilantro dipping sauce for the pappadams is super fresh. Soups are so good served steaming hot tried both the dal & the bean & lentil. Love the $10 AYCE lunch buffet, items change daily, so I need to keep going back to catch the chana masala. Just wish tney offered dosas as part of buffet but they do have an AYCE dosa nite. But there are always vegan options available on buffet & those soups, salad & fresh papadams. definitely a return to place.

JB_nTavhNyLgDxHYNUyKPA.text: Mint Bistro is an unassuming gem in the University section of Las Vegas.  Right across the street from UNLV on Flamingo, Mint Bistro is one of the best Indian restaurants in town.  The University/ Paradise section of town already has around 5-6 great Indian restaurants, but Mint Bistro is the best.    The outside of the restaurant makes you think that it is a take-out restaurant, but once you walk in you will feel welcomed by the comfortable Indian decor.  I have been to Mint Bistro about 5 times, and have always had great food.  My favorite dish is the Saag Paneer, which is house-made Cheese sauteed with spinach.  They make a very good version of one of my favorite Indian dishes.  I also really like the Mango Masala with Chicken.  This dish combines the classic flavors of a Chicken Masala with the sweet Mango flavor.  The other dish I usually try to get is the Rebel Curry.  Very flavorful, but spicy, curry, served with your choice of meat.  If you are a vegetarian, Mint Bistro has many options for you, but if you eat meat you have many options, too.    Mint Bistro also has a great selection of Belgian Beers.  My favorite that I had was the Duchesse de Bourgogne, but they have many more.  Although it sounds random for a Indian restaurant to have a great selection of Belgian beers, they have some of the best I have seen.  Definitely try the great pairing of the beer with the Indian food.    If you are looking for Indian and Nepalese food with a twist, definitely try Mint!

vpdsI298MXXlawgX-aKNBA.text: This place was soooo good idk how to put it into words lol! We found Mint on Restaurant.com, and I'm so glad we did because it was just awesome! My wife and I live and San Diego and none the Indian restaurants there come close to this place! We ordered the Veg samosas and cheese naan and my wife had the chicken tikka masala and I had the chicken vindaloo, and everything was so good! I seems like lots of places are too cheap or afraid to use a good amount of spices, not this place they make it good and make it right! And the service was awesome as well!!

BMUGD1B8URaJelylX37F3Q.text: First time here, clean and delicious!!! I had the lunch buffet for 12 bucks, totally worth it. GREAT vegetarian options, fresh food, full of flavor and the Knaan bread was made to order and soooo good!

WPDN-2Y-HtVIoaRnLHZyEw.text: Flavors are terrific, service capable, ambience ok. The key to any ethnic restaurant is patronage. Many South Asian folks present. Next time, we'll try the Chef's menu. Our 4 dishes totaled a bit high. An informed diner needs to know.

7q02gwgTrkm-BPCJE87Ipg.text: The best Indian food in Las Vegas. Tons of Vegetarian and vegan options. Tons of chicken and lamb options. If you have never tried Indian food, there are several options that will get you introduced  to it with familiar flavors. They really do have something for everyone. They have easy to read descriptions and so many different flavors to choose and love. They only think that isn't 5 stars is the cocktail menu. The descriptions are nice but the flavor is just OK. Stick to the virgin Lassi or their nice beer selection for better options.  It has been fairly or very quiet every time I have gone and the service is always friendly and excellent.  You can control the spice of your food as well on a 1 to 10 scale. I usually go with an 8 or 9 depending on the dish. Good spice with excellent flavor. Great for a date night or to try somewhere new.  Food is 4-5 every time, Drinks are 3 to 5 and service has been 5 every time so a 5 it is for being the best Indian food in Vegas.

7JmzlhUbTFThLG2PB1LFaw.text: I am soo in love with this place!!! If I lived in the area, I know I'd come back all the time! Although their menu is quite large, they offer a useful & effective ordering system - Aside every menu item comes a list of options for how you would like your order prepared (i.e. with or without butter, onions, garlic), what you would like in it (cheese, veggies, chicken, lamb, fish), & the size/ cost (half or full order on some things), etc. with a really cute/ funny description of each dish. Some key symbols you will see throughout the menu are "V" for Vegetarian, "Vn" for Vegan, "G" for Gluten-free, "J" for Jain (w/out onions & garlic), & "N" for nut-related products, as well as "H" for choices that are considered healthy. Although this may not be of concern to some people, I found it to be very helpful & this made it much easier for me to order my food exactly how I wanted it.  For my dinner, I tried the Vertical Vindaloo w/ Fresh Veggies & Veggie Tikka Masala Curries w/ Paratha. I enjoyed both dishes & was really glad I went with the Paratha instead of the usual Naan since I love Whole Wheat products & wanted to try something different. Also, I love that they carry brown basmati rice & even give you a side of regular white basmati rice when you order curry, as most places I've been to have not done this. But, keep in mind that half orders of curry are probably smaller than you might think, so it's probably best to place full orders since their dishes are so good anyway! In addition to the rice & noodle dishes, soups & salads, & curries, they also have some good-looking dosas & condiments like tomato, mango, or coconut chutney for only 1$ :)  Our service was very nice & attentive too; We had multiple people check on us throughout our meal & each brought us everything we asked for w/out any problems. I had a really good experience here & can't wait to come back!

OAPrtYG8aq_uZnt4bT2GEg.text: My husband and I eat Indian food around the world regularly. This is definitely one of our favorite Indian restaurants. My husband loves the beer selection, which is says is the best selection by far of any Indian restaurant we have been to. The food is fresh and the flavors blend well. They do a good job with take-out too. Thanks!

gXOoYhlmw6mtG0bRGkAn1A.text: Amazing food!!  three things you half to try is the chicken tikka salad, dosa, and chicken tikka masala! Most amazing flavor, service, also the mint lassi is the best drink. Good for groups. Kid friendly.So many choices on the kids menu! Definitely come and try this place!

mzbAC-eJxsw2uvgEVk-DJQ.text: After trying multiple Indian places throughout the Las Vegas valley, this place offers the best. I experienced their dining options and their buffet quite a few times. I really appreciate that they offer vegan and vegetarian options which is quite extensive. The food is fresh and bursting with flavor which Indian food is supposed to be about. There are layers upon layers of flavor from their most basic dishes to the not so well known dishes. The decor and atmosphere is soft and elegant. The staff are attentive and very welcoming. This place can get very busy during dinner hours so I do recommend calling ahead.

MauBzTBqpiH1GoaPA8-v0w.text: Obviously an Indian restaurant that can attract Indians to their location must be good. This is my 2nd time here and it's absolutely delicious. They extended their happy hour from 3pm to 3:45pm. It's $10 to $12 for all you can eat and it comes with freshly made naan of your choice.  The employees are very sweet and helpful. If you get a chance, eat here. It's amazing. I've had a lot of Indian food and this is classic, perfect Indian food. My only complaint, the mint sauce isn't my favorite. But it is fresh and does cleanse the palate.

CjU1Amfc5P2X_-_KnVapFw.text: It was a bright vegas night when i tried to catch some indian fare, and i was not disappointed. They had some of the juiciest chicken biryani and fried okra with yogurt. Their mint chutney was heavenly. and rightly priced. i would give it a second visit when i am back in the strip.

HkxaCJLXtA32Czenf46w4g.text: A pleasant surprise in a town with a ton of mediocre overpriced restaurants.  - $10.99 lunch buffet (including weekends)   - Vegetarian options galore     - Delicious food       - Best garlic naan I've ever had (made fresh to order and included)         - Constantly-refilled carafes of water (instant hangover re-hydration)           - Comfy and clean atmosphere  My only complaints were that there were no samosas and that I couldn't order off the regular menu during buffet hours.  While initially disappointed, the food on the buffet line was really great.

Xe6D2hvTaCjJSHK-kqaPvA.text: The BEST Indian restaurant in vegas! Great food. Extensive drinks menu. Great for vegetarians and ALSO meat lovers. Best kabobs and breads. I've tried a lot of Indian restaurants in vegas in the past and Mint is my every trip staple.

wafAu4c4ncPCWpbn1pKanQ.text: Excellent Indian food, quite a wide selection too! Good service, friendly professional staff, an imported beer collection to die for :-)

RNYt6BaModU-DpA1WNbyKA.text: This place serves halal meats which is a plus if you are looking for a zabihah restaurant.  The chikken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, and lamb vindaloo were all very good as was the naan, bhaji, and yogurt.  Kheer (indian rice pudding) was also very good.  The Indian dishes that we tried were among some of the best Indian items we had tried.  I recommend the Indian dinner plate special, which is $30 and contains about 7 or 8 items to be shared with another person.

30Z6DylZLoweQ8AO2SE4Wg.text: I wish this place wasn't so far away!  They make me want to be vegetarian.  They do have chicken and goat (which are delicious), but the vegetarian food is like no other.  They serve fresh bread, I usually go for the garlic butter naan.  For the drinks, I like the mango lassi because it thick and not overly sweet.    The decor is very special and feels warm.  It's a very simple restaurant, but I love it.    The waiters are quick to clean up finished plates.  I've only had the buffet here, which is about $10.  Very low price for delicious food.  In the buffet, each item is labelled with a lot of details, so you know exactly what you are eating.

Kirn9_swg0P6yzynOXK_Bg.text: This place always delivers in delicious food. The butter butter garlic naan was divine and the lamb lollipops were to die for. If you want some flavor this is the place to go!

k2HTyxvWX5mbXF_ZJrFsRw.text: I think this place far best indian food and most expensive in the town. I and my wife step in to the place with bunch of homeless people harassing to get some change in front of the place. But the place was packed and i was little bit hungry too. Their potions are small and you have to order at least four or five portions to get fillup your self, if you are two people group. do the math!! Mango lassi wasn't my best choice becos, of the old taste of mango i felt and other than that food taste was great. here is the critical part of this Indian restaurant, I gave the resturant.com gift card i bought and price went up including the gratitiuty charge 18% for two people..!! TWO PEOPLE GRATITIUTY!! cmon now.... i am not a stingy ass person and i told my wife to not bring that up either. She was angry. You dont want to make lady angry, means you lose your customers. So we are not going back to this place. even though they are good service and such....

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

07NQ3LCdYQQ76qHdmuwZHA.text: My fiance wanted to go to this place and I was a little nervous at first since I have not had not been to a good indian buffet in town and I had given up trying. I was really surprised when we got here though.   First all of the food looked really fresh, not like it had been made earlier this week and was reheated. Everything was very tasty and not spicy. I really enjoyed their mint chutney, spinach, pakora, tiki masala, goat, and garlic naan. (yes I did eat all of that for lunch, I know I'm a fatty). Only giving it -1 star for no samosas and the service was kind of lacking.

qkYl353Yp2GHM6B8y7P1MA.text: This is THE best Indian food restaurant currently around LV Strip. Food is super delicious with great hospitality - feels like home. Recommend it for the flavorful Indian food done right with welcoming and caring hosts!

rWDqKCzY_Yfk4s44RNve7A.text: This is the best Indian food in Las Vegas.. Hands down.   I travel all of the world and I'm careful saying something is good versus the best.   If your used to eating trash Indian food.. You won't like this place.   This is real Indian food.   You can am as judge an Indian restaurant by the number of Indians that come here as guests.   Every time I come here there are Indian families here.  The best part about it.. It's off the strip only 5-10 mins and most people are locals.   I have been coming here for years and seen these guy seen these guys grow.   They have  a huge beer list (exotic) beer.. Gluten free options.   Wife is gluten free so this place always is a must.   They are a hard working family that waits on every table regardless of who your server is.    I've eaten here about 20 times as its always consist.   They will also click a taxi for you that can get there in about 5-10 mins so no worries coming back.   If you have 4 or more... Plan on reservations.

x1uPep0kVtkzKaYzAyCR9A.text: Excellent service.  Excellent food.  the first visit we ordered the tasting menu.  We went back twice after that (during a one week visit to las vegas) and ordered our favorites from the first visit.  Tomato Soup, tikka masala, and spinach paneer.  Everything is excellent.

dSKMTRy50LPZ8P5iWsmxgw.text: Excellent food! Excellent customer service! Excellent restaurant vibe!   The place was very classy. Their Lassi Bar looked amazing! Quick service too: we came to the restaurant around 1030pm, got a full 3-course meal, and left by 1140pm! We didn't feel rushed at all. The staff was so friendly :) The food was the bomb!!! Our server asked us how "spicy" we wanted our dish and was able to accommodate our request.   Highly recommend: Butter Chicken, just because it's a classic! One of the best I tasted ;)

KCfswY1732TrECAUc6zokA.text: Food was okay, decor is nice, but the waiters seemed to be rude. Overall, not a very pleasant experience.

3TqQGDi6UdV1d3yUOxujGQ.text: All I really love in life anymore is Indian food. Everywhere I travel, I seek out Indian restaurants. I went to their masterful mega buffet. Mint was simply transcendent.

5GoD6V5O27dLYiRclbxtog.text: Ate lunch buffet here. Decent but doesn't really qualify for 4 stars, especially when we have a lot of great Indian options nearby.  Creative items like noodles - good try, but were not necessarily tasty. If it was done right my view would have been completely different.  Unlike most Indian restaurants, they do have a nice vibe there, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet

S3BLA17CXmNuJGn4_MzEvA.text: This is my second night here - chicken vindaloo was not great last night. Today we ordered yellow dal and Alu curry. Food is falvorful and delicious.

V0lWJ5FFIfCl3dmgUIufjw.text: I haven't been here since it was a Himalayan place. What took me so long to come here! I had stopped down the street at India Masala for Dosa Tuesday, only to find out their chef quit and they're no longer serving South Indian food. So I left and came here.  First thing that caught my eye was one their first page of the menu, inferno naan. YESSSS please. We were asked to sign a consent prior to ordering. What the? Made with ghost peppers and habanero chills, it came out looking so plain, but when you open up the naan, it was loaded with peppers.  I took one bite, it was horrid. I love spicy food, but I like a good taste with the spice. This was pure nastiness. I had to spit it out. My nose, lips and tongue immediately started burning, thankfully I had a full lassi in front of me that cooled down the heat.   Onto the next one. I was excited to see that they served Northern and Southern Indian food. I ordered my favorite, Mysore Masala Dosa, red chili chutney and potatoes, and onions. This was by far the best dosa I have ever had. The chutney served with it was really good as well.   We also ordered the lamb kabobs, these were nice and tender, great flavor too. Of course we had to order cheese naan, every americans favorite. I love naan. I could eat it for days.  The most exciting thing tho, they have a lassi bar! I tried the mango and rose lassi (two, don't judge). I love a good mango lassi. I've never seen a place have a lassi bar, there were so many different flavors to choose from. I will most likely be trying all of them.   I like this place, a lot. Good Indian food. I like that they serve both cuisines. Kinda like when you go to a Thai place and you can get Northern and Southern style. I like options.

iv2h0K8fVsKglKjuHpCosA.text: Love that they have vegan options! Food was delicious! The service was excellent! Enjoyed looking at the decor! The black current lassi was delish!

QpX8IhZtz9hizjkoIZzFZw.text: Delicious food.  One of the best mango lassi and fruit custard we had. Buffet had lot of items to eat. The food was really great and we enjoyed eating here...

0DF8Tp8okoOAjMB1eesaXg.text: I was never a huge fan of Indian food, until I was introduced to this place.and the bar has really been raised  I must warn you that this place is small and it will be busy. It was difficult to get a table and we went on a Tuesday.  The lamb lollipops were out of this world! I really enjoyed my meal. Our server was very attentive and treated us well.  If I ever get to Vegas again, I am returning guaranteed

20sGzibGRRkayvUalbryTg.text: We waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for our food! When we inquire about it they said that they are busy! and yet they serve the table next to us who just got there! The food is NOT good at all! To top it off,they charge my card twice!!!  I will not recommend and i will never go back.

o8N7_i5j185WxS-yI1lPPQ.text: This is probably the best Indian restaurant outside of a casino in Las Vegas. Extensive menu, high quality indian food and yummy lassi! :)

YiJkX1EVjVY9EvQVwL5B_w.text: Delightful!   Truly.   Great atmosphere, attentive,  but not over bearing service and DELICIOUS Indian food.  Flavours from Southern India AND Northern India are available as well as a few new twists on old favorites.  We enjoyed the pani puri to start,  Chicken Korma & Lamb Rogan Josh.  We played if safe on the heat scale at a 3 on the scale to 10 and we could have easily dialed it up a few notches.   And for real spice/hear lovers there is a separate menu of items called "Inferno"....needing a waiver to eat.   We'll be back.   Can't wait to try more on the menu, including the cherry lassi.

VOUIyCjAfbGBp1mFH69pDA.text: Great food,  they have lot of varieties for lunch buffet and the cost is also very reasonable.

YnAYp3RClHuaDTDENb3Rmw.text: Worst place ever!! Full of liars.. the folks that work here are very dishonest.. We have been to many classy Indian restaurants as we are from Silicon Valley, home to numerous Indian..  First, an employee invites us in by saying for kids it's half the price and for adults it will be the full price..  My kids ages, 8 and 10 are super poor eaters to begin with.. The reason I am sharing this info with you is so you know after we ate(we are very health conscious folks and don't eat much anyways to begin with)... the manager Biru brought the bill to us with full cost for all 4 of us. We requested to please explain the bill as they had mentioned something different for kids. Conveniently, he first asked how old my kids were and we told them.  After this, he stated that 3 and younger are free and 3-7ate half off! When I brought to his attention, he stated he couldn't do anything and the person who seated us didn't know anything.. anyways, long story short. Folks here are very unprofessional and liars.. Food is mediocre..  I don't recommend it and won't suggest it to anyone!!

7B9XOSCn4JwFsXsSDteAMQ.text: *went to DURANGO location**  Delicious!  We are vegan but anyone would have loved what we ordered!    Started with vegetable stuffed dosa that comes with 4 different dipping sauces.  Also ordered a cocktail recommended by our server Jay.  Five spice passionfruit mojito- I think- lol.  Had fresh ginger, star anise, mint, lemon,cherries.     After taking a look their menu we decided on the vegan prix fixe menu which was $42.99 for 2 people.  Each person got a bowl of tomato soup, shared an appetizer and then a a huge sampler entree of the veg korma, curry, dal, rice, pickled veg, roti and more.., and a dessert.  Everything was prefect.  The dessert that they normally serve with the vegan set menu they were out of though so they gave us some sort of mango sorbet.  It was so frozen that it was hard to eat with a spoon but I was so full it didn't matter.  One other downer is that we did have to ask a total of three times (two different employees) in order to get our bottle of sparkling water.  No big deal though, other than that we had atleast 4 different employees serve us, check in, help out.  Honestly if the service had been perfect I would say 5 stars.   Great staff and genuine.  We will be back.  Can't wait to try lunch buffet.

E6UtJuYXV3gCZHaHW1I1SQ.text: I came here with my family after my graduation ceremony. Considering we didn't have dinner reservations, we were seated in a timely manner and our order was taken promptly. However, after that we waited about an hour for any of our food come up. Once it did, all the dishes we ordered were satisfactory but I've definitely had better Indian food in the Bay Area.   One random thing I noticed was that the waiters all were obsessed with making sure our water glasses were full. While I appreciate the attentiveness, it began to disrupt our conversation which was a little irritating.

fmEKzexU1CdMfd3Al9-h3w.text: Food is Ok type. Disappointed with food wait time. Restaurant being half full it took around 1.5 hrs to get the food on the table. Poor service

tcO4P4HUf8syXS5unbXLJg.text: -Lunch Buffet Review - (TL;DR - I prefer my Indian cuisine to have lots of flavor, spices, and heat. Yet, sadly Mint didn't meet my requirements. The flavors here were too boring. Plus I had stomach pain soon after eating here. I won't be returning.)   We prefer Mt. Everest's lunch buffet - they have a better selection of flavorful curries and an overall better tasting selection of food. Also, their naan (even if they don't offer garlic naan for buffet anymore) was fluffy like pillows and had more charred stone oven flavor.   Maybe I'm the odd woman out and call me crazy, but I prefer my food to be exploding with flavor and rocking my taste buds off, you know, the type of flavor that punches you in the face. Especially when I'm in the mood for Indian cuisine, I expect bold spices and ingredients to jump out. Unfortunately, Mint didn't meet my requirements for a satisfying Indian buffet.  There was a scarcely detectable amount (if any) of spice used here, no layering of flavor, and specifically, no wow-factor. The selection here was poor and didn't offer up the typical items I was hankering for - Malai Kofta, Saag Paneer, or even Samosa, to name a few. The list goes on with my rants about this place.  Mint is also super sticky, right as I was seated, my silverware placed on the table was stuck like glue! I had to use some elbow grease to pick them up. Plus, I despise their buffet set up - you constantly have to touch the sticky germ-y handles to lift the lids up off of the trays on every single item, then use the spoon to scoop up your food. It was really gross touching the handles. Good thing I brought my wet-ones. The plates that they use gets hot instantly when you place hot food on it, so I had a hard time holding my plate without burning my hands. Also a pet peeve - they have Pepsi here and it's not fizzy at all, it was flat.   I only found 1 item from the buffet that was delicious enough for me to get seconds of, that 1 item was the chicken korma (cashew chicken curry.) Everything else was super bland, dried out, or boring.   Here's the breakdown of what I tried:   - Mint and tamarind chutney were both were refreshing and flavorful. They really helped to bring life to the boring curries and food.  - Coconut chutney was alright, but not something that I kept eating.  - Chicken korma - rich and sweet, also had tiny hints of spice which is why this was my favorite dish out of everything I tried.  - Saag mushroom wasn't my favorite. I really missed the cheese curds. There was no bold flavor, richness, or natural sweetness from the spinach. It was seriously bland and sad.  - Chicken tikka masala's flavor was muted. It tasted like bland tomato cream soup and lacked all of the rich luscious flavor that I've grown fond about tikka masala. I did not finish finish it. - Tandoori chicken was dried out and tough.  - Chile chicken had decent flavor, but they were super dry. - Veggie tikka masala flavor was very boring, just creamy, and no lively spices going on in there. - They offered yogurt, which is fine, but I was upset that they didn't offer refreshing cucumber raita. - Cranberry rice had colorful specs of carrot and peas, but it wasn't amazing or memorable. - Both the garlic and butter naan were dry, plus the garlic flavor was faint and the butter naan was boring.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L-R: pickle chutney, rice pudding, mint&amp;tamarind chutney (fave), chili paste, yogurt, coconut chutney, mango chutney.

We ordered rice mixed with lamb and the portion size mmm i cried what a waste of time and money Should have gone to our normal hang out eateries  Never again i will speed past their locations..fast..

kPFZ9_AhzaLJxjOTsY_fWQ.text: Great food, and service at a great price.  We ordered the 3 course meal (non-vegetarian), the tomato soup was devine, the Tandori chicken was the best I have ever had, spicy and moist.  Great beer and wine selection.  Highly recommend

9NzhiUnt2guUWOP8FmdlVA.text: Excellent buffet  Loved der mint chutney very much  Overall food is very good  Highly Recommend dis place  Best Indian food place in Vegas

YuDP-5mXNsf940bTeHJ3sA.text: Bar none - my favorite Indian food anywhere. Perfection! And be sure to get a mango rum lassi.

y66S-KgHuFFNA6HtJKWLqg.text: Do the lunch buffett! Great deal and everything is fresh and delicious. Best Indian food I have had in Vegas.

JV49-w-cfZVdJHDp-L0NbA.text: I've been coming here for years. Reliably good tasty dishes with appropriately rich sauces not overly spiced (to your spice number when ordered) traditional Lassi available as well as some variations.   Currently my favorite in / around the Strip and not too far from the airport grab a last great meal before you fly out!

nLecV_SbIEDGImOfcg0nfg.text: This is the best Indian buffet in Vegas. Completely worth it! Excellent taste and quality. Tandoori chicken is awesome and every single item is very tasty.

UlVChFj5m3bBmT4ED8kfow.text: I'm learning Vegas surprisingly has quite the Indian food dining scene, which is fantastic to say the least. My family and I were headed back to the strip (our home base) after a long but fun day at the west rim of the Grand Canyon. We knew we wanted Indian but the strip joints couldn't promise a 4-5 star meal. I did a quick search as we got closer and Mint was just a couple minutes away and seemed to have a good track record.   We arrived and were seated immediately. We were given a good amount of time to review their expansive menu which by the way is filled with more variety than I have ever seen in any Indian restaurant coming from Chicago. A lassi bar, lassi cocktails, various styles of naan, an inferno challenge - living upto the Vegas touch, foods labeled clearly as vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, Jain, etc. We ordered masala papad and sev puri as appetizers to start and both were above average. We felt the sev puri lacked much flavor. For our entrees we did paneer tikka, pineapple schezwan rice, fire roasted garlic naan, kabuli naan and bhatura. The paneer tikka was excellent - full of flavor, as was the naan and bhatura - yum! The rice was far too spicy to eat so I wish we hadn't gotten that and the kabuli naan tastes like desert so I wish I had passed on that because it was odd having to eat it with the paneer tikka.   Overall we had a great meal and were quite impressed with menu and selections, the ambience was nice and service was quick. There's definitely room for improvement however. I guess some of the busboys don't know English (they don't communicate this to us) so when we would order something with them a waiter would come and ask us again and everyone would be lost as to if someone was getting our order. It would be much simpler if those that don't know English would just grab someone that does or not work the floor. For drinks we saw lychee lassis on the menu and knew we had to have them, so we ordered only to find out they're unavailable along with the tandhai, two of their most unique flavors!!! I was so disappointed to learn this. The owner explained it's because they need someone to bring it from India whenever family or friends go which is hard to rely on, but then I feel the menu is a tease in that way. I feel when it's available they would make a "specials" menu for the month and include it on there. In that event I went with a rose lassi which was great, my got a mint lassi because again the uniqueness of flavors. Well that was a mistake. We were thinking mojito like sweetness in a mint lassi - we were very wrong. For those of you that know what the mint "pain" in pani puri tastes like, it's that, mixed with yogurt. Absolutely unpleasant in the context of a lassi. Regardless of the mishaps, we had a generally great meal and would definitely consider returning when back in town. Only a 5 minute drive from the strip, well worth it for the quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Masala Papad
Photo of Mint Indian Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papdi Chatt - A North indian Favorite

Kv5XWnioOtBQdPJLaRUBPA.text: I love Indian food but I have found that not all Indian restaurants can deliver.  Mint does deliver...and in a big way. The lunch buffet is definitely your best way to go. You can try many different types of Indian cuisine at one flat price.  Their servers are timely and attentive.  The staff go out of their way to accommodate you. They even made a bowl of fresh tikka chicken with no spice for the toddler with us. She thoroughly enjoyed it! Their food on the buffet is hot, fresh, and authentic.  I would like to see more paneer choices- i.e. palaak paneer and the location is a bit obscure but worth finding, as once you arrive, the inside is decorated nicely.  I love their fresh, garlic naan.  The dessert bar was very good, as well.  I highly recommend Mint.

Ms9whr7lOIDjT5m4ZCFZVQ.text: Good place for Indian food close to strip. Jamuns were great. So as idli. Subji gravy was too watery. Was expecting more Veg options. But definitely value for money. Be early for lunch buffet

_IQQzFqQlycCTbRxyljOLg.text: Went here for lunch the other day with some friends. Lunch is served buffet style (FYI). To my surprise, they had LOTS of delicious vegan options. I will be back soon for dinner!

fXnwJySlu_S5O_hKlkqoxw.text: By far the best Indian food you can get don't waste your time getting your Indian food fix on the strip if u have the ability to travel off the strip 5-10mins on Flamingo do it.....garlic naans with butter and chicken tikka masala  is the BEST, chicken tikka off the grill is a great starter b4 the entree, with a TAJ beer u can't go wrong. When ever we r in Vegas we always come here for at least 1 dinner.

eNlyZUWplqbgDUIPD_OjEg.text: As far as Indian food goes in Vegas, there are so many options. Mint is perhaps my favorite for dinner because of the WIDE array of options at various spice levels. The menu clearly labels what is vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free. You can get any kind of curry with any kind of meat (except beef- obviously), among various other things.    My husband and father tried the Inferno challenge- which is a challenge to eat whatever you want at the Inferno spice level made with ghost chilis. They did not complete the challenge, but my father took his portion home and used the delicious based to flavor home cooked meals.   I haven't had the lunch buffet, but I would prefer to order off of their extensive menu.

suZ6sRPKCK66Yaa4yCHHSg.text: We stopped by here for dinner after our long road trip. As I was craving for Indian food after 5 days of eating outside this was on point.. They also had hot chili menu I would love to try one time. The only upsetting point was a homeless lady outside the restaurant in parking lot. She was asking for money to everyone stepping in and out of the restaurant. Passing mean comments if people were not giving money.

IL34XoFeIPM2J-0MlmH6Cw.text: This was my first time ordering Indian food since I moved to Vegas a few months ago. While I'm used to the flavors of my former go-to place, this food was good. Ordered my usual saag paneer and chicken tikka masala along with naan, lamb biryani, and a plain dosa.   My only complaint is that I ordered from the website and it defaulted to this location when my intended pick up location was on Durango. This location was many, many miles from my house which was troublesome. Also, ordering was difficult as their website was not formatted for an iPhone browser and was sort of annoying to navigate.

dSAB7z9Qs8SnilJ4HidEYw.text: Nice elegant restaurant with friendly staff. Very neat. The food came in a very decorated manner. But the taste was a big disappointment. We ordered  Moscow mule, idli, karahi chicken and naan. Naan was small in size and the curry was lacking Indian spices. Thumbs up for the drink. Ordered kheer in the desert, felt like boiled rice in milk.  Will come back to give it a try again and order something else.

5ZGTjZ0_MhdGA0jtFEhURQ.text: Food needed more spice, low on salt and Indian spices. Value just isn't great for what your getting, look elsewhere for the best Vegas Indian buffet.

KMAO8qAWl3pEmrU9_MaLuA.text: One of the 2nd year pediatrics residents who is Indian recommended Mint to me, so I decided to check it out. I came during lunch, during which food is served buffet style. It's a little pricier than most other Indian lunch buffets I've had ($12.99 here), but I will admit that the quality is quite good.  The interior is very sleek and clean, and the buffet area is kept very tidy. The restaurant has a good number of tables but isn't huge. I was the first diner to enter shortly after the opened at 11AM, but by the time I was finishing my meal around noon, the restaurant was almost completely full.  Since it's buffet style, there isn't a ton of waiter service, but servers would come by to collect my used plates. They give you water carafes so you can refill your water by yourself. You also get a choice of naan when you are seated, and the naan is made-to-order than brought to your table in a basket.  While there were no samosas or kheer during my visit today, I was surprised to see idli and bhel puri, two items that I rarely see at buffets. I especially enjoy bhel puri with all of its crunchy bits. =)  All the other dishes were good too, and there was a decent variety. They even snuck in one Indo-Chinese dish, chilli chicken. Surprisingly, the sweet chicken tikka masala was not that good (the sauce was a little overcooked and some of the yogurt had coagulated, plus the chicken was a bit tough), though the paneer tikka masala which has the same sauce base was much smoother. I was also surprised by the spice level of things that didn't look very spicy and that aren't that spicy when I've had them elsewhere (saag mushroom, daal). On the flip-side, the chicken vindaloo was just moderately spicy; go figure. Nothing was too spicy for me to handle, but some dishes were just packing unexpected heat.  I wouldn't mind coming back to try ordering off the menu. All in all, a solid and very clean Indian restaurant.  P.S. I was a bit alarmed when I saw all the recent one-star reviews on Yelp, but most of them seem to be centered around poor dinner service or takeout orders, and I came for buffet lunch. Food weighs most heavily in my ratings anyway, but make of that what you will. My experience today was not bad at all.

q6I_-khV0Fe4_pHRhFzzlA.text: Everything was so good. Seriously, everything. Came for the buffet and the $20 on a Tuesday was totally worth it. Spicy goat biryani, paneer Tikka, mushroom saag, tandoori chicken.. all bomb. I had one of everything haha too much to lost

2JhlA2priphhbzED-sbYfg.text: It was my very first time eating Indian food and I am glad that Mint was my first Indian restaurant! We arrived around 10pm and the place was packed, yet the staff found us a table, cleaned it so fast so that we could seat down.  We had hard times ordering food because Indian cuisine is new to us. The manager was so patient and helpful and we made the best choice we probably could make. We ordered mini portions of some of the main staples of the place, an organic tomato soup as an appetizer and a mini desert which was delicious. I am not sure what it exactly was, it was these two little bakes balls in mango and hot Indian ice cream sauce. Wow! Delicious! We loved the atmosphere as well. Even though we were a little bit late, nobody was rushing us out. We will definitely recommend this place to our friends. 5 stars!!!!

Please take your business elsewhere.

But I did find a few that weren't and they were absolutely delicious! The Paneer Tikka Masala was probably my favorite, but the Vegetable Korma and Chicken Tandoori were great as well!   They also offer a little salad bar and some desserts. The naan is brought to the table fresh - you even have a choice between plain or garlic!  I will definitely return soon!

MC0-gc0e5sjVgTylHrgArA.text: Went here based on the reviews after a long 4.5 hour flight from Atlanta. Based in a strip mall setting, there is some parking but not a lot. agy9nTuBYI69YgmB0y9yHg.text: Great buffet full of delicious items! Garlic naan was fresh and hot, and delicious. All and all, it was a great experience and I look forward to returning for more yummy Indian food.

ZlymjoAIvj1H4zvROsJIEQ.text: I've only been to Mint Indian bistro a handful of times and that has been for the lunch buffet. This review is based on the lunch buffet only.  The food itself is delicious, the ingredients and quality are good. At some Indian food places I have been to, I am disappointed when I see the food is very oily or it smells as if it is not fresh- or low grade quality ingredients are being used. That is never the case at mint. You can trust you are getting good food here. I also think that for the price it's a good deal.  There are plenty of options for me as a vegan and I like that everybody there is always willing to let you know what's what on the buffet line.  The interior of the place is small, clean, and has a quiet mellow feel to it. I do like that as well because sometimes dining and noisy places is just too much. I enjoy a quiet meal w good food.  While this isn't in an area that I'm often near, I do always remember that it is here and if I am craving Indian I will come back to Mint.

wIGGrMkb3-v727A96HMfSA.text: One of my local friends recommended this Indian buffet as their go to place, so we went. Parking is good, plenty of good size spaces just outside. The server was pleasant greeted us immediately upon entering and found us a booth. He gave us a .thorough explanation of the lunch buffet.   This is review is relevant for the weekend buffet on a Sunday afternoon.  First impression was nice modern decor and fast friendly service. After previewing the buffet my mouth was watering in preparation for the feast that was about to go down. After filling up my plate it was time for the show.   I started with a bite of both the tikka masala with chicken and paneer.  The base sauce was thin and spicy. The sag paneer was even more spicy and lacking the richness my tastebuds are accustomed to. I went back for Gulab Jamun and Mango custard to cool down my mouth.   Overall I've grown accustomed to slightly less spicy and more rich flavored Indian cuisine. The service, cleanliness and decor were great, but the food was too spicy and curry seemed watered down.  To each his own.

9Ev1rKyMoNFEfsgeJtrrVQ.text: In the middle of Title Loan shark and typical Thai food, we found a delightful Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas. Yearning for charcoal oven tandoori chicken and flavorful biryani rice, we swing by the Mint Indian Bistro on a wimp for a bite to eat. But what a surprise find; the restaurant warm welcoming atmosphere and inviting leather padded seat, real Indian music, and warm reception make you know that these folks are serious. We ordered dal lentil soup, "famous organic" tantric tandoori chicken and handi chicken biryani rice for our dinner. The tandoori chicken came well seasoned 3 legs and 3 thighs and melt in your mouth tender chicken pieces. The seasoned sliced bell pepper on top of the moist chicken pieces enhance the tandoori flavor. The lentil soup with chopped cilantro tastefully seasoned and we should have ordered  a bowl instead of a cup! The chicken biryani rice a bit pale flavored and not intense with herbs and spices. The rice and chicken has proper texture but lack boldness to stand on its own. What saved the rice dish was the crisp and bright Flying Horse beer compliments the meal. Our overall experience were favorable, and the good food begging to experience other dishes the restaurant offer. We'll be back for more!

txaGEszkawkOzO0XYctV6A.text: they ended up gettin dirt dinners place was infested with roaches they didnt care total neglect on there part after i found this out  i never went again !

tm5Pkl8is2ZL_mwLdiRBSA.text: A good spread of Northern and South Indian food over buffet. Happy to see a bunch of quality Indian restaurants like these open in the area.

fiGmtlIKMm1YMTjiKQw3wg.text: Im not sure how this place has so many good reviews. Must be a bad experience for me.  We ordered ahead to pickup and when we arrived they couldnt find our order. Pathetic! We had to wait for so long after a long day.   The food wasnt amazing either. The worst biryani i've ever had. The quantity was very less and their packing is terrible. Also tried their chilly chicken which was way too spicy. We had stomach issues after eating here.  The people who took our order werent helpful at all. When asked how much a single order of chilly chicken would serve, they very rudely said - depends on how much you eat.   Wouldnt recommened this place at all.

o-i7q5uPm4F9fTW-RzRYsg.text: Buffet is a good deal, there is a good variety consisting of chicken tikka masala, curry, rice, basmati rice, tandoori chicken, dal, spinach, paneer, and other Indian dishes. Tables already have water available. You also get sliced of buttered naan. Yumm. Every other drink you order is charged and over priced. For dessert, you have the options of sliced oranges, kheer (rice pudding), and all you can eat gulab jamun! That's a total gateway to diabetes; but we don't talk about that. One thing I disliked was how the check was brought so quickly and we weren't even completely done with our food. No other restaurant I have been to has brought the check without me asking for it. I found that a bit rude, like they were asking us to leave before we were done. Even so, the place was nice and clean so there's that! You can get your dose of spices in the hot Vegas weather.

9H_7-ihurD4HCN1X8Wt6xQ.text: This is the best Indian buffet I've ever tasted and the price was reasonable at 12.99 per person you will be delighted with a multitude of aromatic experiences. My faves were chicken tikka masala and the paneer tikka masala. The korma and palak mushroom was also exceptional. The lentil soup was full of flavor and the naan was perfect. The service was attentive and I love the purity of the water. Give it a try.   By the way I arrived after 15 minutes of opening and I think that is why I was impressed as everything was fresh and hot (my pet peeve is old and cold).   Everything is clean and modern. I love the artwork above the inferno wall.   On a last note be sure to check the hours for the buffet.

jjy_yt_xI04IlpW2o7aQYQ.text: My first impression of the owners' food was not the best, but this visit changed my mind.  I'd tried their Desi Burrito concept last week, but Mint Indian Bistro is what I should've done all along. My co-workers wanted to squeeze it into our lunch hour, so we hurried over for the $12.99 lunch buffet, offered 11am-4pm daily.  My first impression was that the buffet line isn't the biggest, but it still had plenty to offer. Clean plates and bowls are in the back corner near the salad, sauces, and soups. Vegetarian options are next if you follow the line down, and meat dishes (mostly chicken) are nearest to the seating area.  The food was quite impressive overall. Carbs from the Vegetable Fried Rice and the Vegetable Chau Chau, a soft noodle dish that their web site states to be from Tibet. The veggie Pakoda were a nice fried treat that didn't seem too greasy. Goat curry was tender enough and tasty, if a bit annoying to eat with all the bones. Pretty much everything chicken was yummy, but the tandoori chicken is most likely the best, moistest version of it that I've had - and it's at a lunch buffet. Don't forgot to grab the veggies served on that tray either. Finally, don't forget the decadent gulab jamun for dessert. They're kinda like wet/soft, sugary, soaked donuts, and they're served very hot here.  The negatives weren't that much of an issue for me, but I have to mention that the service was very spotty. We were through eating our first plates by the time that they brought out the water, and considering that a couple of dishes are mildly spicy, it would've been nice to have relief earlier. The garlic naan took even longer - even considering that they tasted freshly cooked, you'd think that they'd just keep pumping them out during lunch rush. Even the check took a couple of minutes to arrive after we finally flagged someone down, and we ended up walking to the register to pay.  Also, the naan were the one food that I had a quibble with. Although they were crispy, flaky, and served hot, they were undersalted if eaten alone.  I wish I hadn't had my first meal at Mint Indian Bistro during a rushed lunch hour, but it was still delicious. I'd say it's fine if you have at least 45 minutes, not accounting for drive time. If I catch the Indian food bug, Mint would definitely be on my rotation.

9DttXIn6jdqX602W_bZzxA.text: It was my first time here. A friend of mine had suggested that I give this place a try. I'm so glad I was able to get a chance to try it out, because it was very tasty. When I arrived, I had to put my name on the list inside the restaurant. It was a waiting list that you put your name and phone number on the the app. Very helpful, because I am sure that the restaurant does have many patrons. Because the day I visited, it was full of people. I only waited about 20 minutes before I was able to sit down. There was table water available already. So I'm sure they have guests asking for water. Their menu is very detailed, which I liked very much. I started out with some garlic naan, which was served warm. There were about 4 pieces in the basket. Then I ordered some buttered chicken tikka masala, that was very tasty. It was served with basmati rice. And they even asked me what spice level I wanted. I'm not too much into spicy foods, but they made my buttered chicken the way I liked it. I'll definitely be back to enjoy more of the menu.

zybBEO_syAc9LNJ5bYnCoA.text: Foods great; service sucks.  We placed our order around 6:30pm. Our appetizer came out quickly, more patrons entered, ordered, ate...and yet we were still waiting on our entrees. Waiter came by with the roti we ordered and noticed we still didn't have our food. He left the bread with us and left, and we waited approximately 20 more minutes until I finally asked how much longer it would be.   Apparently our order ticket fell to the floor and they never made our food. Got an apology and eventually our food. Our table was practically ignored as we had to wait another 10 minutes for our check even after we asked for a to go box which normally means "hey, we're done"   We finally got the check and there was no compensation for the hour wait for our food.   I work as concierge on the strip, I have a degree in hospitality management, I send guests to this restaurant when they ask for this particular cuisine, but I'm extremely disappointed with my second visit.   Step up your service, guys.

nqptzf543KPcqNwlV8xY9A.text: This was my first time having Indian food. It was an amazing experience. Quality of food and flavor is exceptional. Great environment as well. jvmdY_JS66UkfSRNAahjNw.text: Had dinner here for a couple of days and felt that the food is good but some dishes seem stale.. maybe reused from the lunch buffet.  Tomato soup was tasteless and crude. Chicken tikka was dry and felt stale. Mix veg in the thali was very average!  Butter chicken and lamb curry was good, liked them! Daal tadka was also really nice, had a nice hing flavour!

Or11I-ThM4Lqmuk3ePg60w.text: This was a few weeks ago but I wanted to share my experience. I had planned to get food to go but I started chatting to one of the employees and decided to just eat it there at the bar instead. The conversation ultimately centered around the Route 91 festival which I was working at, as I was wearing my #vegasstrong shirt it was all that was on my mind. I was telling the man named Chris my story, my heartbreak, and my luck to even be alive. My food began to arrive. I had ordered enough for two people as I was starving and had barely eaten that day. My weight had dropped over 10 pounds since the previous week of the festival. After I was finished and stuffed I asked for the check.  Jay, one of the employees informed me that it was taken care of. I asked what he meant and he told me that the owner had taken care of everything. I did not know the man I was speaking to was the owner and I had not noticed him leave. I broke down crying with tears of happiness and sadness. I began to tell the others also what had happened as they didn't really know. The staff in there were so caring refusing even a tip, and even offering me dessert and a ride home. Such kind, kind people.

Krqi2BqVaN-L_mDTe_UHbQ.text: Poor management n service. It took more than 50 minutes to serve the food. Some of the pieces in the Lamb kabab was undercooked. The yellow dal was too salty and also had stale tomatoes. The people don't accept mistakes and keep giving justification. Ask for some chilis and was charged $2.49 for them. My card was also overcharged by a cent.  Not a good experience for the price of the food I paid.

G-zvI3QfccBYMFcKWKxm3A.text: Finishing the last episode of Gordon Ramsey's Great Escape; I had the strongest urge for some flavor packing curries and was instructed to come here by my over-zealous vegan friend.   This restaurant has such a wide variety of curries of non-vegan and vegan selections.   Their buffet runs from 11am-3pm and might i say, something everyone should become very familiar with.  The buffet is only $12 and it comes with such a variety of foods, it's such a steal!  Considering I came here for dinner and ordered chicken tikka masala (buttered chicken) and naan; the bill came out to about $18.  The buffet includes chicken/vegetable tikka masala, tandoori chicken, basmati rice, bone-in lamb curry and more dishes i can't pronounce. It includes normal and garlic naan!  The curry is packed with so much flavor, the naan comes out freshly made (HOT), the meat of the tandoori and chicken tikka masala is slightly dry but other than that I really can't complain. Food is an A- for me.  The only complaint I have is for dinner; their portions are a bit small for what you pay for but nonetheless still very tasty.  Service is spot on and punctual whenever you're out of drink, naan or if you have empty plates; oh yeah their naan is refillable!  Our server was extremely friendly, wasn't overbearing and took care of us throughout the whole dinner.  Ambiance was very warm, lights dim but not dungeness and with trending indian songs to add culture to a very modern looking restaurant.    Despite having a few indian restaurants surrounding this area, i'll always return to Mint for their money worthy buffet, vegan options,affable and attentive service and their delicious food.

C9ugRTzUo_AoIzdcwvRpMg.text: Mint is the best Indian buffet in town. I love the original location down by UNLV, but this one is even better. It's more spacious and has more food choices. My only complaint would be that it takes a very long time to get the naan bread - the first time we went, we assumed that we were supposed to wait for the man at the buffet to make it fresh for us because they didn't take our order at the table. The second time we went, the host took our order for bread, but we didn't get it until toward the end of the meal.   Overall, the price and value is good for all the food you get.

tK6GBaMZEWRrVH0WcRBqGw.text: A wait list for an empty restaurant on a Friday night....hmm seems they wanted to keep tables free for parties larger than two. Their close proximity to the strip leaves them hopeful that others will come. But in the meantime, alienate the customers who are already here and ready to pay....very stupid practice! The place is all pretty on the inside. Cute decor and the sexiest buddha sitting in the midst. But the service was horrible. We decided to sit at the counter and watch the shenanigans. Parties of two constantly being wait listed or sent to the bar then looking around and leaving. Larger parties being sat (without a reservation mind you). Our food was brought out over spice, cold and tasteless. They made the list of worst Indian food I've ever had, and I eat plenty. All pomp and circumstance. Not the place to go if you really want to eat great Indian in Vegas. Tourist trap....
